Their ability to resonate with audiences through humor, action, and emotional depth solidifies their place as two of the most compelling characters in modern popular culture.

For a moment it seems like "Deadpool & Wolverine" will manage to get away with it's multiverse story. Raising it's eyebrow to the idea that every world has a hero that is fundamental to its survival. Hence the search for a new Logan.But no. It doesn't. Just like all the multiverse movies that came before, it skips around abstract worlds, introducing unbelievable characters and situations, and destroying any possible drama.But that's probably not why you watch a Deadpool movie. You watch it for the jokes, the smut and the fourth-wall breaks. Of which there are plenty. This installment also has a long list of cameo appearances, none of which disappoint, with a handful being true highlights of the film (I won't name names to avoid any spoilers).Hugh Jackman plays Wolverine straight, with lots of slice-n-dice fight sequences. But he is definitely the support act rather than the co-lead. This film is all about Ryan Reynolds - or at least, whoever wears the red and black costume.Back to the "story", Matthew McFadyen is OK as the first British baddie. Emma Corrin is really poor as the second British baddie and never manages to find the right tone.To sum up, the laughs are there, the action is good but repetitive, and the story isn't even worth trying to make sense of. Which is why this film isn't a match for the previous two Deadpool adventures.

Wow, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is an absolute blast! As a huge MCU fan, I loved seeing Wolverine and Deadpool team up. Ryan Reynolds is phenomenal as Deadpool, delivering his lines with perfect sarcasm and wit. Hugh Jackman as Wolverine? Pure magic. Their on-screen chemistry is electric, with razor-sharp dialogues and spot-on humor-never a dull moment. After a long dry spell, the MCU is finally back on track. The action, plot, and banter are top-notch. If you're an MCU fan or love action-comedy, this movie is a must-watch. It's a film that reminds us why we fell in love with the MCU in the first place!

Well done Ryan Reynolds!! Not allowing any outside factors deter you from being yourself and creating a ridiculously funny, entertaining film. Not since End Game, have I enjoyed a Marvel film so much!! Does the story tie in with the grand MCU scheme and plot lines? Who cares!! Cameos, one liners, and Wolverine at his best! A must for nerds, non-nerds and any person who can not be a ball aching critique!!Please watch this in the Cinema! Give it the ratings and accolades it deserves to cement it in the Top 5 where it belongs in the MCU films.Every emotion smashed during the film and the End credit scene, just awesome. I just was gutted when it finished.

I love the X-Men Universe and lore. This movie though, was just meh. The countless easter-eggs were quite nice, but require a deep knowledge of the subject-matter. The humour no more than decent. Deadpool himself was over-the-top much of the time, and not in a good way. The excessive sexual jokes were quite immature and often disgusting. Hugh Jackman and Emma Corrin delivered the best performances. Wesley Snipes was wasted for fan-service, and due to the plot, his character was completely out of context. Regrettably, as many of you already know, the MCU has died after Endgame. This film is no exception.

Best Marvel movie to date! If you don't get Deadpool humor, Don't go. If you're upset it's rated R, get over it and don't go. If you love hilarious, laughing the whole time and the best fight scenes on a Deadpool level, you will love this. Went today will go again. This movie saved the MCU and Disney from the bomb movies that have released the last few years. Back to classic. Back to marvel roots. The jokes on Fox..... I was epic but I don't want to spoil but this movie is ome you will watch over and over. Unsure what the haters where expecting because it's SO Deadpool and wolverine vibes with him perfe.

247th place in my personal and objectively right list of movies of all time (first place is persona) this movie has everything and everyone should Watch it today or maybe tomorrow if its late in your area, you should probably don't watch this with your parents its not a kids friendly movies, its just a pure entertainment product and that's what makes this movie special, its a love letter to the nerds but also a emotional movie for the cinema lovers like myself, an incredible adventure not saturated with explicit content or jokes, its an unique movie with a very easy to follow premise and a sweet little message in the end"The past is what makes us who we are"

Its story may not be the strongest, but the comedy makes 'Deadpool & Wolverine' an excellent watch!There are some top notch gags in there, particularly to do with the recent offscreen changes for Wade Wilson's alter ego. As you'd expect with Ryan Reynolds in this role, the jokes are plentiful and there is barely any time to react to one before another appears. That can sometimes not work as well as intended, e.g. 'Deadpool 2', but here the humour is executed perfectly.Reynolds himself is quality, it is a quintessential Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool performance. It's real neat to see Hugh Jackman back as Wolverine, he does play second fiddle to the other titular character but still more than holds his own, as you'd expect. Emma Corrin, meanwhile, enters the MCU with a great showing.As noted at the top, I do think the plot couldn't been superior - but not in a negative way. What is portrayed is still entertaining to watch, it's just not necessarily on the same level as the comedic elements. A fun watch, all the same. Do I like it more than the 2016 original? I think so, would only be minorly so though.

You can't go into this movie expecting an actual movie, because that's not what it is. It's a parody of Marvel movies. Deadpool 1 (and sometimes 2) had an actual plot to follow. Deadpool 1 especially could stand on its own. This movie is different. Don't get me wrong, it's funny, and I love it for what it is, but there's a reason it's not called Deadpool 3. The plot is all over the place and the multiverse aspect (combined with the fact that they can both regenerate) makes the stakes non-existent. If you just turn your brain off and have fun though, it's a good time. It is however a shame that we probably won't ever see Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool in its own standalone movie again.

Honestly, I don't quite understand the hype.Yes, the movie is funny, and yes, it's entertaining, but the plot feels pretty mediocre. The whole multiverse and time-travel concept has been overdone and only serves to highlight the mediocrity that Marvel has shown in recent years. The fourth wall breaking happens far too often in this film, to the point where it feels excessive.Bringing wolverine back to life was fun but WHERE IS THE PLOT?Please, Humor is not enough for a movie.Do not disrespect the audiance.Overall, it's a good movie-fun and enjoyable, but I think the 8/10 rating it's given is overrated.

Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are such a great duo together. I'm glad to see the true and only Wolverine come back in theaters. Ryan is super incredible at his comedic talent. My wife and I could not stop laughing. He did a great job on this movie and this is the best Deadpool movie  by far.  Ryan Reynolds is the best actor for Deadpool and Hugh Jackman is the best actor for wolverine. Ryan Reynolds is the best actor for Deadpool and Hugh Jackman is the best actor for wolverine. Ryan Reynolds is the best actor for Deadpool and Hugh Jackman is the best actor for wolverine. Ryan Reynolds is the best actor for Deadpool and Hugh Jackman is the best actor for wolverine.

I would say that maybe the reason why i didn't like this was because i've never been a fun of deadpool movies but then i thought it would be different with wolverine inside but i was wrong. I found this very boring.I think one of the reasons why people enjoy this is because of the caliber of casts used in this film and the fact that it is deadpool, but for me this was not it. Deadpool and Wolverine is everything we expected and wanted new Deadpool movie to be.It's not a masterpiece from a filmmaking side, but it is a Masterpiece from a side of Respect for fans and fulfilling what fans wanted all these years.We received full of cursing and D-jokes movie where both Reynolds and Jackman have fun and their chemistry on screen is through the roof.There is so many references and cameos in the movie that every few minutes, your head starts spinning. You are also constantly slapped with jokes about state of MCU, Disney and even other franchises that aren't under disney and sometimes even about current state of the online discourse.Breaking the forth wall is executed in there beautifully and way better than it was in first two movies.Loved it, and can't wait for it to get a home release so I can get it on 4k!

Deadpool & Wolverine is a riotous, action-packed spectacle that delivers on the promise of its title. This R-rated mashup of the two iconic anti-heroes is a rollercoaster of humor, violence, and unexpected heart.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman share an undeniable chemistry that powers the film. Their banter is sharp, their interactions hilarious, and their on-screen partnership is a joy to watch.The film doesn't hold back on the action. The sequences are choreographed with precision and filled with adrenaline-pumping moments.Deadpool's signature fourth-wall-breaking humor is in top form, complemented by Wolverine's dry wit. The film is constantly surprising with its comedic timing.Beneath the layers of violence and comedy, there's a genuine emotional core to the film that adds depth to the characters.The plot is fairly standard fare for a superhero film, with a few predictable twists.While the action sequences are impressive, some of the CGI effects feel overused and can be distracting.The cinematography is slick and stylish, capturing the gritty urban setting and the over-the-top action with equal finesse. The editing is sharp and keeps the pace consistently high. The soundtrack is a well-curated mix of both classic and contemporary tracks that complement the film's tone.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman deliver career-defining performances. Their portrayal of Deadpool and Wolverine, respectively, is iconic. The supporting cast provides solid performances, adding depth to the world.The film is packed with surprise cameos that will delight fans of the Marvel universe. While some cameos are brief, they add a layer of fun and fan service.Deadpool & Wolverine is a wildly entertaining film that successfully blends humor, action, and heart. It's a must-watch for fans of the characters and action-comedy enthusiasts alike.

I have purposely avoided the comic book genre of movies for the last few decades since I view them as infantile. Superpowers, extended battles, ridiculous physics (or lack thereof), binary good vs evil characters...perhaps if I were still a 10-year old boy I might enjoy that monotony. Of course there were some classics like 1989's Batman which elevated themselves beyond just a "superhero" movie. But I have been happy to ignore the deluge since that time.Unfortunately I was dragged in to see this Deadpool / Wolverine abomination recently, and I feel compelled to express my dismay.Yikes. Is this what the moviegoing public is cool with? Most of it is simply a series of extremely graphic mass murder sequences set to upbeat music, juvenile jokes (I didn't laugh once), swearing, and the usual ridiculous CGI jumping through dimensions or whatever. Whatever "plot" there was, I missed it because it was complete gibberish.Yes, let's further desensitize ourselves to brutal violence by laughing at the murderous rampages. Are we supposed to be moved by the poetic arcs of blood and guts flying across the screen? Who is this for? Honestly, what kind of sick person *enjoys* this?I'd feel cleaner coming out of a trashy strip club than this movie. The high ratings and praise suggest that there's something very, very wrong with our society.

I wouldn't say that Deadpool & Wolverine is one of the best Marvel movies, but Marvel is definitely making a strong comeback, reminding us, 'Hi, I'm here to blow your mind with entertainment!' It's incredibly entertaining, with Deadpool's signature humor hitting all the right notes. Ryan Reynolds, with his impeccable comedic timing, once again proves why he's perfect for this role. Kudos to the action choreographers and the special effects team for their outstanding work. The reappearance of Hugh Jackman as Wolverine sent chills down my spine. Overall, it's a thrilling ride full of laughter and action.Best to experience in IMAX 3D.

Finally saw Deadpool & Wolverine a few hours ago, it was almost exactly what the fans of X-Men and Wolverine were waiting for, like myself.The action was insane, PHENOMENALLY COOL, BLOODY & BADASS filled with gore, the comedy may have gone a bit TOO overly profane and tedious by Deadpool, but when it did tasteful humor, the jokes and one-liners landed hard, the music was Sooo good & beautiful (the first fight theme reminded of Bleach OST "Battle Ignition") and used all that had come before as a very emotional (personally eye-teary) legacy of Deadpool and Wolverine's lives to mold their relationship and fates in this film.The movie was beyond pleasingly stacked with a gratuitous amount of these two together, and an incredible JAWDROPPING amount of cameos, ones you would NEVER expect, that you'd become confident to expect even those appearing that would seem impossible. Go into this movie with ZERO spoilers if you can!! Its the REAL Multiverse of Madness.Without spoiling anything this movie is a pseudo love letter and send off to what 20th Century Fox has done with Marvel and the X-Men with great appreciation and heartfelt embracement of what remains for the MCU. 2:20am.

Where do I even start... imo it's way better than the first and second, and the opening is AMAZING. This really saved Marvel. Like the other Deadpool's it has good jokes, the sexual stuff was toned down in this one though. There were a ton of cameos, of course one being Wolverine / Logan. The only problem is the final fight wasn't really a fight. This was more of a comedy than the usual marvel movie, but there was just some action to add onto the funny jokes. If I'm being honest, this may have revived marvel, on a scale of 1-10 this is a 10 for rewatchability. The opening is probably the greatest openings in marvel history.

I mean come onn, it's Marvel Jeasus how can he disappoint us. Absolute banger of a movie, from open credits to post credit scene, every bit was perfect last to the minute details. The comedic timings from Hugh & Ryan were on spot as expected. Also I was expecting they have shown everything in trailer but naaah, don't keep your hopes high, not because it will not be upto your hope, the thing is you can't expect any thing. This is above our Hopes. I would say this was the best movie in the Deadpool Triology with great story and massive addition of Hugh as Logan. With the comic times, action scenes & blood bath the Background scores were om spot!!

Without spoiling the movie- The characters themselves carry this movie's plot as best as they can.We're all here for the Merc with the mouth FINALLY united with Wolverine. As we have waited pretty much our whole lives waiting for this moment, ok dramatic...The plot and the movie itself are tired.Marvel just doesn't seem to want to break the shell it's currently in and is exploiting as much as it can to keep this charade going.Opening weekend/ early viewing made it fun- Excited fans of all sorts hollering and shouting at the punchlines and action. Made it an EXPERIENCE as it should be... but If i were at home watching the movie for the first time, I probably would've left to get food in the middle of it to help better enjoy myself.6.5/10. Try and watch it opening wknd to get your money's worth.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" brilliantly merges the irreverent humor of Deadpool with the gritty intensity of Wolverine. The film masterfully balances chaotic action with witty banter, creating an unexpectedly harmonious dynamic between the two iconic characters. The storyline, while refreshingly unconventional, maintains a surprising depth, exploring themes of redemption and identity. Exceptional performances from the leads elevate the film, making their chemistry electric. Visually, it's a feast, with dynamic fight scenes and stunning cinematography. This movie redefines the superhero genre, offering a unique blend of comedy, drama, and raw action. This is a brilliant and epic masterpiece with surprising cameos.

Ryan Reynolds is annoying to listen to for long periods of time. It's not until the final 3rd of the movie where his lines are minimized (Thank God). The final 3rd of the movie was enjoyable to watch. The first hour of the film you could burn in a fire and no one would care. It's a typical Deadpool movie. Incredibly violent, gory, profane, etc.It's not that the movie needs non stop action to make it good, that's further from the truth. Too much action in a movie can be an energy drain on the viewer. What made the final 3rd of the movie enjoyable is that the plot actually went somewhere. Where the first hour of the film felt like filler; building things up at a snail's pace. In order to understand this film better I HIGHLY recommend that you watch the TV series "Loki" because MANY of the plot points come from the plot of that TV series. Without watching Loki I think a lot of viewers will be confused as to what is happening in the film.The credits have two special easter eggs. One shows up almost right away during the credits and the 2nd credit scene was actually genuinely funny. I can't tell you how many credit scenes Marvel has done that was down right pointless or not worth the wait. But the one in this movie was actually well done.

DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE (2024) ***1/2 Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman, Emma Corrin, Matthew Macfadyen, Morena Baccarin, Rob Delaney, Leslie Uggams, Jon Favreau, Aaron Stanford, Tyler Mane, Karan Soni, Briana Hildebrad. Marvel's meta-mouth mere and X-Men's ultra bad-ass (re)unite for the first time in this mind-bending, universe paralleling action packed adventure dealing with multi-time lines, kicking ass & general debauchery. Gleefully over-the-top & fourth wall shattering the DynamicDuo of RL besties Reynolds & Jackaman is nothing but pure cinematic bliss with its balls-to-the-wall graphic carnage, side-mouth quips and bone-crunching destruction to the hilt deliver the, well, marvelous goods. Chock block with cameos & an '80s power groove jukebox soundtrack. See it on the biggest screen with the loudest sound system and thank me later. (DIR: Shawn Levy)

"Deadpool & Wolverine (2024)" is like that decent pizza place down the street-good enough to satisfy the craving but not quite the slice of heaven you were hoping for. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are basically on autopilot at this point, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. Their banter is still sharp, and the chemistry is undeniable, but it feels like we've been here before. It's like they reheated the leftovers from their past roles and slapped a new label on it.The movie is a wild mix of blood, jokes, and a plot that barely holds together. It's fun as hell, don't get me wrong, but it's also kind of like riding a rollercoaster that's mostly made of old parts from other rides. You'll laugh, you'll cringe, and you might even cheer a few times, but by the end, you're not really sure if it was the ride itself or just the thrill of seeing these two back in action.Overall, "Deadpool & Wolverine" does the job, but it's not the game-changer it thinks it is. It's like ordering the usual from your favorite takeout spot-you know exactly what you're getting, and it's just fine. Perfect for fans, but maybe not worth the hype if you're expecting something groundbreaking. Still, it's hard to complain too much when Reynolds and Jackman are having this much fun, even if the movie itself is just...ok.

Marvel Studios' Deadpool & Wolverine is a movie close to 25 years in the making, ever since Hugh Jackman first donned the black leather suit and adamantium claws to play Wolverine in 2000's X-Men. While Ryan Reynolds was a more recent addition to 20th Century Fox's X-Men franchise, he became so synonymous with the Deadpool character that I'm certain I'm not alone in believing he would be nearly impossible to recast. Instead of going the recasting route, Deadpool & Wolverine utilizes the multiverse to not only explain their joining the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but offer an exceptionally fun buddy comedy.Ryan Reynolds & Hugh Jackman shine as superheroes with great comedic chemistry.Exciting action scenes & multiverse references cater to all types of fans.Weak character development and one-note villains may deter some viewers.Marvel Studios' Deadpool & Wolverine is a movie close to 25 years in the making, ever since Hugh Jackman first donned the black leather suit and adamantium claws to play Wolverine in 2000's X-Men. While Ryan Reynolds was a more recent addition to 20th Century Fox's X-Men franchise, he became so synonymous with the Deadpool character that I'm certain I'm not alone in believing he would be nearly impossible to recast. Instead of going the recasting route, Deadpool & Wolverine utilizes the multiverse to not only explain their joining the Marvel Cinematic Universe, but offer an exceptionally fun buddy comedy.The plot of Deadpool & Wolverine is somehow both convoluted and basic. The movie is essentially a buddy road trip story that's complicated by multiverse politics and red herrings. The TVA, introduced and explored through two seasons of Loki, plucks Deadpool from his timeline and tells him his universe is in trouble. Instead of working with TVA agent Mr. Paradox (Matthew Macfadyen), Deadpool looks for help from one of the multiverse's Wolverines. Since they've both gone rogue, the TVA banishes them to The Void - the multiverse's trash heap - where they face Cassandra Nova (Emma Corrin).Look, I'm not going to sit here and say Deadpool & Wolverine is a "good" movie. The character development is thinly drawn at best, often taking a backseat to multiverse shenanigans. There's still an emotional throughline, as Deadpool searches for a purpose that'll make him matter - all to impress Vanessa (Morena Baccarin), because he's ultimately a selfish character. The new Wolverine has a barely touched tragic backstory to justify his anger issues. Everyone else in the Deadpool & Wolverine cast is a largely one-dimensional character, existing simply to serve the plot or get a cheer from the crowd.But that's not why you go to see Deadpool & Wolverine - and it's certainly not why I enjoyed the movie. Deadpool & Wolverine is a love letter to Marvel movies of the last 30 years, and I love those movies. I grew up watching the X-Men movies, and had to sit through the franchise fizzling out while enduring the false starts of The Fantastic Four. Deadpool & Wolverine gave me closure. The film is the ultimate fan service movie, couched in an odd-couple team-up. It's Fox's version of Avengers: Endgame, rendered through the playful and crude lens of Deadpool.Deadpool & Wolverine is best enjoyed by someone with a deep, enduring love for Marvel movies; as a result, the film sometimes leaves casual fans in the dust. The last three decades hold a lot of Marvel movie lore, and even those who have seen every movie referenced by Deadpool & Wolverine may be confused by some of the real-world callbacks. Thankfully,the movie strikes a good balance between very deep cuts and more general pop culture references. Still, this is very much the kind of movie where it's better to do your homework if you want to appreciate everything.

Hard belly laughs, excessively gory high-octane action, and a grounded heart to round it off nicely. This film has it all, and gives you everything it has promised from day one (and WAY more.)Ryan Reynolds is back as everyone's favourite anti-hero, and this time he's busting the back doors of the MCU wide-open, and the MCU isn't holding back. (If that isn't enough, they've opened up wider to make room for Wolverine.)Hugh Jackman brings Wolverine back to the silver screen in true Hugh Jackman style - flawless, and together with Reynolds the combination of Deadpool and Wolverine couldn't be sweeter (or saltier, whatever you prefer. I like a mix)It has to be experienced in theatres. Much like Spider-Man: No Way Home, this instant MCU favourite will have like-minded fans cheering and whooping for joy. It has all the wicked wit and tongue-in-cheek (sometimes literal - looking at you Dogpool) humour of the first two films, but with an undeniable MCU glow up that is perfectly poked at with impeccable taste.Minor flaws, the film starts fast and keeps up the pace nicely until about the 3/4 mark. The plot isn't quite as air-tight as I'd have liked, but that isn't to say that it's weak, just not without its flaws.Despite this, prepare to laugh, cry, laugh some more, choke on some popcorn, cough it back up, act like nothing happened, and then laugh some more again. This film is about to invasively fondle your mind in a way that you'll never forget. So grab your filthy novelty popcorn buckets and march into those theatre doors with your head held high. This is your time to shine.

This was a blast, I was expecting it to be fun, Deadpool back In 2016 was a nice Surprise, it was funny and had great writing. The newest Installment is exactly the same, but funner in more ways then one. The cinema was great especially for a midnight screening, plenty of laughs in the Cinema. So it's time to review, the ultimate, the Marvel Jesus, oh wait no it's just "Deadpool + Wolverine".Very fun start, it felt cinematic and had Brisc pacing and at break neck pace, quite literally. The first action sequence for that reason is very well done, it had plenty of laughs. The "206 Bones" in the body and then they made a joke about "Gossip Girl being 207" that was a creative joke and quite a clever one too. Deadpool is probably at his best, he's more brutal which is a good and bad thing, and he's also more funnier. And Ryan Reynolds puts in an outstanding performance. Very heart-felt and touching at times, but most importantly entertaining and funny.Wolverine was a great character to bring back, lots of fan service moments, and they worked well because it showed his emotional side and why he had given up everything, and Not only that but it was a top-notch Performance by Hugh Jackman. Possibly the stand Out, but both Ryan and Hugh Put in an excellent performance. I thought there chemistry did lack at times, but overall they were fun together, and I felt it was the right move from Marvel to pare these two up as they do have some great moments together and between them.Cassandra Nova was the Villain, we got some cameos from Marvel characters, Blade being the biggest serprise out of them all, I won't say any more on that because I don't want to spoil it too much. Cassandra was very powerful and could brake anything quite easily, she like goes into your soul and it shares some good and bad moments in your life, particularly moving when she did it to Logan.The chemistry was perfect between Hugh and Ryan, But I did feel as though his character was too jokey at times, and also the film was fairly gory, and too gory. Aside from that this film was very enjoyable and Entertaining. I'd certainly give it a re-Watch. And I like the team-work between Deadpool and Logan, they both worked together which was interesting to see. So the big question is...,Would I recommend this Film?,Yes absolutely, I think it balances humour, Entertainment, clever witty dialogue with some fun scenes very very well. Top-performances, Stella cast jam-packed with Bloody Fun Moments, quite Literally. I did ask most on there opinion on the Movie, Some had hoped for more, others really enjoyed it. So I am glad most of them enjoyed it. Just don't have overly High expectations like others, and you won't be disappointed. 8.5 out of 10.

I saw this movie yesterday and it has everything I could ever dream of: comic accurate costumes, world class actors, comedy, action and emotion, all in one! But what made this movie special was how much heart and soul everyone put into it. Ryan Reynolds' back must hurt so much from carrying this movie. Because by writing AND producing this movie, he really saved not just his own franchise, he saved the ENTIRE MCU. And as for Hugh Jackman, I had faith he would come back for the role since Logan (2017), but I didn't want to get ahead of myself, but the waiting for this team up was so worth it. LFG!

Superfans of the entire Marvel universe will find this film filled with top-notch comedy and action, Easter eggs, cameos that left the audience gasping and cheering, a lot of meta jokes and digs at 20th Century Fox...It's the perfect way to wrap up the "Deadpool" franchise for good. Deadpool & Wolverine isn't the height of the MCU, but it is the height of the MCU right now, and for a franchise that's struggling at the moment, it's the shot in the arm that the MCU needs. With the whole super-racket on the ropes, the cast of "Deadpool & Wolverine" seizes the opportunity to prove the power of their own charisma. Demand for the movie is high and, although it's not the be-all/end-all of superhero movies, its anarchic and rambunctious approach to the genre results in an entertaining hybrid of comic book action and straightforward satire.My Rating : 7/10.

This is how you make a good movie! It's good to see that Marvel is still capable of doing great stuff like this, even if just reminds me of how it used to be. This movie proves they CAN make great/fun movies, but they simply DECIDED not to do that for almost 6 years.. (aside from Guardians 3) the dialogue, the jokes, the cameo's, the surprises, the fights, everything was done so well. It's unfortunate that it'll probably take another 3 years or so, for another good movie to come out, but we'll have to see. Maybe this has opened their eyes.We can only hope that they realise their mistakes & decide to focus on good storytelling & fanservice, instead of whatever they were doing until now. I'm glad all 3 Deadpool movies were a success.

One of the most anticipated films of the year is finally here and, to be honest, is it critics who pay the bills for big productions? This is a better example of that, but let's get to the film.The first act starts off very well, with an excellent action scene, showing everyone who was afraid of possible interference from Disney, we had an adult movie at Marvel. And was it a well-made movie? It depends.The film doesn't care about keeping the plot cohesive, neither between itself nor between the universe, and is that important? Not so much. For Marvel fans and even those who have seen any superhero movie, there will be a shower of references in the film, here there are many characters from many old movies that simply They appear all the time in the second act. And you realize that I'm already talking about the second act and I didn't talk about the plot, because there isn't one. It's just an excuse for him to save the universe and the film is based on that.And unfortunately I don't have much more to say, there is no plot, the village plays the role of driving the story but the villain changes in the middle of the film and that's it, many box office success characters and no plot. 7/10.

Was like a bad parody movie. The whole mad max thing was so childish. The only two good jokes were the gossip girls and fantastic 4 ones, rest were all trying too hard to be funny to Gen z audience type of jokes. Might as well add some skibbidi and whatnot in it. A script some 12 year old fan boy would make like it's some kinda random bromance between his favorite characters but completely butchering the characters. The multiverse thing is getting so boring now showing it in every marvel movie. Like we get it nobody really dies because you want to bring back every liked character because you're in love with money but come onnnnn!

I had extremely high expectations going into this movie. I enjoyed the first two Deadpool movies and have been disappointed at several of the latest Marvel movies so I was hoping this would restore my faith in Marvel. It met and exceeded those expectations! Hugh Jackman seemed to be having a terrific time and Ryan Reynolds was his usual, incredible self throwing quips and one liners around like candy. The story was not what I was expecting, and had heard speculation about. The story was even better than I thought it was going to be. In my opinion the cameo appearances played into the story very well and did not just seem to be gratuitous. This is a movie that I will have to see multiple times to appreciate all of the subtle references and Easter eggs scattered throughout yet. I do hope that we get to see another team up of Deadpool and Wolverine!

Wow i never see movie like this sooo much entertaining and interesting. Typical deadpool movie actually very funny and action and this is how they do it. Little adventure time little jokes better than Dwayne Johnson and action like Jason Statham and this is the perfect movie from Marvel. This is a review without any spoilers because i am a good guy and you guys must see this movie and enjoy it. Ryan Reynolds is a perfect combo with Hugh Jackman. Sooo much scenes where real fans can enjoy and the others was like "Ugh what is this and why they scream so loud". Finally this is the movie of 2024 i am sure about this.

Seriously the most fun, most awesome gore fest of comedy and surprising heart. Fan service at its best. Us 90s kids were smiling big time. Sweet justice was brought to great characters that existed in a trash cinematic universe. 20th Century Fox X-Men was garbage. Admit it. But the Wolverine character wasn't. And I now actually have hope the MCU can recover. And I think it did with this one film!!Buckle up for an amazing time of blood and guts. Super violent in all the best ways. You really get to see Wolverine at his best. I will 100% watch this again soon. And I don't really rewatch much now a days. Seriously go watch it before someone ruins the fun for you.

Deadpool and Wolverine was worth the wait. This movie delivers everything. The action was amazing. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman put their heart and soul into this movie. The cameos we were so surprising We thought we could never see these cameos. The storytelling Was done so well it got serious when it Needed to get serious And it got funny when it needed to get funny. This is easily one of the biggest movies of 2024 and will go down in history as one of marvel's best movies. This movie set up a lot, and I can't wait to see what Marvel brings In Avengers five and secret wars because this movie caves the road for greatness.

I will be honest and say I was underwhelmed by Deadpool & Wolverine. I was quite looking forward to it. I know Deadpool has always been an outrageous and comical character. However this film was full of random events that were forcefully pushed together. It lacked flow and I feel a massive opportunity was missed here by coupling up the most rugged character in the universe with the craziest. The humour was passable and worked now and then but it definitely wasn't as funny as I hoped it would be, given the two leads and how crazy they could have made the villain or antagonist. The villain did not even look formidable and just someone in a suit. This was another missed opportunity to have someone who could have been as formidable and hilarious as the two leads. This film would have benefited so much by borrowing the elements from Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 1 that made it so funny, logical and fun to follow at the same time.I just could not get into the this film and while people are raving about it, I honestly felt it was quite a weak mess of a film with no proper story, it was full of random and uninspired scenes and did not make as big a splash for me. This is a cash cow for Disney and Marvel but the quality of writing, great humour and nice story to weave it together was lacking.

If you're looking for a movie to kick back and enjoy without too much thinking, *Deadpool and Wolverine* delivers. It's packed with humor and action, making it a good watch for a fun time. However, the over-sexualized jokes and dialogues often touch the cringe meter, detracting from the overall experience.Additionally, the use of the multiverse feels excessive. With the ability to bring back any character, dead or alive, it seems like nothing truly matters anymore, undermining the stakes and coherence of the story. While it's entertaining, the film lacks the substance needed to elevate it beyond just a casual watch.

Giving this an 8/10 ratingThis film is bloody, has lots of swearing, great action, and has good feelings with it, and a more than fine storyline. It's an unexpected triumph, I hoped for just a good film, as the films in this genre ,this year, have been less than good.The marketing on this has been non stop for a long while, and almost drove me away. But today, I sat down and enjoyed a nice gem for the big screen. Fun from the start to finish, you have such a great cast of actors, and there is a big cast of them, so it was important that the script was not only funny, but had meaning, a good place for it to go, and characters that are believable. Motives aside, even the villains, have genuine bite and some caring to them, well, one does.If you like the first two films, you already know that you are going to see this, and this is great a late night cinema stay, just know that this has lots and lots of blood, and bad language, other than that, it's solid as they come.

Loved it! Some say that is was not all that, but I disagree. My wife and I thought it was the best Deadpool movie. Definitely the best MCU movie in a long time. Funny, great fight scenes and good action all the way to the end. So many Easter eggs and references. You have to know about DC and MCU movies to t all the jokes and references. But even if you don't, you will still have plenty to laugh at. So many cameos. Even the post credit scenes were great! Make sure I stay to the very end of the credits. The soundtrack is great. I was not anticipating this much, but I was pleasantly surprised. Gotta watch it again to see what all I missed.I really hope they do another one.

This movie is amazing. The chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman is beyond the 10/10 level. I am sure they are good friends in real life, but to visualize it through a film is different.Everyone go watch this movie in cinema, support this kind of quality. I think this is the best film since the Infinity war. (Yes IMO its better than Endgame and No way home).The movie is pure entertainment and joy. The only question is, where next? Can the MCU understand that, there is still a need for suprehero movies, just they have to be good. I hope they will appear in the upcoming movies and MarvelJesus could safe the future for the fans.All the best for Ryan and Hugh.

Six years after Deadpool 2, a lot has changed in the industry regarding 20th Century Fox and Disney. Ever since Disney acquired Fox, I think it's safe to say nothing has been done with its hero properties, and Disney/Marvel has been hurting.So does Deadpool have what it takes to reinvigorate some much needed life back into the MCU? Well, let's be honest regardless of how well this film does in theaters. Disney/Marvel needs more than one movie to come back to life.With that being said, Deadpool & Wolverine is perhaps the summer hero blockbuster the MCU needs right now.Is this the best film in the MCU? I would say no, but it's definitely better than recent Marvel projects. Deadpool & Wolverine is simply put a fun time at the theaters it gives us more of the merc with the mouth and lots of blood and action. Then stack that with Hugh Jackman in his return to Wolverine, but also put on top of that cameos galore featuring some great Marvel characters of yesteryear and this very easily can be seen as an instant fan favorite.Unfortunately, that's all this film has to offer. It's like they said let's make a movie based on nothing more than fan service. Not to say, fan service is bad, but a movie should have more than just fanfare. The story is shockingly shallow, and ultimately, I found it boring. The villain or "villains" were also boring. Then the charm of all this fan service wore thin surprisingly quick. When around every corner is supposed to be fanfare for the sake of fanfare, then those moments lose impact and magic.This whole movie felt like I was touring a "museum" (and yes pun intended) of Marvel characters past and present. In the end, though, it was like having a super annoying fan sitting next to you saying "hey you remember that character... hey, you remember this character?" All I wanted to say was yes. I remember these characters. Can we do something else now.As much fun as it is to see these characters on screen again, I'd rather visit their respective films than have them being used for what amounts to commodities for ticket sales.While Deadpool & Wolverine isn't bad, it could have been so much better, but hopefully, this will be a turning point for Disney/Marvel, and the MCU would have breathed in some new life. Only time will tell.IMDb: 6/10 Letterboxd: 3/5Watched in IMAX 3D.

The main reason I watched "Deadpool & Wolverine" was to see Hugh Jackman back as the iconic Wolverine, and he did not disappoint. From the very start, with Deadpool's dance and the catchy song, the movie keeps you entertained. There are plenty of hilarious moments that had me laughing out loud. The fight scenes and the bromance between Deadpool and Wolverine are spot on. The cameos are a delightful surprise for MCU fans, adding to the fun. Overall, this movie is an enjoyable ride, delivering exactly what Marvel fans have been waiting for. The dialogues are super hilarious. I did not feel bored at any moment.

Oh yes , amuch awaited Deadpool movie, I think this is the only movie released in this year from Marvel. This has been by far the best after all the average before from marvel. From this movie i get to know tat marvel is really struggling to bring back the authenticity. So bringing in all the characters like the vintage. There are many surprises in the movie, just experience it. Ryan reynolds , omg he is just a master of performances and his dialogue delivery is way toooo good. He is way too good. Hugh, actually i always to see wolverine in the suit, my wish has come true in this , he also did his role astonishing. Many other Marvel characters will be witnessed and tats a surprise element. Just go and experience in theaters. Overall a good superhero movie with a good story and screenplay. Please do watch it in theaters.

Marvel really took the reins back into their hands. The movie is loaded with full power of hype and fan service and nothing more. Reynolds delivers another top performance as Deadpool, breaking all the walls and Jackman has heard the voice of the fans and returns to the screen better than ever. There are a few slower scenes in the movie, but you can forgive them, it's mostly a fun plot anyway. The idea of friends going on an adventure works well. The action in the film has been polished to the last detail, katanas and weapons swing at full power and with a big budget. This film is definitely worth seeing in the cinema, what an experience.

I'll give credit to Disney for knowing how to make good money and milk and milk and milk until the cows have no milk but I can't stand how many timelines and how constantly aware these movies have become.I wanted to get up after half an hour but stuck with it because let's face it... I paid for the ticket.The movie to be fair is fun in very small doses and if it came out before the glorious avengers timeline and before Logan became a wonderful end, I would be probably change my tune to sum it up as fun but it's as bad as the last Thor.If I was given bags of cash to come back I too would have so I can't blame any of the actors - it's a job I get it.I just wish Disney / Marvel would hit the reset switch, take time off, and come back strong but that's not how business works unfortunately.Well done for a fun movie in its own right but fingers crossed that this is the last one to come out and ruin the wonderful history of movies. It felt unnecessary.If you go in with the idea of just watching a fun movie with no connection to anything else then you'll have some fun but if you felt any connection to the previous movies or characters you might have a feeling of being ripped off by someone who knows how to make money and make money Disney will.To sum up how bad I thought it was, my review started out as 4 stars and with a bit of time and thought it went down to the now more accurate 2 stars.

Deadpool And Wolverine (I can't believe I'm saying this!) Is a 2024 dark comedy action film with Ryan Reynolds not only returning as Deadpool but the Hugh himself returns as Wolverine after 7 years, but this time he's wearing his classic suit and seen as a letdown in an alternative universe as he failed to save his X-Men team.As their misadventures continue throughout it's over 2 hour runtime the enjoyment and pure fun this film produces is awesome, along with insane cameos and breathtaking visuals this entry in the Deadpool franchise is most certainly different from it's predecessors.What makes it give it the huge difference in comparison is the very powerful chemistry between the 2 leads. Deadpool is what he always has been and has not been altered in any way but Wolverine kind of bounces Deadpool back with some colourful language too and it's like sometimes, their arguments are like a long tennis fight, and I think it was absolutely hilarious.While it's hard to talk about the film without going into spoiler territory, trust me DO NOT GET THIS FILM SPOILED. There's really surprising character comebacks and it's crazy to actually witness on the big screen where you should definitely watch it.Overall Deadpool And Wolverine has the same qualities as the original 2, but with it's horrific but funny gore and explicit jokes comes with more heart and enjoyment with battles and quotable dialogue that really could change the tide of the MCU, this film really is the best of the year so far and makes a mark on Deadpool and the MCU as one of the most fun films I have ever seen, Well done guys!Grade: A+25th July 2024 Showcase Cinema Deluxe Southampton.

Usually by the 3rd sequel, the luster has worn off of the franchise so maintaining that shine is difficult. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman just killed it in this 3rd installment of Deadpool. The jokes, the fight sequences, the jokes...are just non-stop and if you walk out of the credits and miss the usual MCU after the credits...you lost. The whole multiverse concept has not gone over as well as the Infinity Stone story line, but Deadpool may have saved it. The fact they were able to bring back Wolverine and NOT mess with Logan...simply genius. The references to 20th Century Fox, references to old X-Men movies, old Super hero movies is just done so well....and Ryan able to get his wife in this movie, was a really nice Easter Egg. I rated this 9 of 10, but I honestly don't know why I didn't give a 10. I supposed that's serious films, I dunno.

Do you believe that movies should show respect to its characters, and make you FEEL? This movie does just that! It is one of the greatest movies I have ever seen. It works not just on its own but as a whole sendoff and farewell message to the whole of Fox's marvel properties. The comedy is something that is nailed in this film. The journey of Deadpool and Wolverine is something to behold. The intro comes out like a hammer and believe me when I say that it is the greatest way to start the movie. I loved every second of this. My only criticism could be some of the fight choreography was a bit hard to comprehend when it involved large numbers of characters. But this movie has something that will resonate with all, instead of a lifeless movie that belittles characters the audience loves, this movie has SOUL and UPLIFTS its characters. It is cinematic history in the making! Go give this a watch!

Deadpool and Wolverine is a spectacular showcase of Marvel's ability to seamlessly integrate Fox characters into the Marvel Universe. Serving as a nostalgic farewell to the Fox era, the film is packed with clever references that will delight longtime fans.While the dynamic duo of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman undeniably steal the show with their impeccable chemistry and hilarious banter, the film's plot unfortunately falls flat.Despite lacking depth, the movie compensates with its over-the-top action sequences, stunning visuals, and non-stop humor. The jaw-dropping fight scenes are a highlight, and the witty dialogue had me laughing out loud.Ultimately, Deadpool and Wolverine is an entertaining action-comedy that's more style than substance. Reynolds and Jackman's performances are electric, and their on-screen partnership is pure magic. I eagerly anticipate seeing them share the screen again.

Deadpool&wolverine is the most deadpoolie films ever made!!First of all its the funniest deadpool film of the three also its the best of the three and most serios of the three.And my god that opning scene!!!My best thatere exprience since endgame!!What im trying to say is: youre not ready ok.This is a film you must see with a packed thatre!And those cameos are very suprising all 3 trailers showd almost nothing go as soon as possible to not spoil yourself!!This is a film youre not gonna want ruind!Also those action scenes!!!Best of mcu since endgame.Also there is only one post credit scene its at the very end of the credits.Now what are you wating for go to that thater and watch it now!!

Oh my god basically everything about this movie is great. The comedy is on par and sometimes better than its predecessors, the action sequences are easily some of the most satisfying fight scenes in the MCU and the dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine was amazing. The cameos were also really surprising and relevant to the overall story (one in particular completely made me lose my mind). The villain was solid and entertaining enough to move the story along. However, one of my main problems was the pacing. It feels like they were able to put a 3 act movie into the first 75 minutes and then all of a sudden there's still 45 minutes left. The story after was still great but it just felt a bit off. Plus they didn't really cover the whole Deadpool Corp thing enough for me to understand and care about the conflict. It was still very funny but the narrative side was a bit confusing. Other than those small issues, this is easily one of the best things Marvel has released in a WHILE.

I just came back from watching Deadpool and wolverine and it was amazing. It beautifully finishes the original x-men movies and it also continuous hugh jackman's wolverine in the most respectful way possible. The chemistry between ryan reynolds and hugh jackman also really shows in this movie. It's just a very well thought out and perfektly eksiquted movie where every detail has been thought of. Its amazing how many Easter eggs and reference there are in this movie. Ryan renolds have really out done him self this time!Its a testimant to how most marvel movies should be and a wet love letter to all things x-men and marvel.

This is the movie that I had been waiting for a very long time. 24 years ago I saw the X-Men in theaters and I kept wondering why they were all dressed in black. Wolverine finally gets to use his correct costume, the one we all love from the comic books and cartoons. This movie is plenty of fun, with Ryan Reynolds constantly breaking the fourth wall and just being himself. The multiverse is the perfect plot device to bring back dead characters and explore dead movie franchises which this movie does beautifully. I am glad the Hugh Jackman is back. I recommend seeing this in 3-D as not many movies are made this way anymore.

Coming from someone who's not easy to bore and who normally likes stuff but watching this movie felt like I should take my eyeballs out with a spoon and cut my ears off. Thus felt like a cheap parody movie, infact i wont even call this a movie. Lame jokes, stupid script, unnecessary extra cast.Wolverine had no role whatsoever. Its a complete waste of time and money. I am surprised by the rating.. what has happened to fellow humans, have they completely lost it. Feels like non-sense and stupid is in trend nowadays. Really really disappointed with Marvel. Pls stop making movie just for the sake of it.

It is a masterpiece from top to the bottom, fight scenes and comedy. I dont care what anyone says, this is an amazing movie for the MCU.The cameos are perfect and live up to the comics name. The fight scenes are excellent done, and most of all the music choice is unreal. It somehow fits Deadpool's style and also provides a good fight. I know some people dont like the humor of Deadpools movies, but i find it hilarious. I am clearly not the only either, everytime something funny was said the whole theater laughed.So all in all Deadpool & Wolverine is a success, and may be what the MCU needs to strive again.

Yes, you could say he is the Marvel Jesus. This movie has just the right mix! Ryan is the perfect actor for it! And like the rest of the Avengers stars, he's one of my favorites... Well done and really fun to go to the movies again. The Marvel movies thrive on their core characters... you're always happy to see them... it's the same with Wolverine... no one embodies him as well as Hugh Jackman... He and Deadpool are truly Disney's saviors.. As I said, the movie was great fun although I wasn't hoping for too much at first... an even 10 out of 10. People go to the movies and watch it... definitely the best Marvel movie in years.

If Marvel wasn't so greedy, I'd say this should be their sean song. They brought back elements and long forgotten characters from over the years while someone tying up a lot of loose knots. While there were a few "wtf" CGI moments, (namely Logan once he puts his mask on,) but otherwise it was truly perfect. It wasn't at all watered down as many of us fears when comparing to the previous 2 installments in the trilogy, and even made sure to be VERY self aware while never taking itself too seriously. Sadly no, this DOES NOT MEAN Marvel is "saved." We all know their next movie will be right back to the garbage they've been doing since End Game, (Spider-Man excluded.) The SMART move would be to allow this to be the final film they make for a while and then start with a fresh reboot. Buuuuut we all know that won't happen.

This might be one of my new favorite movies of all time. It hits a lot of specific movie tropes that I really enjoy, such as found family, time travel, and AUs. The soundtrack is AMAZING, and I've been listening to Like a Prayer on loop since I left the theater after seeing it the first time (I've seen it twice in theaters already). Ryan Reynolds is amazing as Deadpool (as always), and Hugh Jackman is equally great as Wolverine. Their on-screen chemistry is perfect, even - or especially - during the tense moments. I was pretty surprised that I liked this movie as much as I did, especially considering it was a three-quel. It's definitely a must see!

Not all good movies are enjoyable, and not all enjoyable movies are good. This one is solidly in the latter category. If you like Ryan Reynolds' humor style, especially that of the prior Deadpool films, it's almost a lock that you'll laugh at and enjoy this as well because, well, it's more of the same.The action is also quite good. Some of the sequences can overstay their welcome at times, but they're always at least initially visually interesting. They just needed to be about 20% shorter, I think.There's a strong visual spectacle to the whole thing that is also quite good...probably better than the previous Deadpools.The acting was decent. I think Jackman in particular gets to go places I'm glad he went with this character. The moments are brief, but they're good. Reynolds...not so much. Cassandra Nova's actress did quite well I thought. Chris Evans is delightful in his cameo. But most of the rest were highly forgettable.But let's talk about the bad. The Plot. There isn't one. Okay, that's not entirely fair. There is a plot. It's just TERRIBLE. It's little more than a light justification for stringing together random cameo sequences and Reynolds' comedy bits. The movie feels almost like a sketch comedy show but with two recurring characters in each sketch, like a Python movie.Both villains' entire plans are undone by the fact that both of them are extremely stupid for no reason...multiple times. Each time Logan and Wade get the better of them, you WILL see it coming in the same way that a train blasting it's horn at you is hard to miss.Logan's character arc makes good sense, and resonates, but Reynolds' kind of doesn't. It is invented for this movie. To some extent that might be inevitable in the third installment of a trilogy.And while the fan service/homages/references/cameos are often done well and in a comforting way (the movie would have been insufferable had they been done poorly), they are nonetheless empty calories.And of course, plot holes. There are so many plot points that feel arbitrary and nonsensical. Characters doing things for the purpose of advancing the plot. Technologies or magic system points that come out of nowhere to justify things. I don't think it's a spoiler to name the most egregious one: The 'Anchor Being' concept is so profoundly idiotic and inconsistent that I actively encourage you not to think about it lest you lose 5-7 IQ points from psychic damage. As I did. And believe me, it's FAR from the only one.But at the end of the day, the question is: Did I have a good time? I did. As stupid as this movie was, Reynolds is funny and charming. The action is fun. There are a few parts of the movie that just DRAG, but I had a good time. And isn't that the point?

Rating: 8/10The "Deadpool & Wolverine" movie is an absolute blast from start to finish! Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman deliver electrifying performances, bringing their signature wit, charm, and action hero credentials to the table.The film's clever script masterfully balances humor and heart, with plenty of laugh-out-loud moments and heartfelt interactions between the leads. The action scenes are intense and expertly choreographed, showcasing the duo's unstoppable chemistry.Reynolds and Jackman's banter is pure gold, and their characters' unlikely friendship is genuinely heartwarming. The movie's pace is relentless, with constant surprises and thrilling set pieces.Overall, "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a triumphant union of two beloved characters, delivering non-stop thrills, humor, and excitement. Don't miss this unforgettable adventure!Positives:

The first deadpool was fun, the scrond was evern better and just awesome with josh brolin as cableNow as for deadpool and wolverine, well, yes the cameos are nice to see, yes the blood and offensive language is funny to a point, and to see wolverine team up with deadpool is long over due, in fact i hope they make another one with these two, but with a more solid better story with heart, thrills, and a villian we care about.Sure nova was kind of menacing in this, but she is the typical standard bad guy or bad girl. Course the star trek ending was amusing. But this movie is not worth the ticket price, wait til bargin tuesday. It's fan service nothing more.

Okay, so there's not much of a story here. They give us just another reason to save the world. But Marvel has taken this simple plot and done what they do best. Give the audience what they're craving for.Superhero face-offs, spoofs, breaking the 4th wall lavishly with enough humor and intense action sequences.And they know when to give you something, I mean the exact moment to deliver something that you've been waiting for from the beginning of the film.In this movie, the cameos deserve special mention. It is almost like Marvel never give up on their superheroes. It is all about leaving a legacy.I can't say much without spoilers but some of the cameos were a lovely gesture to some long lost superheroes.Three cameos particularly stands out. One where most of the audience guesses the character wrongly. Then the one with the glasses (you'll understand when you watch it) and last but not the least, the one from .. oh I can't reveal that.But it's a beautiful way to poke all the DC fans out there (me included).And now to Wolverine,So nice to see Hugh Jackman reprising his role without feeling any pressure on him. We could sense that he was enjoying the role again. There was a sense of calm this time (along with the rage). And the end credit scenes will leave a smile in you.

Marvel Jesus... There is no savior for Marvel anymore.Went to see the film after reading a couple reviews here giving it 8-10. Boy should I be smarter next time.As someone stated earlier, Deadpool 1 was greatest of them all, giving a new spark to Marvel movies.Deadpool was a pass, but this one is overforced humor and a lot of unnecessary fights which are meaningless since both parties regenerate and don't flinch at that many stabs.The whole point of the movie is lost on me.If I could I would get my money back.Not going blindly at the movies anymore, but checking out lowest reviews to get an idea of what to expect and maybe wait till it hits streaming services or something.

This whole film and convoluted story shouldn't work, but it does because it is so funny. If Marvel were to stop making movies now, this would be a perfect ending. This phase of the MCU has been dire but Deadpool & Wolverine has made suffering through the awful Thor Love and Thunder and Antman 3 worth the wait. If it were any smarter, it'd write a book, a book that would make Ulysses look like it was written in crayon. It would read it to you. I can't remember the last time that I saw a film that caused so many laughs and happy reactions from the collective audience. Forget about the newish Doctor Doom. Give Deadpool his own phase.

I loved this movie and I am not even a Marvel fan. Talk about one surprise after another. They literally brought back characters that were trapped in the back of the closet of my childhood memories. It has the right kind of edgy rated R comedy you would expect from Ryan Reynolds, and perhaps one of the best action sequences with the perfect amount of gore you would expect from a Deadpool movie. And of course nobody did this movie more justice than the return of Hugh Jackman to the Marvel/X-Men universe. He truly returned to the big screen with a loud echoing bang. Both he and Ryan Ronalds have such a chemistry together that made this movie one of my favorites. Wolverine with his serious attitude and Deadpool with his nonsensical humor. Truly opposites attract. This movie is definitely the best Deadpool movie of all time and is definitely one of the best Marvel movies of all time.

FILM: 8.5 Deadpool & Wolverine is an unexpected treat, especially for someone like me who thought Hugh Jackman had permanently hung up his claws after Logan. I remember thinking that it would take a miracle to get him back as Wolverine, but leave it to newly crowned Marvel Jesus Ryan Reynolds and the sheer force of his passion for Deadpool to make it happen. Watching these two together on screen is pure joy; their bromance is undeniable, and it translates so well into their performances.This film proves once again that when the right people are behind a project, comic book movies can still feel fresh and exciting. Reynolds' relentless passion for Deadpool, which willed the character into existence back in 2016, now brings Wolverine back into the fold. The film doesn't shy away from what made Deadpool such a hit-despite joining the MCU, the character isn't watered down. In fact, the film takes every opportunity to mercilessly skewer Disney, Marvel, and even a few rival studios. The violence and profanity are as brutal as ever, which is honestly a relief; it stays true to what fans love.As a fan, I also appreciate the cavalcade of cameos. It seems like every other film these days is crammed with nostalgic appearances, but this one actually makes those characters earn their place in the story. It's fun without feeling forced, which is a rare feat.If there's one weak spot, it's the villain, who doesn't quite live up to the standard set by the rest of the film. But then again, that's something I've come to expect from Marvel, so it didn't really dampen my overall enjoyment.All in all, Deadpool & Wolverine is a blast from start to finish. It's a movie made by people who clearly love these characters as much as the fans do, and it's loads of fun to watch. If you're a fan of either character, this is one you won't want to miss.FORMAT: CinemaVIDEO: 10.0 4K theatrical presentation Detail level: Excellent Colour reproduction: Excellent Level accuracy: Excellent Encode: Excellent Master condition: ExcellentAUDIO: 10.0 Dolby Atmos theatrical audio Dialogue reproduction: Excellent Soundtrack & effects clarity: Excellent Dynamics: Excellent Surround sound presentation: Excellent LFE content: ExcellentMOOFIEMETER: 8.0.

This was without a doubt the funniest thing I have watched in a very long time. Jokes were 10/10 and I'm lucky to be in the demographic that was able to get 99% of them.However, what thwarts it from receiving a 10/10 is a few things.Yes, it's a 10/10 comedy sketch, but not a film.There were a few scenes/jokes that did go on for longer than necessary. This is especially more noticeable in a second viewing; which I did just to be sure I was on it the first time. I don't know if that's on the director or editor and it doesn't ruin the movie, though it does take away from it some.There is no real story beats beyond that the characters need to get back and save the day. Commonplace, but here, for the majority of the film we are simply cast adrift while the pacing stops and we wait for something important to happen. It's oddly stagnant, but not easily noticed by most I think because they were too busy laughing to be paying attention. I was laughing too, but I was also trying to get invested in the plot.In an effort to avoid spoilers I'll simply say that Deadpool's motivation here is delivered weaker in this movie than all the rest. One thing I adored in Deadpool 2 was its combination of humor and emotion. There are no heartstrings being pulled here. And weirdly enough, I think that the creators were going for it in this film but it didn't translate well through the screen, which is disappointing.8/10 I love this movie but it does have room to improve.

Deadpool & Wolverine is the perfect example of a fan-service film. It works in the way that it's very character-centric , with both Deadpool and Wolverine being well rounded characters with several movies under their belt at this point. Ironically , Wolverine is a little more one dimensional this time around (considering we see several versions of him - not including the older films) but he's still the Wolverine we know and love with also some of the same internal struggles we've known him to have every time we see him. It's just in a slightly different context this time. It works though , and the pairing of these two characters , both perfectly suited for an R-rated environment showcasing tons of action and self-referential commentary , while also featuring cameos from fan favorite marvel characters both new and old. The problems start with the villain , which ties into issues that Marvel films have been having for a while now. There's no avoiding it at this point. Though the meta nature of Deadpool can help you shrug off things here and there , there is no avoiding not just the extremely vague/shallow motivations of the antagonist , but the same tropes that Marvel has implemented as part of their formula that they've been using for over half a decade now. There's plot holes and MacGuffins galore , and no matter how many times you point that out and try to make us laugh about it, (and therefore hopefully shrug it off) it just doesn't work like that. If your movie has off kilter pacing and plot points that make you start questioning things to a point where you are taken out of the experience, said experience is inevitably diminished. In this day and age , Marvel just makes too many excuses to get from Point A to Point B that it can't be ignored. No amount of cameos and references is going to hide that fact , especially for people that genuinely care about the art of film. I say this because if you're just a Marvel fan that wants to see some of your favorite heroes, and more importantly Deadpool and Wolverine on the big screen both as a team and against each other, (arguably one of the best scenes in the movie is a fight scene that takes place solely inside a Honda Odyssey) you'll probably be pleased. However , as someone who was obsessed with the MCU all the way up until Endgame , they started losing me once it was obvious they had no real plan. I don't blame them. You want to keep the machine going. It's just that it this point it doesn't matter what you put on screen and how much you make me laugh; if that same tired formula is still clearly being used - those same heights can never be reached again until the whole foundation is re-worked top to bottom. All that being said, It's still a perfectly enjoyable movie that will make plenty of people happy - happy in the same way No Way Home made people happy. It's just that you can't help but worry about where things even go from here and how they could possibly keep the lightning striking. Something will have to change.... Maybe I'm just not into Marvel like I used to be.SEE IT FOR DEADPOOL&WOLVERINE (and a certain man in sunglasses) but nothing else. Cheers.-Tate.

Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) is an exhilarating and entertaining film that earns an 8/10 for its successful blend of humor and action. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman deliver standout performances, bringing their iconic characters to life with chemistry and charisma. The cinematography is dynamic, capturing the film's high-energy sequences and darkly comic tone. The story is engaging, balancing action with witty dialogue, though it occasionally relies on familiar tropes. The soundtrack adds a vibrant pulse to the film, enhancing its energetic atmosphere. Overall, it's a fun and well-executed addition to the superhero genre, though it could have pushed its boundaries even further.

I can't even begin to describe how disappointed I was with Deadpool 3. I tried SO hard to finish the movie, but I got so bored that I just couldn't make it through. Seriously, what was this even about? A multiverse? WTF is that? Nothing original, nothing funny like the first two films I loved. There's no gore, no witty banter-none of the things that made the first movies so fun and refreshing. This one felt flat and uninspired, like it was just trying to cash in on multiverse hype, but it completely missed the mark. I honestly can't get it. I was sitting there, trying to find something to hold onto, but nope, it wasn't happening. I'm so bummed I even wasted my time on this.

I loved a lot of things about the movie. The humor, dialog, costumes, camios especially!, and even the incredible amounts of cgi blood and fight scenes. It does a great job as a dead pool movie in the sense that it gives you what you want however the only pressing con I found was that it seemed very clostrophobic in a way. The scenes, the story, even though part of it takes place in infinite void from time and universes, there was still something that made it feel like the every scene was in box and not in a world. Could it be a common things with budgets and special effects in movies now days that is creating it or is there something else such as cinematography lens choices for certain scenes? To be honest I'm not quite sure what it is exactly that gave me such an impression but it leaves me wanting to see it again in order to find out and to see if there was other things I may have missed.Over all still a great comedy with good action and of course big nods to the comics and creators that inspired it.

Enter Deadpool 3 and I walked in brushing myself up on the happenings of Deadpool 2.So let me get that out of the way. There is no direct relation and part 3 can be watched without remembering part 2.Avoiding any spoilers, I will say this, the movie lives to its promise of humour and both Hugh and Ryan play their roles to perfection.The story is always in every dead pool movie, loose and easy to follow. Scratch that! This one starts off a bit in the future and one needs to pay a little attention to keep track.The humour is great and makes the whole 2 hour journey of this movie worth it. The movie keeps with its Deadpool trend which is tongue in cheek humour and it is well timed and helps one really get a good load off oneself. Laughter is indeed the best medicine.The killings are still gruesome so I would suggest avoid any kind of ketchup in your food as it makes an unnecessary correlation. I kind of wish Deadpool wasn't so gruesome but hey it's DEADpool the name says it all.The movie promises a future continuance of this partnership and I for one would love to see this Wolverine and Deadpool bromance take over from the Avengers.

I kept my expectations low going into this film, considering the disastrous cringe fests that were Endgame, Spiderman NWH, Doctor Strange MoM, GotG Vol. 3, Venom, etc. & don't even get me started on the Disney+ shows. Marvel has been truly unbearable recently.But this movie right here... really brought the thrilling, gruesome, & intense action that comic hero/action movie lovers yearn for! Everything from the cameos, comedy, action, & cinematography that recent Marvel films have been disgustingly FORCING & LACKING have been made up with this film.Every fight scene in this movie is miles beyond any fight scene that was in that absolute disgrace & overrated embarrassment of a movie that is called Endgame. Still don't understand the praise over that film.Hugh Jackman & Ryan Reynolds's acting was fantastic per usual, there was never a dry or dull moment through the entire movie, these 2 make a great combo. Hugh Jackman looked AWESOME in the Wolverine suit. Ryan Reynolds quips and witty humor complimented everything perfectly.Very very solid movie. Marvel, PLEASE, keep your momentum with this movie.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" is a must-watch! The film perfectly blends intense action with side-splitting comedy. The partnership between Deadpool and Wolverine is electric, with Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman delivering stellar performances. The action scenes are mind-blowing, and the comedy had me laughing so hard I cried. The witty banter and hilarious situations make this movie a standout. It's a rollercoaster of emotions, combining heart-pounding moments with laugh-out-loud humor. If you're a fan of either character, you'll love this film. It's an unforgettable cinematic experience that's both thrilling and entertaining. Highly recommende.

I'm not the biggest fan of Deadpool, however, I greatly enjoyed the first movie, and I even made peace with the second, which is acceptable and has several strong points. But this third one is nothing more than another wet dream of Reynolds, and not one of the properly conceived ones.It doesn't surprise me that there were so many writers involved, as the quantity only served to dilute the quality.Obviously, as a writer, I'm mainly referring to the story's plot structure, character development, their depth, and everything that makes a good story enjoyable and memorable. Yet, all of that was lost in a sea of cameos devoid of emotional depth for the main story, and even a nonsensical barrage of verbiage from all the characters, each with less comedic weight than the last, until it became tiresome.In other words, they relied on nostalgia as the primary driver of this movie and even tried to ride the coattails of Logan's success to exploit it; however, the lack of connection and emotion caused them to desecrate one of the best movies, and one of the best endings, in this category, all to satisfy the spontaneous ideas of a character who should take some time to think things through better.It's not that I have a problem with bringing Wolverine back, but not like this. Much less under the stupid premise that Vanessa and Wade broke up due to Deadpool's frustration over not being able to do something meaningful with his life, even though there wasn't the slightest hint of those thoughts in the previous movie. In fact, it doesn't even fit with Deadpool's ideology.Honestly, I couldn't believe that after all that odyssey, their relationship would break so easily, and even less so, that it would be mended just as easily-and without the slightest involvement of all those -supposed- friends of Deadpool.Moreover, I'm not even going to get started on the dramatic holes in the timelines, let alone the clich appearance of a villain pulled from nowhere, the unification of worlds that don't even make sense together, or the barrage of theatrical scenes that completely disrupt the story's flow.It's clear that the writers were aware of the lack of narrative depth involved in bringing up the multiverse and time travel (themes that played a detrimental role in the MCU) as a method to revive characters and continue profiting off them. However, they didn't care and did it anyway.In any case, it's just my opinion, and as far as I'm concerned, I'm going to watch Logan once more to get rid of such a frustrating narrative structure, and then wait until Ryan Reynolds invents another character to make fun of this terrible event. But if the fans continue to prioritize nostalgia so much, then I suppose this will be our cinematic future, just like what happened with Star Wars.That said, I greatly enjoyed the choreography between Wolverine and Deadpool, the nostalgic appearance of some characters (even though they made no sense), and even seeing some actors I hadn't seen in a long time. In that sense, it felt like this movie was more of a personal project by the fans to pay tribute to those heroes, and therefore, a nice reminder of those times, which would explain the additional scenes at the end of the movie, and even the music from my childhood. However, as a writer, it was inevitable for me to hate the premise, the plot, and the overall character development, since the new ends up desecrating the old, just as Deadpool exemplified with Wolverine's lifeless body; which seems to be Disney's new strategy with all the remakes they have cooking."We were so preoccupied with whether we could, that we didn't stop to think if we should."In the end, when we understand that in the digital world our voices can last for centuries, it forces us to realize that we must refine the footprints we will leave behind. And therefore, following my own advice, only the best of my literary work will endure in this small vault: ...

Deadpool & Wolverine is the only Marvel film to come out this year, so it needed to deliver, and boy it did!
