Were we ever really in doubt though when we heard that it was going to keep its R rating.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman absolutely kill it and have such great chemistry together, from the jokes/comedy and the fight scenes, to the heartfelt moments.This movie is a barrel of fun with plenty of references and pokes and nods to Disney and Fox in the jokes. Deadpool breaking the fourth wall never gets old. There are plenty of great cameos to take you by surprise, and the villain, Cassandra Nova, isn't a top tier villain but she still does an excellent job in the role.It is easy to follow and is fairly easy to understand what is going on in case the inclusion of the TVA had you concerned it would be confusing.The music soundtrack is perfect with little references, but that opening sequence was so good. I have that song on repeat it's so good.Hats off to Shawn Levy, Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, because their work absolutely paid off big time and this film deserves all the success as I cannot see a better way to have done this film it is the perfect send off to Fox. My favourite Deadpool film, but a tough decision between Logan and this one for my favourite "X-Men/Fox" film.If you have not seen it yet, go and see it now while it is still in theaters, as it a surreal experience and watching it on Disney+ doesn't feel the same as the theater experience.

Oh how I was looking forward to this... Yeah, like everybody else, I know. I'm certainly not alone in my love for X-Men, although, in all honesty, I haven't kept up enough to know all the details. And so, there were more than enough moments and references throughout which left me clawing my own brain (much like a certain character in the movie) looking for the right information to go with what I was seeing to explain the overwhelming mayhem that was going on. Unfortunately, for the most part, I was left feeling exactly like that: overwhelmed and pummelled by the nonsensical mayhem.Please understand: I freaking love Deadpool!! And I love Wolverine even more, I really do. You have no idea how high my anticipation was for this collaboration that's basically been 24 years in the making. 'Logan' (2017) was a truly beautiful piece of cinema, deeply moving and virtually flawless. It was a truly fitting ending to one of the best fictional characters in modern cinema. I remember going into 'Deadpool & Wolverine' extremely excited, and then, as the introductory scene started rolling out, suddenly I thought to myself, "Oh God, I hope they don't ruin it." I was overcome by a sudden sense of dread that somehow, Wolverine's resurrection in this movie would somehow completely demolish the feeling left behind by 'Logan'. And I hate to say it, but... I wasn't entirely wrong. Certainly, this is Deadpool and you know going in that absolutely *nothing* is sacred, but still... Was it worth it? Was it at least funny? The answer is yes... and no.The absolute worst thing has happened: I didn't love 'Deadpool & Wolverine'. I didn't hate it either. It left me feeling ambivalent. Who the hell wants to feel ambivalent about the greatest X-Men pairing of all time??The first act was great. It gave me great hopes for the second and third acts, and then, suddenly, that feeling vanished. The start of the second act is awesome, no doubt about it. D&W are hurled into what's essentially the garbage bin of the universe, and this is where all the fabled cameos start rolling in. And then, inexplicably, there's a shift in tone. The first familiar X-Men face to turn up made me super happy, and then it was over before you could even blink and I felt a devastating disappointment. I was so looking forward to this particular reunion/confrontation and it ended so abruptly that I felt robbed. I felt the shift happen with the rest of the audience as well, it was palpable. From this moment on, so much happens all at once and we're thrown into a setting that's so reminiscent of "Deadpool and Wolverine beyond Thunderdome", (including actual jokes about Mad Max) that somehow, it passes the point of parody and turns into on-the-nose clich. It all feels too familiar, and at the same time, so strange and confusing, I was just constantly stuck in a feeling of "what the hell is going on"?! Who are all these characters? What are they doing here? Why did Feige et al pull open such a random can of X-Men villains without giving any of them any worthy screen time? How are we even supposed to understand everything that's happening when all we are given to go on is an overload of references and puzzle pieces that we apparently have to put together ourselves? Do they expect every single audience member to possess an encyclopaedic knowledge of the entire MCU? Jason Flemyng and Kelly Hu are back as Azazel and Lady Deathstrike respectively and are given so little screentime and not even a single line of dialogue, it really makes you wonder if they prioritised quantity over quality this time. The answer to me is clearly, yes. It feels as if they spent 15 minutes working on the actual story for this film, and the rest of the time they had on gathering as many Marvel characters (and nearly all their original actors!) as possible to pummel the audience into their own kind of Void, where we might actually be fooled into thinking that an overkill of quantity actually equates quality.The rest of the audience clearly felt the same way I did. From the start of the second act, for at least about half an hour or so, it was awkwardly quiet in the theatre. Nobody laughed and all the jokes fell completely flat. It wasn't until the third act that things started looking up again. Maybe it has all become too familiar. The first Deadpool movie was incredible, because it was something that had never actually been done before, style wise. The tone was so original and refreshing, and the ironic nature of the humour was such an original concept that it all worked surprisingly well. Then they did it a second time and even though it was a little less brilliant, it was still great. This time, it's just... yeah I've seen this before. Oh ha-ha, ironic joke. A dozen ironic songs. Breaking the fourth wall so much it's been destroyed completely. Subtlety was never Deadpool's strong suit, but this is overkill, even for him.God, I feel like a right sourpuss right now. Was it all bad? No!! Absolutely not! In fact, there was a lot that was hysterically funny, really well done and OH MY GOD WOLVERINE IN HIS ORIGINAL COSTUME IS THE COOLEST THING EVER AND SOOOOO WORTH THE WAIT!! There will truly never be another Wolverine like Hugh Jackman, and I for one am so thankful that he came back to do this one more time! For this reason alone, this movie is well worth the price of an admission ticket. And yes, some of the cameos are truly awesome - there are a few who were seriously unexpected surprises - and are a joy to watch. But still... I can't shake the feeling that it could have been done very differently. There was just too much of everything, but (and here's the true irony of Deadpool 3) by and large the best scenes were those where Poolboy and Wolfie were alone together. That's where the magic was; they didn't need anyone else. The story was downright idiotic and the main villain was annoying and uninteresting AF, and the few cameos I was truly looking forward to were all so short they barely added anything of value, with a couple of exceptions. And the thing that puzzles me the most is the staggering absence of Vanessa. They already ticked me off by virtually erasing her from DP2, and now she has even less screen time. I don't get it. Not only is her presence Wade's most important driving force, but the chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin is so awesome, that I am simply dumbfounded as to why they wouldn't use her more. Oh man, I could go on forever... There is so much that I loved, and so much else that frustrated and confused me.Is it worth it? Yes.Is it all I hoped it would be? No.

If you a fan of old school MCU and just want a great laugh, you've come to the right place.Self aware jokes ripping into the current state of MCU, loveable cameos, just a great time in general.I wasn't expecting the storyline to be so well developed as well. The cast is incredible as always and Hugh Jackman addition was lovely to say the least.Villain was incredible whilst not being the primary objective which I find refreshing. My only concern is that the multiverse theme will become too common a trend and become old soon, with different versions of main characters being reused and washed up.Highly recommend giving this a watch.

I'm a Deadpool, Ryan Reynolds fan and this movie didn't disappoint. The action was ongoing and their are a few cast surprises they managed to keep secret. I'm glad they did because it was a pleasant surprise! The soundtrack was awesome and the storyline was good but got better towards the middle of the movie. Would've loved to see more character development in a few of the characters but other than that I enjoyed the movie. The references made about the MCU and movie studios was priceless. The character Wolverine was excellent as you would expect nothing less. Jackson and Reynolds's had good chemistry and it showed. Great job!

I've loved all the Marvel movies, but this is one of the worst films I've ever watched. It's tedious with barely a thread of a plot.I wish I'd timed how often Deadpool and Wolverine fight each other - I reckon that must have covered around 30 minutes of running time. In fact, most of the movie is just mindless fight scenes; perhaps that's to disguise the lack of plot.It's not really a movie but an excuse for 183 minutes of Ryan Reynolds trying to show off how witty his dialogue can be.The director must get a particular joy watching people get skewered in the nuts, as it occurs around 20 times through the movie. It just gets boring after the first 2 or 3 times.I actually wanted to walk out half-way through the movie, but persisted and wasted an extra hour of my life.

Not what we expected but it still a great movie...I love the chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine; it's on another level. My only issue is with the villain, but I won't spoil anything you can watch it for yourself..............Overall, 'Deadpool and Wolverine' succeeds in delivering an entertaining and visually impressive adventure that fans of the characters will undoubtedly enjoy. While it may not be flawless, the film's strengths lie in its engaging performances, spectacular action, and sharp humor... It's a must-watch movie for Marvel enthusiasts and a fun ride for casual viewers....

A cinematic sugar-hit, as many folks have said & they're not wrong.Reynolds probably got everyone together whilst Huge Ackman brings the gravitas, the dramatic chops - call it what you will.Cameo after cameo is true, but that you've got great actors filling out these tiny roles is the key to the funtastic successful stocking fillers. The new faces were 100% top shelf too!I tapped out after Endgame apart from the big screen offerings of Dr Strange 2, Black Widow, & The Marvels. Would like to have kept up with Loki's timeline shenanigans on the Disney channel but I'm afraid of going down the Disney/MCU/Star Wars rabbit hole. My experience with Back To The Future, Terminator, Timecop (yes, you heard right) did suffice in helping to understand this movie's time alteration hijinks.Most people will have fun with it.[Edit: the closing credits montage of the early X-Men films was a fine reminder of how so very many of us have aged alongside Hugh's take on Logan - The Wolverine]

Deadpool & Wolverine is a breath of fresh air for the Marvel Cinematic Universe and a warm farewell to the Fox Universe. A true feast of Easter Eggs, both for movie and comic book fans, and a killer soundtrack! The chemistry between Hugh Jackman's Wolverine and Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool carries the whole film. The only thing holding this movie back from getting a 10 for me is that it does take a while to get started, with a fairly exposition-heavy beginning, and the overuse of a handful of swearwords makes the dialog feel a bit sloppy at times. But all in all, it's an excellent film that I cannot wait to watch again!

Let me first say that this film is incredible meta, meaning if you aren't familiar with the marvel movies of the last 25 years, especially with the X-Men franchise, you won't get all that much enjoyment out of it.If you are, there is a lot of great stuff in it. I loved all the jokes they made about the MCU and all the callbacks to the movies made before it. Sadly, Deadpool 3 doesn't bring much to the table itself. The plot makes no sense at all and relies too much on coincidences. There are pacing issues and at times it feels like they smashed tree different scripts together all with a different tone and intention. The story lacks focus and shies away from any clear message. While it is still a joy to watch Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman in their iconic roles going at it, I can't help to wonder if this movie could have been much more.

Just saw the movie in a packed cinema in Poland. It delivered what I (and the fellow people in the audience) expected: trademark humour that got us into Deadpool in the first place, cameos that were more than just that, kick-ass fight scenes and absurd galore.In a world of re-makes, prequels, side-revamp-whatever, this movie is what you need to burst out laughing and once you leave the movie theatre to still giggle at the references, the inside-jokes, the sheer love that was put into it, because it doesn't take itself seriously and that's just what you needed, entertainment (provided you "get" the humour, so maybe first watch the first Deadpool movie and if you don't laugh out loud there, go watch some re-hash...this is a movie that doesn't take itself seriously and it dead serious about that!)Love, love, loved it! And am really glad it drew a lot of people to the cinema, all the dedication and work put into it are paying off for Ryan and everyone involved!

Some witty dialogues , below the belt slang one liners , abundant blood slashing and the same recently overdone and over repeated multiverse theme makes it a one time watch. On a serious note nothing special to be given 8 plus rating. If you want to see an assembly of bygone superheroes this is the movie. If parallel universes are your stuff then you will love it. Honestly in the last couple of years Marvel universe has been overstuffed with this concept and now getting too boring. The high ratings on IMDB is probably from younger moviegoers and not from the yore days x-men lovers. A big weakness of this film is the absence of any major showdown with the adversary. Also the greater evil of Cassandra was not explored well. All in all it is a Ryan and Ryan show.

This movie was everything I wanted from a Deadpool and Wolverine movie. I felt like a kid through all of it. The dialogue, cameos, action, and surprises were all on point. I can watch it again and again. In my humble opinion, the best of the 3. If you want gratuitous violence, strong language, humor, cameos galore, and nostalgia, this is the movie for you. It's a fun ride and I am glad I took it. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds do not disappoint. Chris Evans was great in it as well. What more can I say to meet the minimum six hundred character requirement of IMDB, but if you are a fan of the characters and collected comics in the 80s and 90s, you will be more than satisfied.

I'm sorry I know some people probably worked pretty hard on this but I am so tired of the endless regurgitation pumped out by Marvel these days.As someone who grew up on Marvel and these characters this film honestly dose not resemble them at all.The writing is crude and low-brow. The story line is non-existent. There is really only so many times I can see someone get stabbed in the balls and laugh.The whole multiverse concept is self defeating as well because it diminishes any stakes in the film. In a universe where there are infinite other Deadpools it doesn't matter if one of them dies.I think Stan Lee would be really disappointed in what they've done with his work.Needless to say I want my money back and I really regret being part of this films 'success' because the Disney/Marvel machine will simply pump out more of this garbage; diluting the quality of film and lowering the bar for everyone.

Ill keep this short and wont provide with a detailed review as it will not be necessaryHalf the internet would already cover me on thatGO SEE THE MOVIE!!!The increase in budget can been seen from miles awayThe direction hasnt dropped in qualityand Hugh Jackman is as awesome and as better as he always has been.Moving a liiiitle bit aside from the small exaggeration of some ''sexual' jokes,most of the time they are delivered from very charismatic actors (Ryan Reynolds e.t.c)Hugh Jackman fits in Almost Perfectly,and while this movie wont save for Now or Ever the MARVEL C. USome people behind this project of a film someday get to really show What the people want and they deliverPure Fan Service and Fun Spectable.(also there is nowhere any assasinations of the character of Wolverine,he is as musculine,attractive,witty,monstrous and good hearted as he always has been and he is on a Big Buff this movie,just pointing that out for 1 or 2 Reviewers out there)GO SEE THE MOVIE,turn off your brain a little bit and HAVE FUN!!! <3.

Wow what a ride this was funny from the very beginning and it never let u[ but the funniest scene was when they were in the car and they both started fighting and i mean really fighting, i mean even thou there were cameos it did not matter i just loved the fact theat wolverine and deapooo were finally in a movie togeather and it tottally woked, i still cant believe the people they brought back fot this movei it made my heart rave and there were no slow momence in this at all i would even say this is better then endgame and lets face.it captain marvel ruiend the last avenger ,movie so enjoy this one and laugh like i did this was better then part 2.

This one is the weakest in the Deadpool series but also has so much to enjoy. It's more like the swan song of the Fox X-Men series rather than an MCU entry.First the bad. It's pretty tame compared to the first two Deadpool movies. It may be because it's now under the official Disney-Marvel banner, or maybe it's because the Writers and Actors strikes during development. Whatever the reason, it seems like it's pulling its punches. It still has plenty of bite, but there's some obvious stuff the movie avoids going after.Already, some of the worst of the MCU is bleeding in. Mostly, that it relies too much on other works. Don't know the entire history of Marvel movies including undeveloped ones then the cameos don't feel special. Some of the stuff can go over the heads of casual fans. Didn't see Loki on Disney+? Then a lot of the second half won't make any sense. Deadpool has always used references to other Marvel work, but this is the first time it's necessary to the plot to know this stuff.Sadly, the supporting cast seems to have been tossed aside. There's the party scenes that bookend the movie, but they're entirely gone. None of the fun interactions with Colossus, Negasonic, Dopinder, etc that made the first two so much fun. There's a moment that seems like a set-up to a side story about them rescuing Wade, but nothing comes from it.The movie doesn't have the emotional core that the earlier two did. The first was a love story and the second about family. They had personal stakes. This one is about the destruction of the universe, which is big but lacks that personal touch. It also doesn't connect to the end of the second film as far as where the characters are. Too much of the in-between has to be explained when it would've been easier to just rewrite some scenes.There are two villains, but neither are interesting. Both seem to do whatever furthers the plot but not what makes sense. Neither have a plan that seems thought out, just to make the most problem at any given moment. The previous two had great conflicts, and this points to that lack of personal stakes.And finally, the Multiverse. Marvel and DC Comics have made great use of alternate realities, What Ifs, and possible futures. The movies not so much. I love seeing Patrick Stewart, Michael Keaton, and Tobey Maguire back in costume. But bringing back beloved actors, and occasionally listening to fan castings, seems to be the extent of what the movies are doing. The Deadpool Corps are also wasted. The idea of dozens of alternate Deadpools coming together should be cinematic gold. Instead they're mostly treated as cannon fodder.Now the good. The titular duo are amazing together. Reynolds and Jackman know how to bounce off each other. Both are in perfect form, showing the kind of rapport that's straight out of the comics. This is a team up that's been fifteen years in the making, and it doesn't disappoint in that regard. Though it's definitely more Wolverine's movie. It acknowledges how terrific Logan is, but gives this new Wolverine plenty of depth in what might be the best example of having its cake and eating it too.The movie does for the X-Men movies what No Way Home did for Spider-Man. It expertly includes the previous movie into the MCU while making a great case for their continuation. The X-Men and Spider-Man movies are the reason the MCU even exists so it's nice to see them treated so lovingly.Just like the original Deadpool did, the movie expertly brings the R rating to the MCU. In fact, there's more blood, swearing, and carnage than the other Deadpool movies. The only thing I know they couldn't do is hardcore drug use, and this makes for some fun scenes with Blind Al. This may be under the family friendly Disney banner, but Marvel seems to realize it's best for some franchises do their own thing.Deadpool has always had fun with Easter eggs, cameos, and references. This one more than most. The fight at the 20th Century Fox logo being a big one. It brings back a lot of characters from the franchise, and some from others like the Russian guy from the Thomas Jane Punisher movie. It may be more in-your-face than the previous two, but it's a lot of fun for the hardcore fans.This one feels like Avengers: Endgame. Too many problems to really match up to the previous entries, but too much good stuff to be bad. The MCU has been in a rough spot, but if anything this movie proves that Marvel can acknowledge that and work to fix it. Hopefully this won't be the last we see of Deadpool and Wolverine.

Only Ryan Reynolds could have this much fun with it; he's truly the Jesus of Marvel. Almost every scene has a surprise, specifically catered to fans, making the viewing experience incredibly engaging. Even if you haven't seen the entire Fox X-Men series, you can still enjoy the movie and have a great time! However, it's highly recommended to watch 2017's *Logan* beforehand-it's crucial for understanding some key moments in the film.Overall, the movie is absolutely crazy and bloody, delivering high entertainment value from start to finish. The action sequences are intense, the humor is spot-on, and the surprises keep coming. For the best experience, find a theater with a great atmosphere and enjoy it with an enthusiastic crowd. Watching it with others who are equally excited amplifies the fun and excitement.I truly hope this film can help Marvel bounce back after some lackluster years and remind everyone why we fell in love with their movies in the first place. It's a wild ride that promises to leave a lasting impression on both long-time fans and newcomers alike.

I was super excited to see this movie, but it was Incredibly disappointing. It was great to see Hugh Jackman back with the yellow costume, but this version of his wolverine I think was unintelligible.The plot made absolutely no sense and the humor was not there. I laughed a couple times, but nothing like the first or second Deadpool.I'm not sure if the writer strike had something to do with how this movie ended up turning out. I wouldn't be surprised if this movie ends up, not having the best reviews and being financially successful but a complete flop of a movie. I think most would agree that our expectations were either too high or the movie really just wasn't that great.

LFG!!! Deadpool & Wolverine was the movie we all expected it to be! It was funny, It had heart, it had excellent cameos that serviced the story and that were mind blowing AND most importantly, it had Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman! To anyone who criticizes this film, You just don't get it. You might not get the jokes and the humor and the jumbled/messy, but very effective plot but you are heartless souls if you say this movie doesn't have any emotional depth to it! My theater reaction went wild during this movie! One of the best marvel movies I've seen in today's world! Truly, a triumph for Marvel Studios!!!! Can't wait to see what else they are gonna cook up for us nerds!!

The revenues of superhero films have been disappointing in recent years. The reason is obvious, even though Disney does not seem to realize that realization. It is the same reason that Deadpool & Wolverine is empty despite the barrage of jokes (three or four of which are good ones). And feels thin: because of the endless possibilities of the multiverse - through which characters can step from one reality to another - the stakes are no longer at stake. Films become a series of random scenes with some ultra-violence and adolescent humor for laughs.The collaboration between the two polar opposites is quite infectious, but Deadpool & Wolverine never really becomes a full-fledged film. There is a storyline about two British villains (Emma Corrin and Matthew Macfadyen) who want to mess with the timelines, but any sense of plot development is undone by adolescent humor and countless cameos that add little. What's left is a visually hideous two-hour inside joke.

Greetings from the other side. Everyone has been waiting for this movie, and it did not disappoint. The 2 hours just flew by. It was so good to watch a movie that was made for the fans, with no politics.I will definitely be going to watch it again. I can even remember the last time I did that, but it's been several years for sure.The action scenes were just incredible, The comedy was good, but maybe a tad too much. That would be my only issue with the movie, and it's a minor one. To me, the jokes were just a little too much, it should have been toned down just a little. Actually, the main villan seemed a bit wierd, and really over-powered, but again, it's just a little thing.Other than that, it was awesome. The cameos were very surprising, and there were are few.I don't want to say to much, but you should definitely go see it bub.

I saw the movie and it was okay. It might be the best marvel movie especially after the end game, it was even better than the last movie of spider-man but it had a few mistakes in my opinion. The jokes were sometimes ridiculous. And deadpool for some reason felt like he needed wolverine too much, which I think he is much stronger as a character. Some references were not bad. Marvel needs to stop using the universe thing or it's going to get confusing. In this movie, the time and universe thing didn't have an absurd narrative, but I didn't find the locations simple and beautiful. If you want more details, press the link from my profile and watch my video.

As a lover of Deadpool, I cannot stress enough how disappointing this movie was. I found it incredibly boring and so long. They were so focused on making half assed jokes 4 times a minute that you got no character development or any semblance of interesting plot. Dogpool was cute and the soundtrack was great as always. If I could see oily Hugh Jackman walk out in slow motion to Iris by the Goo Goo Dolls every night before I fall asleep I would. But marvel got its hands on this movie and just ruined everything good about Deadpool. The fight scenes aren't even good. They're long as hell and they reuse the same gag of stabbing someone in the crotch like 15 times in two hours. This whole movie felt like beating a dead horse, and I cannot handle any more multiverse stuff. Marvel is so capitalistic at this point, there is no art in the movies anymore. You have to watch every single release to make sense of anything anymore, and nothing matters. Honestly, I wish I could have my money back or send the movie back to the drawing board. But hey, at least they set it up so they can make 8 more movies!!

Let's be honest, the MCU hasn't been the same since Endgame. Everything they've released in the past few years has either fallen short or completely bombed.That being said, the Deadpool franchise has been really entertaining outside of the MCU...until now. Nothing got me more hyped than knowing this would be a Deadpool AND Wolverine movie. I even decided beforehand that I would still see it even if the reviews were bad.HOLY SH!! This was the most completely awesome Marvel film I've seen in years! The jokes, the action, the cameos, the story ALL of it brought back that great thrill I once had for superhero films.I'm DEFINITELY adding this one when it comes out on video. Thank you Ryan, Hugh, and Shawn for bringing back Marvel's glory!

I don't want to spoil this film for anyone. So I will just say, this film is wonderful! If you're a fan of comic book films, this is a must-see! After 5 long years of MCU Dudds, I feel like this has brought the franchise back to life. I'm uncertain of what Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman's involvement will be in the MCU after this film, but they need to become a big part of it.It's clear to see, that we have been missing some powerhouse stardom after Evans and Downey left the MCU and I believe these two majestic beings (Reynolds and Jackman) are the ones to deliver it!Bring on Deadpool 4,5 & 6.

Let's be clear. If you are expecting another superheroes (recycled) story as happens lately in Marvel; you will be disappointing. But you are willing to laugh and really have fun on the messy Marvel inventions; like timelines and time guardians and multiverse prepare for the time of your life.Some comments said the story is absurd; yes it is; as most of Marve MORE SERIOUS stuff; the good thing about this one is that it make everything big fun.Of course having Hugh Jackman / Wolverine requieres some serios moments; are not that much and are very well and seriusly performed. The rest is one joke after the other and many many unexpected cameos that are also part of the joke.Mixing Avengers; the Fantastic Four and X-MEN did not look easy but Ryan Reynols and the rest of scripting team did and excellent job mixing lots of elements and characters.In brief; enjoy it for two hours you will not regret it.

An incredibly fun ride from start to finish, but with a serious tone underneath. It handles all characters so well its almost unbelievable. It develops some characters further, it brings justice to some that might not even deserve it and brings some to life not seen before. It doesnt hold back, its unforgiving, but without being pretentious. It steers the way back for whole Marvel franchise after so many awful movies and TV shows. It brings so many fun cameos. In other words this film is exactly what it needs to be, what fans wanted and what Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman deserve, and even a little bit more. I dont think one awesome movie can save the whole franchise thought, we will just have to wait and see what the future holds. Life is a mystery :)

I really don't understand what a good movie is in the eyes of people... Whatever the marvel makes a movie doesn't necessarily mean it is a good movie... The voters sometimes give high grades to bad movies and low grades to good movies.. Ok this movie is not so bad... entertaining and good visuals... but I don't think it is worth 10s, 9s or 8s. I've watched it dolby atmos, which was great! Effects and fight scenes are worth seeing... heart-blowing indeed... I am giving my points just for thise fight scenes. Go see it and have some fun with your family or friends.. That should be all you need to expect..

Finally a movie worth watching. Let's get the most important out of the way first, this movie delivers! Big time. I felt like a kittle kid as it brought me back to this wonderful world of make belief. There are some pretty nice cameos, one of which really gave me the thrills and chills. This is definitelly a hit for Disney, and a must watch for the core fans. Jackman is Jacked-man, so believable and really playing it on a high level. Deadpool is fantastic as always with some of the depth but not too much. Antagonists are a bit of a miss tbh, but they get their asses kicked big time, so all good. I wanted to give the movie a 9 but it had some magnificent moments that made me go with 10. Btw, deadpool 1 was a 10/10 for me.

I finally got around to seeing this one tonight. And, I have to say that I'm disappointed.The first half of the movie was just random fight scenes and forest scenes and desert scenes. And it had a completely different feeling from the first two movies. There was no real connection to most of it. And, honestly, I found it boring.Finally, about halfway through, it got interesting. Logan and Wade came together and went on mission. And I couldn't turn away.Then came the excitement that I felt in the first two movies.I have to say that it ended great! I would still recommend it, even though I'm only giving it a six rating. But I would recommend waiting until it starts streaming so you can fast forward past the boring parts.

Deadpool & Wolverine continues with the adventures of Wade Wilson/Deadpool(Ryan Reynolds), after the events of Deadpool(2016) & Deadpool 2(2018). Logan/Wolverine(Hugh Jackman) wants nothing to do with anyone, when he meets Deadpool. They join forces to vanquish a powerful enemy.Deadpool & Wolverine is a mind-blowing film. Director Shawn Levy has given us a movie that builds upon the best parts of the Deadpool franchise & amplifies it because the titular characters are now in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The comedy will make you guffaw uncontrollably. Don't worry though. There's definitely a heartwarming & emotional core at its center. The action set pieces are awe-inspiring. The visual effects are phenomenal. The 3D is eye-popping & becomes even more immersive in IMAX. The cameos are jaw-dropping! Ryan Reynolds is spectacular as Wade Wilson/Deadpool. Reynolds should play Deadpool forever. Hugh Jackman is outstanding as Logan/Wolverine. It's an absolute delight to see Jackman finally wear the comic book accurate Wolverine costume, after 24 years playing the iconic character. Ryan Reynolds & Hugh Jackman share effortless camaraderie & exchange the best banter, in all their scenes together. Emma Corrin is fantastic as Cassandra Nova. Matthew Macfadyen is brilliant as Mr. Paradox. The supporting cast is excellent. Deadpool & Wolverine is a must watch for Marvel Cinematic Universe fans & fans of the titular characters. Watch it on the biggest screen possible & I promise you will be laughing, cheering & having the best time you could possibly have! Can't wait for the next chapter in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Maybe I have giggled 5 times in this movie, because a joke was quite good - HOWEVER everything else made me sick.Storyline?Multiverse? - Even within the movie they even rate this idea completely bonkersThere was nothing compelling, nothing noteworthy, all was forgettable rubbish.Acting?"Deadpool" might get a 5 out of 10 for acting. Wolverine - 0.The rest - 0. My grandma could act better. Nothing was believable.Cameos?Horrible - stars from the grave..probably acting in front of blue screen from a mental institution?I do not give a ... about X-men, Marvel, Fox.. to listen to that "plot" the whole movie... unbearableSo overall - a rubbish movie. I actually went also to watch Dafne Keen who somehow popped up as an actress in this movie in some ads.. YET I think the Honda van had more acting time and performed more.It was so horrible - I expected to see a 2/10 rating here but what movie did the others watch? Is it so much better in the Multiverse that you live in?

No She Hulk or any of the feminist rubbish - just classic characters being true to themselves, the way they were written. Only 1 detail made this not 10/10 - no Spider-Man cameo. But as usual, that's Sony fault.Wish we saw Blake's face, wish we saw Mathew M's face. But that's ok.No She Hulk - Tick No Miss Marvel - Tick No captain Marvel - Tick No Echo - Tick No Female Thor - Tick No Female Iron Man - Tick No Captain Britain - Tick No Hawkeye Daugher - Tick No Wasp or Antman Daughter - TickFlash of Hulk - Tick Glimpse of Thor - Tick Sprinkle of Captain America/Johnny - Tick Antman - TickSo 9/10.

This movie was absolutely hysterical and full of action and it was like that from start to finish super enjoyable. I could not recommend it enough. If you are a fan of comic accuracy. This movie is for you Marvel have redeemed themselves. They made the MCU great again. Deserves a 10 out of 10 rating because solely based on Marvel's fan service to fans, they listen to us when we ask them for fan castings they deliver on all accounts. I was not expecting there to be as many cameos as there was, and I don't know how but Marvel managed to make it not possible on most social media platforms to not reveal spoilers.

You don't often get a film as exciting and fun as Deadpool & Wolverine. I have been an avid theater goer my entire life and I can count on one hand the films that left me grinning from ear to ear. This movie is full of comedy, action and fan service but in the best ways. This is the best marvel has been since infinity war. Anyone who is judging this film purely as a film critic I guess I can see a lower score of maybe like 7 (this is not a Chris Nolan or Denis Villeneuve film) but for pure entertainment it doesn't really get much better than this. This move is in one word is FUN. Get out and see the film before the spoilers ruin the experience, you won't regret it!

No story - just random scenes that are supposed to be entertaining. Nothing feels authentic, there is no tension, not even the jokes are particularly great.Why would you even bring Logan back if there is no story? I was really excited for this film, but I am sorry guys... I need a story. I need at least some tension... Some genuine emotions...Stop this lame multiverse crap and give us grounded meaningful stories with some emotional weight - Go back to Deadpool 1!It's not enough to write a bad movie and then burry it in mediocre comedy - Yes some of the jokes made me chuckle, but that's not enough! I would have probably chuckled the same amount if I spent those two hours on social media...What is this... Seriously you guys... Marvel movies have truly become a complete shell of themselves.In addition to that the villain is a cheesy joke that takes itself way too seriously in comparison to everything else. Not only does the villain look stupid, her character and motivations are as generic as it gets.Oh and the "action" scenes are also extremely lame... They are completely empty and simply feel like performances for the viewer, not something that happens organically or has the potential to change the outcome of the story in any way. Action scenes are best when something is at stake and when they have meaning for the actual plot - this is the type of stuff that could make us sit on the edge of our seat! In this movie the action just washes over the screen and makes us feel nothing.

If you are reading these reviews you are at least a little curious and have a rough idea what to expect.It's a Deadpool movie turned up to 11. It's silly, over the top, but filled with so much blink and you will miss it moments you can see that all involved took time care and attention to put together something that both fans of the franchise and Marvel will appreciate.Both Ryan and Hugh clearly loved the opportunity to work together and there bits bring out the laughs, the drama and the heartfelt moments you would hope for, Mary Puppins steals a scene or two as well.No this is not fine art, but that shouldn't be what you are going to see this for, within the first few minutes of the movie you know what you are in for, and as for all the little secrets and stuff, there aware loads to soak in, some really fun surprises. Just go and enjoy it and hopefully no one spoils the fun for you, BTW the end credit was worth staying for in my opinion.

I think movie is 10/10. People write amazing things about it and then score 8. No, its a 10. Has everything a superhero movie has to have. And I am not even a fan of this genre, but they did a very good job with it especially the music. Go and watch it in the theater you wont regret it. I loved listening to two songs (you will know which ones ) and it was amazing to listen to it with the theaters huge speakers. I actually ended up watching 2x, on a Friday and the Saturday after. Acting was excellent too. One small critique is that I think it was a little too violent so I would not bring children under 12.

Well, I knew going in after the other Deadpool movies that there would be a lot of raunchiness and profanity. I do think they could have toned that down as much of it seemed gratuitous and unnecessary. At least former Captain America was hardly recognizable to little kids so his language at least can be attributed to Johnny Storm rather than Steve Rogers. I thought the plot was decent and the villain impressive, but found myself wondering what Loki was doing during the events of this movie considering his involvement with the TVA etc. Worth watching for understanding further MCU events, but I wouldn't take the kids to it.

How do you reboot a stale franchise, give the fans what they want!Highest box office returns this year for an Oddball resurrection ably produced including the Co-operative of actors and writers.Now Feige and Iger are choking on all those dollars flowing back down their gullets.Mr Downey jnr also getting a return as F4 doctor doom..go figure.Anyways:- madcap movie excessively violent, with umpteen easter eggs,spot the family Reynolds members, and other multiverse characters, this movie may seem madcap, but is oddly coherent, and resolves what went before and after... Of course the maindraw is the duo of Deadpool and Wolverine reincarnated, superlative direction and entertainment for cinema,and home screening..12+ to geriatric pensioners welcome... The soundtrack is also classic....

If you didn't have fun watching this movie, you're not a Deadpool or Wolverine fan.This film captured the same good old deadpool humour, which I'm happy to tell you hasn't changed one bit, gruesome but brilliantly executed combat and a movie driven on the long lasting friendship between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman (this movie was always meant to be).Mathew Macfayden and Emma Corrin are perfect antagonists playing hilarious and daringly criminal roles.The only area for me that the film lacks in, are the stakes. Not saying that they weren't high at all, I just think they were better and less predictable in the first half of the movie.Great and unexpected cameos that are followed by unnecessary but enjoyable and what seems to be very bittersweet goodbyes.Will be watching this on repeat.

"Deadpool vs Wolverine" is a fun blast from beginning to end, serving as a love-letter to fans of both characters. From the opening scene to the final showdown, the movie is packed with action, humor, and the kind of irreverence that only Deadpool can deliver. The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine is electric, blending their unique personalities and fighting styles into a seamless and highly entertaining narrative.The visuals are top-notch, with stunning special effects that bring the comic book world to life in vivid detail. The fight scenes are choreographed brilliantly, showcasing the raw power and agility of Wolverine against Deadpool's unpredictability and resilience. Fans will be thrilled with the numerous Easter eggs and references to the broader Marvel universe, making it a true delight for those who have followed these characters for years.The humor is spot-on, with Deadpool's trademark wit and sarcasm perfectly balanced by Wolverine's gruff and stoic demeanor. The jokes land perfectly, providing plenty of laugh-out-loud moments without detracting from the overall intensity of the film. The dialogue is sharp and cleverly written, keeping the audience engaged and entertained throughout.Overall, "Deadpool vs Wolverine" is an awesome movie that delivers on all fronts. It's a thrilling, hilarious, and visually stunning experience that will leave hardcore Marvel fans more than satisfied. If you're a fan of either character or the Marvel universe in general, this movie is a must-see.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a beautiful love story of two men who join forces to create an amazing cinematic experience. And to have the opportunity to spend several months together (without Blake suspecting) at the same time.The story of the movie isn't important, because most of the time you're just making sure you don't miss another cameo, joke, or easter egg anyway. I tried to count them all, but before I could be sure I hadn't missed any, I ended up with 69.Throughout the movie, I felt like Leonardo di Daprio in his famous armchair and TV meme. The whole time I wanted to jump out of my seat at the cinema and wave my hand that I could see another one!Long story short, I'm looking forward to seeing that movie again. Definitely worth it. I was laughing the whole time.

Yes, my review title is a dialogue said by our central franchise protagonist Deadpool from his debut movie back in 2018.It will cause real pain if you even try to even make sense of this incoherent inane garbage.If disney thinks nostalgia baiting with a few gratuitous cameos and bringing back a fan favorite character, a undeveloped one note villain sprinkled with toilet humour can save a dying franchise then they are wrong. Hugh tries to deliver some good performance but can't work his way around with the idiotic script. Action choreography is horrendous as expected from a director whose sole trademark is delivering soulless corporate mediocre slop.All of the character cameos doesn't resonate with the audience at any level and plot wise it's even more idiotic.The plot or whatever passes around for one these days in Hollywood is not only paper thin but tonally inconsistent. Glad i wasted my time not money by watching a pirated copy. Trying to overdo what made the first movie leads to this hot trash. Save your money and avoid this stitched up carcass of a franchise long dead. Also the plot doesn't have any consequences for MCU so along with poor direction, you can add false advertising to the litany of accusations you can pile up on this fossil of a franchise.Tim Miller, the first movie director understood how to approach the character but too bad when the central star is given preference and free reign as if he's the who one understands plot progression better than a certified professional filmmaker.

I needed this movie!! The main point I can make about this film is that it's incredibly enjoyable. Doesn't take itself seriously, has some real laugh out loud moments, fantastic fight scenes, even better cameos and overall it's a just a joy to watch.Is it a strong story? Not massively, but it works more than enough to get what you need out of it. My thought process going into this was "will wolverine work? And how does he come to be with Deadpool?" But, it's explained well and it doesn't feel too gimmicky. Like I said, it works well with the plot at hand. The comedy I thought they absolutely hit the nail on the head, worked so well with the plot and the marvel jabs really made me laugh!When it comes to it. This film is exactly what you'd expect it to be and some. If you want an easy watch, something to switch your brain off and have some laughs. Then I cannot recommend it enough and it's such a breath of fresh air. Both in the movie world and indeed Marvel. I needed this movie!

When the film was first announced, I was a bit excited because of Hugh Jackman, but I knew the story wouldn't be that good. There is a problem with all these multiverse movies. The lack of effort in storytelling is evident in all of these movies. The phrase "all style, no substance" shows a lot in the multiverse movies, and it shows a lot of it here, although I wouldn't go as far as saying there is an absolute zero substance here, but you get the point.The movie is what you would expect: a high-octane action-packed movie filled with lewd jokes and jokes directed at Disney, Fox, and the MCU. Sometimes, it gets exhausting to repeatedly have a joke every minute or so, but the ones that do land are really funny. I have to admit, this movie got me cracking at times. However, for a movie that was expected to save the MCU, it didn't reach that high bar. I still hope this movie inspires the MCU to give what the people want or what most want anyway. This way, the next movie has a higher chance of being a movie that fans will love.Despite having no real plot, I liked the character arcs of Logan and Wade. For Deadpool, he learns what it means to be a hero. For Wolverine, we see a new arc since this guy's a new guy. The character arc is good, as he also learns what it means to be a hero. However, I felt that this arc had already been done before for Logan, so I felt it was kind of repetitive. Outside of the two leads, however, the other characters have little to do. The two mains really carried the movie for me. Hugh wearing the comic costume was also nice.For a movie that was meant to be the last "Fox" movie, I was kind of disappointed with how it dealt with the Fox movies. I know the movies are things of the past, but I felt that more respect could have been given. Again, there are some things I can only talk about in the next review, but all I will say is that I felt a bit unsatisfied. One thing that I really loved was the credits scene (not to be confused with the post-credits scene). That tugged at my heart.One thing that I absolutely hate about this movie is that most of the cameos (maybe except X-23) weren't utilized more. They were just kind of there, like in Multiverse of Madness (or Sadness as I would say). People like Sabretooth, Pyro, and the rest (who I can't talk about yet) should have had more to do. For X-23, I guess she had the talk with Jackman's alternate Wolverine, which I think is what made me say it wasn't wasted. There were several missed opportunities, which I will mention in the next review.The performances were all really good, though. I think Hugh Jackman plays Wolverine so effortlessly. After 7 years of retirement, he comes back, and it feels like he never left, and I am not saying this just because I love Wolverine. Hugh's and Ryan's interactions were really fun. Macfadyen and Corrin's performances were also good in their villain roles, despite the lack of depth each has.The visuals are alright. They're better than past post-Endgame movies. I think the scenes in the Void could have looked better because they kind of look dry sometimes. I know that's the point because Deadpool references Mad Max, but I just think maybe it could have been less plain. The soundtrack, however, was awesome. I think that every time the music plays, the scene gets instantly better. They match what the scene needs.Overall, if you're looking for a movie that moves you or has a decent story, look elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a movie that has good action and lewd jokes that crack you up from time to time, this is your movie.P. S. Spoiler review will be released once the movie hits home media.

Six years after the last Deadpool movie and seven after the last film featuring Wolverine, the two titans finally come together in the third Deadpool film. To some, this may scream fanservice, but let's face it: in this franchise, that's the name of the game. The jokes are rapid fire and virtually non-stop, poking fun at everything from the state of Disney and Marvel to how much we've been waiting for this crossover to the tropes of big budget films like this, along with the requisite load of fourth wall breaks, a personal favorite type of humor. Suffice it to say, all this leads to a ton of laughs. But, the film surprisingly also has a decent story. There are actual stakes that affect people other than our heroes, and some shockingly decent emotional moments. And, the pacing is perfect, fast when it needs and slow when it needs.The return of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman to their most famous roles is more than welcome. They prove they still have it and have all the chemistry. You can just tell they had a ton of fun with this film and the chance to finally work together on a superhero film that isn't garbage. Just as thankfully, after the previous two films didn't even give us one good villain, this one gives us two in Matthew McFayden and Emma Corrin. And, the cameos are pervasive and everywhere. I won't say who appears to avoid spoilers, but they are all fantastic and even get some laughs, like when an actor appears who we think is one character but turns out to be someone else.The action scenes are the best in the series, fast paced, brutal, and giving us some huge laughs. The best are, in my opinion, the fight during the opening credits (my disappointment over how they aren't nonsensical credits like the first two was undone by the clever editing and just how awesome the action is) and the fight between the two leads in the car. The sets are stellar, including the returning TVA headquarters and the amusing lair of Corrin's character. And the soundtrack is fantastic, including some hilarious song choices during the two aforementioned action scenes.Overall, Deadpool and Wolverine may very well be the best of the Deadpool films. It actually has a story, unlike the first film, and it's better paced than the second. It really gives the audience everything we could ask for with this duo, and I couldn't be more satisfied.

Last night i watched Deadpool & Wolverine and i must say film is must watch. I watched previous two Deadpool films and other Marvel film's in its original language but my friend recommended me to watch this movie in Hindi Dub and I must say dubbing was actually very good. Hindi Dialogues perfectly match in comedic situation and audience laughing all the time in theatre.Deadpool & Wolverine is an explosive, hilarious, and action-packed ride that perfectly blends the irreverent humor of Deadpool with the brooding intensity of Wolverine. This film is a testament to the power of chemistry, as Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman share an undeniable on-screen camaraderie that elevates the entire experience.The film masterfully balances its comedic and action-packed elements. Deadpool's signature fourth-wall-breaking antics and witty one-liners are as sharp as ever, while Wolverine's raw power and berserker rage provide a thrilling counterbalance. The action sequences are choreographed with precision and are visually stunning, but it's the comedic timing and banter between the two protagonists that truly sets this film apart.While the film pays homage to the characters' comic book origins, it also manages to offer fresh perspectives on both Deadpool and Wolverine. We see a more vulnerable side to Wolverine, while Deadpool's chaotic energy is dialed up to eleven. The dynamic between the two characters is constantly evolving, keeping the audience engaged and entertained.The fight sequences in Deadpool & Wolverine are a breathtaking blend of brutal efficiency and comic book absurdity. Wolverine's feral, animalistic fighting style is juxtaposed with Deadpool's chaotic, unpredictable approach, creating a visually stunning and exhilarating spectacle. The cinematography during these sequences is nothing short of exceptional. Rapid cuts, slow-motion, and dynamic camera angles capture the intensity and chaos of the fights, immersing the audience in the action. The use of handheld cameras adds a gritty, realistic feel, while the incorporation of Deadpool's fourth-wall-breaking commentary provides a unique and humorous twist.The music score for Deadpool & Wolverine is a masterclass in balancing contrasting tones. The action sequences are accompanied by a pulsating, adrenaline-fueled score that perfectly complements the on-screen mayhem. The use of heavy metal and industrial elements adds to the raw intensity of the fights. On the other hand, during the comedic moments, the score is lighthearted and playful, often incorporating unexpected musical choices that enhance the humor.The cinematography in Deadpool & Wolverine is a character in itself. The film boasts a vibrant, comic book-inspired visual style that is both visually appealing and functionally effective. The use of color is bold and striking, with the red and yellow color palette of Deadpool's costume serving as a focal point.While the film is largely a triumph, there are a few minor issues. The plot, while entertaining, is somewhat predictable at times. Additionally, some of the comedic gags might not land for everyone, as the humor is sometimes crude and irreverent.Overall, Deadpool & Wolverine is a must-see for fans of the characters and action-comedy genre. It's a film that delivers on all fronts, with a perfect blend of humor, action, and heart.

For starters, this is the first real multiverse MCU movie. And by that, I mean it finally feels like a multiverse through a constant rain of cameos - even if it's fan service on steroids, somehow keeps managing to keep that away from being disruptive. It totally reminds you of the comics, where known characters of a broader world can simply come and go, because moviemaking ramifications don't apply.Aesthetically, this is the most stylised movie of the Deadpool franchise and sets a great example for the rest of the future MCU projects to adopt. Without giving anything away, I would say that it totally opens up the road for Secret Wars and the Mutant Saga.The acting is astounding, especially from Hugh Jackman who demonstrates how seriously he still takes that role. Every single actor had their time to shine as well and that's very honourable from Ryan Reynolds, who deliberately didn't attempt to make his character outshine anyone.The action scenes and the choreography are taking your eyes hostages by force. There were plenty of scenes where I self-reflected by saying "what kind of sorcery am I experiencing right now?".The humour gives you the same fresh feel the previous ones had when they came out, but it's more meta and packed. That known feeling of doubt: "how they got away with that?" has done a comeback for good.To the downside, some plot points feel a bit off, but the movie itself teaches you to not take them seriously. Even if it could totally be at least a 9/10 construction wise, you simply know that it doesn't want to be (its EXTREME amount of self-awareness is all-time record worthy). Plus, considering how this project was even made, during a major writer strike and near the completion of a studio acquisition, this outcome is a statistical improbability. Still, it is the best MCU movie until No Way Home that came out 3 years ago.Will it save the MCU? It certainly could, but not by itself and that's another theme in its core DNA. Marvel Studios are letting you know this movie will be an example of what's to come, as it should.LFG.

I watched D&W last night, I didn't have highest of hopes, having been starved, hopeful and ultimately let down by the other D injections in recent times, this hoe phase has not been the best. The rush of the first time has waned, and I have experienced so many new and exciting sessions since, and memories can only take you so far.Happy to report, I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it!Not the perfect night, with my experience, I know there were many missed opportunities to give D more depth, and frustratingly when the tempo started hitting the right places it would jarringly change, as a whole it wasn't as filling, or as satisfying, but ohhhh boy I can promise the nostalgia and clever mid-session foreplay really pushed me over edge. It was not D, D2 or Once Upon a D in execution, mostly because it suffered from a desire to up the ante from such a dry place, I would describe the setup as a clumsy effort, but I was not ready for the juicy slab that was to come!In summary, I love D and I don't think that will change.

Reading some critics reviews recently and I think they've missed the point completely. Sure there are a few shaky moments where the odd joke falls flat but this is in essence a buddy movie and one where your instantly on the side of the protagonist's. The main duo need to get from here to there encountering a few bumps along the way making a few friends, defeating the villain and coming out the other side all the wiser from their adventures. Hugh and Ryan work well together,the chemistry is undeniable. It's a shame the ancillary characters we've come to know from the previous films are not in the movie more, aside from Peter and his piercings, but including them more would have dragged out the runtime. I really enjoyed the villains Emma Corrin is fantastic as Charles Xavier's little sister, she creeps me out in real life and does the same on screen. MacFadyen as Mr Paradox is a pleasure to watch also. I have been wondering for ages about whose severed head Cassandra was carrying through the portal and now it all makes sense. I loved this movie even more because I had a small part in it. Take the kids along I reckon anyone over the age of 12 would have a blast. A definite 8/10.
