Nowadays, more people expect much higher in terms of story, script, and acting along with CGI.Good news is that "Deadpool & Wolverine" successfully meets its expectations by utilizing various techniques to not only keep the audiences engaged for the whole movie, but mainly to give them an experience of constant laughs, a mix of unique stories, and fun duo scenes between the two.The movie constantly keeps the audiences bursting out laughing using Deadpool's one-on-one interactions, blatant mockery of real-life references along with stern and serious Wolverine intervening to offset its one-sided jokes from Deadpool.Despite numerous Marvel and other miscellaneous references such as characters, stories, and even songs, they make it not so obscure to those who aren't Marvel savvy. They also do a decent job on expositions so people don't get lost in the middle of the movie. What they do exceptionally well is the timing of witty remarks and inappropriate humours. Some of the key moments are born from these.Finally, the chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine was fantastic. The fact that they have the complete opposite characteristics and yet they both wield sharp weapons that slash whatever blocks them works like a charm.The only improvement that can be made is the battle scene. While it is still entertaining to watch them jabbing, poking, and tussling, the pattern and mood of some of the battles feel repetitive due to similar music being used as well as the slow motion being incorporated.Regardless, red and yellow fighters show up in the nick of time to the rescue in what seems to be the lowest stage of Marvel franchise. One of the best duo movies of all time.

Since my friend is celebrating his birthday today (though it's actually next week), I obliged to pay for both his lunch and movie. We both decided to watch this one since it's the one that started the soonest when we went inside the theater. We both were familiar with both the previous Deadpool and Wolverine movies and the fact they had Deadpool find one of the multiverse Wolverines made sense since the one in Logan couldn't come back. Nice to see both Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman reprise their roles also fun seeing Chris Evans reprise one of his two Marvel hero roles. (I won't reveal which one he does here) There's a few more familiar actors reprising their roles from other Marvel movies but I'll just now say that me and my friend very much enjoyed the action and profane humor as well as some of the touching scenes of this, Deadpool & Wolverine. So that's a high recommendation.

Wolverine and Deadpool is an absolute blast! This film is a masterclass in blending non-stop action with laugh-out-loud humor.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is electric, and their banter is pure gold. The action sequences are jaw-dropping, and the special effects are top-notch.One of the highlights is the incredible array of cameos. It was like a who's who of the superhero world! I won't spoil anything, but trust me, you won't be disappointed.While the film might lack some depth compared to other superhero epics, it more than makes up for it with pure entertainment value. It's a perfect escape from reality and a guaranteed good time at the theater. If you're looking for a fun, action-packed flick, this is it!I loved every minute of it!

If this movie was released 10 years ago, it would be classed as a fun movie to kill 2 hours of time watching. Nothing more, nothing less.However, since Marvel (and Hollywood in general) have so epically dropped the ball over and over again for the last few years, this movie is (at the time of writing) sat on an 8/10 rating. Personally, I think this demonstrates just how starved viewers currently are of movies that are made for the sake of entertainment (without the influence of politics).My positive takes on the movie:Some really great cameos from actors/characters I never thought I'd see on the big screen again. And, unlike Star Wars, the cameos didn't come across as desperate ploys to bring back fans, they actually fit into the movie rather wellNegative takes:In summary: A solid movie and mostly enjoyable. I'd definitely recommend giving it a watch, but don't buy into the 8 rating.

First of all Thankyou Marvel Studios for making this movie happen. Special thanks for ryan reynolds to bring hugh Jackman On marvel screen after 7 years. The Movie contains lots of Amazing Actions Amazing music which is the masterpiece of all time. I'm So happy they bring back hugh Jackman with the classic yellow Wolverine suit. The movie the one of the best versions after Avengers Endgame 2019. This is how marvel needs to be done in the future. Warning Spoiling the movie will definitely destroy the enjoyment. Every actor in the movie performed their roles very well. I hope they bring back both Deadpool & Wolverine to the upcoming projects like Avengers Doomsday 2026 & Secret Wars 2027. LFG

Deadpool shoots and slices his way into the MCU in a largely fun comic-book film (after a long time, uff!) filled with great set pieces, a fantastic lead duo, one-liners galore, and a barrage of cameos (as expected). Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman were born to play Deadpool and Wolverine, respectively-their yin-yang dynamic is used in marvelous ways (pun intended) throughout. Shawn Levy, who has worked with Ryan and Hugh before (but separately), is able to extract the best out of both, making the 2h 7m run-time almost fly by. A lot of the humor is self-deprecating, fourth-wall-breaking, and taking digs at both Fox and Marvel (especially, for their recent fumbles). When you look back at it, Deadpool & Wolverine is almost like a tribute piece to all those Marvel comic-book films made in the last couple of decades, regardless of who made (or acted in) them.That is also why the film's smaller emotional beats might strike a better chord with millennials. The multiverse concept has REALLY run its course, and I'm only letting it slide because it finally brings this iconic duo together (in better circumstances - yes, I'm looking at you X:Men Origins Wolverine) alongside a few others (not going to spoil them - don't go looking for the IMDB cast list!). Considering that's the case, the plot is kinda messy, even when it offers plenty of holy hell moments. The screenplay also nearly forgets to flesh out its antagonist - Cassandra Nova (Emma Corrin) - and it does so in a hasty way as if just to have a character for the two dudes to finally take down when they're not fighting each other.There's one set piece that randomly begins inside a car, and the way it was shot, particularly stood out to me. Levy and crew also exhibit inventiveness in bringing characters from other universes and timelines, without making a giant mess of it. Every cameo (or extended cameo) is a delicious cherry atop the humongous cake, and also leaves a lot of room for further exploration - now, Disney BETTER NOT go and make 76 films and 29 TV shows already! This is a crowd-pleaser by all means, and it's gonna rake in a lot of moolah at the box office. It's not the perfect comic-book film; heck, it's not even the best Deadpool flick (the first one STILL takes the cake, for me), but what it is though, is a sumptous FEAST for all those who have grown up on a steady dose of Marvel over the years (except for, well.. the 2020s).

Prerequisites: Please watch the Original Deadpool, Deadpool 2 and X-Men Origins: Wolverine as minimum mandatory viewing before seeing this. That will allow for Maximum Effort in enjoying every inside joke and Easter Egg this movie has to offer.Pros: The jokes are fast and furious and the action is hard hitting and iconic. The visuals are stunning and the nostalgia is amped to Level 11 for any fan of the X-Men Comics, or even X-Men 96 Animated Series. The fight sequences are top notch and memorable. The soundtrack is legendary and will create an infinite number of new fans for Madonna & NSYNC. But best of all, the cameos will leave you speechless and on the edge of your seat.Cons: The plot was a little shaky, convoluted and hard to follow at times. (What would you expect when time travel and the TVA are involved?) And this is a plot that will more than likely be cleaned up by HISHE (How it Should Have Ended) on YouTube. I would've also liked to have seen more screen time involving Dopinder, Colossus, NTW, and at least Cable and Domino! (Where'd they go?!) My only other minor gripes are the over-the-top violence and gore (but that's what makes Deadpool). And the end credits seemed like a missed opportunity to spring board for any upcoming Avengers projects.Summary: Absolute Must See of 2024. A superb stand-a-lone movie masterpiece on par with the other Deadpool movies and a great swan-song and (if need be) curtain call for Hugh Jackman's Wolverine. (Unless Ryan is right about using him until he's 90, lol!)

On the one hand I enjoyed it, on the other hand I left the movie theater disappointed.Every time I say that I will give the movies a chance, then I go to watch the movie and end up disappointment. Indeed it was a little less disappointing than the others but not what I was looking for... Yes it was funny. Yes it was fun. But enough is enough.At this point I just want a Marvel movie that is serious! Similar to the older ones, with a focus on the plot and just some humor in it, rather than just humor with a minimal amount of plot.I'm sorry but I am no longer 16 and it's starting to bore.Maybe for others it will he good enough but me and Marvel are done.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a mildly enjoyable mess. To try to understand why, this review will be a comparison between MCU Deadpool and the previous two amazing Fox Deadpool movies.I expected the biggest difference to be with the violence and vulgarity. Even with an R-rating, I didn't expect Disney to allow it to go all out. Luckily that's not the case. We see violence in abundance, along with crass humor and dirty jokes. The comedy comes closest to its predecessors, cracking me up multiple times. But there are several comedic attempts that don't work.The biggest difference is the story, or lack of one. It's a huge mess, more like a series of fun skits than a coherent narrative. There are a couple awesome action scenes that stand out amongst some bland ones. And while we do see some characters from the previous ones, they are barely in it, which contributes to it not feeling the same.While the first two are primarily comedies, when they get serious, you feel it. When they get emotional, you cry. And then with tears still in your eyes, you laugh. The contrast between funny and emotional is masterful. I didn't feel the serious/emotional side nearly as much in this one.Lastly, while the cameos are fun, they are not likely something that will stand the test of time. I enjoyed them, but they do feel a bit gimmicky. Also, the villain isn't as good.As a long time MCU fan, I don't think Deadpool saved it.(1 viewing, opening Thursday UltraScreen 7/25/2024)

When Deadpool & Wolverine (D&W) was first announced, I was excited. This was soon followed by trepidation that the film would ruin the sensational and emotional rollercoaster that is Logan.I needn't have worried.What I found with D&W was a film breathing new life in to the Marvel franchise. Since Avengers: Endgame there have been a lot of poor quality Marvel exploits and finally here is a great addition that sits up there with the likes of Thor: Ragnarok and Guardians of the Galaxy.As much as I would love to review the content of the film, that isn't going to happen. There is no way I could get through a whole sentence without giving away a spoiler or two so if you are yet to see it, my recommendation would be to do so before anything is ruined.The chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman shines throughout and the ensemble works beautifully. There is, of course, much inappropriate behaviour from Deadpool, making this arguably the funniest edition to the series, but what stands out the most is the heart with which the film is built on. A cinematic experience that was worth waiting for, let's hope there is more to come soon from the 'Marvel Jesus'.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a total blast. Any concerns of Deadpool being watered down in his violence, profanity or fourth wall breaking nature upon entering the MCU are instantly disproven in the hilarious and gleefully violent opening scene. It's not preoccupied with saving the MCU, offering a really funny double act between two genuine friends and perfectly cast actors in a film that doesn't forget about the sincerity that completes a Deadpool film.Ryan Reynolds accomplishes a hard task of being a real motor mouth once again without becoming annoying. There's only really one joke that properly overstays it's welcome and he's still given plenty of emotional weight to work with so it doesn't feel like empty calories. Plus, his fourth wall breaks get away with a surprisingly high amount of jabs at the current state of MCU as well as helping the film to overcome the messy and convoluted plotting.Hugh Jackman's return was always going to undermine Logan in some capacity so the best case scenario is doing minimal damage to that perfect ending and that's achieved here. As well as pairing beautifully with Reynolds, Jackman's performance makes it clear that this is a very different Wolverine to any of the other's with a new arc that allows this version to get a satisfying arc over the course of the adventure.Shawn Levy's direction gets the job done. He's by no means an auteur however he is a filmmaker who's done his fair share of blockbusters and worked with Jackman & Reynolds multiple times already, so he makes sure everything keeps moving along nicely with action scenes that are mostly well constructed. The characters may be invulnerable but Levi only uses that to indulge in the gore like never before.The soundtrack has always been a major highlight of the Deadpool films and this one reaches new heights. The songs are employed a lot more than Rob Simonsen's forgettable score and the ones chosen are so good that they're able to make up for the score. Bye Bye Bye and Like a Prayer are the best by far, which is especially fitting since those two bookend the film beautifully.

One of the best films ive seen in years. Yeah it's not an End Game - but it provides something that those "blockbusters" doesn't. It hilariously mocks itself whilst giving audiences exactly what they have wanted for years since Dead pools opening lines in DP1.Some really good "cameos" and references to the original Marvel movies and comics of old. I may even go back and watch it again as there is so much happens it's hard to take in, in one sitting.Superb fight scenes, with some pent up anger left over from when WW and Wolverine first meet!!Go and watch it - enjoy and be prepared to laugh your tits off!!

But other than that, it's boring and childish. Hugh Jackman and Emma Corrin were really carrying this movie. The story was flat and felt like no idea was too dumb. The fight scenes between Logan and Deadpool were nice. The rest were exaggerated choreographs. And all the guest stars appearances felt like walking over a graveyard and opening caskets. Until they opened the grave of Remy LeBeau and instead of Taylor Kitsch, we get the low IQ stripper who can't act with this ridiculous accent. Even the self irony didn't help.So the average Deadpool movie. Low IQ kids humor, lots of splatter, some "borrowed" ideas from other movies and the worst dialogues. As expected.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a highly enjoyable film within its category. If you're looking for a complex story with deep character development, plot twists, and a need for intense concentration, this probably isn't the movie for you. However, as a light yet thoroughly entertaining watch, it succeeds in achieving its goals.The film shines in its simplicity, delivering the kind of action-packed fun one would expect from a pairing of these iconic characters. Personally, I find Deadpool and Wolverine among the most entertaining in the Marvel universe. The inclusion of Deadpool's chaotic energy is precisely what Hugh Jackman's older Wolverine films needed to inject some liveliness.The fight scenes are spectacular, and the humor stays true to Deadpool's irreverent style, far from the childish jokes often found in other Marvel films. This movie retains Deadpool's essence while seamlessly integrating Wolverine's grittier persona. It's a highly recommended watch, especially if you're at least somewhat familiar with the MCU.

Boring seems a pedestrian word to describe any movie but from around 20 mins in, all the except clips had run and there was just fillers.The 'ploT' was an attempt to let the Marvel core fan club get the 'in' jokes and references. There was a small hope of interest when they landed in the void. Trying to see if I could get a reference through a dusty crashed aircraft. I didn't, though maybe I saw a helmet from Flash Gordon? The jokes weren't pithy, ironic or grown up enough to merit the 15 rating, so they added some swear words to them, then we all felt like adults, not. Gen Z got a few mentions as did the whole Disney/ Fox blah blah blah.I don't know how the film ends, life is too short to waste once you've eaten all your popcorn and your jammies await you.

Saw this last night at the movies with the boys and we were just cracking up every few minutes. It's like Deadpool's hilarious character (Ryan) who's just hilarious in everything teams up with Wolverine( Hugh) who's the greatest superhero in my opinion and only superhero who's movies are not boring. I mean these 2 teamed up it's insane. It was one of those movie experiences that the whole crowd was just literally LMAOing. I can't wait this isn't on off theaters so I can keep watching like I do with other Deadpool and Wolverine movies. Go check it out in movies, this is what real theater movie is all about.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a spectacle to say the least. My review of this film may be biased due to my investment in the MCU over the years; however this is an enjoyable experience for anyone who loves comedic marvel action. For comparison this film has very similar aspects to previous Deadpool installments. With this said, there's an awesome culmination of easter eggs, throwbacks and entertaining fights sequences. As expected the story isn't overly daunting for a Deadpool film since often times there a bits of comical relief. This film takes the comedian in Deadpool to the absolute max, there's a constant spotlight on him while also not taking any attention away from Wolverine. In the end, showing both of the protagonists motives makes for a heartfelt and cinematic experience. Something else I loved was the contrast between Deadpool's levity and wolverines stubbornness, making for some good exchanges. Overall this film is full of laughs, surprises and awesome cameos.

Emma Corrin is great. She is the only actress who deserves the highest praise. Sure, Dafne Kee, Hugh Jackman, Ryan Reynolds, and Channing Tatum did a good job with their roles. But she still gave the best performance. All the other actors look stupid. I don't understand how they could ruin the multiverse theme. Why did they do that? The script is stupid and too simple. The multiverse is an infinite, continuous and unlimited flight of fantasy and imagination. The film was supposed to be more interesting and grandiose than all previous projects of MCU. As a result, instead of fireworks, my expectations were deceived.Finally, that movie is complete crap.

Positives: It was refreshing to see two hugely popular characters working together. The film also made me reflect on the end of the "20th Century Fox" brand, bringing back nostalgic feelings for movies like X-Men from that era.Negatives: This is more of a personal issue, but since it had been a long time since I watched the previous Deadpool films, I couldn't remember many of the characters, which made it hard to feel fully engaged. Additionally, because of my limited English proficiency, I struggled to keep up with Deadpool's fast-paced dialogue and jokes, which left me confused at times. I also don't typically enjoy stories involving multiverses.Overall: While the "20th Century Fox" brand has already ended, this movie serves as a nostalgic reminder of that era. However, with its fast and complex dialogue, I don't think it's ideal for those looking to improve their English with subtitles. That said, if you approach it with the goal of enjoying the jokes, action scenes, and the interactions between the characters rather than focusing on the storyline itself, it can be an excellent and highly enjoyable film.

This was one of the very worst movies I've seen in quite a while. And it was doubly disappointing because all of the hype made me think it was gonna be special and really, really good.It wasn't. It was really, really bad!There truly no theme to the whole mess. It was a constant stream of bad jokes (does this guy EVER shut up?) and dialogue. Sooooooooo much talking. It was tough to make it past the first 45 minutes because it was comprised of boring scenes and lots of unnecessary chatter.Then, when it was supposed to get good, the film turned into a bad MTV video with silly characters and Mad Max-style vehicles.Plot? Nope. Interesting superheroes? Nah. Nothing made sense and the ending wasn't wrapped up in a nice little package...it just ended.This was an extremely disappointing movie.

Our family saw Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) in theaters last night. The storyline follows the end of existence, with Deadpool being offered a chance to die now or find a happy place to reside until the end. Instead, Deadpool escapes to another world called The Void and seeks help from old friends in the Marvel universe, and hopes to save existence and everyone in it.Directed by Shawn Levy (Free Guy), the film stars Ryan Reynolds (Van Wilder), Hugh Jackman (Logan), Dafne Keen (The Acolyte), Matthew Macfadyen (Succession), and Emma Corrin (The Crown).This was a fun rollercoaster, and you could tell everyone involved put a lot into this film. The characters were a blast to watch, the comedy was colorful, and the cameos were brilliant. There's definitely a lot to like here. The action scenes are well-executed, though a minor gripe is that some fight sequences felt repetitive, and I don't prefer CGI blood, but it is what it is. Seeing all the characters fight together was fun. They definitely had some smart twists with characters, but there were aspects of the story that worked better for me than others. I also think they could have used better villains. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds were awesome, and their bickering back and forth carries the film. They looked like they had a lot of fun making it. Leslie Uggams (Sugar Hill) killed her performance in this; she always cracks me up. The ending of this movie was great, and I actually think we will be seeing a lot more Wolverine in our future.In conclusion, Deadpool & Wolverine is a perfect summer popcorn movie that deserves repeat viewings. I would score this a 7.5/10 and strongly recommend it.

Deadpool and Wolverine was exactly what I wanted out of a Wolverine and Deadpool film. This is the 3rd entry in the Deadpool films and by far my favorite. The film's plot sets up nicely how to include Wolverine in this movie. Disney pullled no punches with their first Deadpool movie and the cameos are both brilliant and simply amazing. Now I won't spoil who shows up in this movie and you will just have to watch for yourself to see. The action is violent, gory, and in your face. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is perfect. I really can't wait to see what Disney does with the next Deadpool film. The film is about 2 hours long and I laughed pretty much the whole time through. Now I will say it certainly helps to have seen the previous Deadpool movies plus also watching previous Marvel films, otherwise you might be a little lost. Deadpool and Wolverine get a near perfect rating from me at 9 stars out of 10.

Everything i love in a movie: lot of fight scenes, blood and gore, and lot of laughter. Since the wolverine again, Electra, Blade, Johny; absolutely reminds me of my childhood.It is really good watch. Was giving up on Marvel after so many Disaster since End Game. Hopefully, this DeadPool is the beginning of Greater resurecction for Marvel. It really simple, give us the stuff we grew up with and don't change anything, we would definitely watch it.Hoping that this is not the last time we have seen of the Wolverine.Everything you wozld expect from Deadpool is right here, totally uncensored.

Ok! No Spoilers! But WTF that is possibly the Funniest and most Bizarrely Awesome Superhero movie I might have ever seen. 100/10. I wanna watch it again!! What an incredible watch. Who would have thought Hugh Jackman; Leopold Van Helsing Jean Valjean Barnum oh yeah and WOLVERINE, and Ryan Reynolds; Van 'Freakin' Wilder Wade Wilson The Green Lantern Pikachu oh yeah and Deadpool. How these 2 completely different artists came together to create something so fun and wild and weird; wouldn't be Deadpool would it if it wasn't just a little bit weird.... Anyway go watch it twice maybe three times just sit back and enjoy the ride becuase it's Wild.

The "Wolverine x Deadpool" movie is an absolute masterpiece, blending humor and action flawlessly. From the very first scene to the last, the film keeps you hooked with its razor-sharp wit and clever references. The chemistry between Wolverine and Deadpool is electric, creating a dynamic that's both hilarious and intense. Each joke lands perfectly, and the smartly inserted references to pop culture and previous films are a delight for fans. It's baffling how anyone could rate this movie one star; it's simply too smart and entertaining. A must-watch for superhero fans and comedy lovers alike! Wow just wow.

When I get a taste of the first Deadpool, I wonder how they make a worse movie with each passing movie. Wolverine is a very nice character, but the way they handled him to come to this movie was very raw. There's no proper story. It's a simple enemy motivation, I'm going to destroy entire universes and so on. There are many beautiful scenes in it. They have done a very good job in terms of graphics quality. Deadpool's jokes are also good. But the story is so simple, boring. I wish there were stories that flow and make sense and If only they would end this parallel universe nonsense. Because enough is enough. Either they can't, or the topic of parallel universes is not interesting.

This is probably on the of the best marvel films since End Game (the other being GOG 3). Wolverine and Deadpool have excellent on screen chemistry. As for the story line it feels like its come straight out of a marvel comic. The numerous cameos make for great viewing, the film is essential a love letter to 2oth century fox super hero films and gives some closure on characters that we never really got the full story for.Cassandra is a satisfying villain and Emma Corrin's portrayal is decent enough. My only criticism is that she is thrown away too easily like villains from other marvel films (gore the good butcher for example).I can understand peoples criticism of the film, I think you'll either love it or get annoyed by it.I personally enjoyed the film and would certainly watch it again. The one question is will the film stand up to several viewings or is it a one trick pony?

The best of the three; the addition of Wolverine gives a better balanced comedy, and offers increased options for action, drama, and sci-fi stuff: all in all it enhances the basic ingredients of the cinematic Deadpool character and world.The improvement in the writing is the other big help along with adding Wolverine to the mix, with one-liner jokes that mingle in with comedy routines and the general humour of the plot. This makes for more comedic complexity than in the prior films. The jokes and the story poke fun at the MCU, Disney, (the former Twentieth Century) Fox, the multiverse, and the Fox superhero films of yore. Along with somewhere bad taste sexual jokes and bad taste bodily jokes about violence and anatomy being splattered around as much as the fake/CGI blood there is a good ambiance of fun funny.This is a crowd pleaser. The characters are written to give the actors a few moments of actual acting to do whilst mainly keeping it cool in their character default. It's a light touch which usually stays light and only occasionally becomes a bit heavy going or cloying.There are some silly sci-fi superhero hijinks - nothing too serious or interesting - and some decent effects and action sequences although the action is where 'Deadpool & Wolverine' actually seems weakest: the action is less impressive than the well weighted writing, the easy going acting, the special effects design, or the light direction style.I rate a well satisfied 7/10; for me the best of the trio of cinematic Deadpool: accessible and easy and funny.

This movie was very disappointing. Many of the characters seemed to be there for no reason, contributing nothing to the plot. There was no clear idea or story, just a lot of nonsense. Despite this, the movie made a lot of money at the box office, which is quite concerning regarding public taste these days. This lack of substance and direction in the film undermines the credibility of previous Marvel movies featuring these characters, leaving audiences confused.It's alarming that such a poorly constructed movie can achieve such commercial success. It seems that flashy effects and familiar faces are enough to draw crowds, regardless of the quality of the story or the coherence of the plot. This trend is troubling because it suggests that audiences are more interested in superficial entertainment than in engaging narratives and well-developed characters.The movie fails to honor the legacy of the characters and the stories that have been built over the years. Instead, it feels like a hodgepodge of scenes thrown together without any thought to continuity or depth. This is not what fans of the franchise expect or deserve.In essence, the film's success despite its lack of substance is a reflection of a broader issue in the entertainment industry: the prioritization of profits over quality storytelling. This is a disservice to the audience and to the art of filmmaking. Moving forward, it is crucial for studios to recognize the importance of crafting meaningful stories that respect the intelligence and expectations of their viewers. Without this, the future of film as an art form is at risk of being overshadowed by shallow, profit-driven productions.

If you enjoy a Deadpool movie, then you are going to enjoy this film. The protagonists were great, The story was good and compelling, and overall, it was an enjoyable film.The best part of this movie was the characters. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman had great chemistry together. The side characters were very memorable and you're in for some surprises But my lips are sealed. Fans of X-Men will be happy.The story was. The dialogue was downright goofy as well as engaging in some serious topics including mental health, which was a breath of fresh air. The problem was very consequential so there was something at stake and it was important to save the day. There are also plenty of gory and amazing fight scenesProduction value was very good considering it is a Disney movie so if they're not footing top dollar for this movie, then that's just their own fault. But overall the visual effects were good. The editing was good. The soundtrack was good, especially some of the songs with the fight scenes were great.Overall, this was a stellar movie and if you enjoy Deadpool movies you're gonna like this one.

Most of the Shawn Levy movies I have seen give off a 2000s-era blockbuster feel that I always feel missing from recent films but I crave for. Even here when it deals with the multiverse and being the sequel to the Deadpool movies, it still managed to give me that. It also helped that it's filled with cameos of pre-MCU Marvel characters that I grew up with. It was so much fun to see all those cameos and also the fact that everyone had actually something to do rather than just appear out of nowhere. The surprises with some aspects of the cameos were also incredible to watch with a great responsive crowd. That one surprise cameo was really unexpected for me since I had dismissed it as fans going overboard when I first heard about it months ago.The buddy action movie template with a multiversal stake around it worked pretty well as a fun-filled entertainer without having to think much about it. Even though some expositions felt a bit not so creative, they intentionally did it so that anyone could enjoy it even if they weren't aware of the innumerable references, easter eggs and cameos.Hugh Jackman is still such a fantastic Wolverine, giving depth to a weakly written character just using his face. Emma Corrin also surprised me by giving a strong performance, acting against these guys, again with a one-dimensional character.I also loved how this ended up basically a tribute to the pre-MCU Marvel movies, specifically the 20th Century Fox Marvel movies. I was a fan of all those superhero movies growing up. A lot of people didn't really care about such movies until Infinity War came out. And they are the first to cry about how after Endgame, it's not the same. But to me, it's these movies from the 2000s that gave the base for the MCU. There are just so many dialogues in this movie referencing those older movies that I just love to see the respect given to them.Suffice to say, I loved this movie more than the previous Deadpool movies.

DEADPOOL & WOLVERINEWhat do you get when you try to make a crossover from a franchise that had decades of buildup, throw in lots of references and cameos, and make that film be a part of yet another franchise? Blend them all together and see what comes out of it. A 2 hours and 8 minutes of pure fun, chaos, and nostalgia. Deadpool has always been wild, but this is the wildest Deadpool movie yet, which took me by surprise. I'm glad there were still cameos they kept hidden.Deadpool himself is as funny and mocking as ever, while Wolverine is as badass and savage as ever. After twenty years, they finally made a costume for Hugh Jackman as Wolverine that is comically accurate and it didn't disappoint. Also, Hugh's acting was the best one in the film, no doubt. Watch the movie and you'll clearly see why. Plus, Deadpool and Wolverine are destined to be played by Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman. There'll be no one who can replace them and their legacy shall live on forever.Now the little downside of this movie is that it felt too short. Don't misunderstand, the pacing was good, they gave pretty much everything we wanted and hoped for. However, they could've explored more of the characters (excluding Deadpool & Wolverine) and given them more time to shine. Also, I wish they had used IMAX cameras so that the film had an open matte format like Endgame (2019) and Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 (2023). Other than that, I think I have no problem with this movie.It's hard to talk about the movie a lot without spoiling, but overall, the movie was wild and fun. A film truly made to make every Marvel fan's dream come true. Also, the best movie of 2024 so far IMO. 9/10I wish our great Stan Lee could see this."I am the Messiah. I am Marvel Jesus."

This was a joy from start to finish.Over the top.Crass.Very meta.Self deprecating.Geeky references.In-jokes.Extremely violent and lots of comic book gore.Great soundtrack and use of songs.Deadpool is annoying. Wolverine is grumpy. As it should be.Matthew MacFayden is an excellent villain - very funny.The story doesn't make total sense - but hey - its Marvel, do they ever?This movie is everything I hoped it would be. I laughed lots - the gags come thick and fast.Is it the best movie ever? No. But its not trying to be. Its an antidote to some of the more serious, incoherent, drawn out, boring sagas the MCU has presented.

Deadpool and Wolverine! So many things to say about this long-awaited, dream of a team-up!For those who haven't seen it, I will make this review as spoiler-free as possible.Walking into this, I knew, without a shadow of a doubt, that this movie would be a lot of fun. But like many of my fellow viewers, the excitement was also accompanied by many concerns.Was it going to be truly Deadpool? Raunchy, violent, and fourth-wall breaking? After being bought by Disney, was it still going to maintain the R-rating that Deadpool was well known for, and pull it off? After the recent decline of the MCU, would it ruin our beloved heroes, or would it be Marvel's saving grace that they desperately needed?Well, after seeing this movie, I can say it was the worst of the Deadpool films. But it's also everything I hoped for.I loved this movie. It was a vulgar, violent, and hilarious ride. Seeing Wolverine and Deadpool banter back-and-forth for two hours is what every fan had hoped to see. It was a compelling story, with plenty of self-aware humor about Marvel. It had plenty of cameos, all of which made me extremely glad to see on the big screen. It also had great actors, choreography, and action scenes. None of which, disappoint.If you were worried that Deadpool would be different after 20th Century Fox got bought out, I can tell you now that those fears can be put to rest, and that you will have a grand time seeing this in the cinema.But with all of the positives, there were definitely some negatives.First off, the main antagonist would probably be my biggest complaint. He wasn't really a VILLAIN. He wasn't scary. He was a wimpy, man-child throughout the entire film, which kind of sucked to see. He had the potential to be very intimidating, but obviously, the studio went a different direction.Other than that, some of the humor doesn't really quite land. Although yes, it did have a lot of funny moments, it doesn't feel EXACTLY like the past two Deadpool films. But that's a very minor concern.Overall, the pacing was nice and it was worth a trip to the theatre. I would recommend it, and I say it's a big step-up from superhero movies in recent years. Will it save Marvel? Probably not. But it was a breath of fresh air. It also felt really good to see Wolverine adorning his classic, yellow suit, and brandishing his claws again. The cameos were a welcome surprise, and Deadpool being Deadpool was exactly the change that the MCU needed. 7.5/10.

Best Marvel movie in a long time. Deadpool and Wolverine surprise with a spectacular tape, full of cameos and great moments of action. It's worth every second and you're gonna laugh a lot.Director Shawn Levy did a sensational job, being well directed and with a well-sustained narrative argument in the multiverse aspect, even better performed than in "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness". Deadpool 3 is great in the way it unfolds at certain points in the script because of the universes that Marvel has presented for many years, giving a close to the Deadpool trilogy and some way to do it. This sequel is a barbarity for the mutant fans and for those who saw many characters from the editorial in their live action films of the 2000's, applying nostalgia and many surprises to the plot of the film.Ryan Reynolds's great work should be highlighted, whether from his production, script and acting as Wade Wilson. The actor makes it excellent and once again brings to the table the character character comedy like in Deadpool 1 and 2. On the other hand Hugh Jackman as Logan once again is of the best that can have a Marvel tape, the actor demonstrates that he was born to be the character and in this sequel shines through each scene, showing another variant of Wolverine more wild and epic for the big screen.In the special effects section Deadpool and Wolverine has an excellent job. A CGI that possesses an extraordinary level of detail worthy of a mercenary film. These approaches can also be highlighted camera, soundtrack, photography, assembly and staging.However, all that addition of characters and cameos to the tape are one of the key points to keep the hype for each viewer, being some very well performed and others wasted in different scenes. Still, Deadpool helps in this argument by giving those more than logical jokes that really help answer your doubts. Marvel's Jesus did it excellent.8.5/10.

This movie is one of best that has been released in a long time.It is so funny and the surprise cameos and references to other movies in the various franchises are so well done.Kicking off with a typical Deadpool-style action-packed opening, it never slows down.The chemistry and real-life friendship between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is the star of the show. They just looked like they were having fun the whole time!Sure, the storyline isn't great, but it isn't the sort of movie you are going into expecting Oscar-worthy writing. You get exactly what you expect, an over the top action movie full of wise cracks, swearing and violence.

Because of the hype went to the movie with my friends. I can say they made good scenes of Wolverine & Deadpool combinations. Cracking jokes of Deadpool is works well as like in the previous movies. But it's just an another story was dragged with & some unneeded contents. Fight scenes are made well in perfect. The hype made for all to Wolverine it's worth but story wise I could say it's a okay movie.The movie started well until some what middle, Later it got dragged and ended up just like a normal story. Many fans won't accept it but I believe they could make it up with upcoming Marvel movies.

If you're a fan of comedy and a fan of superhero movies then this is the film for you. This film is one of the best marvel has produced of recent and definitely the funniest.From the start, it does not disappoint even with the speculation of the dulling down since Disney bought fox. It lives up to the R-Rating from the very start.To see Deadpool and Wolverine team up in this film is something many have wanted for decades and this shows. The narrative throughout is hilarious and the film as a whole is full of shocks and surprises where I found myself constantly smiling and laughing out loud.Overall this film is a must see, a 10/10 from me and leaves me wanting more.

My rating is 7.5/10. Reynolds and Jackman were brilliant and have great chemistry as the two leads. There were also some great cameos in this and I loved the ending. That being said I still wouldn't rate this as highly as the first Deadpool film (which is fantastic). Whilst it made me laugh I didn't enjoy the plot as much as the previous Deadpool films and the fighting scenes started to get a little repetitive. I am not a huge fan of the multiverse so maybe that's why I didn't enjoy the plot as much. However, I still think the positives outweigh the negatives and this is definitely the film to see if you fancy a good ol' laugh.Was this film absolutely amazing? No.Was the film a bloody great time? Absolutely!

It was a graet movie the most thing i liked is they didn't change a lot of what we were used to in Deadpool movies and the The fights were great and the bloody scenes were the same as we are used to, but I didn't like the story very much Marvel movies will end soon I think that superhero movies are coming to an end now but they have to continue to collect superheroes and exploit parallel universes as much as possible but everything will come to an end I hope they find Something else for them to work on because I really love their movies and want to keep watching them. As for Deadpool, I think this is it.

This movie creates the ideal balance of irreverent humor and explosive action. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds are both quite good, and their different talents make for a compelling combination. They both delivered standout performances that will be remembered fondly by fans of both characters. The film's strengths in humor, action, and visual appeal make it an enjoyable experience. It is a satisfying and entertaining addition to the superhero genre, offering a fitting and entertaining farewell to Hugh Jackman's portrayal of Wolverine.The action scenes and visual effects are excellent, and the plot moves quickly and is full of clever banter. It's a must-watch for superhero fans because of its brilliant writing and humorous parts, which will appeal to fans of both characters.

The humour in the script is fine. The language and the occasional 4th wall break don't bother me. It's Deadpool and I knew what to expect coming in.The problem is that the story simply makes no sense. They've sacrificed every ounce of story coherence and meaning for posturing and meaningless illogical fight scenes. Don't get me wrong, I don't expect some masterpiece here, but don't make it a ridiculous dance stunt. Have a bare minimum of logic, justify the McGuffin chase.The problem of going too meta and disregarding the story is that you make the dramatic moments meaningless. There's no weight to them because you made everything a ridiculous joke. It just doesn't work.

Absolutely amazing movie!!! Loved every minute of it, funny as ever, great story, emotional, kept me interested till the very end! The cameos were WOW factor and great surprise!Ryan and Hugh were amazing, worked so good together!!From the beginning of the movie till the end I was engaged and excited to see what was next!The action was great, the comedy well let's just say Ryan just made me cry from laughter!The cameos that were introduced or can we say re introduced into the MCU! Wow is all I can say, so unexpected and not just came in for a few seconds but played proper roles in the film!A must watch especially a MCU fan and Comic fan!

GOD! Waiting for this movie is worth it. 2 years back when they announced that Deadpool and Wolverine are finally coming together, fans like had gone crazy even though I had my semester exam that day.Talking about the movie, this movie is completely fan services movie that's complete all fantasies which we fans where excepting from it. In some cases this movie has cross beyond its limited in humiliating Feige, Disney and Fox studio. And yes they allow even though their ass were burning like hell. This movie is first R-Rated movie of MCU and they has shown that amount of blood and violence just in opening short that in history MCU had ever shown.Coming to character, we know 'Deadpool is always be a Deadpool', but Wolverine character development was impressive yet it was not require in story which slow down the story phase little in between. And if I'm talking about character developed, I don't know why the main villain got lazy writing. She don't have weightage in story because less screen time. Story is also basic if we go in detail but what matters is they full filled our fantasies. Lots of blood, jokes and action and lots more.... Movie has got countless cameos which were enough to take me to that phase when I had just started to superheroes movie. They had given presented most marvel characters movie with their humors, humiliation and their cameos. In some cases, they have include that movie which don't comes under superhero category.For my recommendation, this movie is worth. Watching with your friends, more worth it...

It truly is a rare thing to come across a movie sequel that surpasses its predecessor, when its predecessor also was a sequel and a pretty great one too. It becomes apparent that someone worked really hard, not only to get this movie made, but to make it into what it is: pure joy and entertainment. This movie reminded me of what entertainment really is about. I had forgotten, because the corporate overlords at Disney doesn't want to entertain us anymore, they want to lecture us and lectures are never entertaining if you didn't chose to attend them by free will. This movie does the complete opposite. It takes you on an adventure, but it also checks in on you now and then just to see to that you are entertained, it gives you little moments to breath and, by god, if it didn't put a tear to my eye at one point. This movie cherry picks all the best parts of the previous two movies and manages to make it into a firework of action, drama and humor (I can't even remember the last time I laughed so hard, out loud, so many times, in a movie theatre). This is what you get when the creators behind a movie franchise really care about and know their audience.

I went to the theatre with higher expectations due to all the hype and high rated reviews with everybody saying this movie is gonna save mcu and all. But I must say im a little bit disappointed. Not that this is a bad movie, just because my expectations were too high. Cameos and easter eggs were good but my theatre was too dull nobody cheered or anything so it was a mood killer for me. Acting was great. Personally deadpool's fourth wall breaking eas bit too much for me but nothing to complain. Plot was just okay nothing great or super about it. Action was good. But i dont see how this movie is gonna lay the foundation to future mcu movies. Anyway if you are interested in watching this movie, go to the theatre with low expectations and youll be just fine. Jus as MJ said in NWH, expect ddisappointment and you wont be disappointed. Just kidding its a fine movie.

Sometimes that happens when you're a juggernaut my dude. You come out swinging take it to the top make a few mega hits then some jabs, then some misses and then a right hook.Not sense Spider-Man No Way Home has a Marvel Movie hit this hard, although the movie is more similar to Avengers End Game.This was a fan service that I did not expect at all. What's interesting is as much as it hit me as a fan boy who knows his comics it also will appeal to anyone who has been watching comic book movies sense...no spoilers, here!But for those of you who care nothing of how big the cinematic universe really is, that's ok cause you came here for two reasons...Deadpool and wolverine.Deadpool, played by Ryan Reynolds is one of the best action heroes in cinema. As crazy as Martian Riggs as Cowboy as John McClain and almost Axel Foley (in the first two movies) funny. If the term star power was more literal than Reynolds would be an Omega Level Mutant.And speaking of Omega Level, here comes Hugh Jackman. Perfectly reprising the role that made him a star 24 years ago, it always feels like he became more Wolverine with each movie. This movie is no exception simple because he's wearing that costume. It's like he could never say he perfected the character unless he puts the costume on (now if only we can cut his height down a foot). Mr. Jackman, thank you so much for coming back one hundred percent in the game!I would say more but I really should not. Let's just say it's one of the best action films you will watch and Reynolds and Jackman are two great actors who mastered their characters and came together with a chemistry that would make their wives question their intent.Trade your brain in for a tub of popcorn and enjoy!

This movie wants to put a smile on my face and laugh at all of the 20 Century Fox days, but not in a way that is full of spite and hatred. More that was fun times even if the end movies was not the best.In this movie is really good at doing silly and funny stuff that makes me not really ask. Any questions about the logic of it all because it is a laugh a minute kind of movie. That is really where in the cinema nowadays.I didn't think the action scenes look good . Didn't have much punch to them, but they were more interested in having fast energy through show comedic scene. So that is forgivable.Surprise about how much music there was in it it felt like a musical but luckily because of the constant breaking of the fourth wall, It is hard to get taken out of the movie when there's music I recognize because I am already less invested in the realness of it and more in the funiness of it.Watching two adults stapping each other is fun and going to the cinema to see it with a friend is even more fun.

This has been a long time coming, since Wolverines cameos from the previous Deadpool movies.Great plot and concept, bringing back a previous classic Wolverine in his iconic X-Men attire, with the humour & sarcasm of Deadpool with Wolverine's hot headed nature is comic gold!Open scenes at the resting place of 'Logan' was just brilliant, no spoilers!The Plot was nothing new, in Loki and with 'TVA' with the multiple time lines of some of Marvels greatest supes.The action is always on point, I giggled throughout the movie, the scuffles with our main leads never got boring with great music to add to all out rumble!Trying to avoid any spoilers, go see it!

Best movie I've seen in a very long time since Deadpool 1 and 2. Witty, gruesome, the acting was out of this realm relatable to anyone who has a sense of humor and most of all...full of hilarious inside nuggets (and outside...Peter). Why don't movies like this get Oscar's? It's pure delightful entertainment in every sense of the phrase.I don't need frilly love stories every year to be my top contenders. This one is action packed with a fully entwined storyline to previous films in the franchise and others. How ingenious this story was put together along with the perfect cast of characters makes it Academy worthy in my envelope of winners.Oh and the soundtrack...yeah...definitely needs a sing a long version.

Listening to the "turn off your phone" Deadpool wolverine trailer before the actual movie felt great this time around. I had a smile on my face throughout the opening sequence and kept it for most of the film. The movie was packed with jokes and is definitely a comedy first and foremost. We also get to see Deadpool genuinely care about saving his world.I was absolutely blindsided by the appearance of "Captain America." It's impressive how they managed to keep so many secrets and cameos from leaking, even though the story had been theorized by fans for a while. The movie is great and really funny, but the story itself isn't particularly groundbreaking. Despite the grand scale-Deadpool literally trying to save a universe-it didn't feel dense or carry much weight.At the same time, I understand why. The MCU has faced criticism for making the multiverse phase too convoluted and confusing, especially for the average viewer who hasn't seen every movie and TV show. So, despite the scale of this movie, the story remains very easy and simple to follow. It felt like Marvel was playing it safe, which makes sense and worked out well for what Marvel maybe needed at this point.I loved the movie; it was fun, funny, and simple. However, it didn't wow me. It didn't need to be a cinematic masterpiece or the best MCU movie ever made-it just had to be good and give hope for mcu's future. It delivered on that. Plus basically a perfect Deadpool trilogy. I have more thoughts, but they are quite spoiler-y. I also thought Cassandra Nova could have been a much more menacing villain. They showed her strength, but her character was quite underdeveloped. I hope she comes back in future movies.

This attempts to blend the irreverent humor of Deadpool with the intense action of Wolverine, but unfortunately, it falls short in several areas. One major issue is its reliance on outdated and often uncomfortable jokes about homosexuality. Rather than engaging in witty, thoughtful humor, the film resorts to repetitive, crude stereotypes that feel both lazy and offensive. These jokes not only undermine the potential for genuine character development but also detract from the overall narrative. In the end, while the film tries to offer a unique crossover experience, it ultimately gets bogged down by its problematic and insensitive humor.

The Deadpool films have always been very enjoyable to me. They've never been endlessly rewatchable, simply due to the crass humour from start to finish, but that's just because I don't want to get tired of them. The first two films found a way to make me smile, but I never felt the need to keep revisiting those same jokes. This time around, we're in a whole new era. Since Disney purchased 20th Century Fox, we've known they were going to let this R-rated franchise continue, but in what way? Well, Deadpool & Wolverine has now hit theatres and I must admit, I once again had a solid time and it is probably the most fun I've had with any of these movies, even though the overall film itself fits right in line with the first two, quality-wise. This is a consistently entertaining franchise of 4/5 star films. Here's why I enjoyed this one, but also why I have a few concerns for those who don't follow every Marvel project.Without getting into too many details, the basic premise of Deadpool & Wolverine begins with Deadpool being pulled into the TVA, where he learns that his world is dying and there's nothing he can do about it. Realizing that Wolverine/Logan passing away is the reason for this, he makes it his mission to hop through dimensions to find another version of that character to help him save his world and the only people he cares about. This leads them to a wasteland where characters and things from the past have all been forgotten. From there, chaos ensues, surprises will please many audience members, and the story becomes more emotionally driven than expected.Again without giving anything away, there are a lot of cameos in this film and I enjoyed every single one of them, whether they were used for a cheap pop or a meaningful reason for being there. The use of a certain character had me in tears and another had me laughing hysterically, so I had a great time with the cameo aspects. The story is also effective enough that it held my attention, but the true core of this film comes down to Deadpool and Wolverine. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds have clearly dreamt of doing a movie like this together and it shows. Their chemistry is electric and this is definitely a side we haven't seen from Jackman yet as this character. They made this a great experience.There are also needle drops every few minutes, but most of them worked in the context of the scenes. Shawn Levy has directed many films in the past, but never anything like this, so it was nice to see he was capable of content like this. What else can I say about this one? Well, the action is great (like all of the Deadpool films), the cast is fantastic, the humour works 90% of the time, the surprises are a plenty, and the third act actually reeled back from what I thought would be happening. I have to admit that people may have set their expectations a little high as to who and how many characters might appear, but in general, I have no complaints there; However, there are concerns I have for certain audience members.They make it easy enough to follow everything, but some appearances and stories carry over from shows and pieces from other films that, if you haven't seen everything, may make you scratch your head. I know there will be elements lost on some people, but at least the whole point of the movie is just about Deadpool and Wolverine. It's far from perfect and a few aspects (which would spoil your enjoyment if I said them here) are very easy to nitpick, but I have to be honest and say I had a really good time. I can't wait to see more. Deadpool & Wolverine is now playing in theatres.

I saw the first show, the movie was good but not as good as first two deadpool movies.Definitely one of the best marvel movies to come out since endgame.I saw the first show, the movie was good but not as good as first two deadpool movies.Definitely one of the best marvel movies to come out since endgame.I saw the first show, the movie was good but not as good as first two deadpool movies.Definitely one of the best marvel movies to come out since endgame.I saw the first show, the movie was good but not as good as first two deadpool movies.Definitely one of the best marvel movies to come out since endgame.

Deadpool and Wolverine blew my socks off!! Action sequences and fight choreography are top notch( chef's kiss). Ryan Reynolds is a genius at delivering the funniest lines and does wonderfully well in his emotional scenes. And Hugh Jackman once again reprises his role as the wolverine and delivering nothing short of a wonderful performance. Its cameos are handled exceptionally well. This is a true deadpool movie to heart and giving the fans what they deserve from everyone's favourite marvel couple. The dynamic chemistry between Hugh and Ryan is very much the backbone of this movie. Absolutely loved every part of it, just wished it was longer.

Light spoilers ahead only a spoiler of the first 5 minuttes.I am a HUGE fan of both Deadpool an Wolverine so when i found out they were having a movie i was over the moon with exitement.And when the first scene were we saw deadpool kicking ass in the snow to the tunes of bye bye i became even more exited. But... when the plot was introduced the film took a massive downward slope.But with that said i had a grelt and gory time with my 18 year old Big brother.
