If there is any film released this year that movie goers were going to see regardless of what Rotten Tomatoes thought, this would be it. The ghosts of Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel could not stop audiences from seeing this thing. Hell, nothing short of nuclear war or Madame Web type of word of mouth could prevent D & W from being a huge hit.With that said, I can't imagine anyone enjoying this who isn't already some sort of Marvel super fan. I mean, I like Marvel movies but there were tons of references in this flick that I didn't get and had to look up when I got home. Personally, I didn't like homework when I was in school. I certainly don't want it in my cinema experience. Of course, as I mentioned, this is a huge box office success so I might be in the minority on that. In any case, I did laugh at the jokes I did get. And I'm enough of a Marvel head to wonder why Loki's supporting cast is in this but Loki isn't. Other than that, all I can say is, if picture is fondly remembered (or remembered at all) in a decade I would be very surprised.

Undeniably the movie of the year! The hype was real, and watching Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman on the big screen was pure magic. Their chemistry revived the classic MCU energy we love. The film balanced humor, drama, and action perfectly. The CGI was top notch & cameos were thrilling without giving anything away. This movie celebrated the FOX X-Men legacy while integrating seamlessly into the MCU. Seeing it in theaters with other fans was unforgettable. Final rating: 9/10. Loved every minute of it! Fox fans, this is your moment! It's a must-watch for any CBM fan. Truly a cinematic masterpiece!

The team up that we didn't think would come, but now it's here finally. Ryan Reynolds still brings the satire that we love about Deadpool, and Hugh Jackman returning as Wolverine, wearing the yellow outfit from the comics. And those two together is the fun on screen odd couple since Hobbs and Shaw (2019).It has a great multiverse plot, not to mention there are so many Marvel characters guest stars, some you won't see coming. But it does have heart to it, and Reynolds and Jackman do play that pretty well also. You can't help but to just sit back and have fun, if you love Deadpool, I believe you'll have a blast here.

For Disney's first R rated marvel film it is amazing, the story is huge compared to previous Deadpool films but is easily understandable without watching any material with the same plot uses. The references to the 2000 Xmen film all the way up to apocalypse are amazing with actors returning left right and centre. The jokes are actually funny and the violence is actually necessary although of course amplified to add to the humor. I'd say that it is the best marvel film if Logan didn't exist and if you want to enjoy this film you should watch Logan and to have the best experience watch all the Xmen films even the bad ones except dark phoenix save yourself and don't watch that. Logan or Deadpool and wolverine who cares all we know is that the avengers era of marvel is ending.

One of the best marvel movies in awhile. Hands down the best Deadpool movie. Would watch over and over again. There are no word that explain it. No works of art can compare. Deadpool and Wolverine's latest film is a thrilling ride packed with irreverent humor and intense action. Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool brings his trademark wit and fourth-wall-breaking antics, while Hugh Jackman's Wolverine delivers the grit and intensity fans love. Their chemistry is electric, balancing humor and drama effortlessly. The storyline cleverly intertwines their worlds, offering fresh dynamics and unexpected twists. With stellar performances and top-notch visuals, this film is a must-watch for superhero enthusiasts craving a mix of laughter and edge-of-your-seat excitement.

Deadpool & Wolverine is the third Deadpool film. This film is directed, partly written and produced by Shawn Levy, director of Night at the Museum, Reel Steal and Free Guy.After all Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) his adventures he is now trying to take it easy. He tries to live a more normal life, without using his superhero alter ego Deadpool. This changes when the time agents of the TVA come after him for all the adjustments he has made to the timelines.When mutant Cassandra Nova (Emma Corrin) then forms a bigger oath, Deadpool must try to stop this threat together with a variant of Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), before all timelines are in danger.After Disney took over the film studio 20th Century Fox, they also got the film rights of the X-men, as well as the rights of the character Deadpool. Deadpool is actually not a character you expect to see in the more child-friendly world of Disney. Fortunately, they have found a good way to bring back the character of Deadpool in a familiar way, without making it really child-friendly. This is, strangely enough, the first official r rated superhero film in the Marvel film series.It is good to see that Disney now also seems to dare to make more adult films, so that they can also please older viewers. This film is such an entertaining r rated film, with brutal action, blood, swear words and other adult material. The Disney film studio gives itself more opportunities to also make films about adult material. In this way, in addition to family and children's films, they can now also try to reach the adult target group with their own r rated films. In addition, they can now also try to use other, more adult acquired film rights from 20th Century Fox, to also make these film series their own or to continue with them.Ryan Reynolds has, in addition to playing the lead role, also been involved in this film as a producer and writer. In this way, he has made a great effort to ensure that the character remains as well-known as possible for fans of the character. Fans who know Deadpool from the two previous Deadpool films, from the comics or from other films, or animations can have a similar experience with this new film. Furthermore, he also provides many moments of meta humor about the film world, other things from pop culture and of course moments where he breaks the fourth wall. Hugh Jackman seemed to be done with playing the Wolverine character, after the film Logan from 2017. When Ryan shared his ideas with him, to come back as the character again, he eventually did so. The two are also good friends with each other and, like their characters, have good chemistry. In this way, they know how to play well with and against each other.Fortunately, the story has also become a good thing of its own, because many feared that this film would become more of a film with comic references and cameos. Several cameos and references are in the film, but fortunately without them overshadowing the film and trying to be something of their own. So, after a more low point in the Marvel film series, they can hopefully handle the future film ideas and stories a bit better after this film and get the series back in shape.Director Shawn Levy already has experience with directing action films, but in this comic film adaptation, during some action scenes, many things happen at the same time with several different characters. Here, everything is sometimes not always clearly shown, so you can't always follow everything exactly. This can sometimes take you out of the film or cause confusion.

Recently, studios have been making movie they like but this doesn't fall prey. Deadpool & Wolverine is a love letter to fans and was done perfectly.Movie that embraces comedy, action and still entertains. The cast was amazing. The reality of seeing anyone else play either is almost impossible; even though we had a slight cameo.Not only is this a love letter to fans but it's a great way if introducing two of the greatest marvel characters to the MCU.2024 has been underwhelming but D&W puts that aside and we get a masterpiece. In a fair world, D&W should be considered for several Oscars but unfortunately movies like Challengers will get all the accolades while D&W was the perfect movie.Can't recommend it enough.

This fun cross-over met my expectations! I will preface that my rating is only slightly on the lower side because that's how I felt about the other Deadpool movies too. Solid, slap-stick, gore-y fun!These actors are top-notch and the action scenes were great. The humor was well performed and the graphics were smooth. The plot was a little scattered at times, but that's consistent with some of the Marvel movies if you don't do your research before. I think the comedy is what elevated this movie- Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool guarantees hysterical witty punchlines, and in conjunction with Hugh Jackman (Wolverine), I was entertained from start to finish. Definitely recommend to any action/Marvel lover!

I truly can't remember the last time I left a movie theater this happy! It totally lived up to my expectations. I'm so happy Disney didn't screw this one up. I laughed so hard I actually cried! The script was hilarious, the violence is brutal yet as funny as to be expected from a Deadpool movie. The nostalgia and totally unexpected appearances of some old familiar faces blew me away! (and might've made me tear up a little again:)) The soundtrack was great too! Seriously, what a great movie! I literally can't think of anything bad to say about it and I've already got tickets to go back to see it again tomorrow:)

Ok so just to make this clear, I'm just a casual moviegoer who decided to watch this movie because I had nothing better to do. I'm not a Marvel fan, and I haven't watched any of the X-men movies. With all this in mind, I was due for some pretty interesting surprises.What I can say from my experience, with all due respect, is that I could most easily relate this to No Way Home (one of the few Marvel movies I've actually seen). Although the story itself is kind of convoluted and ties into lore from several previous X-men and Marvel installments, most of the experience is carried by the non-stop action and satirical jokes by Deadpool, which filled the movie from start to finish. The reason I tend to compare this movie to No Way Home is because I think both are films that are designed primarily for the life-time fans of the franchises (hence the many cameos), however they tend to provide a solid and (to an extent) smooth experience for many casual moviegoers like me. If I had to pick my preference between the two I'd have to go with this one, just because of the amount of jokes that kept me rolling.Maybe your wondering the reason I only gave this movie 7 stars. Like I said, I'm not a Marvel fan and I haven't seen any of the other Deadpool films so of course I'm not going to understand every little detail. My primary criticism with the movie comes from the lack of explanation or clarification to just how insanely convoluted and twisted the entire premise of the movie is, let alone the hero's' objectives. I guess I'm not fluent enough with the X-men lore to have understood many of the details regarding the characters and their universes, although I will say it definitely had an impact on my experience. I know it may seem a little mixed because this movie itself is technically a sequel (although I had no idea how interconnected the Deadpool franchise was with the X-men universe).I could go on about this and highlight more of my specific praises and criticisms with the movie but at the end of the day, I can appreciate it for what it's trying to be, even though it's not my kind of movie. I'd probably only recommend this to people who've at least seen enough Deadpool or X-men films to have a basic understanding of the worldbuilding. However, I still had a good time with it, and to anyone else who enjoys action-filled dark comedies I think you'll have a damn good time with it as well.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a regular movie, with a script with tons of black humor, irreverence and offensively funny dialogues that in this era are not so common in film productions and that will manage to bother closed minds and amuse open minds, but the story becomes slow at times and even repetitive in the Marvel universe. The performances of the duo Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are fun and with a lot of chemistry, while Emma Corrin plays a ruthlessly comic villain. The soundtrack is full of good songs (mostly), the cinematography is ordinary without any notable quality, the level of production is perceived to be low and the special effects manage to be realistic in some scenes and terrible in others. A film with no other pretensions than to provide fan service, with a fun story of black humor but full of ups and downs.

Deadpool & Wolverine, directed by Shawn Levy, is an obnoxious film that stars Ryan Reynolds and is a double act already paired up in Marvel comic books. Both are self-healers, have authority issues, and have substance abuse problems. However, their differences, such as being slashed, stabbed, and punched out in close combat in a Honda minivan, give the film its juice. The film earns every last month of its 15 certificate for its gore and risque gags. Deadpool and Wolverine are flung together after the timeline of Deadpool's universe is threatened with abrupt termination by Mr. Paradox, a rogue agent of the Time Variance Authority. Since the death of the Wolverine in Deadpool's universe is a key factor in its demise, Deadpool goes multiverse-hopping for a replacement, finding the worst version - a self-loathing, drunken failure. Redemption beckons, but not before plenty of effects-driven carnage and a run-in with Cassandra, the deranged evil twin of Professor Charles Xavier. The film earns every last month of its 15 certificate for its gore and risque gags. Disney acquired 20th Century Fox in 2018 and began working on its first sequel to Deadpool, a popular R-rated Marvel character. Despite being from the Marvel label, Reynolds' character was not easily adapted into Disney's less edgy PG-13 Marvel Cinematic Universe. Six years later, the first R-rated MCU movie, Deadpool & Wolverine, was released in 2024, bringing a dream teaming for fans. The results for Deadpool & Wolverine are truly out of this world. Deadpool & Wolverine, a film directed by Shawn Levy, stars Reynolds and Hugh Jackman in a forced odd coupling, reminiscent of Godzilla vs. Kong and Midnight Run. The chemistry between the stars is evident, with Reynolds describing the film as like Fox dumped Wolverine, Disney picked him up, and Jackman "has to play him until he is 90." The movie is the most anticipated of the summer, proving a new future for both characters in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Reynolds' character, Wolverine, is a crackerjack quipster who constantly breaks the fourth wall, letting no one off the hook, including the studio. The jokes come at you so rapid-fire that one viewing is way too much. Levy, who co-produced and co-wrote the film, abandons his family-friendly filmography and fits comfortably into this particular universe, allowing the blue comedy to rip and the action to soar while ingesting heart and friendship into a winning mix that never seems off for a minute in the 127-minute running time. Rated R for strong bloody violence and language throughout, gore and sexual references.

I'm a die hard fan of Wolverine and after the great "Logan", I was a bit scared that they would screw up this temporary comeback. But man, it was perfect. 2 minutes in, I knew what I was getting into and I was grinning like a kid. I'm so grateful for the fans that didn't spoil the cameos and the guests actors ! What a joy to see some favorites reappearing. And what a great gig for an older Hugh Jackman, who's in top shape, more charismatic than ever. I laughed, I applauded, I cringed, I cried (during the credits). The villain is great and plausible. In a nutshell, it was such a fun ride that I can't wait to see it again.

Deadpool and Wolverine is well worth the entry cost.Yes there is no story, it's just a string of action, comedy, violence, quips, swearing and more cameos than you could fit on the Ark but it is so much fun.The Cameos in particular are fun but meaningful if you know your comic book.movie history, and some unexpected ones. Lot's of quips at expense of Disney and 20th Century Fox too. The connection between Ryan and Jackman make it work.If you don't like swearing, violence and gore then this isn't for you, but if you know the seadpool movies that would be well known.It's fun, go see it in the movies.

Went to this movie a little over a week after it released. Thank god, because I had heard that people clap for every character that was cameo'd and i find that to be so annoying (my theater didnt, LUCKILY). I feel that I can accurately review this movie because the largest disney fan in the world sat next to me; let me tell you about her. This lady laughed as loud as she could, even the jokes nobody else thought was funny and had to explain to the guy she came in with who every character was in every single cameo, one time he even shushed her. I can attribute my bad viewing experience with this lady because the movie was basically pandering to anyone who has consumed a large amount of disney media, rather than actually flesh out a movie. The cameos were cool but yet were shoe-horned into the movie to make up for plot.I must say it had cool action scenes and I liked Wolverine and Deadpool's relationship dynamic. Word to the wise; wait a week before these movies come out so you don't sit with anyone as annoying and unlikable as the woman I sat next to.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is absolutely fantastic, a true rollercoaster that takes us on a hallucinatory journey at full throttle. The movie fulfilled what it promised, giving a huge breath of fresh air to the "MCU" even without making a significant change in the paths already traced, but rather by providing "Marvel's" return to the good movie's and giving a true experience to those who go to a movie theater to see a movie from this studio. This movie is not meant to be an epic record-breaker like "Avengers Endgame" was, but rather it is a "Marvel" event in the style of "Spider-Man No Way Home" because it is full of surprises, special appearances, lots of comedy and hilarious moments with the "Deadpool" signature, non-stop action with lot's of gore in the mix, great combat scenes, good special effects and lot's and lot's of fan service. In short, "Deadpool & Wolverine" leaves us with a smile on our faces after the movie ends and when we leave the movie theater we want to see it again, that is the most important thing and it's been a long time since that happened, It should be noted that the movie is "Deadpool" in it's purest form like the previous ones, and it carries this movie in a fantastic way once again by the hands of "Ryan Reynolds" who makes this role his life, but the icing on the cake It's the return of "Hugh Jackman" as he once again plays "Wolverine" and once more, without exception, every time he appears, he ends up completely stealing the show, making this duo something truly special to remember later once again. "LFG"

I rated it at seven as you can see, as you can't argue with the movie was somewhat fun.That said it was also plodding, repetitive, villainless (Considering the villain herself was only thrown in there as a means to an end). This movie barely had any plot at all. One of the most super thin plots of any MCU movie.Clearly what it was about was trying to throw these two characters together and watching them Bromance through the whole thing while making repeated jokes about fox, pedos, masturbation, and other intense sexual innuendo, which is unfortunate because no doubt scores of young children are going to watch.Ryan Reynolds, of course, was a little over the top.Overall, a bit exhausting but funny if u r an adult and don't really care about the overall universe.

I'm one of those fans who defended those X-men films for years. YEARS!! If it's gonna get better I hope. And it didn't. But Logan, days of future past and X2 proved you still have to appreciate what came before the MCU. Twentyth century Fox is the reason we have the MCU and beyond. Thanks Ryan Reynolds for making Deadpool 1 & 2. Anyways, the film had to many ideas that weren't cooked all the way. It felt like a comedy of characters we know and somewhat plot and action. The comedy is what makes this film redeemable. Wish the writing was better. But all I can say is. Hopefully the next one is ok.

I recently watched Deadpool and Wolverine on Amazon Prime (yes, I paid for it, unfortunately), and while I enjoyed it, I couldn't help but compare it to the first two Deadpool movies, which I found much more entertaining. Don't get me wrong, I laughed-just not as much or as consistently as I did with the previous films. The humor felt a bit more restrained this time around, which isn't necessarily bad, but it didn't have that same relentless energy that made me love the original two.I went into this movie like a disciplined Puritan, avoiding all the teaser clips on YouTube to save myself for the full experience. In hindsight, this probably would've been better in theaters. It's one of those films, much like Oppenheimer, where I'm glad I saw it, but I'm equally glad that I won't need to see it again. Well, maybe I'll give the extended director's cut a go when that inevitably gets released, but that's likely it.Unlike the first two Deadpool films, which I can pick up and watch from any scene and still enjoy over and over, this one doesn't have that same rewatchability. I appreciated it for what it was, but it lacks that magic that would make me want to revisit it regularly. For fans, it's still worth the watch, but for me, it doesn't have that endless charm. Decent? Sure. Instant classic? Not quiteDo I think trolls and bots beef up the reviews online? Absolutely. There's no doubt in my mind that a bunch of trolls and bots were at work, boosting the reviews for Deadpool and Wolverine. You can spot them a mile away-overly glowing, repetitive comments that don't quite match the actual experience of the film. It's almost like they were written by people (or algorithms) who hadn't even watched it. While I did enjoy the movie, the rave reviews online seemed a bit... overhyped. It's pretty clear that the internet armies were out in full force to give it an artificial bump.

Deadpool and Wolverine is a montage of grotesque music video sequences; They are extra gross to mask the lack of creative fight choreography.The writers thought we liked the disgusting humor, but little did they know, many of us only tolerated it because the first two movies had heart to go along with all of the awkward butt jokes, the second less so. Now this third cash-in doesn't and the movie kind of sucks because of it. They must be best friends with, The Boys season 4 writers, or maybe they're just in the same cabal to ruin awesome IP's? Either way, they've lost the ability to write a good plot, meaningful heroes journey (even satirically) and their moral compass is officially AWOL.

Some of the people I watched this movie with were complaining how there was no real story and nothing happened except action. But come on, its a Deadpool movie.I think the point of this movie was pure fan service and pure fun. Of course it did not branch out of a classic Marvel movie but I enjoyed it over most of the superhero movies I have seen in last years.For me this is on par, or slightly better than the first part which was a masterpiece.Will have to rewatch it again to catch all the references and cameos.I guess it will be a hit or miss depending on what you are looking for. If you are expecting a fully developed complex story its not for you. If you appreciate jokes and cameos and fun, with some refreshing things for recent Marvel movies, then you will for sure enjoy.

An absolute thrill start to finish! Lots and lots of unexpected surprises. Will be seeing it again, and again, and again. Well... until Disney+ releases it. Thank you Disney, Marvel... 20th Century Fox? At least 600 charecters... hmmm. Well, 356 to go. Blah, blah, blah and 324. No spoilers but. Marvel will be extremely busy in the following years. It was stated however Hugh Jackman will be doing the "Wolverine" role until he is 90. There can be only one... I say this movie hits a high rating. At least it deserves the highest rating of the "Deadpool" trilogy. Disney... you did not disappoint us with the "R" rating. Let's keep this trend going. I dig "R" rated Disney. So much more fun.

I needed the toilet the entire time but didn't want to miss anything, don't listen to critic reviews this is arguably one of the best marvel films to date.The starting scene is hilarious and the cameos are really good, it just leaves you wanting more deadpool and wolverine. This is the best wolverine film ever made that is actually to the comics for once.The scene after the credits is emotional and pays tribute to all of the movies leading up to where we are today, marvel films have been dead since endgame but this one really takes the biscuit.Please go to watch this film for yourself and make up your own decision and don't let critics bomb it.

This movie was such a wasted opportunity. It could have been something, something more, but it chose to be a movie of this moment. That will delight many people, it will be catharsis for others after recent struggles, and annoy some as well.The original Deadpool was a great satire of the superhero genre that the mcu was. This is more akin to an internet comment section comes to life.Ryan reynolds is having a blast, so is Hugh jackman, I enjoyed Emma corrin as well.The action suffers from being unimaginative. By this I mean every one fights the same way. It's been an issue in every superhero movie. There is no reason that Deadpool and Logan would fight the same.If you want to see a movie that repeats a few juvenile jokes for 2 hours, this is for you. Over the top violence for the sake of it, for you. A ton of sexual references, for you.I was just disappointed because I was hoping for than Ryan reynolds making dick jokes and three year criticisms of the mcu. The Deadpool franchise has the ability to take risks and plays to the lowest common denominator.This movie will absolutely delight many people which is evident by the score and multiple reviews. It just doesn't work for me due to being paper thin in just about everything and very repetitive with its jokes.

It feels like it just me who went to hall with expectation laugh the whole time like I did in previous movies not that I didn't in this one it was Deadpool but the pool pf jokes felt half filled. Ryan is sooooo good at being deadpool it doesn't feel like a character to me but his own personality haha.My favourite part of movie is every bit dogpool is in the movie. The songs choices I believe is impeccable. I learnt about cameos after I watched the movie so, it made me feel like I should have a little research done earlier to make it even more exciting.Of course , it's Deadpool and a friend so anyways, want a new sequel which is all about the red suit.

The good, was entertaining, good action scenes, Wolverine definitely didn't get enough raw slashing time in previous movies.Cameos were cool and the really abstract and meta idea of merging cinematic universes was realized. The multiverse overall is tough for movies because it's so abstract and distant from reality and you've seen that in marvels box office struggles this phase.Villains were an interesting choice, while well done, I don't think we'll see them again, which is somewhat disappointing to lack the MCU continuity there.Wolverine and Deadpool had good chemistry and the actors themselves seemed like they were having fun.Could you skip it? Yes. Was it entertaining? Yes.

POV: Through the eyes of the lovely audience, who has come here to read this from such long distance and time. Deadpool and Wolverine is the best friendship movie because it depicts the actors and their respective characters in a long fight, a fight cumulative of their efforts and their endless passion to serve that character and respect its worthiness and value against all the odds in the reality of the time (& The VoiD) ! They are "Brand Ambassadors of SuperHeroes". They are Jackmans and Reynolds ! Hugh-Ryan ! They are brothers of the band who are crazy for their characters and play them so well that no one else justifiable for that role playing will ever born again ! UGGGHHHH, okay let's take pen from DEADPOOL, now... ! CUT IT !

About 10 minutes into this film I had a startling realisation. I realised there was a good chance I was going to have to give a film in the much despised (by me) MCU a 10/10 rating. I was just having such a good time with 'Deadpool' on his own unleashing brilliant line after brilliant line. Then 'Wolverine' came into the picture and the film quickly lost a lot of momentum.I'll never understand what people see in the 'Wolverine' character. My only guess is that Hugh Jackman is such an incredible and charismatic actor that he was enough to make people fall in love with an otherwise boring character. And usually I would just accept that and move on. But I'm Jackman's biggest fan and he does nothing for me as 'Wolverine'.The only other gripe I have with the film is the amount of time we have to spend watching the two leads fight, despite knowing that neither one can do any harm to the other one. Sure, some of the choreography is funny and it breaks up the story a bit, but man, could they not find some way to put some stakes into it?Otherwise I had a pretty good time with this one. 'Deadpool' was as hilarious as always, the music choices were terrific and the villain was decent. 8.5/10.

The two main characters did not need to fight each other that many times, or for that long. The minivan fight, really!?Secondly, I'm no prude, I love R rated films and as much gore as you want, but I'm classy believe it or not, so I don't throw F bombs around all day either. The writers here don't see superheroes that way, and the only thing overdone more than fight scenes is the number of F bombs. It gets to the point where you think you're watching an 80s high schooler's demo film who got the teachers approval to use profanity. Do better Marvel/Disney/whoever is running the ship now.Anyway, I'm glad I didn't pay for the ticket to this flick.

Deadpool & Wolverine was a good movie. A movie that was able to help me forget about Marvels latest shortcomings. I am extremely happy Disney didn't intervene in this project because they tend to destroy good things. This was probably my favorite of the three Deadpool movies even with the pretty big plot holes and inadequate writing. I like the character appearances, they gave the audience those big oooohhhh, ahhhhhh moments. Overall in comparison to older Marvel Greats like Ironman and Captain America, this doesn't compare on a story level. However, everyone knows these Deadpool movies aren't meant to be taken seriously. I gave the movie an 8 because it was actually watchable compared to movies like the previous Ant-man movie, and it gave me a good laugh.

While some will be delighted with a lot of suprise cameo/variants and fun jokes about disney-fox ( deadpool joke).I cannot denied the plot is very thin, the character progression on this movie is very little. Just compared it to deadpool 1 and 2 . You'll see it.This movie is simillar to no way home use cameo as the appeal to audience. Well i'd say no way home did it better with the character development.The movie throw too much joke that are very segmented for a few people to enjoy, general audience are not gonna understand 40% of the joke.Cast is fire, hugh still rocks as wolverine!!!!, hugh and reynolds chemistry is perfecto.Emma corrin killed it as the villain. But i also add that the character suffer as alot of mcu villain that they are a one off character (die just like that). I needed more of her man :).The soundtrack is used very well on the movie. Like a prayer is a banger baby :)Ok to sum it all up i'd said that This movie aint no marvel savior but an enjoyable movie and a send off for the fox universe.

Wow, wow. This movie is fabulous. And that doesn't even begin to describe how much I enjoyed it. And I can see why it's totally doing well. Surprise, surprise, If you are a fan of Deadpool, I highly recommend this film. This is the best. One I personally think so. I also believe that. Hugh Jackman. Has once again played Wolverine pretty well And this is not modern day Wolverine at all. And it's about time that Deadpool is finally in the McU as a massive fan. I avoided many years too many. And hopefully more. We will see that rated our films will work. And I. Definitely hope. The Deadpool. Will show up. In secret Wars. And Doomsday I also thought the cameos were awesome too. Talk about nostalgia, So many good memories.

This movie had me laughing the entire time. All the action almost breaks down as comic strips. The plot isn't the best ever, but it's good and the actors, cameos and actions carry it through flawlessly. Sure there are things they could've done better but getting to see this after all the lackluster marvel movies put a real smile on my face. Left the theater with a huge grin on my face and that's what the movies are supposed to be. Anyone hating on this isn't into these movies or lives in the basement and just wants to troll. Have fun with it and enjoy the ride. Will watch this again in theaters and the fact they had all kinds of collectibles was cool in my opinion.

This is the Wolverine that I know back. They brought his character from the comic books action to reality. And it's so fun to see much rivalry and brotherhood between Honey Badger and Marvel Jesus. We get to see lots of both character variants, unexpected returns of many of familiar characters. What I really want is that Hugh to really really play Wolverine till 90. That's what Deadpool said.Love the music in use, it matches every scene possible. Love that 4th wall jokes and it's super entertaining for an R-rated film. Every scene is almost a pop culture reference. As a fan, I approve this!!

We all know that Marvel has been a little shaky lately with productions that are not at all captivating. Heartless films that seem like they are only there to compose a universe that always seeks to expand without caring about the story being told and only bringing uninteresting things. That said, how good it is to see a film that was made with the heart, with the sole intention of having fun and having a good laugh with what you are watching. Deadpool & Wolverine was everything we needed, a film that cares about telling its story and making you laugh with the (sensational) jokes that the film has, but those who have a certain amount of knowledge of the films before this one can enjoy it even more .Regarding the story, which isn't actually as incredible (which isn't supposed to be and that's a good thing) compared to the other two. And unfortunately, it felt a little dragged at times, especially in the second act of the film, where I felt that some scenes went on too long, especially involving certain characters introduced during the film. In addition to having missed a little how the film deals with old characters from the Deadpool franchise, as much as that is an opinion.The film's humor is IMPECCABLE, seriously, all the comedic moments in this film are really good, and especially the jokes involving the MCU. The same level of incredible can be said about the action scenes, which are very well directed, with many scenes in which the action is done in sequence, which makes the scene much more organic. The film's CGI is great in the film, although at one point or another it remains very fake and ugly, but in general it is very good... The first act of the film is personally the best part of the entire film, where all the funniest parts of the film are and ESPECIALLY its opening, which is honestly one of the best openings of a film I've seen in a long time. Its second act in this case has great scenes, but as I mentioned it has some scenes that are a little more drawn out involving a certain character in the film. And the third act where a series of frantic action scenes take place and which, yes, has a good conclusion to the story, although the solution to stop the threat in my opinion was a little... without consequences, I think. But it's not bad, just a little strange.The film's title characters are definitely the best thing about the film, seeing these two acting together and talking is a treat for fans of this character, and especially for fans of Hugh Jackman's Wolverine, my God, how good it is to see this man returning to the character. Ryan Reynolds, as always, delivering everything as Deadpool, only this time with a much more personal and emotional objective in the film, meaning that his character is not just about the jokes, giving an even more emotional tone, which is enhanced by the character of Wolverine , which also has a heavier tone for his character. But these two together are incredible and VERY funny and all their scenes are incredible, because these characters along with their actors have an absurd level of charisma that always makes us want to pay attention to them all the time. There are several other characters in the film, such as the film's special appearances, which are many, and which are really surprising (some are more surprising, but surprising) and which help the film, being (mainly) in the comedy or even in the emotional weight of the film. Film. The antagonists/villains, however, are a slightly more complicated case, at various times they are very interesting to follow and have understandable motivations given who their characters are, for a few moments I found the interpretation of each of the actors to disconnect me a little from the film. , as much as I know that part of the film is to be that and I overlooked that point. Other characters in the film, like those in the previous films, don't appear much, but they're there, they're not really missed, but at least they're there.The separate songs for the film are sensational, my goodness, what a good thing to hear in the film, but not only are they good, they also make a lot of sense with the scenes in the film. The opening song says so. Not only that, but the film's entire original soundtrack is very good.--------//-------//--------Deadpool & Wolverine is a good comedy and action film that doesn't reinvent the wheel but does a well-done and fun job, which is what we've needed for a long time in this Marvel universe. The two title characters have an absurd chemistry and that's why every scene of interaction with them works perfectly. Definitely a film worth watching not only for its characters, but for its incredible comedy and action scenes in an uncompromising and very fun film, something we need more of in certain hero films nowadays.

I've seen many comments mentioning that the movie is great in so many aspects, but has no story. I think great part of it is because the villain story is so weak. It's that kind of villain that's just there to be beaten at the end. Her motive is so weak that you don't feel the real threat. Basically "I love living in the void, so ultimately I want to kill all other realities so the void is the only one". Even though it makes no difference for the if the others realities exists or not, since she only lives in the void.But ok, enough with the bad part (in my opinion)The movie is great. Not only because all of the obvious things (cast, nostalgia, cameos, soundtrack, etc), but mainly because it's a ray of hope that MCU can eventually get back on track. The movie specifically admits that the MCU is failing, that the F'd up.Of course there's a possibility that this is the money grabber so they can then continue making bombs like Shehulk and Marvels, but i don't think this will be the way.Deadpool is a delight for the fans. And I'm happy to see that Disney didn't mess up this great character.

The marketing was on point, the production is great, cinematography fabulous, and yes, hilarious. My main beef with this is that it brings in characters that you have to have met through other movies. This brings in so much lore- in Deadpool 2 it was okay, but I was so confused when they brought Vanessa back- I felt like I'd missed a movie! Although it was easy to grasp the characters, it still felt weird. This movie markets itself to everyone, so I don't think I'm the only one who was confused as hell. Even bringing in Chris Evans and making him a character we were supposed to know- and not captain America- felt weird. I had some laughs, and I don't regret watching it!

Hello film fans I hope you are all well. So they finally did it, they got Hugh back to play everyone's favourite mutant! Was it worth the wait? Yes, yes indeed it was! As a huge Deadpool fan, reading the comics, playing the games and been to every midnight preview of each film, I was VERY excited to see this one! I even called jackman being in part 3 as me and my friends left the cinema after the brilliant second movie(I LOVE DUBSTEP! Lol). The first film was a good start, despite DP not having the multiple personalities that he has in the comics it was a great introduction to the character. The second one was for me one of the best comic book movies ever, great story, great action, great gags and of course, a great soundtrack! So the bar was already very high for this next one especially with Jackman back! It surpasses expectations! From the BRILLIANT opening credits to the final showdown it is pure brain candy! It has everything you'd expect from a DP movie and more! I won't give any spoilers but hurry up and see it before you hear any! I had my favourite cameo spoiled before seeing it but it didn't ruin anything luckily! This film has single handedly saved the poor excuse that is Marvel these days, this film will do the numbers that endgame did and it deserves to! Endgame was a movie that was totally overhyped and just delivered plot hole after plot hole! This film nails everything it aims at! Jackman is (surprise surprise) brilliant as Logan as usual. The chemistry between him and DP will keep you laughing all the way through, and the violence, well, let's just say it's as graphic and as brutal as you'd expect from these two titans of comics! Ok so without giving ANYTHING away I'll have to stop there! Go see it asap because you WILL want to see it again! Thank you for listening and until the next time, stay safe, and may the force be with you.

First I don't know why magic Mike was part of this with his stupid cards... People only like when he has his shirt off... Otherwise not much acting talent there! Hate these cross over stories.. it's like 2 sucky shows together doesn't make a good one. Marvel has killed the idea of alternative dimension so bad multiverse should be removed from the English language. Don't know why Hollywood bothered paying for the writers to come back when they never listen to them and keep putting out the same crop! It was funny but each deadpool they put in more jokes and get rid of some plot. Overall worth watching at least once.. don't know if I would have paid 100$ to see in the theater!

Deadpool and wolverine is easily the most fun i've had a the theater this year and is battling between Dune 2 as my favorite movie of the year. Went to see this with a great friend in IMAX and had a blast, the humor, action, serious moments and performances were all peak. A perfect run time as well didn't feel overly long but was more than enough to justify the run time, Hugh Jackman had one of his best performances as wolverine and Ryan could easily play Deadpool for another 10 movies or as he put it "until you're 90". I'm not afraid to say it, this is marvel at it's best when it has balls to not only have an R rating but also make fun of themselves, I'll likely being seeing this at least 2 more times and you should too!

I am quite shocked to see this movie has such good reviews. I will say that I have been checked out from superhero movies for a while now but I liked the first Deadpool movie and the 2nd one was decent so I thought this one would be entertaining. Sadly for me it was not. The storyline made no sense at all and felt totally random. The jokes mostly fell short and the action scenes were just ok. (I didn't know Deadpool could also take no damage and regenerate like Wolverine)All in all I was disappointed and just couldn't wait for it to be over. It's a failed attempt for me but apparently everyone else seems to love it.

This movie was everything you expect from a deadpool movie. Don't expect a detailed plot with a great story. We wanted hilarious 4th wall breaks, nostalgic cameos and great action sequences. And my God they delivered.I can't remember the last time I laughed so much in the cinema. From the first second till the last I was in stitches from the non-stop jokes. The chemistry from Ryan and Hugh is second to none.Probably the best Marvel movie I've seen since No way home. The MCU hasn't been great this phase, but we may have found our saviour.Part of the MCU deservedly so. Just absolute pure fan service.8.5/10.

I found the movie, overall, to be an easy watch. Some of the jokes landed well, the costumes for many characters looked nice, and I love the nostalgic cameos that we get. I like the opening montage where Deadpool dances / kills to N'Sync's "Bye Bye Bye"; and I like the first fight scene between Deadpool and WolverineSeveral shortcomings prevent the movie from reaching A+ level though. Some of the jokes, particularly the ones involving Fox Network, fall flat. Too much of the movie occurs in The Void, and Professor X's sister is nowhere close to being intimidating or interesting enough to be the primary villain. The whole plot involving "Anchor Beings" and multiverses seems lazyMy last criticism is that I just didn't like seeing Jackman reprise his role as Wolverine after Logan. He had the best send-off to his character. Many people defend his return by noting that "this is another Logan from another universe," but I find that nuance to be splitting hairs. The character in this movie is still Wolverine played by Jackman, and we see many references to Logan, including an appearance one specific character. Therefore, the movie does diminish Jackman's sendoff in Logan.

Wonderful movie and great casting by the director. The Crossover of Wolverine and Deadpool was amazing especially the Introduction scene and the music and the BGM is just amazing. Can't wait for the next part !! Actually expecting wolverine in marvel cinematic universe in all movies of marvel . May be another Avengers end part with wolverine included in it will be a worth watch for all the marvel lovers !!!! Last not not the least the climax scene was just breathtaking like wasn't a expecting thing from the director. Comedy is too good the sense of humor of both the characters is just amazing.

Per its title the 2nd "Deadpool" sequel "Deadpool & Wolverine" unites the superhero characters of Ryan Reynolds (sassy) & Hugh Jackman (grouchy - and back from the 'dead') - to fight each other and baddies like Matthew Macfadyen, in a bloated sea of CGI (polished by director Shawn Levy) & star-cameos (Jon Favreau, Channing Tatum, Chris Evans, Henry Cavill, Jennifer Garner, Wesley Snipes, and more). With its fast talkin' filth (superbly written by Reynolds, Levy and three co-writers) and fourth-wall breakage (oft at Hollywood's expense) it maintains the 'Deadpool' rep of being Marvel's most irreverent, fun sub-franchise. Those into the 'MCU' rejoice.

...I wanted to deduct 'points' for the foul language but I found could not due to the fact that I had such a fun time watching this flick.... It was so obviously put together by people who love the lore of these characters and you could see that they had fantastic fun in the putting together of all the myriad segments of this,dare I say...Masterpiece...There!....i said it..and I think it was , of its ilk, certainly..... if you can judge a film on its enjoyment value then this is a Masterpiece... I had a smile on my face from the first moments to the last and I never lost it , not once. Ok , the cartoon violence was close to stomach turning , at times but that's 'Deadpool'... it's not for children,at all. The joke quotient was tremendous with oodles of laugh out loud moments,(..one gag near the end was one of the funniest tings I've ever seen/ heard...still chuckling about it now..Hee hee hee..). The cameo's were fabulous and seemingly endless , one in particular,(..a certain Mr T..),was especially chucklesome, if you know anything about behind the scenes shenanigans and films 'development hell' of past years. All the actors were great but obviously the 2 Mains were quite Stupendous ,bringing all their experience and gravitas to their signature Roles. Just fantastic ,adult,comic strip fun...Absolutely loved it...(..PS..Some viewers may not get all the gags and references and may deduct 'points' accordingly but being a Fanboy since the 60's I think I got most of them and almost certainly will' complete the set ' when I watch it again, as I surely will...).

Sometimes, in rare cases, a good movie doesn't need to have deep or good story, as long as it delivered what it promised: a fun movie. And this film is exactly that, and boy it really was a fun ride from start to finish.Not saying the stoy is bad, it's not, but it wasn't the focus of this movie. This movie is a fanservice movie done right. If you're a fan of the characters and the Marvel IP, then by all means go dig in and have absolute fun. It was never intended for other audiences other than Marvel fans, because there's a lot of references and other things that would only be understood if you're a fan. And sometimes, having these kind of movie is okay if done right, and full of passion and heart. And this movie is exactly it.

I loved every moment of this movie. The atmosphere in the cinema was electric. People were laughing out loud, groaning and yippeeing at all the appropriate moments. Hugh Jackman was absolutely amazing. He is no longer a young man, but wow, is he in shape!!! This movie had humour, pathos, comedy, and some of the most frenetic and intense fighting scenes I've ever seen. Lots of blood and gore, but I was riveted the whole time. Not one person left at the end of the movie. We all watched the extras at the end and they were great. Showed some of the history of the franchise. The jokes about Fox and Disney were spot on. I want to watch the three movies again in sequence.

After several years of hits and misses from the MCU since after Endgame, the long wait is over. Deadpool and Wolverine as well as several other mutants have joined the MCU. Now I'm not going to give away too much on all the characters in it, but there are some awesome surprise characters appearances in this one. Also, Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds make an awesome team in this epic awaited MCU debut film. This is definitely Marvel's big break after four years of hits and disappointments. I can't wait to see more X-Men characters in the MCU in the future. Anyway, this was awesome, hilarious and worth the wait. Ten out of ten for this.

Great and bootiful film No bad thing about it honestly comedy is very well timed When Deadpools dance came on I was like damn this song and dance nice and immediately started vibing to it Another great thing is very minimal sexual content and you can watch it with your parents if you are ok with the swears Hugh Jackmans comeback to marvel was very profitable for both the audience and him ,he as always protrayed wolverine in the best way possible I was so excited for this movie that I watched it within the 24 hours it came out This movie really revived marvel s dying franchise I mean Loki was pretty great too but this was supreme.

The film "Deadpool and Wolverine" can be described as a fantastic comedy satire taking place in the Marvel multiverseNevertheless, it cannot be denied that the movie is a rattling mix of banter, charisma and battle scenes that will not leave the audience indifferent. Deadpool, with his cheerful sarcasm and the destruction of the fourth wall, creates a unique contrast with the tough and laconic Wolverine, whose claws cut not only enemies, but also the "thread of matter time". Together, they turn the film into a bacchanal of humor and action, where every frame is filled with references and moments designed for omniscient millennial fans. The cartoon plot, intentionally exaggerated to the point of absurdity, allows the filmmakers to ridicule their own superhero seriousness.Each vivid scene and sparkling joke is a joy, but also a reminder of how far large corporations can go in exploiting our feelings and memories. The storyline is extremely sarcastic and is a satirical parody of the multiverse, which was parodied by Marvel managers with their bureaucratic myopia.The film also features multiple cameos and cameo appearances by other characters from the Marvel universe, many of whom have long been forgotten or pushed into the background. I was pleased with the appearance of "Blade", and yes, I don't see anyone except Wesley Snipes in this role!These "returns" delight and make you smile at the paradoxes of the multiverse, which is why the antihero calls himself a "Paradox".Constant intersections of time lines and ridicule of the complexity of the plot can confuse new viewers, but for devoted fans it will become a kind of intellectual game and an occasion for revisions and discussions, although I would not take the movie seriously at all, because the film has only one purpose - to entertain, and it succeeds, but not for me, well, that's my "different worldview"However, despite all its advantages and success with a large audience, the film cannot hide from the shadow of its own success. He plays on nostalgia and the cult status of his characters, but his deep dependence on recognizable cliches and fanservice opens the door to possible criticism, but this pop icon is absolutely not afraid: the film laughs at itself in every scene.Ultimately, "Deadpool and Wolverine" stay true to themselves, creating a fun and vibrant cinematic experience. This is a film for viewers who can laugh at their favorite characters, not forgetting that behind every comical moment there is a loving and appreciative audience. And although I perceive this picture with irony, like the characters Deadpool and Wolverine themselves, but I admit that such a decrease in the degree of seriousness only enhances its uniqueness. Enjoy watching and don't take the movie seriously.

I really hate it when members of an audience make it obvious that they get all of the in-jokes in a film by forcing a knowing laugh at every available opportunity. I'm not that type of person - I sat stony faced throughout Deadpool & Wolverine, despite actually 'getting' some of the references: they simply weren't funny to me. And that's not a good thing when almost the entire film consists of fan-service and self-referential quips.It took me maybe ten minutes to realise that I had made a mistake in going to see this film: the opening gore-drenched fight scene was neither exciting nor funny. And the rest of the film followed suit, as Deadpool (Ryan Reynolds) teams up with Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) to prevent corrupt Time Variance Authority employee Mr. Paradox (Matthew Macfadyen) from deleting his dimension and thus terminating all of his loved ones.Over two hours of mind-numbingly repetitive cartoonish violence and utterly inane humour (I laughed just once, at the ass-slapping during the costume scene), this latest travesty from Marvel is hopefully another nail in the superhero coffin.2.5/10, rounded down to 2 for the ugly dog, who got more screen-time than a lot of the big stars.

Lots of action, comedy and adventure. The number of jokes and surprise appearances could be a little off putting to people who have only ever seen Deadpool movies, but the lovely homages to all previous Fox Marvel movies was tremendous. So many Easter Eggs to the Marvel comics that you can't even be sure you caught them all.Synopsis: Deadpool's peaceful existence comes crashing down when the Time Variance Authority recruits him to help safeguard the multiverse. He soon unites with his would-be pal, Wolverine, to complete the mission and save his world from an existential threat.Deadpool's peaceful existence comes crashing down when the Time Variance Authority recruits him to help safeguard the multiverse. He soon unites with his would-be pal, Wolverine, to complete the mission and save his world from an existential threat.

Deadpool & Wolverine are a buddy comedy match made in heaven. For his third outing, the court jester of Marvel brings his A-game to what is an explosive summer blockbuster. It has everything fans wanted and hoped for, and yet, I still wanted so much more. This is more of a satirical send-off to the 20th Century Fox, X-Men cinematic universe than it is gleeful middle-finger to Marvel studios. Every now and then, D&W targets Marvel in glorious fashion. But you'll notice how much was left off the table. But for all we know, they could be saving a lot of that for Deadpool 4, if and when we get one. What you do get doesn't disappoint. I love how these movies leave audiences roaring with laughter. I miss good studio comedies.

Deadpool and Wolverine is literally what Doctor Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness should've been when it comes to cameos! This movie had tons of cameos and surprises! With this being Marvel Studios' first R-rated movie, they really used that rating to their advantage to show intense action scenes and deliver hilarious jokes; however, I believe some of the jokes are weak, but when the jokes are good it's really good. The issue I have with this movie though is the writing is a bit weak in areas such as the emotions and plot; it's still good don't get me wrong but there's definitely room for improvement. Overall, it's great and I recommend watching it.Rate: 8.8/10.

The film was full of over the top violence and inappropriate jokes... which is exactly how it should be. I really enjoyed the first 2 Deadpool film, but they didn't feel like they had the full support from the studios. This one felt like they had free reign to have fun.I love the X-Men franchise. Logan was a work of art and a beautiful ending to that story. Getting to see Hugh Jackman have a bit more fun with the character was very enjoyable.Great chemistry between the 2 main characters which should come as any surprise to anyone that's seen them interact in the real world.Definitely going to see this again in the cinema!

I was expecting this movie to suck because of what Marvel has done with most of his new content since Endgame. But luckily I was wrong, this has been one of the best movies I've seen this year. This summer is such a win for superhero content. We got the new season of The Boys, we got Deadpool & Wolverine, and we are getting the last season of Umbrella Academy! This movie was a love letter to Fox's many movies about X-men and other superheros I don't want to spoil. The fighting scenes were so good they had a great coreography, they were bloody violent and gory I forgot this was Marvel! I could have gone with less Marvel Jesus jokes because they repeated them so many times and they were not funny but oh well. I also disliked the amount of sex jokes, way too many, someone needs to go to horny jail. This was yet another multiverse marvel movie that introduced new multiverse rules never before established. I was sad to see some actors missing that had previously been in Deadpool and Deadpool 2, would have been nice to see them. Oh and the whole Wolverine deal was not clear, like I get what happened, but how did it happen? Couldn't they show us, maybe using comics instead of actors so they did not have to pay them if that was the problem? Oh well, I got a poster for going so I'm not complaining, and I also bought 2 little Deadpool figurine. I went with my brother and his girlfriend and they were able to follow the movie despite not knowing some stuff because it was from shows they haven't seen. Overall would reccomend, 8/10.

Well, new into the fandom, Deadpool really is one of my favourites.. went to watch this film with friends and a little let down, if i have to be completely honest.. The opening credits to this film is a visual rendezvous of everything amazing!! Be it the action choreography, camera angles, credits rolls or BG, i loved it every bit.The cross over of characters, universes, dimensions, in the most unexpected way, are moments of rejoice for the fans, with the iconic crackling humour of Deadpool and the cold humour of Logan hit the spot once again..What turned me a little sad was the story in itself. Somehow, it just felt that despite the good intentions of the plot points, somehow, it was a tired narration of a story where you're banking on the love for the character rather than his/her journey. Logan's arc did have a lot of intensity and so did Deadpool's but somehow, what joined the arcs didn't somehow workout for me..Even the fight choreography, kinda felt tired by the time it was the last one- considering action has always been iconic in Marvel movies.I really liked the use of bus windows in the last fight though..But overall, who literally cannot like Deadpool and Wolverine together? So hit the theatres!Ps- avoid 3d shows if ur city doesn't have a good 3d infrastructure. It will just ruin the experience altogether..

Well watching Deadpool and Wolverine is just like dreams of many people and it's became true watching huge Jackman as Wolverine and ryan as Deadpool is just like a heavan the comedy, the actions the dialogue is just perfect for me it is comeback of marvel universe and now we are waiting for next marvel movie the Cameo is just different and more amazing didn't expect the Cameo new Wolverine and captain... Opening scence is just amazing marvel logo intro then dialogue of Deadpool give me chills and nothing and now waiting Deadpool in mcu and Avengers team if this happens then we know what will happen.

Cheap parody of a movie! All the production movie references made it boring. All the slow motion with cheap music made it worse! Literally could have done something better! I would have it given a good rating if it was a stand alone movie with Wolverine which was not a joke! Just have to settle that good movies are no longer a thing. Totally disappointed. First and last time watching this movie. Same typical dialog about everything and everyone. Its just sad. Logan was a masterpiece when you compare it with this trash. Why couldn't they hired better writers? Dont go to the theatre, trust me. Just not.

I came out of the cinema confused. I loved the film for its nostalgia, it was funny, plenty of action and I enjoy how the deadpool films engage with the audience. I also enjoyed that a lot of the jokes connected with real life rather than just the MCU. I didn't expect a good plot so I wasn't disappointed when it wasn't. And as far as deadpools go, it's the best one.BUT... wolverine is over 200 years old, he has been through so much heartbreak, so much loss and we've been on that journey with him, from Gene dying (twice) to meeting X23 and everything inbetween. He has lost everyone close to him, turned to drink and wanted to die over and over. I felt this story was too lighthearted for his journey. (Even though it's a variant) They touched on it, they had the chance to deliver and I felt they missed it. Logan (2017) was a fitting end for him, I have no issue with them bringing him back but i just hope it doesn't turn into a path that changes who he is. We don't need another deadpool character.

I viewed Deadpool and Wolverine at the cinema yesterday, on July 26, 2024. I have to admit, it was an exceptional movie experience that I thoroughly enjoyed. The dynamic between these two characters may not have seemed compatible, but when they finally came together at the end, it was truly remarkable. I hope that this movie surpasses the billion-dollar mark, as I believe fans and movie enthusiasts alike would truly appreciate and love it. It is indeed a genuine multiverse movie from Marvel.A love letter to the Fox marvel characters. I got emotional when they run the behind the scenes footage from all the previous X-Men and F4 etc movies .

Deadpool and Wolverine deliver a thrilling experience that perfectly blends intense action with the irreverent humor fans of both characters crave. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool and Hugh Jackman's Wolverine is nothing short of electric, with their witty banter and shared history making every scene a joy to watch.The action sequences are top notch, showcasing Wolverine's brutal strength and Deadpool's chaotic fighting style in a way that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The film balances these adrenaline-pumping moments with laugh out loud humor, ensuring that you're entertained from start to finish.For fans of the characters, this pairing is a dream come true. The movie does justice to both heroes, respecting their individual legacies while creating something fresh and exciting.However, the movies plot feels a bit thin at times and the humour can try too hard leading to jokes that don't always land.

Every non-Disney Marvel movie was honored in a sendoff that had heart and a butt-load of laughs. As a lifelong Wolverine, X-Men, and Deadpool comics fan, I couldn't have asked for a better movie. A masterpiece of action, comedy, and love for fans.Without spoilers, this was a magnificent way to showcase the best and ridicule the worst of Fox's contributions to Marvel. I assure you if you're a movie fan <30 years old, you'll enjoy the cameos throughout. This is especially true as you're experiencing it with Deadpool through the 4th wall.My only criticism is the homework. If you're like me and stopped after "Endgame", then you might want to look up the events of the show "Loki" (but probably not essential to enjoy the premise).An outstanding movie, that parents should leave the kids home for - or take them and toughen them up a bit. Either way, it's a blast.

I loved watching this film but it is kind of a hot mess. It takes on so much that it can't quite give anything it's full attention and, as a result, chinks in the armour do appear. Underdeveloped characters and plot lines mixed with story conveniences, pacing issues and sloppy exposition are peppered in throughout the film's two hour runtime. However, these flaws are likely just consequences of the filmmaker's completely understandable decision to prioritise humour and great moments above all else. They do certainly try to add some emotional stakes and weight to proceedings but it's so fleeting it all just comes off as a bit half-baked. You can't really blame the writers for rushing the story in order to get back to the fun stuff when the fun stuff is this good. Bloody action, surprising character appearances, an excellent soundtrack, countless one-liners and the most meta humour we've ever seen onscreen - it truly is great stuff. If you were to see an hour long highlights reel of the film's best moments before you saw them stitched together in the final product you'd swear it was the greatest superhero film of all time but, unfortunately, moments don't make a movie and the film those countless great moments are in sometimes fails to live up to the sum of its parts. Fortunately, we do find some focus at around the halfway point when the film really prioritises its greatest strength and that is the pairing of Hugh Jackman's Wolverine with Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool. Their chemistry is thoroughly entertaining and well worth pulling Jackman out of superhero retirement to bring to the big screen. Of course there's plenty of cameos, easter eggs and surprises for fans but, surprisingly, the filmmakers were more taken with dusting off the old Fox/Marvel universe and giving it a proper send off than playing with their shiny new MCU toys. At times the film really does play out like Reynolds and director Shawn Levy emptied their Marvel toy chest onto their bedroom floor and smashed them together for two hours but it's clear they had a great time doing it and that joyous feeling definitely rubs off on the audience. It was also refreshing to see a Marvel film truly have fun with the multiverse tool after multiple attempts have criminally underused the concept. Overall, the film is hilarious, violent, fourth wall shattering and an extremely fun time at the cinema but if you're looking for an emotionally fulfilling superhero story, stick to Jackman's previous Wolvie outing in Logan.

Deadpool and wolverine did good together. However, there was zero plot progression and everything was nonsense. Cause and effect does not exist in this timeline. The only consistency between scenes are meta references, and it makes the transition between scenes jarring. Also, the female antagonist seems shoehorned in. Aside from being a white, bald, angry British woman, it is a shallow all powerful fingery woman, who just happens to be the baddie. If Disney wants to be so reductive in their antagonist, surely they can find a more believable way to do it. Pointless, but yet fun is my description.

Blown away from the opening blood splattering bone crunching action extravaganza of a sequence with our potty foul mouthed hero crushes guys with innovative brilliance.Love the movie from start to end with amazingly funny references to Fox, Disney etcetera and talking to the camera was absolutely priceless.Love the timeline of different wolverines as well as the plethora of wonderful cameos of our beloved characters. This movie is a laugh riot with over the top action scenes and f-bombs like rain coming down.All in one a treat to watch the end credits of the takes of X-men, Fantastic four and Electra movies.Best Deadpool movie yet !

FOX's superhero franchise is the Burger King to MCU's McDonald's. Some of the FOX movies are amazing, but they never caught on as well as the MCU, and on top of that, there were some real stinkers among them.We started strong with X-Men and X2, dipped at X3, nosedived at Origins: Wolverine, a turn for the better starting with First Class and Days of Future Past, only to slowly nosedive again all the way to 2019's Dark Phoenix. Sprinkle in a couple of those nostalgic Fantastic 4 movies, a bad Daredevil, a worse Elektra, a few Punishers along the way, with Logan and the Deadpool movies being the last bit of saving grace for this "franchise".Why go through all that history of the FOX superhero films? Because despite the big, red MCU opening animation at the start of the movie, Deadpool & Wolverine is, at its core, a heartfelt good bye to that era of films. It's pretty ironic, that 7 months after the DCEU died, with its last movie being the big, wet fart that was Aquaman: Something Something 2, the FOX superhero franchise goes out on a surprisingly bitter-sweet note.Who knows? Maybe one day we'll see something similar for the MCU? With all its recent releases, it's actually becoming more and more likely.As for the movie, it's really funny. Deadpool's meta humor still holds up, but you can definitely tell it's lost a lot of its novelty. The action is the best it's ever been in Deadpool, though the CGI sometimes looks like a video game. Acting is surprisingly emotional, with Hugh Jackman giving an incredible performance.Cameos? They're great, and one cameo in particular was my personal favorite (though it wasn't much of a cameo). You'll know which one I'm talking about when you see it.Music? Let's just say the opening of this movie is without a doubt the best opening of any FOX or MCU superhero movie. You'll know what I mean when you see it.Fan-service? Dude, it's the end of an era. You really think they're not going to give you everything you ever wanted? They do and it's glorious.So why an 8 and not higher? Ironically enough, what holds this (almost) FOX movie back is the MCU fluff. Once they start getting into the multiverse, focal beings, and all that other nonsense, I immediately lost interest. The movie's plot is framed within these ideas, sure, but that's all it really needed to be. Framing.I actually missed superhero movies that weren't a part of a bigger universe and didn't need to serve the practical purpose of expanding on the broader narrative of Phase 17 of a cinematic universe. Maybe now we'll get to appreciate those FOX superhero movies?But one question remains: if FOX's franchise is the Burger King to MCU's McDonald's, then what fast food place is the Sony superhero franchise? It's the dumpster behind a Church's Chicken.

If you have been tired watching the marvel movies after the endgame era, tired of seeing the same storyline, folding over and over again. Then Deadpool and wolverine will take you to a place where everything is happening differently. They swear, they don't care, they break the fourth wall, they break the third act. They connect with you mostly throughout the entire film and also gives you the taste of marvel cinematic universe in Deadpool flavor. Wolverine's appearance was clearly a moonshot and it succeeded. Everyone loved wolverine on the screen and with Deadpool it makes it even better. Killed the typical boredomness of the marvel cinematic universe after the end game. Loved it!

Ok so just to make this clear, I'm just a casual moviegoer who decided to watch this movie because I had nothing better to do. I'm not a Marvel fan, and I haven't watched any of the X-men movies. With all this in mind, I was due for some pretty interesting surprises.What I can say from my experience, with all due respect, is that I could most easily relate this to No Way Home (one of the few Marvel movies I've actually seen). Although the story itself is kind of convoluted and ties into lore from several previous X-men and Marvel installments, most of the experience is carried by the non-stop action and satirical jokes by Deadpool, which filled the movie from start to finish. The reason I tend to compare this movie to No Way Home is because I think both are films that are designed primarily for the life-time fans of the franchises (hence the many cameos), however they tend to provide a solid and (to an extent) smooth experience for many casual moviegoers like me. If I had to pick my preference between the two I'd have to go with this one, just because of the amount of jokes that kept me rolling.Maybe your wondering the reason I only gave this movie 7 stars. Like I said, I'm not a Marvel fan and I haven't seen any of the other Deadpool films so of course I'm not going to understand every little detail. My primary criticism with the movie comes from the lack of explanation or clarification to just how insanely convoluted and twisted the entire premise of the movie is, let alone the hero's objectives. I guess I'm not fluent enough with the X-men lore to have understood many of the details regarding the characters and their universes, although I will say it definitely had an impact on my experience. I know it may seem a little mixed because this movie itself is technically a sequel (although I had no idea how interconnected the Deadpool franchise was with the X-men universe).I could go on about this and highlight more of my specific praises and criticisms with the movie but at the end of the day, I can appreciate it for what it's trying to be, even though it's not my kind of movie. I'd probably only recommend this to people who've at least seen enough Deadpool or X-men films to have a basic understanding of the worldbuilding. However, I still had a good time with it, and to anyone else who enjoys action-filled dark comedies I think you'll have a good time with it as well.

The Plot - 4/10 It was an inch deep and a mile wide, and fundamentally failed to bring to bear any sense of stakes, and more importantly, bring to life any real emotion. Even where it was within easy grasp in Logan's scenes of being a failure, it failed to reach the genuine depths we know the character is capable of when played by Jackman.The Cameos - 10/10 Let's be real, each one managed to top the last, having you giddy and on the edge of your seat, smiling like you were a kid again.The References - 12/10 In universe, out of universe, and real world inside jokes and references. They went above and beyond.This film managed to reach the intersection of "Always Be Escalating" (ABE) and finally skinning the Golden Goose. This is it it's over. This film finished at a 7/10 for me but came rocketing up to an 8/10 with the post credits scene.The homage to the fans, Fox, and the films that raised us. The good, the bad, and the cool, long before anyone ever dreamed of something like Ironman, it was a salute to us that nearly brought a tear to my eye. Thank you 20th Century Fox. It will never be the same again.

Deadpool is back and brings together with him the wolverine. I can say that was a movie which had everything and maybe a little more than what we expected.I will refer to the breaking of the fourth wall where it is a main characteristic of the Deadpool movies but in this particular movie it was even nicer and funnier. I really liked the music choices in the movie as well. The good thing is that they kept deadpool and wolverine at the levels that these characters should be. The Multiverse continues and we are going to face even more surprising things than these we saw on Deadpool and Wolverine.

What can i say about this marvel movie??It felt like watching a formula.slow-mo shots for 15 20 minstoo many songs telling you what to feel in the scenesway too many cameos and not a single memorable oneTries to be emotional but fails miserablyAnother multiverse story which doesn't work eitherZero logic and emotion in the storyI think marvel is making projects rather than cinema. "Deadpool & Wolverine" is the highly anticipated crossover that fans have been clamoring for, and it does not disappoint. This action-packed, hilarious, and emotionally charged film brings together two of Marvel's most beloved antiheroes in a way that is both satisfying and fresh.From the outset, the film establishes its irreverent tone with Deadpool (Ryan Reynolds) breaking the fourth wall and making witty quips about the absurdity of the superhero genre. His comedic brilliance is perfectly counterbalanced by the brooding intensity of Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), whose gruff exterior hides a deep well of pain and loyalty.The plot kicks off when a new threat emerges, forcing Deadpool and Wolverine to team up despite their vastly different approaches to heroism. Their reluctant partnership is a source of endless humor, as Deadpool's reckless antics clash with Wolverine's disciplined, often grumpy demeanor. The chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman is electric, their banter sharp and their camaraderie palpable.The action sequences are top-notch, showcasing both characters' unique abilities in spectacular fashion. Wolverine's brutal, visceral combat style is complemented by Deadpool's acrobatic, unpredictable fighting techniques. The choreography is fluid and dynamic, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats throughout.Director David Leitch, known for his work on "John Wick" and "Deadpool 2," masterfully blends intense action with dark humor. The film's pacing is brisk, with a perfect balance of high-octane moments and quieter, character-driven scenes.
