Leitch ensures that both characters are given their due, exploring their backstories and motivations without slowing down the narrative.The supporting cast also shines, with standout performances from Zazie Beetz as the luck-manipulating Domino and Josh Brolin as the time-traveling Cable. Their interactions with Deadpool and Wolverine add depth and variety to the film, creating a rich tapestry of relationships and conflicts.One of the film's strengths is its willingness to delve into the emotional core of its protagonists. Wolverine's struggles with his past and Deadpool's battle with his own mortality provide poignant moments that resonate amidst the chaos. These character-driven elements elevate the film, making it more than just a mindless action flick.The visual effects are impressive, seamlessly integrating CGI with practical stunts. The film's aesthetic is gritty yet vibrant, capturing the essence of both characters' worlds. The soundtrack, featuring a mix of rock anthems and original compositions, enhances the film's energy and tone.In conclusion, "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a triumphant blend of action, humor, and heart. It delivers on its promise of an epic crossover, bringing together two iconic characters in a way that feels both organic and thrilling. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the comics or just looking for a fun, entertaining ride, this film is a must-see.

Honestly the best thing to come out of marvel in a long time. The cameos! Jinkies! THE CAMEOS!! My jaw was on the floor for the majority of the film. If you love to laugh, Easter eggs, blood, violence and the occasional dad joke then this is a must!! Ladies, if you're not into these films, just go with your boyfriend trust me it will be worth it at the end! I cannot wait to go and see it again! Best deadpool film so far. Cinematic genius! You're all in for a treat with this one. Seriously funny laugh a minute, you will get a couple of songs stuck in your head for days but it is completely worth it.

This movie fell short of Deadpool 1, which I would rate a 10. Deadpool 2, I'd rate that one a 6 because it just felt bland to me. This one was fun to watch, and much better than Deadpool 2, but in my opinion the storyline and character development in this movie was very poor compared to the first.As others have pointed out, if you're a big comic book fan you will appreciate this movie more than you would otherwise because of all the callbacks to the universe and various cameos. However, I'm not that big of a comic book buff... I need an engaging story to keep me interested.Deadpool 1 had a better story, character development, and comedy and tied it all together cohesively. This one missed the mark in a big way when it comes to story and character development. Soooo many unanswered questions, and things happening that are important to the overall movie with zero backstory as to why they are taking place.With all that being said, I do recommend you watch it at least once because it was entertaining and worth the watch. Just don't go in expecting a move as good or better than the first.

I like the movie for what it was, just a fun little movie about Deadpool and wolverine. Simple and fun. There were a ton of Easter eggs and overall just cool scenes. The chemistry was really good. Super enjoyable film even for those who aren't really into Deadpool and wolverine. Now it wasn't super funny all the time but it was never boring which is good for a marvel movie.Kinda felt like a super awesome gag movie. Definitely made me want to go and revisit the Wolverine films, re watch them.There's nothing else I have left to say, I went to a smaller theater and the audience seemed to have a good laugh here and there but yeah, the movie was okay. Thumbs up.

This movie had it's moments, however story is secondary to tonnes of cameos, easter eggs and total fan service. Unfortunately that paid off to creators many times before and still works here for mass public. I personally miss any good story, even one like in Deadpool 2.Here any motivation of either hero was very flat and not convincing. Honestly in full cinema there were not so many laughs I would expect.On really good points, action parts were really well done and in IMAX 3d they delivered tonnes of fun.Ultimately I had fun, but I see no point in rewatching it (i don't fancy looking for every single Easter egg)

MAN THIS MOVIE SUCKS........just kidding this movie is FANTASTIC, AMAZING, GOATED, ONE OF THE BEST MCU MOVIES THAT I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. I love how deadpool and wolverine came to the MCU, I love the cameos of ____________ and _____________, and also I love where they ______________________________________________________. As a Comic book fan I really love this crossover one of the best in our lifetime, So overall I really do enjoyed this movie and I watched it a couple of times now, I just wasted my Money again to rewatch it. So i suggest that if you see this review you'll be watching it too.

Very funny and all, loved the jokes and that's the deadpool i came for, deadpool and wolverine constantly being stupid at each other, but what is going on? The entire thing is a bunch of comic easter eggs for comic hunters to have fun at, which is just not what I came for. When you watch deadpool, you should be able to enjoy a easy story with no weird multiversal bollocks, even the movie said "It's gradually been great since endgame" taking the mick out of itself, why are their random time people? Honestly didn't enjoy the story since there was no story for me, had absolutely no clue what. But yeah it was funny.

I was a huge marvel fan, but... It has been a long time I haven't seen a more empty, clueless and useless film such as this one. I ether cringed or slept throughout the film. No story, no sujet, no real emotions, nothing. Here and there a few good jokes, but that is it. Everything was put into gore cutting fight scenes. No problem with them in Deadpool, but it was so random and over the top.... Wasted budget, my own money and actors' talents. I love Deadpool. I love actor playing Wolverine. I really wanted this to be good. But these marvel films - are just mimicking a cinema these days. I trully hoped this one will be a good one, finally. But it was the worse... these gilms became mere colourful empty moving images concentrated around same old cheesy sugar scenes and plots, lame cgi, without any coherent storyline, or depth.... And this trend will only grow and Marvel and comic book movie industry will eat its own tale and implode. Hollow. Nothing. No art at all. And funny thing - no real fun either. Just cringe.

What can I say? It's an imperfect mess that a lot of us would love. Does it save the MCU? Kinda. Does it live up to the tag line "Everybody deserves a happy ending"? Yes. Although a lot of people would be disappointed in Deadpool digging up Wolverine's corpse but it sets up the paper thin weak script but not as good as "Logan" but equally as good as the first 2 "Deadpool" movies. It is a much better ending to the Fox Marvel films than "Dark Phoenix" and "The New Mutants". It's effing awesome. One of my favorite movies alongside "Bumblebee". 8.5/10. LFG! Can we cut this imdb review now please!!

It is the most highly anticipated film of the year. I was looking forward to the movie. I thought the movie was enjoyable. There were some excellent and unexpected cameos. There are some negative aspects of the film. First and foremost, it is tempo. It falls and rises. Furthermore, the story was straightforward, with many unexplained elements. I liked the movie's ending. I also think the Fox sequence at the end was good nostalgia, and thank you and say goodbye. Hugh Jackman performed admirably once more. Everyone was fantastic in general. It was perfect to watch Wolverine again, this time with Deadpool. The film was very entertaining, and there were many funny scenes and jokes. Bravo to Ryan Reynolds! There were also very good references. In general, it was a little weak in terms of story, but I watched a very good movie in terms of pace, entertainment, and references. I left the cinema happy. I think I will watch it in the cinema again.

When you think about dream team-ups in the Marvel Universe, Deadpool and Wolverine top the list. And in "Deadpool & Wolverine," fans get everything they've been waiting for and more. This film is a glorious symphony of chaos, humor, and raw emotion, making it an absolute must-see for any comic book enthusiast.Plot & Characters:The story kicks off with Deadpool (Ryan Reynolds) finding himself in a particularly sticky situation that, of course, only he could find himself in. Enter Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), the grizzled, no-nonsense mutant with adamantium claws and a heart of gold. The dynamic between these two is electric, combining Deadpool's irreverent humor with Wolverine's gruff intensity.Reynolds and Jackman have an undeniable chemistry that leaps off the screen. Their banter is sharp, hilarious, and perfectly timed, making every scene they share a highlight. Deadpool's fourth-wall-breaking antics are in full force, providing meta-commentary that pokes fun at everything from superhero tropes to the actors' own careers.Action & Visuals:The action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. Director [Director's Name] brings a fresh, kinetic energy to the film, with fight scenes that are brutal, fast-paced, and beautifully choreographed. Whether it's a bar brawl or a high-stakes showdown, every punch, kick, and claw slash is executed with precision and flair.Visually, the film is a feast for the eyes. The cinematography captures the gritty, grimy world that these antiheroes inhabit, while the special effects are top-notch, seamlessly blending practical and digital elements. From the blood-splattered battles to the breathtaking landscapes, every frame is meticulously crafted.Humor & Heart:While "Deadpool & Wolverine" is undoubtedly action-packed, it never loses sight of its heart. The film explores themes of redemption, friendship, and what it means to be a hero in a world that often feels beyond saving. Deadpool's irreverence balances perfectly with Wolverine's solemnity, creating moments of unexpected poignancy amidst the mayhem.The humor is exactly what fans have come to expect from a Deadpool movie-raunchy, self-aware, and relentlessly funny. Reynolds delivers his lines with pitch-perfect comedic timing, while Jackman's deadpan reactions provide the perfect counterpoint. It's a laugh-a-minute ride that still manages to find time for heartfelt character development.Conclusion:"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a wild, exhilarating ride from start to finish. It's a film that embraces its comic book roots while pushing the boundaries of what a superhero movie can be. With stellar performances, jaw-dropping action, and a script that's as funny as it is touching, this is a movie that demands to be seen on the biggest screen possible.Whether you're a die-hard Marvel fan or just looking for a great time at the movies, "Deadpool & Wolverine" delivers in spades. It's a cinematic event that's not to be missed-grab your popcorn, sit back, and LET'S FUCKING GOOO!.

An addition to the beloved deadpool franchise that provided nothing i fear. It was funny but felt abit like it was trying too hard, wolverine was a pleasant addition but in a world of milking movies for more then they're worth i feel like this is another victim of it. A trilogy felt unneeded especially after the first 2 movies were hilarious yet gut wrenching at the same time. I'm not saying it was a bad movie but it was bad from a trilogy stand point, if this was the first showing of deadpool as an anti hero of marvel it would've been amazing yet it paled in comparison to the other two and seemed to have added nothing to the main plot line.

Absolutely brilliant. I laughed my ass off from beginning to end. A wonderful conclusion to the Fox movies and a hands down great addition to the MCU. Quite possibly the bloodiest Disney movie ever produced. How they got away with some of the jokes is beyond me. It's a step up in crudity and juvenility from the 2 previous Deadpool movies. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman chew up every scene they're in and the quantity of Easter eggs and cameos should keep every Marvel fan happy. Stick around for the after credits scene... My 2nd favourite Disney Marvel movie after Captain America Winter Soldier.

Yup, that's my take. I didn't walk away hating the movie but I didn't walk away loving it either.I loved seeing 2 best friends in real life being on-screen together and knowing another best friend of theirs was very much involved in the movie.Was it fatigue from all of the promotion that was being done weeks ahead of time? Was it because its "The movie that will save the MCU"?Truth be told, this movie didn't hold the "Magic" that the 1st 2 Deadpool movies did.My take: No more standalone Deadpool movies. That ship has sailed. Deadpool being in other MCU movies? Fine by me. I love how Ryan plays Deadpool; no other actor can ever be him but I think if another standalone Deadpool movie comes out, I will wait when it's on Disney+

Films rarely can live up to their hype especially when it has been years in the making. Deadpool can breath, relax and revel in its own bravery. Since Marvel was taken over by Disney, red flags were waving and increasing in numbers, ironically it actual gets a tounge lashing for its betrayal.Deadpool is charted which an opportunity to work for the Marvel universe to save the planet from its own extinction,with the assistance of the worst Wolverine, thanks to Mr Paradox and TVA.Unquestionably the chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman is palpable, nearly every scene they share is hilarious. Thanks also to a sharp witty script, full of vulgarity and offensiveness. Just brilliant. Welcome also to old favourites who play the role of the others. Its a fitting farewell to this part of the MCU.

Finally, another Marvel movie that hit all of the right notes for me and I genuinely haven't been this invested in an MCU movie since No Way Home. This movie was thoroughly entertaining during its entire runtime and it even brought some tears out of me. Arguably the best movie in the multiverse saga, 'Deadpool & Wolverine' brings the Marvel Cinematic Universe back to full form in the most iconic and batshit crazy way possible, with the help of a few jaw-dropping cameos. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds have all of the immaculate chemistry that was promised and it thankfully never missed a beat. Also, Emma Corrin's Cassandra Nova is a more-than-formidable antagonist that brings a rather rushed 3rd act to an epic conclusion. The laughs never stop, the action scenes are pulpy, and the 4th wall breaks are better than ever! To its credit, the film juggles a somewhat shaky plot fairly well with some much needed emotional weight and an overall good time that makes the pacing feel like a breeze. This 3rd installment of the 'Deadpool' franchise settles in perfectly, all while giving diehards the fan service that they hoped for.

I don't think there's anything else being released this year that has this amount of hype and lived up to it! Seeing all the possible cameos and rumors since '22 and the delays, was hauntingly painful. But we finally made it and by some miracle it lived up to the hype and more! Hugh is wolverine as long as we need him and i'm not complaining. Ryan was born for Deadpool and kills it this time around in both the comedy and seriousness. This film in the trilogy had much higher stakes and while having a more serious tone at times it was the funniest one yet! Cameos are the cherry on top of this film and everyone one had a purpose, a perfect love letter to the FOX universe!

Loved the movie full of surprises. Lived every moment. Especially sense it makes sense with everything going on in the MCU!!!Deadpool and Wolverine for life baby. LFG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But any hoot I really wouldn't recommend taking your children. Parents you do you but I wouldn't do it unless my kid is at least 15 youngest I would say 13 but that's still to young ngl. They won't understand most references or they will and that's just sad. DEFINITELY BIT A FAMILY MOVIE. IT IS R RATED FOR A REASON. I saw someone with there not even oldest maybe was 8 maybe younger. Just sad to see nowadays.

I'm a fan of Marvel and have been since the start of the MCU, but I also grew up loving the Fox Marvel universe. X-Men, Fantastic Four, and even Daredevil were a big part of my childhood, and this film's goal was to remind you of those movies, whether they were good or bad, all in good fun. I feel like this film did a great job of sending off the Fox Marvel franchises while telling an entertaining story.The action scenes were awesome to watch! There is some bad CGI here and there, but nothing major enough to detract from the movie. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds make an amazing and hilarious duo, keeping you entertained throughout their screen time. I was laughing the whole time.However, if you're not a fan of Marvel or didn't grow up watching the older Fox movies, you might feel a bit lost, which is understandable. From an entertainment standpoint, I would give this film a 10/10, but as a film, it's not quite that high. The villains are generic and forgettable, the plot is a bit silly, and the stakes don't feel very high due to the multiverse, which allows everyone to come back in one form or another.But at the end of the day, I genuinely loved this film and had a blast watching it!

Not so great story, but keep engaged with action and cameos. Bunch of Deadpool varients, keep engaged with fight and actuon sequences. If we got this Wolverine flashback properly on screen that would be great, they just indicated that the Wolverine is killed everyone in his universe.Enjoined everybit, movie was fun, not many bad words, but still I suggest to away from the move if you are not adult. This movie is not PG 13 rated yet.I found some plot holes, but you can ignore and enjoy the movie, these plot holes not going bother.My rating is 8.5 out of 10, for action, fun and emotions. Let's f word go.

I had to chime in on this one. I've been following the MCU ever since 2016, and I've been a fan ever since. However, the period after the Infinity Saga ended up until now has been pretty horrible. Constant shows that make me want to die, most movies being mediocre slobs. Its all been pretty bad, and mostly because the head of Disney left shortly after the Infinity Saga finished, leaving the new head Bob Chapek to come on. Thankfully, Chapek has now been dethroned and Iger is back, and the first MCU movie in the new Iger era is awesome.Seriously, this movie is a must watch. It is constantly hilarious, the action is some of the most well choreographed I've seen in a long time, and the drama in the movie is intense (Hugh Jackman is, as always, an incredible actor, both comedic and dramatic).I'm not going to spoil anything, but know that there a handful of very big returns. The coolest part being that none of them were cameos - all were integral characters that had enough screen time to flesh them out.The movie also connects to the MCU (and a modicum of other franchises), leaving me satisfied as a fan.The story is, while ridiculous, very compelling and never had me anywhere near uninterested. Very creative, and very, very fourth wall breaking.I love this movie so much, and whoever is reading this, you absolutely need to give the movie a shot in the theaters.If I write for any longer I'll go on for a year, but if I have to end this review on mentioning something, I'll mention the music. Goddamn is the music incredible in this movie. Never have I seen licensed music used this well in a movie before.WATCH IT!Support this movie so we can tell Disney that we would like the MCU to stay at this quality. This movie has instigated a lot of hope in me for the future of Marvel - I hope it doesn't dissapoint.

The Film Was WAY Too Much, There Was Some Huge Multiverse Stuff Going On, Too Many Jokes, And Ryan Reynolds Felt Like He Was On Top Way Too Much. However It Was Enjoyable And Hugh Jackman Was Acting Perfectly. A Solid Watch Overall.The Plot Was Slightly Confusing, Because You Had To Watch The Directors Cut To Understand. The Dog In The Film Was Great, Really Brought It Up. Also The Random Fights Between Deadpool And Wolverine Made Me Like It More Way More.The Cinematography And Costume Design Was Perfect, No Flaws. However, The Soundtrack Was Bad. The Furiosa Joke Had Me In Tears. Good Watch Overall.

First Time review here, after using IMDB for how long I thought I would sign up to leave a review for this epic film.AMAZING. What a movie. The amount of cameos , the action, soundtrack left me with a huge grin on face. Has me still thinking about it hours after watching. The best Deadpool film, Hugh Jackman as Wolverine steals the show.Feels like a throwback to the 90s X-Men, Marvel cartoons , comics and Cards all wrapped up in one Glorious Film. If you are a Fan of the X-Men especially Wolverine do yourself a favour and go watch this film you want be disappointed! 10/10 can't wait to watch again!

I booked this film relatively early so there could be no spoilers and I'm glad I did as it was cameo haven.There were times in the film where me and my wife were belly laughing as we have quite a dry sense of humour.I do feel like there was something missing potentially in the story line where they could have helped link it to the upcoming movies.I also think that due to there being so many cameras I was quite disappointed at the end when a few of the rumoured characters didn't show up.It is a film that will make you laugh and there are plenty of relatable scenes. If you have been with marvel since day 1 and enjoy all the films this is one for you as it does link past films with recent films and series. I'll just be disappointed if this is the end of deadpool and wolverine as there's so much potential for them to team up elsewhere however with this type of humour I'm not sure where they could be placed in the MCU.Watch the film and enjoy it for the masterpiece it is.

Deadpool And Wolverine!! Just go and watch without a single thought!! Ride of Fun and Emotions, surprise of legendary Cameos! Out standing Dialogs, u wont stop laughing! Bloody violent and that Honda- Kia debate end! Hugh jackman just killed it and Ryan Reynolds gosh this guy doesnt need any review for his movie! Deadpool is 100% MARVEL JESUSFrom the jump, it's non-stop action, snarky humor, and some epic bromance moments that had me dying laughing.  If you're a fan of Deadpool's fourth-wall-breaking antics and Wolverine's gruff, no-nonsense vibe, you're gonna love this. It's like they took all the best bits of both characters and mashed them into one insane, hilarious, and action-packed film.

To its credit, it's bringing people to theatres in droves, and offers the moviegoing crowd a highly appealling bag of tricks, stuffed with gags, eye - popping action and cameos. Was fun to watch this in a packed theatre, 6pm on the opening Friday, and laugh along with a crowd that's invested, and understands the references. That communal experience is what cinema is all about.However, the film also represents a lot of the issues with modern superhero films:1. An over - reliance on nostalgia; I feel like success in Hollywood has become a waiting game; bring it back 10 - 15 years later, and people will love it.2. A thin, cliched and vague, reality - bending multiverse plot, which often takes a back seat to set pieces, eventually becoming bloated and convoluted.3. 'Fight glorification'; everything's hyping up to the two protagonists brawling, as though it's the cinematic payoff above all else.

This is probably one of the most irritating movies that I have ever watched. The only thing I came anything close to liking is the intro scene and titles. Thats it. Everything else about this movie seemed completely meaningless. The jokes were forced, there is no real story. The action is something you have seen a thousand times over. Ryan Renolds is at his most annoying level. But Hugh Jackman saves the movie somewhat.Sets seem to be very claustrophobic for me everything is done in a very small place. This is something which I find common in all dead pool movies that the sets are really really small. It feels as if things were done on a budget which I really don't think is the case. So why the lack of quality?Some parts were funny though, thats the only positive. So in short a few laughs are all I got out of this movie. Apart from that it was a waste of time.Unless your a fanboy , just avoid this movie.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" is a film that undoubtedly caters to the fans, bringing together two of Marvel's most beloved anti-heroes in a way that is both entertaining and visually spectacular. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool and Hugh Jackman's Wolverine is electric, delivering the witty banter and intense action sequences that fans have come to expect. The film is packed with Easter eggs, references, and nods to the comics, making it a treasure trove for die-hard enthusiasts.However, while the movie excels in fan service, it falls short in terms of storytelling. The plot feels disjointed and lacks the depth and coherence needed to fully engage the audience. The narrative often takes a backseat to the spectacle, resulting in a film that is more style than substance. Character development is minimal, and the motivations of the villains are underexplored, leaving the story feeling somewhat hollow.In summary, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is a fun ride for fans who enjoy seeing their favorite characters in action, but those looking for a strong, cohesive story may find it lacking.

Oh boy, where do I start with "Deadpool & Wolverine"? Imagine taking a ride on a rollercoaster operated by Deadpool himself, with Wolverine as the grumpy but badass safety inspector. That's pretty much what this movie feels like!First off, the cast is a superhero dream team. Ryan Reynolds is back as the Merc with a Mouth, Deadpool, delivering snarky one-liners with the precision of a surgeon (or maybe a very sarcastic butcher). Hugh Jackman reprises his role as Wolverine, bringing his signature gruff charm and adamantium claws. The chemistry between these two is like a buddy cop movie on steroids-if those steroids were also laced with caffeine and a dash of insanity.The movie kicks off with an opening scene that's both gritty and groovy, setting the tone for the madness to come. Marvel fans will rejoice at the sheer volume of in-your-face humor, action-packed sequences, and eye-popping visuals. It's like the filmmakers decided to throw caution to the wind and just have a blast, and boy, does it show.The plot is... well, it's there, somewhere between the explosions, witty banter, and unexpected cameos. Speaking of which, keep an eye out for some fantastic surprises, including appearances from past X-Men villains and a few new faces that will leave you grinning. The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine is a special treat, offering a fresh and fierce twist amidst the usual superhero fare.Now, let's talk about some standout moments. Without giving too much away, there's a scene where Deadpool and Wolverine team up against a horde of enemies that's both ridiculously over-the-top and incredibly satisfying. It's like watching a ballet of violence, choreographed by someone who decided that subtlety is for wimps.The humor is exactly what you'd expect from a Deadpool movie, with plenty of fourth-wall-breaking jokes and meta-commentary. There are jabs at Disney and 20th Century Fox, and even a few self-deprecating digs at the superhero genre itself. Ryan Reynolds' comedic timing is impeccable, and Hugh Jackman proves he can do comedy just as well as he does drama.But it's not all jokes and explosions. There are moments of genuine heart, particularly in the interactions between Deadpool and Wolverine. Beneath the layers of sarcasm and bravado, there's a surprisingly touching story about friendship and redemption. Who knew that a guy in a red spandex suit and a grumpy Canadian with claws could make you feel all the feels?Visually, the film is a feast for the eyes. The special effects are top-notch, and the action sequences are brilliantly executed. Whether it's a high-speed chase or a brutal hand-to-hand combat scene, the choreography is on point, and the cinematography captures every punch, kick, and snarky grin in glorious detail.If there's one gripe, it's that the movie occasionally feels like it's trying to do too much. With so many characters, subplots, and jokes crammed into the runtime, it can be a bit overwhelming. But then again, that's part of its chaotic charm. It's like being invited to a wild party where you don't know anyone, but you end up having the time of your life anyway.In conclusion, "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a wild, hilarious, and action-packed ride that doesn't take itself too seriously. It's everything you'd want from a team-up between these two iconic characters and more. Whether you're a die-hard Marvel fan or just looking for a fun movie night, this film is sure to leave you entertained and possibly craving chimichangas.So grab your popcorn, buckle up, and get ready for a superhero spectacle that's as irreverent as it is epic. Just remember, you're not ready. But that's okay-neither are they, and that's what makes it so darn fun.

I came in with correct expectations as this is a Deadpool movie. Do not go in expecting as a MCU fan hoping for something huge and universe alteringI think this movie does the best job in a while with just being fun. It has the Marvel magic, the cameos, the little teases and easter eggsOn top of everything it's just a good funny movie. It's a good Deadpool movieIf anything Deadpool is more unhinged this time around when it comes to slewing and meta commentary contrary to being addicted to sexual organ jokesThe cast all plays their roles well, the story and plot is nothing to glance but the movie is made with passion.

On top of everything I will edit the dialogue and character acting of this movie. Which are great and the Hindi dub is awesome specially Sankat Mahatre has done amazing Hindi dubbing for Deadpool's voice...But to look at the negative side, some things are good to say the story is a bit shaky after the second half. The last scene could have been better. Anyway the movie can be enjoyed and presents us with a childhood nostalgia.But the movie The cameos were amazing, I didn't expect so much, really amazing..And thanks to Marble for giving such a beautiful r rated movie for the first time.....

"Wolverine and Deadpool" (2024) emerges as a cinematic tour de force, deftly amalgamating the brooding gravitas of Wolverine with the irreverent flamboyance of Deadpool, culminating in a tapestry of narrative complexity and stylistic bravura. The film's directorial prowess is palpable from the outset, orchestrating a symphony of visual and thematic elements that coalesce into a harmonious yet paradoxical unity. Hugh Jackman, reprising his iconic role as Wolverine, delivers a performance suffused with a palpable depth, his portrayal resonating with an undercurrent of existential angst juxtaposed against stoic resilience. His embodiment of the character is a masterclass in subdued intensity, each glance and gesture laden with unspoken history and inner turmoil. Contrariwise, Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool is a kinetic force of nature, his sardonic wit and meta-textual commentary punctuating the narrative with effervescent levity. Reynolds navigates the labyrinthine corridors of humor and pathos with dexterity, ensuring that Deadpool's antics, while irreverent, never devolve into frivolity. The screenplay is an intricate mosaic, weaving together multifarious strands of plot and character development with meticulous precision. It navigates the treacherous terrain of blending two disparate tonal landscapes, ensuring that neither character's essence is subsumed by the other. The dialogues are imbued with a lyrical quality, oscillating between poignant introspection and razor-sharp banter, thereby maintaining a dynamic equilibrium. The cinematography warrants particular commendation; the chiaroscuro lighting techniques employed accentuate the dichotomy between the protagonists, with Wolverine's scenes bathed in somber hues and Deadpool's sequences awash with vibrant palettes. The action set pieces are choreographed with balletic grace, each confrontation a visceral ballet of brutality and finesse. The auditory landscape of the film is equally compelling, with a score that traverses the spectrum from hauntingly melancholic to exuberantly bombastic. The sound design intricately layers ambient noises, diegetic sounds, and musical motifs, crafting an immersive auditory experience that complements the visual spectacle. However, the film is not devoid of imperfections. Certain narrative arcs, particularly those pertaining to ancillary characters, are afforded cursory exploration, rendering them somewhat two-dimensional in the grand tapestry. Additionally, the pacing occasionally falters, with segments of the second act meandering into expository quagmires that momentarily derail the momentum. Nevertheless, these minor foibles scarcely detract from the film's overarching triumphs. "Wolverine and Deadpool" is a testament to the alchemical potential of cinematic storytelling, where meticulous craftsmanship, stellar performances, and audacious vision coalesce into an opus that transcends the conventional boundaries of the superhero genre. It invites viewers into a realm where humor and tragedy, action and introspection, chaos and order coexist in a delicate ballet, challenging and rewarding in equal measure. In summation, the film stands as a paragon of genre-blending artistry, offering a multifaceted experience that lingers in the psyche long after the credits have rolled.

This movie is everything we could expect from Deadpool from insane mind of Ryan Reynolds.His duet with Hugh Jackman is masterful and the amount of jokes, cameos, freedom and just having fun with the movie is so refreshing and great. You go to cinema to just enjoy your time and have unfiltered fun. Not to change the world again. We need more movies like this. Seen it twice already and still could easily go 3rd. Masterful, but to be honest - Marvel will have hard time to keep such a high level going forward. Also if ever they decided to do Deadpool 4, it also will be very hard to reach that level again.As Deadpool says in the film "Let's give the audience what they are paying to see" and I fully agree - they delivered on all promises.

This review is about the 3D version, but you can catch the normal version everywhere.Deadpool and Wolverine: an odd couple, if there ever was one. Deadpool & Wolverine throws the wise-cracking Merc with a Mouth and the brooding, clawed loner together for a wild ride. It's a mix of laughs, action, and surprising heart that mostly hits the mark.Reynolds and Jackman have undeniable chemistry. Reynolds is in his element, firing off jokes like a machine gun. But it's Jackman who steals some scenes with a vulnerability we don't often see from Logan. Their very mature-rated banter is gold, and it carries the movie through some of its weaker moments.The action is a rollercoaster. Some sequences are pure adrenaline, with the 3D adding a cool dimension. Others feel a bit too chaotic. But when you've got two guys who can cut through steel with their bare hands, you expect some explosions.The humour is spot on. Deadpool's fourth-wall breaking antics are as sharp as ever, and the movie is packed with funny pop culture references. But it's the buddy comedy vibes between Deadpool and Wolverine that really shine. You can't help but laugh at their constant bickering.It's not perfect, though. The story is pretty standard superhero fare, and there are a few slow parts. Plus, while 3D is cool and increases the feeling of immersion, in my opinion, it's not necessary to enjoy the movie. There's nothing game-changing about it.Overall, Deadpool and Wolverine 3D is a fun popcorn flick. It's not high art, but it's entertaining. If you're a fan of these characters, you'll probably enjoy it. Just don't expect to leave the theatre pondering deep life questions. And remember, this one is definitely not for children.

Worst deadpool movie ever, classic event when Disney screws a previous masterpiece, exactly the same style as other avengers and marvel movies. If u wanna see some weird magic, multivers go watch it, otherwise it is nothing like previous deadpools. The story line is not consice, many characters are introduced in the movie which totally deviates the story from precious world. Lots of time travel and multivers, like all other marvel movies and trieng to involve audience in the movie which they clearly failed. More like a movie for teenagers and kids other than a movie as a continuation of the series.

So many surprises around every corner. The first 8 minutes are diabolical and rotten in a good way only Deadpool can get away with mixed in with lots of humor and Deadpool decadence. This movie constantly makes fun of itself and others and doesn't take itself too seriously as usual and it remains intact with the same jokes we've come to love with a lot of new, fresh jokes sprinkled in. Characters we've never seen come to light for the first time on screen and in the end dreams do come true for many Marvel fans. All in all it's a romping, roaring good time with non stop action, comedy and Ass Grabbing, Ass-slapping, Ass-stabbing and Wolverine Badassness!

Stupendous action out the gate in what can only be considered a love letter to a bygone era who paved the way. As kids, we had to give up on previous franchises and characters as they essentially failed and were replaced by something better. Ironically, Marvel find themselves in a void of their own, relying on past failures for them to succeed.Hugh Jackman shines as Wolverine, clearly experienced in this role and showing that there is no one better whilst Ryan does what he does best. The story is patchy and the pacing is off, but no one turned up expecting an Oscar worthy film when you have Deadpool and his 4th wall antics.

Don't get me wrong all Deadpool movies are pretty good but Dead pool & Wolverine, knocked it out of the park.I can't get out of my head the sountracks, specially Madonas sountrack.Finally Deadpool has the budget that deserve and I can see it and avery single scene , amazing effects , stonish cast etc.Probably a little to much sex related references but The combination of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman on a single movie made a boom to the whole marvel universe.I feel that is one of the best movies of the last years.2hrs 8min feels like a blink of an eye, specialy with all the surprises that came with.Masterpiece.

"Deadpool x Wolverine" is a blast! Ryan Reynolds is hilarious as Deadpool, and Hugh Jackman brings all the Wolverine vibes we love. Their chemistry is off the charts, mixing epic action with tons of laughs. The story keeps you hooked with cool twists and fun comic book nods. The effects are awesome, and the supporting cast really adds to the fun. It's got everything you want in a superhero flick: action, humor, and classic Deadpool and Wolverine moments. If you're into superhero movies, this one is a must-watch. It delivers on all fronts and is sure to leave you entertained and wanting more!!!

Deadpool & Wolverine will go down as the highest box office earner for R rated movies of all time, but it's probably the worst of the trilogy, that's the MCU tax at work.Let me start by saying that, this movie probably has my absolute favorite opening scene in MCU history, might be recency bias, but Deadpool absolutely murdering TVA agents while doing a choreography for N'Sync Bye Bye Bye is perfect, hilarious from start to finish, couldn't stop smiling, and it's just feels right in a Deadpool movie.After that things get VERY shaky, I might have to rewatch the first 2 films, yes the first 2 movies did at times halt the flow pacing of the movie to joke around, but this one, wow. With jokes that take too long, after you think it's done, no... there's more. And once it's done you remember, oh right, these guys are actually doing something. It wasn't pretty, sometimes it worked, but sometimes, it was just too distracting.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are having the time of their lives, their dynamic is so good, and it just keeps the movie going, hope Matthew MacFayden enjoys the pay check, because it felt like he didn't want to be there, and Emma Corrin was great with what she was given, unfortunately they wanted more jokes and cameos that actually building a compelling villain.The cameos were good to be fair, it was great to see some of these, but Henry Cavill?! YES, that was awesome, I'm shocked Marvel managed to keep most of these under wraps, guess that's what happens when Tom Holland isn't part of the movie.Story wise, there's a movie in here, a really amazing one, that just gets a bit hidden by all fan service that it tries to do. It's a good movie, might get better on rewatch, but can't help but feel it was a bit of wasted potential.

This movie was truly one of the best releases this year. From trailers, to marketing, and I expect this is gonna clean up at the box office! But is it the best Deadpool? Imo... no. Don't get me wrong, go watch this movie, you'll enjoy it. But amongst all the jokes launched and action sequences, it feels like the story was a bit rushed. To me, this shows in the middle of the movie, because it seems to drag on constantly with references and Easter eggs. It almost feels like filler to extend the runtime. Now with that being said, the ending to me is what makes the movie great. The whole sequence to Like a Prayer is truly amazing! It almost made me tear up. Go watch. The actual score I'd love to give is a 7.8.

I am writing this review after almost just exiting the cinema in the greatest mood with all the happy feelings my body can handle.First of all I understand the critism about the story, but i don't agree, i can't understand why it even matters that much.. was deadpool really about having a great story?? Please remember the first two, not really great or strong stories.. cute and memorable momenta, but not really great stories.. But they don't have to be.. The Merch With a Mouth is a fourth wall breaking, funny, invincible former special force fighter.. it was never ever about a great story.. it was about fan service, made by a great actor with enthusiasm for the character, nothing more, nothing less..And this movie delivers exactly that..Regarding my review here and why I give it a 9/10 is because it actually exceeded my expectations a lot.. It's Disney I was afraid of getting hit by the lately politics of a Disney, but I wasn't.I haven't felt so good in a long time, especially after leaving the cinema, I'm writing this fresh off this feeling.. I got more fanservice then I expected I almost clapped a couple of times and almost cried from happiness during the movie and after leaving.Thank you for this movie.I am gonna rewatch it again and again and again when it comes out after the cinema.

With all the movies that actually "try", this gem really entertained me and make me forget my miserable existence for a while.A lot has been said and written about this movie: It won't win an Oscar but it doesn't need to, it just aims to be fun and maybe give too many fan service.The plot is teenage manga story level, there is maybe "1" plot twist, the action scenes are fun and amazing, the music is correct and focuses on old good songs to reinforce the nostalgia with the special cameos from other movies from better times.Thank you to the director and the cast. You are the best.100% recommended.

Come on, seriously?! How are people hating on this? Packed with action, comedy and lots of fun cameos. The writers on this really outdone themselves. They came up with some amazing S#%T. Can't imagine what people would expect from this other than what it was. Hope the rating on this doesn't drop much more because of the crybabies that hate the hype. Hype aside the movie was excellent. Don't let the wannabe critics distort your opinion on whether or not you should see this movie. Best comedy that's been in a movie for 10+ years. Haters, going against the grain doesn't make you look smarter. G'day.

So in many way I think this may be the best Deadpool movie. However it has some issues that end up hurting it.Let's start out with the good.Having Wolverine is just very fans dream. The interaction between DP and Wolverine are perfect and what you would expect. Especially when they fight as no one ever really wins since they are more or less unable to die. The amount of cameos is mind blowing and had us nerds gleefully shouting. As did many of the very meta jokes! And of course having the TVA was just perfect given DPs multiverse, 4th wall breaking nature.The bad? All of the above sort of.Let's be clear, unless you seen the old X-Men/hero movies before the MCU and unless you read alot of comics. MUCH of the comics and cameos just aren't going to do anything for you. This also means so many jokes are going to go over people's heads. And this is an issue because if your movie depends on all this knowledge, cameos...etc, then you may have to consider how good the movie really is. Fan service is great, but it doesn't always mean a movie is going to be great.Storywise it's actually kind of weak. The villain(s) were ok, admittedly "she" was terrifying, but also felt like she wasn't in the movie much. And the other villain, he was kinda funny but again, not really scary per say. And overall their stories weren't exactly deep. And in many ways the story became kind of confusing. How did certain people get in the movie? Which earth where they from? When did they become part of the Marvel movies? Even Deadpools timeline earth is sort of confusing. Granted I've always said with a multiverse, if your not careful, it can makes thing more complicated then they need to be and create issues.One good example is the DP movies we see an older X-men and then in another movie was see the younger (First Class) X-Men. How can this be given the DP movies take place after each other and the timeline for the younger/older X-Men is a period of decades. Granted some of it is inside jokes, but it can be confusing if you think about it.And this movie REALLY upped everything. Including the one liners. And while many were hilarious, it often felt endless and almost overly forced to push a joke every 5 seconds. It's DPs nature, but it also almost goes so much that its exhausting.So in the end if you KNOW the past of the Marvel/Fox movies and some comic stuff, you will love this movie and get most of the jokes. If not, you may find alot of the "amazing" or "funny" moments lacking.

This is a little tricky to rate because of what it is. The story line is the best the writers can do with so much on the check list to entice movie goers to get back into the MCU brand loyalty. Rating is brought up by the cameos, but the rating was brought down by the Disney brand: To elaborate, the Disney brand has always been about feel good ending with life a lesson. Considering this is an adult movie, the let's all feel good message is exhausting. There were a handful of scenes that were forced to be dramatic, but it just doesn't feel genuine. Action is overwhelmingly redundant. There are several jabs at real life and movie characters that were relatively easy to catch. And there are many more repetitive, alternative lifestyle jokes that are simply played out after two installments. Even though this was enjoyable, I would not want to sit through it again any time soon, hence the six out of ten rating. Worth the watch, yes as six is still better than average. Expect a typical comic book movie - CGI heavy with not so complicated story line.

I really enjoyed the previous Deadpool movies, and recently watched "Logan", so I had high expectations for this one, and thankfully they were very well met.The movie was just really fun overall. The story was alright, but what really stood out (similarly to the previous deadpools) was the great action, the incredible humor, and the film even had some emotional moments.The chemistry between Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds was incredible and they made a really fun combo.This isn't the movie you go to when you want to watch "pure cinema", this is what you watch if you just wanna have a fun time.I see this as possibly a revival to the mcu after some disappointing installments.

From the explosive, adrenaline-pumping opening sequence, Deadpool and Wolverine is a relentless assault on the senses. The film's audacious blend of humor, violence, and unexpected plot twists creates a cinematic experience unlike any other. Ryan Reynolds' iconic portrayal of Deadpool is matched only by Hugh Jackman's career-defining performance as Wolverine. Their on-screen chemistry is electric, igniting the screen with every interaction.Jackman, in particular, shines in this film, claiming the iconic yellow suit with a ferocity and vulnerability that is both captivating and heartbreaking. His portrayal of Wolverine is a masterclass in character development, showcasing a depth and complexity rarely seen in the superhero genre.The film's visual spectacle is nothing short of breathtaking. The action sequences are choreographed with a brutal precision that is both exhilarating and terrifying. The CGI, particularly in the creation of Cassandra Nova, is flawless, adding a layer of otherworldly menace to the proceedings. The decision to introduce multiverse elements adds a fresh and exciting dimension to the story, keeping the audience guessing at every turn.The film's narrative is a masterclass in pacing, with each scene building upon the next to create a relentless crescendo of excitement. The unexpected cameos, carefully woven into the plot, keep the audience on the edge of their seats, constantly guessing what iconic character will appear next. These nostalgic nods to the broader Marvel universe add an extra layer of depth and excitement to the film, satisfying long-time fans while also introducing new audiences to the rich tapestry of the comic book world.It's the heart of the film that truly resonates. The camaraderie between Deadpool and Wolverine is palpable, their banter sharp and witty. The film manages to balance its over-the-top action with moments of genuine emotion, creating characters that are both larger-than-life and surprisingly relatable.Sum up - Deadpool and Wolverine is a testament to the power of comic book storytelling and fan service. It's a film that respects its source material while pushing the boundaries of the genre. It's a film that will be talked about for years to come.

Just because you're giving fans what they want to see, doesn't mean you're doing bad work- there's no need to be a pompous hipster about it- and there's a way to do it right. Deadpool and Wolverine is somewhat sloppily throwing together these characters in order to get the action rolling, but really pulls off the blend of action, comedy, and yes, love too. It gave me moments to be proud of being a Canadian and proud of being a British Columbian.The mid credits mini doc to all the 20th Century Fox Marvel films was actually a bit touching, and it was a class act by Disney and Ryan to include it.If you've ever enjoyed a single Marvel movie, this is definitely worth a watch!Why WAS Thor crying?

I don't even know where to begin. I've been reading the deadpool and wolverine comics ever since I was a kid and seeing hugh jackman and ryan reynolds acting shows how much they suit the roles of deadpool and wolverine but also the frenemy type of relationship they have together in the comics, hugh and ryan were able to bring that out on the big screen.This movie is hilarious, action packed, nostalgic, clever and witty, the music is great and the chemistry between characters are perfect. I can honestly say I've watched the movie a good 8 times now and it never gets old each time I watch it. So when it comes out available to purchase I'm definitely getting a copy and i hope there's lots of extras on it too.A must see. And maybe look at the lore and the personality types of deadpool and wolverine before watching the movie. This won't be for everyone but it certainly does tailor to everyone in a way with its comediac genius. I couldn't stop laughing during the whole time I first saw it in cinema but you can miss alot by just watching it once.

A wonderful love letter and swan song to everything 20thCentury Fox has done with Marvel heroes, mixed with unrepressed humor, a spectacular cameo episode and the return of Jackman, everything perfectly fit into an unforgettable movie experience, from the unstoppable opening scene, where Deadpool visited the place where it happened unforgettable tragedy, , where he went on a rampage accompanied by an infectious song by Nsync, the film does not stop with surprises and crazy creativity, they resourcefully brought a dose of freshness to Wade Wilson, of course he still packs the halls, but the events that happened in the last sequel left some clue, and after they rejected his application for a job, which he wanted for the wrong reasons, he withdrew into himself, stopped his heroic activities and affected his social life, this turn in him gives an interesting unexpected territory to his character and we see that he is not completely immune to emotions, no matter how much he may want to be, which will increase even more when the world is on the verge of extinction, Jackman's stellar return was made with a lot of respect and understanding and most importantly, the iconic ending of Logan, Wolverine was not touched returned with a lot of energy and life, as if he hadn't been away from the screen that much at all. They maturely dosed the trauma and the feeling of guilt that accompanies him throughout the film, and the dark side emerges lightly from him, while the flashbacks where we get an insight into his past contain intriguing and striking a scene like his walking by the monument. The relationship between Deadpool and Wolverine is dynamic and priceless, two different worlds in an epic team up. One is serious, haunted by the past, and the other is frivolous and rarely stops talking, and the way he raises tensions and is always ready to stab between them, it is witty and fascinating to watch. The humor is fortunately not filtered and delivered with total freedom, rude, playful, rude as it should be, and the cameo roles are shocking and unpredictable, the moment you see them, you get a great thrill and joy, because you are always kind of longed and wondered if they would ever come to MCA and get their minutes of fame in the action scenes, we saw them in action, which is a dream come true. While the action is one of the best in recent times, full of brutality, bloodiness, sharpness, where you can see and felt punches and gunshots, mixed with acrobatics and martial arts, is only a bigger plus with some literal parts, you think of the way they were performed, they look like they were ripped out of a comic book, the very emptiness is in the manner Mad Maxa is luxurious, full of challenges and full of masterful easter eggs, the villain who is connected to Xavier is effective and not an easy task and when he is in the frame with the heroes there is no shortage of tension, while the soundtrack and their pursuit of musical classics only make the film even better.

Wonderful wrap up for the trilogy!!! While I'd love Deadpool to continue to have movies...I really feel like this one nailed everything (it will be so hard to beat). Ryan brings all the same comedic beats from the first 2 movies. That intro dance number at the beginning is now my favorite scene out of all 3 movies. Hugh & Ryan have such an incredible bro-rivalry it works well!I love all the cameos & Easter eggs - they hit all the right feels. The story was like the other Deadpool movies in that even though it seems crude and irreverent it has a ton of heart. I'd happily go watch this again in the theater (and I don't go often anymore what with how much everything is).It was a great date movie.

5 out of 5 stars.Deadpool and Wolverine is an awesome superhero film which brings these two characters into the mcu. Deadpool is still a potty mouth and film is still bloody and gory. Character does not lose his sense his humor with the disney merger. Shawn Levy did a great job in bringing these characters. And delivering justice.Plot is great. About the tva recruiting Deadpool to help save a timeline with another agenda in play. The script has plenty of references and humor to keep the jokes rising. The action sequences is bloody fun. The cast ensemble is great and plus the surprise cameos. The soundtrack is fun. It is nice to see Hugh Jackman back into the role and hope he continues further with the character.Can not say much more without spoiling. It is best to see for yourself. It is one awesome film in the mcu and cant wait to see the next film.

There was a time movies gave us the fans what we like. Not everyone was successful at that. But they tried. Then we all have to go through several years of movies telling us what to like and what not to like, instead of giving us what we like.Deadpool & Wolverine took us back to the times when movies were made for the fans. And it did a great job out of it. Comedy was on point with few of heart felt moments. Movie was no way perfect. The reasons for why Deadpool needed to bring back Wolverine is flimsy at best. But it doesn't hurt the enjoyability of the movie.This movie was pure unadulterated fun for the long time fans of Marvel superhero movies without messages or pandering to the fans.It is just a love letter for fans from all the Marvel superhero movies.

It's Wednesday evening and we're in one of the very first screenings of Deadpool & Wolverine in Australia.The theatre is packed and you can tell we have an expectant audience. Strap in and let's see what this film is all about.For a start, it is definitely a Deadpool movie - all the usual fourth wall chatter, profanity and wisecracks, gratuitous glorious violence, and wonderful choreography. As a Deadpool movie, it's better than the second movie and only slightly less good than the first one.Pan out to the bigger picture and that's where the gaping cracks appear. By trying to say goodbye to Fox and say hello to Disney/Marvel, this movie falls flat for me.Yes, there are cameos from the Fox Universe. And with the first one (intentionally chosen to fool you, say no more), your hopes start to rise that this could be epic. Then you realise that the roster is thin and none of the iconic characters are going to show up, and your hopes fade.The movie becomes an overblown, too try hard, too smug, and a self-referencing bloody mess. You have to be a mega-fan of Ryan Reynolds to enjoy this properly - it's less Deadpool the character and more "Look at me, Ryan Reynolds, playing Deadpool". It's hard to watch. Look closely and you'll barely recognise a script of any substance at all. It's whisker-thin and you end up feeling like it's a one-liner stand-up show crossbred with a Greatest Hits nostalgia review as opposed to a movie that heralds the start of a fantastic new world of Marvel.And just in case you didn't work that out, the end credits scene hammers this home as obviously as possible and that left us feeling even more deflated.I love superhero movies and it's been an incredible 20+ years, through the hits and misses, of both Marvel and DC. I feel blessed to have grown up with the comics and then, as an adult, see those pages come to life through the amazing advances in technology.However, I simply don't know how Marvel is going to hit gold going forward. DC is possibly about to blow us away with their reboot of their universe. I fear Marvel is screwed and the current slump will continue unless heads roll at the top.I give this 5/10 because as a Deadpool movie, it's fun. But, you can't ignore the fact this is supposed to lead us into a new, combined and expanded universe. Based on this, it is a steaming pile of Dodo excrement.

I haven't had this much fun watching a Marvel movie ever! Great movie with excellent humour and amazing action.There is a chuck full of Easter eggs all over this movie with great call backs to 80s, 90s and 2000s. It is a long drive through memory lane but it is done in a way that the journey is supremely entertaining. The cameos are well selected and meaningful.The entire movie theater was giggling from start to end but also there were some deep moments with meaning in it as well.The acting from the two leads were great but the side characters did a really good job as well.It is surely a must watch!

I mostly appreciate classic Hollywood and European cinema, dramatic and existential films. I loved X-men as a child, however, couldn't vibe with Marvel and DC or any super-heroes when they were extremely popular 10 years ago, gave a try with "Civil war" (2016) and hated it. Never wanted to see Deadpool 1 or 2. Lately I became more open to different tastes of films and decided to give a try for "Deadpool & Wolverine" because of good reviews and Hugh Jackman. Was skeptical at first but found myself laughting, smiling, chuckling and even aww-ing truly from my heart. This meta-humor finally made sense to me. Would recommend for everyone. Still 8/10 is much higher them my expectations.

I always have a great time watching the Deadpool movies and not only was this no exception, this may have been the most fun I've had yet.The way Ryan Reynolds has absolutely perfected his version of Wade/Deadpool is marvelous. Yes, pun intended. Every line, every ounce of the delivery, every twitch and wink and smirk of body language is in the name of comedy and serving this one-of-a-kind not-hero hero. I could watch Deadpool do and say anything and likely find it hilarious.The Easter eggs and surprises and reveals in this movie were next level. I am not going to say anything more than just expect the unexpected. Wolverine is the tip of the iceberg.Was the plotline the best executed? Not really. Choppy and a bit muddled in parts. But the rest of the movie makes up for anything the storyline may lack. You can still thoroughly enjoy this movie, even through some plot holes or head scratching moments. That's a testament to the character Ryan has built and the effort put into giving the audience a great fan experience.

Now up there as one of my favourite films ever, this was a superhero geeks nostalgic fantasy come true.And the opening scene, pure class, no spoilers here, but it really is Deadpool at his finest, bravo team Deadpool.I was wondering how they were going to incorporate the multiverse into this film, and in my honest opinion they nailed it.An action packed, adrenaline thrill ride from start to finish, and the pairing of Reynolds & Jackman is a marriage made in heaven.Ohhhhh and High Jackman is jacked in this, fair play Wolverine.As if you couldnt love Reynolds anymore, they pull together this masterpeice.

First off, I am not a superhero movie fan. My kids can talk for days about the Marvel universe, and I struggle to pay attention. They begged me to give this one a chance, and I'm so glad I did.I laughed through the whole thing. Even the fighting scenes, when I usually get bored, kept me entertained. The use of fun pop music during the very gory fighting, as well as Reynolds and Jackman's quips, were brilliant.Reynolds was made for playing Deadpool. The constant jokes and chatter, with the occasional sentimental moment, gives the impression that you're basically watching him be himself, with a superhero suit and powers. He's very natural and funny as always.This really solidified to me that Hugh Jackman can do anything. I've been a fan of his since he was a very young Curly in Oklahoma! He played the perfect straight man to Reynolds's goofiness.The inside jokes got me more than anyone in the theater when we watched it.I'd recommend this movie to everyone. If I can enjoy it, as a superhero hater, anyone can.

I dont normally write reviews but for this movie i felt like i had to. I thought deadpool was dying and never was impressed by the wolverine/fantastic 4 movies but this is all of the best qualities of both of those franchises. Definitely the funniest marvel movie and maybe one of the best marvel movies of all time. I cant tell you the last time i laughed that hard at any movie in general, much less a new marvel movie. With marvel on a serious decline, this might be what marvel/disney needed to take back off. Deadpool and wolverine is definitely a must see and easily one of the best releases this year.

This movie was so well done and amazing, really loved all the jokes that Deadpool did about some other shows and movies. It was super entertaining from the very first minute to the credits. I really liked it, the chemistry between the whole cast on screen was extremely interesting and good. I found the movie a little rushed though, but it's not a big of a deal, the comedy kept it really fresh and surprisingly funny. Anyways, go watch it, it's not a waste money, you will laugh a lot and you will be surprised by the chemistry of Deadpool and Wolverine! I really liked the interviews that Ryan and Hugh did after the movie too, they have that friendship and support even off screen and that's just good!

I don't think we got enough of Deadpool and Wolverine, the movie should have been much longer. I could stayed for 24 hours straight just watching Deadpool and Wolverine fight with each other and with each other, and I wouldn't have been bored for a minute.So many old and new characters, so much nostalgia, and so many jokes my stomach still hurts! It was such an amazing movie to watch, and once again it didn't disappoint. Deadpool is indeed keeping the MCU alive, and the way it featured the multiverse, was simply great!I think Disney should keep Deadpool as it is, an original masterpiece with plenty of jokes and the best marketing that ever existed. I would absolutely rewatch the movie when it comes out on Blu-Ray, and I would also love to see Deadpool and Spider-Man in the near future.

From the opening mayhem and dancing begins, this third installment gains speed and traction as it hurtles through cameo after cameo, Easter egg after Easter egg.Written, directed and performed with gusto.Basically if you liked the other two, then this is more of the same, bloody, foul language and laughs.This film will save the whole Marvel franchise and with luck push it in the right direction.The third installment is usually tricky, not many franchises produce a decent third film (Spiderman, alien, the godfather etc)This does it with ease, although not necessary to see the others to understand this, they're fun and deserve seeing.

Will immediately start by saying that this is one of the most useless movies ever produced, it's not supposed to have an oscar worthy story/plot or whatever, but there's really no reason for this to exist except the fact of putting Logan & Wade side by side...and that's it, there's no plot, no purpose, no nothing. After "Logan" it's truly difficult to watch marvel movies since they're all inferior to that one. Wade is supposed to be a comic relief, but here everyone is a damn comic relief character, well except for Jackman, he's always great in this role. It was good to see him wear the costume. All of the cameos are absolutely useless and out of place, 0 momentum (except for Blade/Gambit, those were actually cool) the whole TVA thing is absolutely childish and ridiculous, just an excuse to do whatever they want with this universe. The movie is entertaining and funny nonetheless, it is well done from a technical point of view, but except from that.... there's truly nothing to see in this, and this comes from a guy who absolutely loves both Deadpool & Wolverine, but this is a cashgrab guys, nothing else!!! PS. The villain is totally forgettable.

I realize that they have been in a movie before, depicting the same characters, though with Deadpool he was sort of the same character. Now, however, we get to see the highly comedic version with Wolverine who is still a bit grouchy and do we see some blood spatter. So, it all was great for me as the first Deadpool we got to see how easily a Colossus can be done correctly, in the second how easily a correct Juggernaut can be and in this one, we get to see how easily it is to have Wolverine in the correct outfit! In fact, it was probably the easiest to do. So, I had a good time, have not been to the movies since The Batman and my comic book streak is alive, but I really saw this more for Ryan and Hugh. Did not care for the Marvel cinematic universe, they kind of said they did not need me as a fan anyways, but I still came to see this one because of the wacky comedy, glorious violence and the multiple cameos, so I was not disappointed.So, the story has Deadpool in a bit of a rut as he tries to do something to really shine. He tried to join the Avengers and got shot down and was told by Happy Hogan (who I am sure they wanted Tony Stark for this) to aim lower in life so Wade becomes a very bad car salesman. However, his friends throw him a birthday party that does cheer him up, and then he learns that his universe is about to become extinct. Now he most don the Deadpool costume and find Wolverine, because it was the death of Wolverine in his universe that set its death in motion. Unfortunately, they get sent into The Void, which is like a garbage dump of people run by Charles Xavier's sister who is very eccentric. They must team with other superheroes that were tossed aside and make their way back to Wade's universe before it is destroyed!Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynold's are great together and make this an enjoyable film. The plot is understandable, if not all that important as it is multiverse stuff, and Deadpool himself craps over the multiverse within this movie! Hugh looks great, the guy knows how to look good for his role and it will be nearly impossible to replace him with another actor, as you just associate him with it. Ryan is, of course, very funny and he just does a very good Deadpool. The villain, Nova was good as well, so crazy and kind of cute at the same time. I will not mention the other characters in this, because I do not want to spoil if for anyone, I knew of one, but more than a couple surprised me.So, this was a nice time at the movies. I suffer from severe depression so I literally cannot see films that have really depressing moments and such. This one had some serious scenes here and there, but thankfully Wade is known for his mouth so it pulls everything back into the light very quickly. My mother went with me to see this and even she really enjoyed it, she especially liked Dogpool....

We watched the first 2 Deadpool's, and the Wolverine spin off movies to get ready ... we loved watching them to get ourselves ready!!I'm going to cover allot in this so get ready ... we enjoyed it and laughed allot. The adult innuendo references were hilarious especially if you expect to hear it and see it. Ryan REYNOLDS was perfect as Deadpool. Sarcastic, smart ass, perverted and flat out doesn't give a darn about what he says or does. Cause he's so warped. He says everything that we're thinking but don't have the courage to say. Especially his talking to the audience. Loved his character. Wolverine/Logan was extremely excellent. I loved his angry, drunken and aggressive personality, like he didn't want to be bothered so his anger would get the best of him.I love the marvel comic series and the picture series. BUT I will admit once the whole multiverse storyline gets into play that's when it gets confusing. Blending in all these wolverines and all these avenger characters into the X-men universe wasn't necessary. They shouldn't really blend in the two universes. Just like when they blended Alien and Predator. Now if they made a spin off movie, completely having nothing to do with the original story lines or not even effecting the storyline. If they did that, I would make a X-men vs Avengers movie, at least a 2hrs and 45 min movie. Then have them team up and face the main bad guy. That'll be worth it. But we do love the joke references to the marvel universe and to the movie industry. Also the avenger references were hilarious. Deadpool can really get under your skin. Lol. Gambit character was unnecessary being portrayed by Channing Tatum. It definitely wasn't a good fit for him. He was better in 21 jump street. Besides WASNT Gambit supposed to get his own film??Action sequences were 200% on point. The CG sequences were very on point. This movie was along time coming and expected. It was worth the wait. 10/10. The action sequences of Deadpool vs Wolverine was excellent. I already knew Wolverine was going to kick Deadpool's ass.

If you enjoyed the previous Deadpool movies and Fox's X-Men movies then you will enjoy this film. (if you don't like the direction that Disney/Marvel/Star Wars has gone the past few years then you will LOVE this film.This is honestly the first film that has made me excited for the cinema since the UK Covid lockdowns. With flop after flop from Disney/Marvel/Star Wars I was sure that I would never return to the cinema and on hearing about this movie (with no trailers or spoilers at all) I decided to give it a go and I was not disappointed. This films story is far from perfect but the entertaining experience of watching it, more than makes up for it's failings. My hope is that this movie makes a shed load of cash for everyone involved and the big-wigs at Disney finally understand that the majority of their paying customer base do not want to sit through pointless pandering, race/gender swapping, diversity for the sake of diversity and rehashing of old stories. Just make an entertaining film (if you build it, they will come). All hail Marvel Jesus.

This movie is a treat for both comic book enthusiasts and general moviegoers alike. It brilliantly honors both Deadpool, the "merc with the mouth," and Wolverine, with their signature personalities shining throughout. The theater was filled with laughter from start to finish. Iconic Marvel characters make memorable appearances, paying homage to the legends that laid the foundation for the MCU. The action sequences are top-notch, supported by stunning cinematography. The humor is vulgar and hilarious-exactly what Deadpool fans have come to love. Every character gets their moment to shine, and the portrayal of the different variants of Deadpool and Wolverine is not only faithful to the comics but also visually fantastic. This is a must-watch for any Marvel fan, and I highly recommend it.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a good product born of the cyclical and cynical nature of modern Hollywood: it mocks the crap out of 20th Century Fox in a satisfying manner and also riffs on the overdrive of craziness that is the multiverse trope in superhero movies since Spider-Verse. And Ryan Reynolds knows fully well he can do whatever the heck he feels like doing because Deadpool is THAT self-aware and refreshing a character who doesn't spare anyone the mercy of mockery.The MCU is certainly in need of some creative revitalising and the film runs with that too; it does this and reveres the Fox-era X-Men films against a narrative backdrop that ACTUALLY does justice to the whole 'vs' concept of a crossover film where two icons fight to the 'death'. Deadpool & Wolverine works because it does what films like Batman v Superman and the Alien vs Predator films failed to realise: being uncomplicated upfront FUN, playing to the strengths of their characters.Deadpool & Wolverine is simply good fun at the movies, and it's what the MCU needs instead of being a constant barrage of sequel-bait material. Yes we like sequels, but they still have to be earned all the same.Deadpool & Wolverine gets 4/5 stars. 8/10 IMDbs. It's the kind of self-contained fun movies strive to be. Hopefully it'll show others how these crossovers are done.

I've never rated or reviewed any movie but this is an exception this movie does an amazing job of paying tribute to the late and early "20th century Fox's" Marvel, while also being a funny Deadpool movie with a splash of mad max. The best Disney movie since "Endgame" without question. It does a good job at pacing and setting up the story, while helping us understand what's at stake, the character development of our cast, and the journey will be going on for the rest of the movie. The villain is actually someone interesting, and without saying too much I think a lot of people will be happy with the ending of the movie I feel as if it may be a blessing or a curse. I know one thing though Hugh Jackman will be wolverine until he's 90.

I feel that in the world recently, there hasn't really been a good movie, for a good while, since Endgame, one that gives you that tingle, one that makes you get goosebumps, one that makes you laugh till your throat hurts, since seeing it, all I can think about is it! Literally surpasses the previous deadpools, I wish there could be an extended version released, I could have watched this story line, and these characters for hours! This movie has definitely revived the franchise and I hope that bringing back the past as amazingly as they have in this movie, is a sign of amazing futures, there is one question that everyone needs answered though... why was Thor crying...?

SO MUCH FUN!!!!!! Can't rave enough!!!!!Perfect balance of fun, wit, blood and guts, and the phenomenal amount of Easter eggs/Cameos...... *chefs kiss*Perfect love letter to Deadpool and Wolverine fans. The bromance Hugh and Ryan share is inspirational and it shines through onto the big screen. One minute your laughing, next minute gasping and then crying! Walked out of the cinema wanting to watch it again straight away!I honestly cant fault this movie. Love that it doesnt take itself too seriously and you can see that thisnwas made for fans by fans themselvesSo worth the money and I truly can't wait till its out on Disney + so I can watch it again!!!!!!!!!!

Deadpool is a refreshing reminder that sometimes, you just can't trust the critics. This film is the perfect blend of action, comedy, and unapologetic irreverence, delivering exactly what it promises and more. From the very first scene, it's clear that this isn't your typical superhero movie. The film masterfully combines outrageous action sequences with a relentless barrage of crude humor, all of which is brilliantly executed to keep you entertained from start to finish.The humor is sharp, witty, and often hilariously inappropriate, making Deadpool a standout in a genre that often plays it safe. Ryan Reynolds is perfectly cast as the wisecracking anti-hero, bringing the character to life with a mix of charm, sarcasm, and just the right amount of insanity. His performance is both hilarious and surprisingly heartfelt, adding depth to a character who could have easily been one-dimensional.One of the film's most entertaining aspects is its use of ironic music during the action scenes. The juxtaposition of violent, high-octane sequences with upbeat, often cheesy songs creates a unique and memorable experience that sets Deadpool apart from other action comedies.
