It's a brilliant touch that adds to the film's overall tone of playful chaos.If you've ever been a 13-year-old boy-or if you just enjoy a good dose of raunchy humor-you'll love this movie. Deadpool isn't afraid to push boundaries, break the fourth wall, and poke fun at the superhero genre itself. It's a wild, irreverent ride that doesn't take itself too seriously, but still delivers plenty of heart amid the mayhem. Whether you're a fan of the comics or just looking for a good laugh, Deadpool is a must-see. It's pure, unfiltered entertainment at its best.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" is a cinematic masterpiece that seamlessly blends action, humor, and emotional depth. Directed by a visionary filmmaker, this film marks a significant milestone in the superhero genre. Featuring Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool and Hugh Jackman reprising his iconic role as Wolverine, the movie offers an exhilarating experience that keeps the audience engaged from start to finish.The storyline of "Deadpool and Wolverine" is compelling, intricate, and beautifully executed. It centers on saving a universe inside the multi-universe, forcing Deadpool and Wolverine to join forces. Despite their contrasting personalities and methods, their dynamic partnership becomes the crux of the narrative. The plot delves into themes of redemption, camaraderie, and sacrifice, weaving a tale that resonates on multiple levels. The emotional depth of the story is enhanced by the character development, particularly for Wolverine, whose journey from a lone wolf to a team player is both poignant and satisfying.One of the most striking aspects of the film is the fight choreography. The action sequences are nothing short of spectacular, showcasing the unique combat styles of both Deadpool and Wolverine. Deadpool's acrobatic, frenetic fighting contrasts perfectly with Wolverine's brutal, no-nonsense approach. These scenes are meticulously crafted, with each punch, kick, and slash delivering a visceral impact. The choreography is complemented by stunning visual effects, making the battles not only believable but also incredibly thrilling.Humor is a cornerstone of "Deadpool and Wolverine," and the film does not disappoint. Deadpool's trademark wit and sarcasm are ever-present, providing a steady stream of laugh-out-loud moments. His constant breaking of the fourth wall is masterfully done, creating a unique viewing experience that feels both intimate and inclusive. The jokes are sharp, timely, and often self-referential, poking fun at superhero tropes and even the actors themselves. This meta-humor adds an extra layer of enjoyment, making the film a joy to watch.The interplay between Deadpool and Wolverine is particularly noteworthy. Their banter is filled with playful insults and begrudging respect, capturing the essence of their complicated relationship. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have an undeniable chemistry that brings their characters to life in a way that feels authentic and engaging. Their interactions are a perfect blend of humor and heart, highlighting their differences while also emphasizing their underlying bond."Deadpool and Wolverine" also pays homage to the legacy of Wolverine/Logan. The film treats his character with the reverence and respect he deserves, acknowledging his past struggles and triumphs. Hugh Jackman delivers a performance that is both powerful and nuanced, reminding audiences why Wolverine is one of the most beloved characters in the X-Men universe. His journey in the film is deeply emotional, culminating in moments that are sure to tug at the heartstrings of longtime fans.Cameos are another highlight of the movie. The film features a plethora of surprise appearances from various characters in the Marvel universe, adding an extra layer of excitement and fan service. These cameos are well-integrated into the story, enhancing the narrative without overshadowing the main plot. Each appearance is a delightful nod to the broader Marvel lore, making the film feel like a true celebration of the franchise.Hugh Jackman's physical transformation in "Deadpool and Wolverine" is nothing short of spectacular, with his impressive abs stealing several scenes throughout the film. These moments not only underscore Wolverine's strength and resilience but also showcase Jackman's unwavering dedication to the role. Additionally, for the female audience, Jackman's remarkable chiseled abs provide an extra layer of visual enjoyment, enhancing the overall appeal of the movie.Also the film's music selection, especially in the opening scene and during fight sequences, is exceptional, enhancing the (funny) mood and elevating the action to new heights.The end credits scene is a stroke of genius, leaving the audience in stitches.In conclusion, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is a phenomenal film that excels in every aspect. It delivers breathtaking action, a compelling story, and a perfect balance of humor and heart. The film stands as a tribute to Wolverine's legacy while also carving out its own unique place in the superhero genre. With stellar performances, especially from Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, and a slew of exciting cameos, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is a must-watch for any Marvel fan. It's a film that entertains, moves, and leaves a lasting impression.

I really don't have much bad to say about this movie. It was everything I hoped for and then some. Without spoiling much I'll just say it is everything fans wanted for the past 25 years in a nutshell down to the last drop. The jokes hit hard, the chemistry between Jackman and Reynolds was stellar and the surprise cameos and action sequences in between and during the plot were highly memorable. I walked out of the theater quoting so many damn lines that were stated and that to me is a staple of a great movie. If I can retain several parts or more of the film well after I watch the credits roll, then you're a true keeper. I guess if I had to dig deep and find anything really lacking in the movie it would be that they really didn't have a big bad villain, albeit traded a big baddy for a more nuanced and vaguely familiar one. Overall, if there was a good, solid theme for this 3rd installment of the Deadpool series I'd say it would be in that it was a nice send off and farewell to the past 25 years of 20th Century Fox Marvel movies and one hell of a Fox homage that I was happy to take part of and show up for with bells on.

Disney did a good thing in taking over this franchise. Go Ryan Reynolds And Hugh Jackman. Please make another before I die. Thanks.

Let me start by saying the previous two Deadpools I thoroughly enjoyed. I even watched them multiple times at home after they were released. Deadpool And Wolverine starts off like the other two Deadpool films. It is funny/over the top and felt like a welcomed return to the character.As soon as the TVA captures Deadpool and Mr. Paradox played by Matthew Macfayden explains how Deadpool's world will be no more, things took a turn for the worst.The only logical reason I can see for Hugh Jackman to return as The Wolverine after dying in Logan is pretty obvious. Money. It truly hurt too see them ressurect his character after the perfect ending he had in Logan (Which is easily the best Marvel film to date).Then there are the endless cameos because nostalgia! It gets old FAST! The fact that Marvel has too rely on cameos to make the film work shows they are desperate and have run out of ideas.From the lackluster script to okay fight scenes nothing really works because the film as a whole is very hollow. I did not care about any of these characters and the whole entire premise of the film (there wasn't one) felt pointless.I will say the cgi was surprisingly well done and all the actors did the best with what they were given. I do understand why a lot of diehard fans love this film but other then nostalgia and Disney/Fox jokes it is just another superhero cash grab.The idea that anybody is rating this over 4 stars is completely insane but I am not a Marvel fan boy. There were multiple moments where I wanted to just get up and leave but it was a family outing.If you are on the fence about seeing this film because of the high rating please don't make the mistake I did. Just wait for it to be on Disney Plus or better yet don't watch it at all.

One of the most striking aspects of "Deadpool x Wolverine" is how it masterfully balances humor and violence, something that has become a signature of both characters. Deadpool, played once again by Ryan Reynolds, brings his usual brand of sarcastic, meta-referential humor, breaking the fourth wall at every opportunity. His jokes are sharper than ever, and the film is filled with moments where the audience can't help but laugh out loud, even in the midst of a serious situation. On the other hand, Hugh Jackman's Wolverine provides the perfect counterbalance. Wolverine is as brooding and intense as ever, bringing a sense of gravitas that grounds the film amidst the chaos. His violent, no-nonsense approach to problem-solving is as brutal as we've come to expect, and the contrast between his character and Deadpool creates a dynamic that is both entertaining and surprisingly heartfelt.

This movie will be the funnest movie of 2024; an educated wish. Deadpool's peaceful existence comes crashing down when the Time Variance Authority recruits him to help safeguard the multiverse. He soon unites with his would-be pal, Wolverine, to complete the mission and save his world from an existential threat.I laughed, laughed, and then laughed even more. Truly one of the most fun movies I've seen lately. The film is packed with jokes; not a minute goes by without a hilarious punchline. The frequent breaking of the fourth wall, with numerous jokes targeting Marvel and the shift from Fox, is absolutely hilarious. The unexpected cameos are a real treat, adding to the excitement and keeping the audience on their toes. The fight scenes are thrilling, filled with intense action and cool moves that keep you on the edge of your seat.Both leads, Ryan Reynolds (as Deadpool) and Hugh Jackman (as Wolverine), delivered great performances. They were born for these roles and shared some great chemistry between them. The movie definitely lacks a strong story but that's not what you would look for in a Deadpool film.Overall, this movie is a perfect blend of comedy and action, making it a must-watch for anyone, especially Marvel fans who would understand all the jokes. Whether you're a long-time Marvel fan or have never seen any film before, you're in for a wild, laugh-out-loud rideScore:8/10.

I went into *Deadpool & Wolverine* hoping for an exciting, action-packed movie, but what I got instead was a confusing, boring mess that I can barely even call a story. The storyline made absolutely no sense from beginning to end. It felt like they were trying to cram in as many characters and scenes as possible without any thought to how they all fit together. Well known characters were thrown in for no apparent reason, and even though they're great characters, their presence did nothing to improve the film. It's like they were just there to say, "Hey, look! More superheroes!" But in the end, it added nothing to the experience.There was absolutely no suspense at any point. The plot was so predictable that I found myself completely disengaged. I was there with my two sisters, and they're not as involved in the Marvel universe as I am, so they laughed two or three times, but I've literally watched everything Marvel has put out, and I knew this movie was trash. If I had gone alone, I would've left early on because, honestly, I was BORED, and I'm not easily bored. Deadpool yapped so much throughout the movie that it became unbearable. I get that Deadpool is supposed to be talkative and witty, but in this film, it was overdone to the point of being obnoxious.The fighting scenes were another huge letdown. They were repetitive and lacked any real excitement. Since both Deadpool and Wolverine are practically immortal, the stakes were nonexistent. Watching two characters who can't die just punch each other over and over again is about as thrilling as watching paint dry. There was no tension, no sense of danger, just the same boring, drawn-out fights that didn't even look good.In the end, the movie was a complete waste of time. The storyline was incoherent, the characters were misused, and the action was dull and repetitive. Even with all these popular characters, the movie somehow managed to be one of the most boring superhero films I've ever seen.

This movie is everything you'd expect from The Trio Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman, and Shawn Levy. It is a beautiful story that keeps you smiling through and through, I'll admit I wanted to cry because of the friendship the brotherhood of Deadpool and Wolverine. The cameos as well was just as shocking and made me fanboy as they made their appearance. The big bads are just as evil as they come but Emma playing as Cassandra was very shivering her performance it was. Overall this is what a superhero movie looks like and I hope that they continue it because Deadpool and Wolverine is the best MCU movie since Avengers:Endgame hands downs, Stan Lee would be proud.

Deadpool & Wolverine is the most anticipated movie of the summer and it certainly plays up to the hype.I haven't laughed so hard and enjoyed a movie as much as I did while watching this. It is absolutely a great third movie of the Deadpool franchise and I would also say that it is the best of the three movies.Before watching this movie I told myself that I wouldn't beat the first Deadpool movie. But oh boy I was wrong.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds (Deadpool) & Hugh Jackman (Wolverine/Logan) is 110% noticeable through the whole movie. It fits perfectly with how the movie wants to tell a story.I was very skeptical on the whole: "Bringing Wolverine back from the dead" idea, but I did enjoy the way they brought him back since his death during the "Logan" movie.The energy and comedy is still very good just like its two earlier movies.The soundtracks is incredible just like the earlier ones and it just takes the energy of the movie up and gets the crowd going.If you're a person that loves cameos than this movie is 100% for you. There's so many characters and names that will surprise you and make you get excited for the next one. (I recommend watching the credits to see the official names).I'm a huge fan of Deadpool and this movie made the long wait worth it for a sequel. This movie will totally win at the box office (as it already has).But is this movie "the Marvel comeback" movie? I will say... Maybe... This movie will do great at the box office, but it isn't a straight up movie I would say directly tells you that the future movies/shows from Marvel will all be great. We've seen the trend of "one good movie/show and then a bad movie/show" the last couple of years. But I have hope for the future... Cough cough* RDJ is back!I had a blast while watching this movie. It has one of the best opening sequences I have ever seen, great chemistry between actors and a fine set of comedic lines that are funny... But it is in typical Deadpool fashion. Definitely a top 5 of best movies this year!

Deadpool x Wolverine" is the kind of film that fans of both characters have been eagerly awaiting, and it delivers on almost every front. Combining Deadpool's irreverent humor with Wolverine's raw, gritty intensity, this movie is a rollercoaster of action, laughs, and surprisingly deep moments that explore the complex personalities of these two iconic Marvel characters. Deadpool x Wolverine" is the kind of film that fans of both characters have been eagerly awaiting, and it delivers on almost every front. Combining Deadpool's irreverent humor with Wolverine's raw, gritty intensity, this movie is a rollercoaster of action, laughs, and surprisingly deep moments that explore the complex personalities of these two iconic Marvel characters.

First time I've ever been to the cinema and actually thoroughly enjoyed the film. A ten out of ten may be biased but it really appealed to me, whilst I can understand why others might enjoy some parts. It's also the first time I've been to watch a film where I've heard the audience actually laugh at the jokes, and the music was absolutely perfectly timed in every scene used. Ryan Reynolds was fantastic again as everyone's favourite anti-hero whilst Hugh Jackmans role ensured that Logan's memory wasn't tarnished. Have to say this is the first marvel movie I've enjoyed for a long long time. Films like this appeal to most people who are fans of the characters involved as the writing is excellent. Again I must reiterate in my opinion a 10/10 film.

It was great to see Deadpool's character in such an out of box movie. Right from the word go we enjoy this character so much. Teaming Deadpool with Wolverine must be one of the craziest team ups. I think their team was more like a old goofy couple who love each other so much that they don't mind pushing a sword into each other's hearts.This movie was more of a X men typo which is not a bad thing. It really serves a welcome for the mutants in a rather not stunning way but a decent manner. The Cameos makes it up very wicked and interesting. C'mmon you should have got saber tooth to fight wolverine a little more. Meta jokes by Deadpool is truly a delight. " Disney bought him and they are going to make him do it until he's 90." What was the dude really thinking? I mean it's so lit and nice to watch such things from Marvel. This is Marvel's proper Redemption from thin air. They are Back into the game.Ryan Reynold and Hugh Jackman are truly brilliant. Hugh we love regardless of whatever happens to Logan. Just be there for Deadpool and U both will be great.Shawn Levy great fan of your work u've done for this film. Hope to see more good stuff.Thankyou for whosesoever made it this far!! Cheers!!

If you had any chance of truly liking this movie, you needed to stay off of social media. (Yeah, Right!) The hype was just in your face everywhere you turned. I myself don't have Facebook, Instagram, Twitter (X) and all of the rest, and I still got my fair share of information overload. Now the movie was very good in a lot of ways. Introductions and visits from old friends, the action, chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine, and Channing Tatum finely getting his wish to be Gambit, and a fine Gambit he was. There were a few things I thought could have been played out better, but it wasn't enough to make the movie bad by any means. It was really fun to watch, I just thought there was going to be more of an origin story of how the multi-verse actually worked its magic to bring together how the FF was going to be introduced, and if this is supposed to be Hugh's last round of Wolverine bingo, they probably should have let him sacrifice himself to the timeline. Anyway, it is definately worth the watch. Don't miss it. Deadpoll is at his best!

I've read several of the reviews and I know that most people loved this movie. I'm one of the few who didn't. Is it funny? Yes... mostly. Some of the comedy is over the top for me. Almost like the movie Airplane (1980). I was not expecting that type of comedy.I'm not saying that I hated it outright, but for some reason it wasn't quite what I was expecting, but I can't say for certain what I was really expecting. I did laugh at some of the jokes, and I enjoyed most of the cameos in it. A few of the characters they brought back, I was happy to see.However, I don't think the story really worked and the villain was "Meh..." to me. All in all, a couple of jokes Deadpool said about the MCU, I agreed with.

The Marvel universe has long been a treasure trove of iconic superheroes and memorable narratives, with Deadpool and Wolverine standing out as two of its most beloved characters. The idea of bringing these two fan-favorites together in a movie has been a tantalizing prospect for fans, one that promises a blend of humor, action, and emotional depth. The announced collaboration in the upcoming Marvel movie "Deadpool 3" aims to do just that, merging the irreverent, fourth-wall-breaking antics of Deadpool with the gritty, stoic presence of Wolverine.**Deadpool: The Merc with a Mouth**Deadpool, also known as Wade Wilson, is one of Marvel's most unique characters. Created by Fabian Nicieza and Rob Liefeld, Deadpool made his first appearance in "The New Mutants" #98 in 1991. Known for his sarcastic wit, dark humor, and tendency to break the fourth wall, Deadpool quickly became a fan favorite. Ryan Reynolds' portrayal of the character in the 2016 film "Deadpool" and its 2018 sequel cemented Deadpool's status in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). These films were a breath of fresh air, blending hyper-violence with sharp comedy and an irreverent take on superhero tropes.**Wolverine: The Lone Wolf**Wolverine, or Logan, is another cornerstone of the Marvel universe. Created by Roy Thomas, Len Wein, and John Romita Sr., Wolverine first appeared in "The Incredible Hulk" #180 in 1974. With his adamantium claws, incredible healing factor, and a troubled past, Wolverine is both a fierce warrior and a deeply complex character. Hugh Jackman's portrayal of Wolverine in the X-Men film series from 2000 to 2017 became iconic, with his performance in "Logan" (2017) being particularly lauded for its emotional depth and raw portrayal of a hero past his prime.**The Anticipation of Deadpool 3**The news that Hugh Jackman would reprise his role as Wolverine alongside Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool in "Deadpool 3" has generated considerable excitement. This film marks a significant moment as it brings together two characters who, while existing in the same universe, have had very different cinematic journeys. Jackman's Wolverine, with his intense and often somber demeanor, will provide a fascinating counterbalance to Reynolds' wisecracking Deadpool.The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine promises to be electric. In the comics, the two characters have a complicated relationship, often clashing due to their differing philosophies and methods but ultimately sharing a mutual respect. This film has the potential to explore that dynamic in new and intriguing ways, blending humor, action, and character development. Fans are particularly eager to see how Deadpool's irreverence will play off Wolverine's seriousness, likely leading to a mix of comedic and dramatic moments.**Challenges and Expectations**One of the main challenges facing "Deadpool 3" is balancing the tone between the two characters. Deadpool's previous films are known for their R-rated humor and violence, while Wolverine's movies, especially "Logan," have a more serious, even somber tone. Finding the right balance between these two styles will be crucial to the film's success.Moreover, integrating Deadpool and Wolverine into the broader MCU presents another set of challenges. Deadpool's meta-commentary and awareness of the superhero genre could provide a fresh perspective on the MCU, but it needs to be handled carefully to maintain coherence within the established universe. Similarly, Wolverine's character arc and history need to be respected, especially considering the emotional weight of "Logan," which was originally intended to be Jackman's final outing as the character.**Conclusion**"Deadpool 3" represents a unique opportunity to bring together two of Marvel's most beloved characters in a way that honors their individual legacies while creating something new and exciting. The film has the potential to deliver on the action and humor that fans expect while exploring deeper themes of identity, legacy, and redemption. With Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman at the helm, audiences can look forward to a movie that not only entertains but also resonates on a deeper emotional level. The anticipation for this crossover is a testament to the enduring appeal of both Deadpool and Wolverine, and their combined presence is sure to make "Deadpool 3" a standout entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a cinematic thrill ride that perfectly blends irreverent humor, intense action, and the kind of fan service that Marvel lovers crave. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman reprise their iconic roles with unmatched chemistry, delivering a non-stop barrage of witty banter and spectacular fight scenes that keep the energy high throughout the film. The plot, while simple, is a love letter to fans, packed with fourth-wall breaks, meta-jokes, and unexpected cameos that will leave you grinning from ear to ear. The film doesn't shy away from the chaotic, over-the-top nature that both characters embody, but it balances the madness with moments of genuine emotion, especially in the evolving dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine.Visually, the film is a feast, with slick choreography and special effects that bring their violent escapades to life in vivid detail. The action sequences are as brutal as they are inventive, reflecting the unhinged nature of the duo. Despite a few pacing issues and some gags that push the limits of absurdity, the film manages to stay on track, thanks largely to the charisma of its leads.Overall, "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a wildly entertaining film that knows exactly what it is and embraces it wholeheartedly. It's a movie that doesn't take itself too seriously, which is precisely why it works so well. Whether you're in it for the action, the laughs, or the sheer joy of seeing these two characters together, it delivers on all fronts, earning a well-deserved 9/10.

So rare to go expecting a good time and be surprised... by a truly amazing film! The last time I was this surprised by a film was Top Gun: Maverick. From start to finish, it played with real emotions while still delivering laughs and insane action sequences. The chemistry between the leads was undeniable and it flew by, leaving you wanting more.Next film, give us more Blind Al and Vanessa! The only thing that even slightly disappointed was that we didn't get enough of some of the other characters in the Deadpool universe because the story needed to take time away from them. Overall, though, I can't say enough about this absolutely fantastic film. A+++.

It's really great, there are so many fine details, everything is very well thought out. And Marvel really likes to leave permanent marks on people's minds, so I'm looking forward to the next movies. Stop whatever you are doing and watch this and the previous series immediately. And I especially loved the introduction. Deadpool will always be my favorite character in my heart, but everyone can be or will be a hero. Everyone is the hero of their life. Stay safe and by the way, how much.

Today I had the pleasure of watching this new Marvel blockbuster, and I must say it was a thrilling experience! The film brilliantly combines a tribute to the 20th Century Fox SuperHeroes films with a New Year's Eve conference, where the MCU is hilariously parodied. While it may not reach the epic heights of Infinity War and EndGame, it undoubtedly stands as the best Deadpool installment to date. The witty humor and dynamic action make for a delightful viewing experience. This film serves as a delightful appetizer, paving the way for the Russo Brothers to bring their expertise to the table.It's not a perfect 10 or even a 9, but a solid 8 for this entertaining popcorn team-up. The blend of humor, action, and nostalgia hits the right notes, making it a must-watch for any Marvel fan.

This movie is a breath of fresh air compared to recent films. It abandons political correctness to showcase an R-rated film filled with action and comedy. No disrespect to Marvel or She-Hulk, but the success of this movie and series like The Boys demonstrates that the audience craves action and comedy combined, without censorship of language or imagery. The film almost gets lost in the plot but manages to end at the right moment to avoid becoming overly long. Maybe a better vilain could help too. But, anyway, we need more films or series like that, with action and comedy and without censorship.

I had very high expectations for this movie and definitely was not disappointed. 3rd episodes are traditionally problematic, but this was a triumph. It was legitimately hilarious throughout. I was constantly chuckling at the irreverence, the broken 4th wall, over-the-top action, and what must have been a tonne of raucous improvisation.At the same time, the film managed to be sentimental for fans of the superhero genre over the last 3 decades. That could easily have been sickeningly cloy, but I felt they got the balance just right. It was a pleasure to see the myriad cameos of beloved past characters.If you enjoyed the first two Deadpool movies, then you'll love this offering. I can sincerely say I had a wide grin across my face from start to finish.

Deadpool and Wolverine is a crowd-pleasing superhero movie that is a love letter to fans of Marvel, comedy, and pop culture.The heart of the film is the relationship of the title characters which is perfectly captured by the real-life bromance of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman. Their chemistry is amazing no matter what situation they're in.People initially skeptical of Disney watering down the mature rating of Deadpool have nothing to worry about as the humor and violence are arguably at their best here. The constant roasting of the mismanagement of the MCU and X-Men never gets old along with the rest of the Deadpool humor. The absurd amount of cameos and references also rewards longtime fans; More casual moviegoers will feel less of an impact by these moments or even be confused at times.For me, the weakest parts of the movie are the middle-of-the-road villains and the relationship between Wade Wilson and Vanessa. Both were just there and didn't seem fully fleshed out along with the setting of a good portion of the movie that I won't spoil here. As far as the structure of the story goes there wasn't much to it for better or for worse. On one hand, we get a lot of Deadpool and Wolverine hijinx but on the other hand, I was hoping for more hints about the future of the characters and MCU due to the inclusion of the multiverse, TVA, and Disney's acquisition of 20th Century Studios.Deadpool and Wolverine however is an insanely wild ride that's created by filmmakers who are passionate about the characters for fans of the Marvel Universe. Many thought a team-up like this would never happen so seeing everything come to fruition was extremely satisfying.

This is a great movie, but unlike most great action movies, there are zero slow and boring parts. The plot was quick-paced all along, and every bit of time was filled with some sort of action, plot advancement, or witty banter, or all three of those.The witty dialogues and monologues were packed with more meta-humor on Deadpool's part than a Mel Brooks film, similarly to the first two Deadpool movies only ramped up a notch. Besides merely referencing aspects of the movie production itself or making teasing meta-level observations of transpiring events, some of the meta-humor in the film was meta in the sense of being meta-level teasing of particular characters' actions, words, intentions, choices or character, which satisfyingly serves to provide instant karmic enlightenment by the given character regarding their own follies, rather than their tropes remaining on a comparatively boring, unevaluated level like with most movies. Or at least we can imagine it did that; they didn't outwardly express the emotional or mental impact of the teasings much.The general dialogue of the movie was thick with frequent rapid-fire creative banter, primarily by Deadpool but not exclusively, which made the movie very entertaining. If there was any flaw with the creative banter, it was that it was rather hard to imagine Deadpool likely having the wit to come up with it all so quickly and on such a regular basis, thus making it seem a little unreal and perhaps serving to take one out of the movie.You'd think something like that taking one out of the movie would be the least concern with all the fourth-wall breaking going on, but the fourth-wall breaking really blends in with the movie well. It doesn't seem to detract from the immersion at all.One great thing about this movie is that it borrowed fun elements from various other movies, or at least two: there was a Furiosa: Mad Max Saga-esque world, and a bad lady had stolen Dr. Strange's Sling Ring and made use of it. It also includes the story element of the multiverse with the Time Variance Authority from previous Marvel movies.Some aspects of this movie's plot were satisfyingly and unexpectedly deep, and while Ryan Reynolds' acting could be considered flawless, what really impressed me about this movie was Hugh Jackman's acting ability. I thought while watching the movie that he should get a freakin' Oscar for it. This movie really brings out his acting skills more than any previous Marvel movie.Regarding the quick plot development mentioned above, the one drawback to this was that, while the reason for the resurrection of Wolverine was introduced early on and expeditiously, it seemed to be rather shallow and contrived: it seemed to involve the luck and convenience of a deus ex machina.Overall, this movie was very fun and satisfying. One thing that made it fun was its levity-which, by the way, included playing upbeat songs like Madonna's 'Like a Prayer,' and a particularly rich remix of it, during massive fight scenes. And speaking of the music, its end-credits song 'LFG (Theme from "Deadpool & Wolverine") by Rob Simonsen was so good that I fired up Shazam to find out what song it was and saved the name of it in my phone for downloading later, and I'm very picky when it comes to music.I suggest you don't stop watching the credits there, though; sit it out till the end. There's an end-credits scene, and it's actually the funniest part of the movie, at least as far as I and some of the other audience members were concerned.

As an action enthusiast, I found the film to be quite engaging overall. However, I did have some reservations about the excessive use of flashbacks throughout the movie. These frequent flashbacks disrupted the flow of the narrative, making it feel somewhat disjointed, as if I were watching random clips on YouTube rather than a cohesive film. Despite this, the film managed to recapture some of its initial excitement toward the end. On the positive side, the special effects were finely executed, the humor was well-timed, and the cast delivered exceptional performances, contributing to the film's overall appeal.

After a few sub-par projects, Marvel has redeemed itself with a vengeance in Deadpool and Wolverine. From beginning to end, this film was done so well, was so entertaining and incredibly true to form.This movie is obviously a must for any fan of Marvel, but it also solidified Deadpool as one of the greatest franchises of all-time. It is of course not a movie for the faint of heart, far from it, but the chemistry between Reynold and Jackman, as well as the performances from the entire cast, turned a great picture into a fantastic one.If you have the chance to watch it on the big screen you will be in for a treat. Still, I look forward to watching this one again when it is available on the small screen.

I found this to be one of the most painful marvel movies I have ever watched and more like the Ryan Reynolds show.I was amazed that following the film 2 of my family members truly loved it. Now it doesn't lack in action or humour but I thought it was like watching somebody else's take on a Marvel film. I get it it's not supposed to be serious but a lot of the story line I found to be pointless.Watch any other Wolverine film and his humour does not reach the levels met in this film, I felt disappointed that he was lowered to this standard to be honest.Not a film that will get a second look from me as I would usually do with any of the other films within the franchise.

LIKES:Great PaceFunnyStill DeadpoolReferences GaloreActingExcellent SoundtrackSurprising Heart At TimesStory Is Okay At TimesExcellent End CreditsAction Sequences Still Hold That Charm/SkillSummary: If you have seen the Deadpool movies, you know they are about fun, frenzy, and fast-paced antics that the red-clad antihero brings. Teamed up with his X-men "buddy". The pace is just as fierce and fun (if not more) as they go about their quest of handling the MCU/Fox merger and more. The whole thing is loaded with comedy, antics, dialogue, slapstick and more all unleashing the full comedic prowess of Deadpool that is still in your face, but curtailed with the rugged bluntness of Wolverine. Reynolds and his team of writers, alongside Levy's direction, read the Internet, the movie problems, and wrapped the tale into nearly 130 minutes of hilarity I've been missing in superhero movies. They poke fun at everything, willing to cross the lines in true Deadpool fashion to leave this love letter to everyone in that charismatic way. It's loaded to the nines with references to so many aspects of Marvel movies and for fans/geeks like me, I enjoyed finding everything I could from the comics, movies, and more (alongside the jabs that were being thrown with it).Yet, the movie is not just about the comedy and stammering lines Reynolds has proven a master at crafting. Deadpool and Wolverine have still more surprises and mastery to give you more to this film for fans to enjoy. The soundtrack is still incredible, surpassing so many of the other movies not just in variety, but the use of these songs in ways that most would shy away from adding that fresh factor people seem to crave. The movie is eighty percent buddy-hero comedy, yet it still holds some of Marvel sentimentality to give our two guys some heart and depth that serves to ground some of the exploits that marrie an okay story without impeding on the Deadpool schtick. And the action proves with the right amount of planning, studying, and potentially removing some of the "violence" limits, you can create some of the best fight sequences that somehow stand out in the Marvel Universe. Even the end credits have this iconic balance, not elevating the story, but doing something better that plays right to the strengths of our two leads. And while a lot of this is on the writing, direction, and design team, I have to give it to the two leads for giving it their all to make this movie what it is as well. Corrin's billing deserves a nod, playing her role with the same gravitas as another Marvel counterpart, and injecting other elements that make such a fascinating piece to this complex puzzle. Jackman comes back to Wolverine and seems to have not skipped a beat in the rugged antihero ready to claw his way back to the universe. He's a perfect Yin to Ryan's Yang, crafting this straight-to-the-point, concise, no-nonsense attitude that helps to shut the mercenary up when needed. And Reynolds has pretty much never left the character, only this time bringing even more fire to the role as his character has permission to rebel against the very trends the studios conjure up. Together, the two make this dance of dynamic, dastardly, derogative deeds that remained entertaining the whole way through and was a pair-up that I am very happy to have witnessed.DISLIKES:Plot Is Not The StrongestSuper Violet/Aggressive/CrudeSometimes Too StupidMore Time Needed For Some AspectsVery Reference And Other Series HeavySo many Characters That I Wanted More Time/DevelopmentSUMMARY: The film is incredible on many accounts, but there are going to be some things to mention that might be considered warnings/dislikes depending on your personal feelings. For one, the plot is not the strongest. While certainly not the worst thing to be put together/recrafted, the third installment has a tale that tries to be deep, but comes off as weird, inconsistent, and kind of pointless given everything else happening in the universe. Those hoping it's going to give you full-on glimpses into the direction of the coming Marvel Phases, or looking for that respect towards an arc that will blow your mind need to lower the expectations now. In standing on its own, the self-contained tale is enjoyable, but I can also appreciate the desire to get Marvel back on a fun plot that made Phases 1-3 so enjoyable. My friend and I agreed as well that Deadpool's excessiveness can be hard to swallow, and the third installment doesn't buffer much in the ways of violence and crude displays of debauchery. Those with sensitive ears, sensitivity to very vulgar language, and stomachs not attuned to bloody violence will need to stay away from this movie and the red that essentially floods the screen at all times. In addition, any who don't tolerate ludicrous levels of silliness, ridiculous asides, and banter that could match any monologue fifty times over, should sit this one out. I agree the excess gets a tad much for me at times, but the variety this film brought distracted me from it enough for this to be less of a dislike than it could have been. Where tapering could have been a boon was in curtailing the antics so that we might get more time with characters and stories. Deadpool has a lot of characters who play pieces given everything this film pulls from, and two hours did not give remotely enough time to get the most out of them. Did they serve their purpose and have memorable moments? Sure, but there was so much that could have been done, primarily with Cassio's character. I can't say too much as that would be spoiling. My friend also did not enjoy how reference-heavy the movie was, and I can agree that, unlike other installments, this movie leans very heavily on a lot of cultural knowledge for this very convoluted plot. Again, no spoilers, but fans who know about the politics behind the movies, the pre-MCU days of the franchise, and Deadpool's other films (alongside heavy comic references) will thrive the most, while others may be overwhelmed, confused, and bored by the comedic directions this film takes at some point. Fortunately, Deadpool & Wolverine have enough to mitigate this, but again a limitation for the overall audiences.THE VERDICT: Deadpool & Wolverine had a lot of things to accomplish, and for this reviewer... they certainly achieved much of what I wanted. Overall, the movie is fun and a solid entry into the Merc With a Mouth's installments that excels at so much of what makes Deadpool his signature anti-hero. The comedy alone is enough to lavish over this movie, but the wit, the action, the surprising heart at times, and the acting make this movie fun. It takes the elements of the MCU I enjoyed in the past, but yet puts that modern twist to defend against the trends and Internet to make a movie that isn't hindered by the world's current preferences. And to give me action and comedy, with some drama, looped in, is a success that a reviewer/fan like me can get on board with. However, it is still excessive, and Deadpool's darker plot lines and gimmicks are more NC-17 than R in the ratings department. Those not ready for the gore, cursing, crude dialogue, and darker elements will not enjoy a film of this caliber, nor will those looking for the advancement of the MCU and X-men franchises that we still await in 2025. It also tries to do so much in a little time and relies heavily on one's knowledge of a lot of things to fully appreciate this homage to the Marvel empire. While fans like me will revel in delight, others without the knowledge may find themselves bored or confused to the level of disliking this movie compared to the other Deadpool entries. From all this, my scores are:Buddy Comedy/Superhero/Action/Adventure/Comedy/Sci-Fi: 8.5 Movie Overall: 7.5-8.0.

What a crazy experience that was !!After a bunch of failed projects (except Guardians of the galaxy vol.3) MCU coming alive again with Deadpool an Wolverine. Overall movie gives you exactly what you want from it. Hilarious jokes and crazy battle scenes. From the very start of the movie never dissapoints you and till the end you have that excited feeling, when we all watched MCU back in the days.Props to the people who worked in the project, they have some courage to really go all the way. Sarcastic jokes and breaking the 4th wall are there. Cameos are great, they are really tried to do intro scenes to be specific. The chemistry between these duo are so good, you can feel that both the actors and characters have that connect between them. But, i felt like during the third act there are some unnecessary scenes that ruined the final a little bit.Overall, I think MCU is back and with right directors and writers, there are good times ahead of us like we had in the past.

Just finally saw Deadpool & Wolverine.After seeing Inside Out 2 and Twisters, I went into high expectations with this Marvel movie and wow, this is an emotional roller coaster love letter like it's the best MCU movie ever since Avengers: Endgame. A fun thrilling Marvel fever dream from start to finish. This is going to go down as one of the greatest and most amazing comic book movies of all-time. The superhero nostalgia fest has a big heart that you've been looking forward to. It's a love letter not just to superhero comics, but also to the Fox era of Marvel movies. It's more gory like ever. It dives more into themes of family, loss, and revenge. There were amazing moments that reminds me of Spider-Man: No Way Home. The comedic screenplay was brilliant. The bloody action packed sequences were TOP NOTCH. The musical score is absolutely worth it. Loved the relentless humor. There are lots of AMAZING cameos and surprises to watch out for. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman were so FREAKING INCREDIBLE together like they made this movie so MIND-BLOWING. You will die screaming, laughing, and crying a lot in this epic movie. It will blow your mind. Probably the most craziness of MADNESS & FUN that you'll ever have this summer. This hits me so hard. Going to watch it all over again!!! A definitely MUST-SEE for everyone! Go see it at a movie theater before it's gone.Shoutout to Shawn Levy for directing this best Deadpool movie ever.

If the shortcomings were found, the ending was too old-fashioned. Can you guess, it's a big deal A happy ending. I can give it a score of nine (it feels like Marvel has had one good movie in a year since last year (two last year), the rest is just a pile)

I just happened to watch Deadpool 2 just before heading off to the cinema, just to start off this film's theme of being set in the multiverse is nothing new as it has been done in several other MCU properties including Spider-Man: No Way Home, which did it much better, along with some surprising faces which I won't spoil it here, however what makes me enjoy this film so much as the duo between Wade and Logan, like seeing ketchup and mustard, compliments well with eachother.This film was a great introduction for Deadpool to be in the MCU plus a great way to end Deadpool's trilogy, or maybe a setup for Deadpool to appear in other MCU films or TV shows? Who knows?We all been waiting for this duo to happen for a long time, even though Wolvie's arc ended with Logan, but I'm afraid he's here to stay possibly until 90 and after 24 years, Hugh wears his iconic outfit from the comics which is arguably better then his leather outfit from the earlier X-men films LOL.

I'm still full of impressions because I just came from the cinema. And I can say right away that it was great. Deadpool's sharp and peppery puns work brilliantly from start to finish, and so do the various innuendos. From the beginning, the film is one big parody of Hollywood (meaning in a good way), and Ryan Reynolds & Hugh Jackman take this energetic Road Movie with an overview. Their chemistry is the pillar of the story and works 100%. And now the main thing: Did the return of Wolverine damage his legacy at the end of Logan? I have to say no.......even though Logan is still a total masterpiece. Not to praise, the action (apart from the Deadpool vs Wolverine fight) is rather average and nothing stands out. Ditto directed by Shawn Levy. He is a skilled routiner, but still a routiner. Also, the villain Cassandra Nova is rather one of the weaker ones. However, despite these flaws, I give the film a beautiful 9/10, because there hasn't been a live action Marvel this good since No Way Home.

Just to say it right away, from a movie critic pov it is probably like a 6/10 story, but this movie is made for fans, and with everything in it and how it is delivered, this is a 9/10 for me.I didn't watch every single Marvel product, especially the tv series, but it never felt like too much knowledge is required to enjoy the movie.It is a statement that not everything needs to be made for everyone to make a profit or be perceived as good in general, which many franchises (at least claim) do today. Many movies seem to have forgotten what a franchise or character is about and why fans love it, but here they nailed it.

I was never a huge fan of the first 2 deadpool movies, I did like them and made me laugh sometimes, even if I find most of the humor very childish and predictable, buit if you liked 1 and 2 you will like this one. I see some reviews complaining that this was worse than the other two, I'd argue that they probably simply matured into whatever this humor is no longer as effective as it was when they saw the first two because it is exactly the same in terms of humor, The story is not oscar worthy, none of them are, but that is not why you go watch these films, for me the best thing about it was the huge amount of cameos even if they didn't make much sense, as someone who watches a lot of movies, it was fun. The rest of the humor is mostly references to existing material being other movies or characters or lines, even the will smith oscar slap, and some sex related jokes, exactly what you would expect from a deadpoool movie.I do wish the story was deeper, made more sense, played more with the multiverse, hell maybe even a TV show of 5 great creative episodes would have been nice, just to get more immersed with the characters, and boy there are many in this one! But they barely get any screen time because of that. And I with the humor was juuuuust a little smarter, with hidden jokes within jokes, background details, anything that could make the jokes not feel so flat and predictable. There are some but not enough to make it the masterpiece it could have been, or that most people think it already is, none of the deadpool movies deserve more than an 8, nor more than half a billion in box office, they are good, they are fun, but there are better things out there that deserve more credit comedy wise.But in the end it is a solid movie, worth watching for any deadpoool fan, and those who have seen most of the fox/marvel movies, and do not care about plot depth and logic, just boom boom and fun stuff, best for people that still feel like kids even if they are 50 years old.

Finally Marvel is BACK!! Hopefully it learnet from it's mistakes. One of the best movie since EndGame. The film is a fanservice for the fans and there is a multitude of Cameos. Hugh Jackam and Ryan Reynolds in the roles we loved and it suits them better than anything else. The best duo after Captain America and Iron Man.*** Mede me see it twice in theaters. The Thrill i got when i saw the cameos and the laugh i got, was exactly the same when i rewatched it a second time ***We hope that from now on, Marvel will return to its old roots and produce only hits like in the past.PS: Disney watch out, you have one of the most valuable things in your hands.

I just watched Deadpool & Wolverine, and wow, it was an absolute blast! Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have incredible chemistry that makes the whole movie work. Deadpool's irreverent humor and Wolverine's gruff seriousness balance each other perfectly. The film is packed with hilarious jokes, epic action sequences, and so many Easter eggs that comic book fans will be thrilled.The opening sequence had me hooked right away, with a mix of intense fighting and Deadpool's signature humor. The constant fourth-wall breaks were spot-on and kept the laughs coming. It's a fantastic tribute to both characters and their histories, with plenty of nods to past films and comics.If you're a fan of either character, this movie is a must-see. It's not just a fun ride; it's a love letter to the fans. The pacing is perfect, and the two hours flew by. Whether you're a casual viewer or a hardcore fan, Deadpool & Wolverine delivers on all fronts. Don't miss it!

Deadpool & Wolverine: Great fun, terrific dialogue. A multitude of characters from the Multiverse return including Electra, Blade, the Human Torch along with myriad Deadpools. The Multiverse gets more twisted than usual as a rogue employee of the Time Variance Authority wants to delete Deadpool's home timeline and transfer him to the Sacred Timeline where The Avengers hang out (he failed at a previous attempt to join The Avengers) Deadpool is not having this and digs up Wolverine in the hope of reviving him. All he gets though is a pile of dry bones. These come in useful when the TVA Police pursue him as he beats them to death with them. There is a lot of gore in this film, one of the reasons for it;s certificate, the other being the adult jokes and dialogue. Eventually after traversing the Multiverse he finds a living Wolverine to team up with. But will they be able to defeat Cassandra Nova, the twin sister of X-Men leader Charles Xavier? Dafne Keen makes a welcome return as Laura / X-23 from Logan, now grown up and still a headhunter! Plenty of fourth wall disappearing scenes with commentary about Fox and Disney, competing MCUs and bringing things together. All a touch postmodern and meta. Directed by Shawn Levy from a screenplay by Levy, Ryan Reynolds, Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick, and Zeb Wells. 8/10.

I walked out of the movie after 30 minutes or so as it was getting worse. There is direct attack on Christianity, let's say someone has been reading the Bible for the wrong reasons:one marvel guy calls himself Jesusanother scene of one on the cross with bloody skulls everywhere.the humorous comment asking if the guy was alright by using the words what troubles you women at the well, which is a teaching about Jesus helping and counselling and setting free the Samaritan woman at the well.Then you just can't catch on with 50% swear words in every sentence...did we forget how to speak? Did we forget the importance of story telling, climax, getting the viewer engaged and into another world?Wowww....

Deadpool & Wolverine delivers a chaotic blend of humor and action, showcasing the undeniable chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman. The film embraces its R-rated roots, filled with irreverent jokes and meta-commentary on the superhero genre.While the plot is convoluted-centering on Deadpool's quest to resurrect Wolverine from an alternate universe-the relentless humor and fourth-wall-breaking antics keep it entertaining. The film cleverly critiques Marvel's recent missteps while celebrating its characters' legacies. Although it may not be a cinematic masterpiece, its absurdity and charm make it a fun addition to the franchise, appealing to both fans and casual viewers alike.

I am not the target demographic for this film. I loved superhero comics when i was a kid. I waited for a good superhero movie or TV show for a long time, There were ebbs and flows with the quality of superhero movies. There were campy TV shows. Then we got the Tim Burton Batman, the Sami Raimi Spiderman, X-Men, and then Marvel. Not all of these films has been good. Some have been dreadful.I really enjoyed the first two Deadpool movies. The snarky fourth-wall breaking character made for two pretty entertaining films. This new movie I loved. It was great. I laughed out loud many times. I was in a theater of people at the first showing on the first day in Imax. I venture to guess that everyone there loved it too.I then heard reviews today. To be fair, I like foreign films and art films too. They're just different categories to me. But i know why critics in general won't like this film. To really appreciate it, you have to have seen the referenced films, TV shows, cartoons, and comics, and be familiar with their characters. For those who have that reference, this is great fun. If you don't have the frame of reference you won't get the joke. This is made for fans of the genre There are characters from TV shows, movies, cartoons, and many comic book references.Another thing that critics won't like is that this movie is very meta on the movie business in general and this genre in specific. Other than that this is a buddy comedy/action film. This is not a new genre and does not have real deeper meaning about life. But it is a fantastic roller coaster ride.This movie is pretty gory at times and very violent. There are lots of sexual innuendos that younger kids will not get and are probably not appropriate for them. But, I saw the original Star Wars movie.more than 40 times that first summer. I fell in love with snarky heroes, action, and great effects. This has all of that, plus offers all of us who love these films a chance to feel like I did when I paid 2$ to get into the first showing of Star Wars and watch the movie 4-5 times in a day. I'll definitely pay to see it again.

I'm not gonna say this movie has the most interesting or in depth plot. Nor did I expect it to. I (like many others) went into this movie to see these 2 characters interact within the world of comedic gold which is Deadpool. The movie follows the relationship of the characters more than trying to have some deep, muilti-layered plot. Which I was totally ok with and expecting. The movie is so self aware with its storyline and jokes, which was so nice to hear Deadpool saying what every Marvel fan has been thinking for awhile. If Deadpool's style of humor is not your thing, then I don't know why you would be interested in seeing this film. I honestly don't know how people don't find this movie enjoyable. Out of pure entertainment factor it's a 10/10.

I've waited for more than 2 years for this cinematic masterpiece to ultimately debut in theaters as the ultimate live-action Deadpool movie outing and it conveniently blew my expectations away by more than a mere potshot.To elucidate this belief in my case, I myself watched this film the first at Reading Cinemas Town Square on Tuesday July 30th, 2024 at 6:15PM, everything about this film was terrific, whether that be, (SPOILER-FREE CRITIQUE), a couple of cameos, comebacks, (the biggest being Wolverine and how well executed and stalwart the cast and crew remained for Hugh Jackman's portrayal of the character, nice). The new characters were pretty phenomenal for everything that had been culminated into a presentation of greatness and cabaret no less. And also sorry for the 20th Century FOX universe about to be altered for eternity, (Diss to the knee, even with Blue Sky Studios), you shall be paid proper homage for your years of nostalgia, (if someone didn't probably do so for you already). The cinematography was well mentally and crucially balanced for the tone of seriousness with gory violence and facetious humor that blew me away even for the 3rd time in a long time, (in forever), stellar portrayals for prom the thespians, (especially for the renowned Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman as the prime eponymous protagonists).As for the prime antagonist, I wasn't too agitated and irritably bothered by one of the antagonists being Cassandra Nova, (but that's less incorrigibly made up for by Paradox, who I thought to be another different variant of Mobius, but I'm more than erroneous up to that particular point). The heavy emotions were carried out nicely as well as the choreography fight scenarios were in the least with a bundle of different ensemble characters from the past, (shan't mention who specifically but good things come to those who wait, even if it isn't everything everywhere all at once, ;) alluding to another 2022 multiverse movie). And did I forget to conscientiously mention about the costume designs for not merely Deadpool but also Wolverine, nice homage to the glorious late 30s comic-book accurate appeal, it's rather satisfying and riveting for how well it was approached in that regard without being to mundane or that overall garnished somewhat. The music homages and the soundtrack was phenomenal as I almost forgot to mention for the prior precursors of Deadpool, (I'll avow to not disclose), and hopefully maybe Deadpool won't merely become Marvel Jesus and alter the course of the status quo of the MCU Phases 4 and beyond, can't wait for much more in store becoming cooking up a concocted pall.Overall, this true pure magnum opus is all the more breathtaking to say for the least that is truly, and might just practically even surpass its precursors by a mere milestone, this for me gets a 9.9/10, no more, no less.

I watch it in 2D as I just don't like wearing glasses to watch a movie. Definitely a movie you had to go watch before anybody spoiled the important moments for you as there has been a lot of people secretly filming and posting clips ruining the big moments for many who hasn't seen the film yet. As several moments had been spoiled for me and would had gotten bigger reaction seeing certain pre-MCU characters to appear, this movie was a good send off to Fox especially when we get to the end credits, from this point FOX movies are in the past and Deadpool and wolverine are joining MCU from here on out. It also shows how much this movie respected fan castings, but also show different comic version of both Deadpool and wolverine. The story was had to predict and honestly had a wonderful time going down memory lane and this was definitely a movie showing Marvel how to get back on track making movies they want and also showing R-rated Marvel movie can get a lot of audience. Especially the opening scene of this movie is brilliant wat a lot of blood and "respecting" the end of Logan. Hope more film to come from Marvel Jesus and friends.

This movie was so disappointing that I may never watch another Deadpool movie again. Let me explain...this movie was just Ryan Reynolds being completely unhinged with a lot of forced humor, most of which wasn't funny. Wolverine was in it, sure, but it didn't matter. Ryan Reynolds didn't let him shine. He had to steal the scene every single time.Now, I'm not a Deadpool fanatic. I know who he is and I've watched the other two movies (which I did like) so I may be harsher than others on this. There was also a whole lot of fan service which I wasn't interested in because I don't watch all the marvel movies. They also made wayyy too many Fox and Disney jokes. Ryan Reynolds just doesn't know when to stop. We don't need the same joke repeated 5 times.So, I didnt like it, but maybe it's just because I'm not a huge Deadpool or marvel fan. I did like the other two movies, however, but this one was significantly worse, in large part because Reynolds was significantly worse. If you're a huge fan, you might like it.

I had watched Logan and Deadpoll series. It's not much of a requirement though.The storyline was decent. Not something that blew my mind away but good.Some things were not properly explained and may be done in the future. I did find many instances funny but rare ones made me laugh. Not bad there.The action was good. Specially the one shot scenes. Being rated adult I was hoping that it becomes more gore. Would consider 13 + max. Stabbing and blood oozing out is not something I would categorize as adult.One particular scene was really powerful and I think you will get to know which one.All in all a good watch. Not a really great rebound for Marvel but certainly a good one.

The return of Hugh Jackman Wolverine with Marvel saviour Ryan Reynolds Deadpool is a perfect buddy comedy action packed rated-R movie.I loved every scene, the opening credit scene of Deadpool and Wolverine has now a separate fanbase.The chemistry amd dialogues between all major characters were perfect.The cameos were phenomenal and best thing about all cameos was that they played a major part in this movie. The background music synchronised amazingly with every scene.The antagonist was weak but two protagonists; Ryan Reynolds Deadpool carried the entire movie with the help of Hugh Jackman Wolverine. The comic book beautiful artwork turned into gorgeous cinematic scenes in this movie.The easter eggs were surprisingly great.A beautiful love letter to Marvel Comic Book fans with a sprinkle of Nostalgic vibes.

The first two Deadpool films are fun and funny with Ryan Reynolds being great as the character, so having him be introduced to the Marvel Cinematic Universe and having Hugh Jackman return as Wolverine was what got me interested in and excited for this third film, especially since this film will have to try to not mess up what the film Logan (2017) did for the character; after watching the film, I will say that I loved this movie with its great lead stars, great fan service, and fun and funny humor. The third film Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) was incredibly fun and funny to watch with excellent performances, fun action sequences, awesome fan service, entertaining cameos, an intimidating villain, great humor involving fourth wall breaks and jokes about the Marvel Cinematic Universe, a fantastic opening credit sequence, and a satisfying goodbye to the Twentieth Century Fox era of comic book films; while watching the movie you can tell that Ryan Reynolds wanted to make a great film, and the film respects the events that occurred in the film Logan (2017) in its own funny and entertaining way.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are fantastic together as Deadpool/Wade Wilson and Wolverine/Logan, with one being the straight man in a way and the other is known for being loudmouth and annoying, that dynamic between them was great and funny to watch from beginning to end; Deadpool/Wade Wilson was once again hilarious with him doing great fourth wall breaks, but also him being introduced to the Marvel Cinematic Universe by the TVA and trying to save his world was investing and entertaining to watch. It is awesome seeing Hugh Jackman play Wolverine/Logan again, it was cool knowing he is a variant of Wolverine with him having a tragic backstory and an awesome comic accurate yellow and blue outfit; he was funny in that powerful way with him and Deadpool fighting each other or trying to fix his own world, but also, that there is a whole monologue from him in the film that was very effective. Lastly, other than some little appearances from other characters from the other Deadpool films, I will say that I like how they use the TVA to bring Deadpool into the MCU despite Deadpool doing his own way to save his world and ignore everything the TVA says about these multiple worlds; also, there is a character who was funny but acted like an antagonist in some way.The villain of the film is Charles Xavier's sister Cassandra Nova, played very well by Emma Corrin, who was an intimidating character, but she was also smart while having these powers that at times made her seem overpowered, but it worked with what the film is; she did not have much of an explanation, but what I got was that she wanted to take control of all worlds. The action sequences were amazing and funny to watch, with them all being well shot and the fights between Deadpool and Wolverine were great to watch, it especially worked because of the R rating; there was so much fun action, and the film was beginning to end because of the jokes and fourth wall breaks; this also leads to the film having variants of certain characters, lots of cameos, and an excellent opening credits sequence at the start of the film. Lastly, this film has lots of stuff fans will recognize from the comics, with the multiple cameos, variants, comic exact moments, and comic exact characters that are amazing to see; the film was entertaining, funny, and fun from beginning to end, especially for comic book fans.The third film Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) was incredibly fun and funny to watch with excellent performances, fun action sequences, awesome fan service, entertaining cameos, an intimidating villain, great humor involving fourth wall breaks and jokes about the Marvel Cinematic Universe, a fantastic opening credit sequence, and a satisfying goodbye to the Twentieth Century Fox era of comic book films; you can tell that Ryan Reynolds loved this character and that he wanted to make a great film, and the film respects the events that occurred in the film Logan (2017) in its own funny and entertaining way. This was a satisfying goodbye to the Twentieth Century Fox era for superhero films, with it also being a great introduction to the Marvel Cinematic Universe for the Deadpool character, along with it being a great third film in the Deadpool film series; if this is going to be the last appearance for the character of Deadpool, then Ryan Reynolds made an excellent trilogy of films thar are fun, funny, and very entertaining to watch and rewatch.

Deadpool is really the Marvel Jesus, reviving our spirits in a time when the MCU has become a hit-and-miss franchise. Deadpool & Wolverine delivers exactly what we needed: a summer blockbuster that's pure, unfiltered entertainment for two solid hours.It's got everything you expect and want from a Deadpool movie: fourth-wall breaking, razor-sharp jokes, pop culture references, swearing, and bloody action.But the addition of Wolverine and the shift into the MCU bring fresh energy to the mix, and it's welcome. The Deadpool and Wolverine dynamic is the perfect mix of buddy cop and bromance, each complementing the other well.It also has multiverse elements and lots of cameos like other MCU movies but here it feels perfectly fine and not overused. They serve as great fanservice, giving a lot of nostalgic feelings for the fans of the Marvel/Fox universe.The story is simple, but it doesn't require a complex plot to be great. You also don't need to watch a lot of previous marvel movies to understand the plot but it can help for some references or jokes in the movie.Also the music is a perfect fit and "Like a Prayer" and "Bye Bye Bye" will be stuck in your head for weeks.Overall, Deadpool & Wolverine is a wild, fun ride that perfectly blends the best of both characters. Whether you're a fan of the Marvel/Fox universe or just looking for an entertaining movie night, this film delivers big time.

Introduction: The largely anticipated release of Deadpool & Wolverine brings together two iconic characters in an R- rated action- comedy film that lives up to the hype. The distinct personalities and changeable prank of Deadpool and Wolverine produce a unique and amusing movie experience, promising suckers a thrilling lift.Plot and Characters: The plot revolves around Deadpool, who's scuffling with a majority extremity after retiring from his brief stint as a auto salesperson and parting ways with Vanessa. On his birthday, Deadpool is suddenly kidnapped and setting off a chain of events involving time manipulation and resemblant worlds. Wolverine's early demise and the posterior unraveling of his timeline add depth to the narrative, climaxing in a battle to save their universe.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool and Hugh Jackman's Wolverine is electric. Deadpool's impious humor and Wolverine's gruff address produce a dynamic that's both ridiculous and sincere. Their trip through time and space forces them to defy empirical questions and review their places as heroes.Themes and Motifs: Deadpool & Wolverine delves into themes of tone- discovery, fellowship, and immolation. As Deadpool navigates through empirical questions and confronts his part in the macrocosm, the film explores the depth of his character beyond the humor and action. The motif of time is pivotal, driving the plot forward and leading to violent action sequences and emotional exposures.Visuals and Cinematography: Visually, the film excels with its cinematic plates and action sequences. The fast- paced editing and swish illustrations round the facetious humor and violent fight scenes, creating a dynamic and engaging experience for the followership. The use of CGI and practical goods is flawless, enhancing the fantastical rudiments of the story.Humor and Dialogue: True to Deadpool's character, the film is filled with adult humor, facetious one- liners, and meta- references that feed to both ridiculous book suckers and general observers. The badinage between Deadpool and Wolverine adds a subcaste of comedy to the action- packed sequences, keeping the followership entertained throughout. The humor is balanced with emotional scenes that are not undercut by jokes, a stimulating change from some recent Marvel flicks.Audience Reaction: Attending an early midnight screening in a packed theater, the atmosphere was electric. The audience was laughing and cheering throughout the movie. The story, while occasionally confusing due to its complex plot, was consistently engaging. The action was bloody and goofy, the jokes were hardcore, and the movie was very meta. "Deadpool & Wolverine" was everything that I ever wanted, and it BLEW MY MIND AWAY, with surprising CAMEOS, but not gonna tell ya! You have to watch it on the BIG SCREEN to believe it! It takes it to a WHOLE NEW LEVEL!!!Emotional Depth: One name aspect of the film is its capability to deliver genuine emotional moments. Unlike numerous newer MCU pictures, Deadpool & Wolverine includes scenes that are not incontinently undercut with humor. These moments give a deeper connection to the characters and their peregrinations, adding layers to the else uproarious and action- filled narrative.Conclusion: Deadpool & Wolverine is a delightful popcorn entertainer that delivers on its promise of an action-comedy extravaganza. The charismatic performances of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, combined with spectacular visuals and engaging humor, make it a worthwhile watch. Fans of the Marvel universe will appreciate the nods to comic book lore and the unexpected twists in the plot.This film is more reminiscent of the Fox-era X-Men movies than the current MCU, and it embraces that legacy proudly. The cameos are a special treat, often serving more than just fan service. If you enjoyed the previous Deadpool movies, you'll love this one too.Overall Standing: 4/5 Deadpool & Wolverine is a must- watch for audience of the characters and the genre. It strikes a balance between humor, action, and emotion, making it a memorable addition to the Marvel cinematic universe. So, grab your popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the wild lift that Deadpool and Wolverine have in store for you!

The sarcasm is over in a way that destroys any normal dialogue.Wolverine is great but despite all his trials to add some drama, he fails because the sarcasm destroys it in the right next moment.Also there is no real villain or evil scenario that justifies why we are teaming up wolverine (the immortal) with deadpool, so it looks like we are in a journey that we know from first moment it is going to be very safe, very light, very disappointing.And since there is no real villain, then also all the bloody good fights are between deadpool and wolverine, in a friendly funny way, so nothing intense here too.To keep it simple, they got Hugh, Ryan, and many many easter eggs, to save Marvel's situation. But without a real meaning or a good movie after all.I wish Hugh doesn't accept to play Logan anymore unless it is real movie, and has a real good plot that respect his legendary role, wolverine.

First of all... how you follow the success of Deadpool 1 & 2 and somehow top it by a lot is beyond me. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds' had the best chemistry. The action and blood was over the top which made it so entertaining to watch during the fight sequences. Just like its predecessors, it has lots of witty one liners that are sure to make you laugh. My theater was laughing for most of the movie. The introduction of Blade and them bringing back Johnny Storm Electra and Bandit were all really cool to see. And to top off a great film.. they showed unseen behind the scenes footage from the filming of previous X-Men movies during the credits which was quite touching for a fan of all those movies. I gave it an 8/10 which is less than generous. Would give it a 10/10 if I believed there were such thing as a perfect movie. Will be purchasing when released on digital! Oh and you want to see this in theaters.

With Marvel Studios trimming back on its film releases in 2024 it made Deadpool & Wolverine the most anticipated film of the year. Today, I managed to watch it and here is my review for Deadpool & Wolverine. After rejecting an offer to join The Marvel Cinematic Universe, Deadpool must find Wolverine in order to save his timeline.Main Character Ryan Reynolds plays Wade Wilson/Deadpool and he is just born to play the role and he does give a great performance in this film. He is just really funny and does manage to deliver on the occasional emotional scenes that are required. Hugh Jackman also makes his return as Logan/Wolverine and he is just fantastic here and I love watching him in this role. The chemistry between Jackman & Reynolds is off the charts and easily carries this film and seeing them together is great.Supporting Characters Emma Corrin plays Cassandra Nova and she is a fun addition to the film. She is clearly revelling in her role and I liked how her powers were shown. I wish she had a little more screen time and her motivations were better but I think she does enough to create a fun villain.Matthew Macfayden plays Paradox who is the TVA Agent in charge of the situation and it is a lot of fun to watch him on screen with these other performers as he is incredibly charming and quick witted with his dialogue.The film has a bunch of decently sized roles from people not announced before the film so I will not mention them here but they are good fun. Though if you are a fan of the supporting cast from the first two films then you will be disappointed because they play minimal roles here.Story The story does a really good job of progressing the characters of both Deadpool & Wolverine and the relationship that they have and I very much felt satisfied by the end of the film. However, this film does really lack plot and interesting motivations for the villain. It does sometimes feel like Deadpool and Wolverine are just meeting people for comedic value and not necessarily for narrative reasons.Script The script is really funny, there is so much material to work with for Deadpool to break the fourth wall and he uses it to the maximum amount and it usually nails it. The drama is also pretty well done and it manages to flesh out the two main protagonists.Style When Deadpool moved to Marvel Studios there was a fear that it would be nurtured a little bit but that is not the case. The violence is huge mixed with the bad language and the action scenes are fantastic with some really creative battles on the screen. But, I actually thought the pacing of the film was a little off, it rams so much into it and the first act is a bit slow that I did find it a bit disjointed at times.Overall Overall, Deadpool & Wolverine is a great film. If you are a Marvel or Deadpool fan then you will enjoy this film and I am glad that the essence of this franchise still exists and that this film does deliver in being a fun summer blockbuster.Rating - 8/10.
