The movie was hilarious, not only was I, but the audience died of laughing. Watching this in theaters was a treat.The movie itself was well done. It was a good sequel. It also followed the path marvel was going for which put together the universe that marvel had created. But overall the movie was very very good. It was hilarious and the quips and cameos just added so much to the movie. I don't want to give too many away but my favorite was when wolverines shirt bursts off. Again just little moments like these make the movie.To add on, this movie really puts together the dead pool character and the universe.The acting was very well done. Yeah not perfect from every character but overall so good. Ryan Reynolds plays dead pool to a tee rounding off the movie.Again hilarious, well done, and totally worth your while 8.6/10.

Honestly Hugh Jackman made the movie...what an amazing actor.As for Ryan, its difficult to watch to many stupid scenes... it came to a point where it was just too much. I guess he tried too hard to be funny in a deadpool kind of humor, dragging some major actors in to the picture lowering their performence by the same kind of boring humor.As for Hugh, he stood up from the crowd, bringing some type of drama, wich was need to the plot, and elevates the viewers to another level of movie. Adding some of the drama in Logan, the tears of is own end, and completes the history of the film.Dont get me wrong... its fun to watch, but it streches a little bit much the comedy.

I convinced my wife to watch this movie together, I told her finally the MCU has a new movie worth a watch, at least that's what most reviews had told us.We started watching it, by the minute 15 she looks at me cringing a little bit. I told her: "yeah, I know... My bad." I just don't quite understand why would they waste millions doing this type of movie, why not do a decent one?And yeah, of course I know the reason why the new generation is able to enjoy this type of film. The reason why is because this is basically a TikTok movie, a compilation of funny sketches with cool music, some nostalgia bait, a lot of 1min cameos, a lot of Easter eggs and that's it.I even considerate Ryan Reynolds a decent comedian but no one can take 2h of him talking non stop, all the same kind of teenager jokes. Also, the real life jokes in a movie throw me off big time, like "Blake will be pissed" , "Hey Hugh", "Disney this, fox that", etc... it's not even funny. Someone, please, for the love of God, tell Ryan that he's not that funny and that a boomer acting like a 12 year old is sad and quite lame and maybe he should focus on the soccer fraud is pulling instead of this modern MCU cringe fest.So, yeah, it's confirmed, the only good Deadpool movie is the first one.

Pretty much everything you could want, but also pretty much everything you would expect. There's plenty of surprise cameos, humorous and rude jokes and 4th wall breaking quips and some excessively violent and gory fight scenes which are long and entertaining, although with 2 invulnerable heroes there's never any thrills or suspense. The special effects and acting were good and the action set to music pieces were superb. The story and settings are inventive and the second lead character brings emotional heft when the plot needs it, but the villains struggle to really stand out and by parodying so much it feels unoriginal, copying rather than innovating at times.

Just got home from the cinema and I must say... I thoroughly enjoyed this film! Gave me everything I wanted to see. Humour, cameos, fight scenes, gore, and more! It was so satisfying to finally see Wolverine in the yellow and black outfit after all these years of Hugh Jackson playing the character. I grew up watching the X-Men cartoon show and I could never forget the yellow and black outfit.Ryan Reynolds as expected, brought the laughter playing Deadpool and you just never get bored of it. This film really is the saving grace of Disney after the recent under par Marvel movies they have brought out the last few years. I am so glad they didn't mess with what makes Deadpool so unique and attractive to the superhero genre. Do I want more Deadpool? Hell yeah!Was it perfect, not quite. But not many films deserve a 10. This film definitely deserves a 9/10 and would highly recommend you go see it before spoilers on social media ruin it for you! How can they ever replace Hugh Jackman as Wolverine?!

This is something that we've been needing for a while. And with that saying it was a complete blast! Some reviews will trash the title and put this like "fan service mess" or "I walked out halfway through". Read my words "Don't listen to them!"Just see it for yourself and then you make the decision. It has a narrative. It has substance. It has the bloody action and violence and vulgar laughs that we expect for a Deadpool movie to have.Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman, and Shawn Levy were given a mission and they succeeded. For a movie and comic book fan like myself, they definitely exceeded my expectations.That is all.

The best thing about Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool movies are that it doesn't take itself serious. There's none of the artificial gravitas surrounding the Avengers movies - whose problem is that doing it one too many times, it loses its impact.In Deadpool (except for #2), the threat at hand takes a step back behind characters and works mostly as a vehicle for jokes - often the threat itself is the punchline.It's a fun ride and nothing more, but what a ride it is!The chemistry between Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds is undeniable.The fan service is outstanding - being served a barrage of blasts from the past (Elektra, Blade, the original Sabretooth, Toad, etc) as well as giving a face to notable names skipped so far (Gambit) not to mention the jokes poked at the former 20th Century Fox Ltd, Marvel itself, Avengers (they discovered shawarma, didn't they?) and so on.It's delightful - though not perfect by far and honestly to truly appreciate all the details you definitely benefit from seeing at least some X-Men, some Avengers and the Loki series, which while to be expected is definitely something that works against the movie standing on its own.

Nothing is a perfect 10, but this came pretty darn close! I've been a Ryan Reynolds fan since "Two Guys and a Girl" and a Deadpool fan since the first, and this did not disappoint. The jokes, cameos, soundtrack, storyline, acting and story were all top-notch.It hits much harder if you're a Marvel fan, and know all the characters and references, especially the cameos, but even if not, I can't see anybody not enjoying this movie if they know what they're in for and that there will be some slapstick jokes and don't take themselves too seriously.I saw one negative review from a couple who apparently walked out after 30 minutes and said it was disgusting. I don't know who in the modern world would willingly go watch a Deadpool movie and not know what to expect. It's carefully crafted and designed for fans of the franchise and character, so come on, really.Ryan and Hugh are the only actors that can portray Deadpool and Wolverine, and they do it perfectly in this.If you're a Marvel fan, run, don't walk to the cinema.

One star for good marketing, obviously, they got me to throw down fat stacks to see it on the large Dolby screen. Second star for being not so bad that I walked out. But maybe the stupidity of sitting through the whole thing is just on me.I get that it was all for the fans. But a constant stream of breaking the fourth wall, followed by D and W bickering like two old hags, followed by gory over the top battles and dozens of superhero cameos, then lather rinse repeat got old pretty quick. It's a shame too, the first movie was brilliant, and the second one was at least fun and entertaining. This had no real plot, the meager attempts at a story were random and incoherent at best. Much like Guardians of The Galaxy 3, I almost wish I hadn't been exposed to this steaming heap of poop.

Not as a great as the first film but by far beats the second deadpool film. Absolutely loved it. Epic fight scenes and a great soundtrack. The humour was still there but I feel like there were less offensive jokes. Really loved Wolverine as well, all of the film was enticing and it had an easy pace to follow. The only downside to our experience was people seemed to come in, take photos and boast about it on social media and then sit on their phones throughout the entire thing. It was really annoying because when you're a marvel fan or even just because you've paid money for a film that you would like to watch, then it's not on really. Multiple people did it. So as a reminder to anyone out there who does this, stop it and be respectful. Just because you can and want to waste your money doesn't mean other people can. It's very sad to see that people now can't sit through a 2 hour film without having to check their socials or go to a film they don't even want to watch. Quite pathetic.

Together with deadpol me, it's more cool that Wolverine comes out It's very fun along with a lot of action in itself, it seems perfect to me. To laugh for a good time and enjoy I highly recommend it, it's a 10 in my opinion. Wait a long time to see the Wolverine actor appear in a movie again And now that the name came out I feel very happy Thanks for doing it.I find it quite funny in each scene, but it is not suitable for minors to see it. They talk a lot about sexual misdeeds. Rudeness is normal in movies but here they let loose a lot But the funniest part was when I was dancing love that yes.

I just watched the movie out of boredom. I'm not a superhero or Marvel Fan at all, I have never watched a Wolverine movie before and only the first Deadpool movie. I didn't know any of the other Superheroes except for Blade. That's why I probably missed many many many jokes already. Watched it in English (I am German) and therefore probably missed even more jokes.Still, I found it to be very funny and entertaining. I loved it.Must be a blast to all the real fans out there.Would definitely recommend to watch it. Will probably watch it in German again and maybe some other superhero movies, too.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a wild ride filled with laughter, action, and a surprising amount of heart. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are at their absolute best, delivering witty banter and showcasing their incredible chemistry. The time-traveling plot is a clever way to bring these two iconic characters together, and the movie never takes itself too seriously.The action sequences are intense and well-choreographed, and the jokes land consistently throughout. But what truly surprised me was the emotional depth of the story. Beneath the humor and mayhem, there's a heartwarming tale of friendship and sacrifice.While the movie isn't perfect, its minor flaws are easily overshadowed by its strengths. Deadpool & Wolverine is a must-watch for fans of both characters, and it's sure to leave you grinning from ear to ear.

So much fun, highly entertaining fight scenes (especially in the Honda) and nostalgia mixed with some genuine emotions.Having watched basically every film and tv show each main and cameo character was in, every appearance left me more pumped. And the cameos were not wasted, each played a part in the story telling. We left the cinema buzzing.Amazing soundtrack adds to the action and adventure. I found myself singing quietly along while enjoying the action.Ryan Reynolds was awesome as always but Hugh Jackman stole the show. No one can play Wolverine as well as Hugh.If you're not sure whether to bother seeing it as the cinema or not, just go and be entertained.

Ad a great time watching this one! It had everything I was looking for in a Deadpool / Wolverine movie: blood, guts, raunchy humor, and a distinct lack of trying to push a message. All this movie wanted to do was entertain, and that it definitely did. It wasn't completely perfect! Very few films are. The jokes all landed for the most part, and the pacing was fine but it did seem like the plot lost track of where it wanted to go a couple of times. Nothing so much to ruin the experience, but it seemed like maybe they were just trying to pad out the runtime when it wasn't completely necessary. It was miniscule, and the ovie was still great in spite of this. I'd probably give Deadpool & Wolverine something closer to a 9 or a 9.5, I feel it's more deserving of the 8.2 it currently holds.

Marvel is back on track..A pure comic movie in total.. ryan and hugh's bromance is max and worked out very well.. Deapool and Wolverine has that on every possible way.Cassandra's character could have been even more better when it comes to villain.. apart from that it was a great movie.Great intro for deadpool with the song and bloody action scene were TVA team Goes down. Background score were also so gound in the movie.If you want to see this film, go to the cinema especially on imax, don't wait for TV because you will miss one of the biggest and best watches to ever hit the big screen.

Saw in RPX earlier today it was pure gold easily the best of the 3 Deadpool's! I'm so glad Shawn Levy mastered this I was concerned since he mostly has done PG-13 films which are great but he's done one R-Rated film; he perfected Deadpool & Wolverine in the best way possible. So much great humor, exceptional action, amazing story, and exceptional entertainment value. One of my favorite things is how Ryan Reynolds's was in Blade Trinity and there's a great surprise origally that's when Deadpool was talked about I love the connections so much. This deserves all the praise one of the most satisfying action/comedies in a long time and glad I was around an excellent audience.Watched again in IMAX on 8-6-24 even more satisfying and so well made - I love everything about this movie!

This movie is exactly what I needed; comfort food in the form of a movie.I actually didn't think I would like it this much. I would have been happy with a lesser movie but this hit all the right spots! The opening fight scene is one of the most enjoyable things I've ever seen in a movie! Maybe I should not have enjoyed as much as I did! LolThe movie is not perfect, neither did I expect that. My only issue with the movie is with the pacing somewhere past halfway. But let's be honest, that's nitpicking.I don't want to spoil anything but if you liked the first two movies (apparently I'm the odd one out by liking the 2nd one better than the 1st one) you should have a blast with this one. The cameos really do ramp up with every movie and this time the cameos actually add to the story.I really enjoyed it, who ff'ing needs Oscars if you can have *this* much fun with a movie.I'm heading towards the 50 and I'm delighted to be able to have this much fun watching a movie.

It's Deadpool and Wolverine ofc...LFG! So glad to know that I have watched this movie that also on first day first show. It's a literal love letter to MCU and the fans. Reynolds really cooked up a magical potion. I am actually mindblown and still in awe. My theatre was laughing so hard + screaming and hooting so much too. The movie was just right. People were even standing, jumping, and dancing! The legacy has been held. My stomach is paining and so I my throat now. The music and soundtrack hits hard. I will never forget this day, he audience reaction was so lit. So much funny, violent and emotional at times too. Going on my fav movie list at the top. The dynamic between DP & W is so crazy and epic. Wolverine getting annoyed and all is just the best, he did everything best just like DP.

The movie of the year, of the decade! It keeps you engaged throughout the whole movie! Laughing and smiling till your face hurts!! A MUST!!! Even if you are not a Marvel fan, go see this! Don't hesitate, go see it today!!! Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman live up to the promos, hypes and critics. What a pair worth the money. The Easter eggs and cameos are delicious and well played. Pay close attention to the characters and the backgrounds of every scene. Not giving anything away, just be on alert throughout the film. And stay for the credits!! Truly made my day and I can't wait to see it again!!

A voucher!?! Seriously, if you don't know who ryan renolds or deadpool are, you have no business reviewing this movie...but thanks for contributing cash (unless you have a voucher...did you not read up on it before going!?!) to the massive success of this movie. Okay, it's an easy choice...if you like marvel, superheroes, the first two deadpool movies, you'll enjoy it. Most of these low scores are from reviewers probably in their 60s to 70s and/or have a hatred toward this genre. Go back to watching your afternoon soap operas, the view, gossip girl (wait, i like that series) and next time start the review with, "i don't like this genre type of movie...".

Deadpool is known for its witty humor, sharp punchlines, and the uncensored, edgy style that makes it stand out from other superhero films. The chemistry between the characters, especially with Deadpool's quirky and irreverent personality, is a big part of the fun. If you're a fan of that kind of humor, it's no wonder you found it entertaining from beginning to end!I like deadpool dance, action of this movie is mesmerizing. I watched movie in english and hindi dubbed, it never let you down no matter which language you watch it, you will enjoyed this masterpiece. After Avengers series, i enjoy deadpool series, it always comes with full pack of entertainment.

Deadpool & Wolverine is an absolute blast from start to finish. The chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine is off the charts, resulting in a non-stop stream of witty banter and hilarious action sequences. This film seamlessly blends humor and heart, creating a truly unforgettable cinematic experience.The writers have done an exceptional job of capturing the unique voices of both characters. Deadpool's fourth-wall-breaking antics and Wolverine's gruff exterior are perfectly balanced, resulting in a dynamic duo that is both entertaining and endearing. The action sequences are well-choreographed and visually stunning, but it's the humor and the perfectly selected soundtrack that truly sets this film apart. Marvel once again delivers a film that surpasses expectations.

I saw it with my 20 yr old cousin.He liked, but he found it underwhelming for the hype.I thought it was way better than expected.The difference is that while he saw the previous Deadpool movies, he didnt grew up with everything the movie makes reference of, so he didnt got most of the jokes, jabs sarcasm and whatnot. He never saw the old movies, the good ones, the bad ones, the cartoons, the comics. Nothing.So, for the newer generations, it is a fun movie.But for the old timer like us who grew with all this stuff, it was all the fan service that we never had and everything we expected from the old movies. I doubt it will win any oscars, but it will win the movie of the year, choice awards and everything else, because its amazing. This movie is already a cult classic and has only been in theaters for a couple of days. Oh, and it rescues Marvel too.Must watch.

All laughs from start to finish, accompanied with emotional logan Moments of Logan's past. The chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine is awesome, the first one acting like a fan of Logan but at the same time making fun of him whenever he wants is perfect, the scenes of them 2 fighting are a hilarious bloody fest.I didnt expect to see blade in this movie, that was awesome, this movie made me wanna watch all x men cronology to understand more of Logan's fight with himself and why he doesn't wants to Join them at a certain point.Ryan hollins at deadpool's is always perfect, this role was Made for him, i don't see a Deadpool movie not being box office with him.

What an amazing gift Deadpool has been. 1st, 2nd, and now this. It is just brilliant with loads of great action. Great dialogue, fantastic moments of WHOA, and lots and lots of swearing... yes, and I loved every second of it.Loaded with the easter-eggs as they love to call them and oozing a class that has been sadly lacking with the rush to make MCU movies thick and fast after Endgame.The laughter throughout was brilliant, Deadpool icons, Wolverine one liners, brooding (it's a Wolverine thing).I am not someone that is compelled to go to the cinema, last time I think was for Endgame. Since I've waited for Disney to show me what I wasn't missing with poor offerings with zero plot and frankly far too much silly ness.Deadpool & Wolverine was worth waiting for. I loved every single second. Thanks to Hugh for coming out of 'W' retirement once more, how he got that bod is well inspiring. Cast was par excellence, and if they do not go there again (I get why Hugh might not want to) but it would be nice for us to see a carefully scripted, adult movie. 10/10.

Just Got out of a Dolby Cinema Screening of Deadpool & Wolverine.I just gotta say this, there's actually a Better Film in here Somewhere but I Still Enjoyed the One we Got. A lot of Belly Laughs(Not Everything Landed) from Different Jokes Throughout the Film.Positives - - Again on the Jokes, And Mileage will Vary on this one(Comedy is Completely Subjective). Quite a Lot of the Jokes Landed For Me. - The Back & Forth between Deadpool & Wolverine Worked Very Well. - I loved the bit Near the End with Both of them Holding the Yellow & Blue Wires and the Epic Song Playing, it was so good.Con - - The Action Scenes weren't Good Enough. And this is Definitely Due to Me Experiencing Black Adam in Dolby Cinema, that films Demonstration of Power, Slow Motion, Speed Ramping, Eye Popping Visuals & Just Sheer Energy within the Action Scenes were Just completely on a Different Level Action Wise. Deadpool & Wolverine has a Few Decent Action Scenes, 1. The First Fight they have, 2. The Car Fight, 3. The Bus Fight (but again, they were ok, but not good enough Compared to Black Adam )Overall, with all that Said, I was Belly laughing(along with My 4 Friends and much of the Audience) multiple Times throughout the Film. So It Delivered.

Clearly the greatest movie ever made. It should sweep the Oscars. I expect that the movie will be studied in cinematic circles for decades.The musical numbers and the random use of Hugh Grant as Hugh Jackman's body double was a stroke of genius. I especially liked the acapella singing of the Music Man numbers.Action scenes are a little light on explosions, but you have to save money somewhere. The movie had product placements from AARP as both actors approach that age range. Just like the movie Hustlers where all the strippers are senior citizens, Marvel tracks the aging North American population by having a geriatric action cast.

In 2016, we were shown a superhero from the Marvel universe like we've never seen before. Ryan Reynolds took on the role of Wade Wilson, who becomes the immortal superhero Deadpool after a terrible accident. But Deadpool is not just a superhero, he is rude and particularly violent. In the distance, the whole thing was a bit reminiscent of Kick-Ass that had a kind of equal concept. The first Deadpool- film was so successful that there was a sequel in 2018. Deadpool 2 built on the same concept and was also a great success. Then came Avengers: End Game in 2019 and actually it went downhill with the Marvel movies. Although Deadpool didn't directly have to do with that part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, it did have immediate effect, because although everyone was waiting for a third Deadpool- movie, it took us six years to welcome a sequel. It also meant the return for Hugh Jackman as Wolverine, who already hung his metal claws in the willows in 2017. You will immediately wonder how this will be solved since Wolverine is really dead.Of course, Wolverine returns because Deadpool brings him back from another world of a different timeline. Bad luck for Deadpool that he just brings back the most terrible Wolverine you can think of. Because of this timeline trick, it is a breeze for Marvel to be able to bring every superhero back of course and whether you should really want that remains a bit of the question. The film is entertaining and full of humor, but at the same time we can feel Disney's nasty woke hand. Fortunately, there is still some stab to do, but Disney has proven with The Acolyte, for example, that she is even the largest franchise capable of turning the neck. Fortunately, that doesn't happen in this Deadpool- movie yet, but Deadpool & Wolverine is completely deviated from its predecessors. The return of some almost forgotten superheroes who come to help Deadpool and Wolverine is very nice to see. Deadpool really wants to join the Avengers, but is not assumed there, it will eventually mean that Deadpool will end up in the counterpart of the Avengers and hopefully that will be a greater success than what Marvel has been working on lately.Of course, the film bursts with ridicule, but in a positive way. Especially the scene in which more than a hundred Deadpools from different timelines come together is a highly entertaining, but extremely bloody course. This was also quite clear in the opening of the film and that a film like this grave, necrophily and all that kind of thing does not shy away from it, may be clear. It is advisable for deeply believing people or people with a weak stomach to skip the film, because Deadpool is not for the dear souls. It remains to be seen what a possible next part will bring, because who saw such a crossover film between Deadpool and Wolverine actually coming, at least I didn't. Hopefully Marvel will climb out of the deep valley of some ridiculously bad movies they made, but I also had that hope after the fantastic third part of Guardians of the Galaxy and then we got Madam Web. Anyway we are going to experience it.Deadpool & Wolverine has become a bloody, coarse, humorous roller coaster ride. The opening of the film alone is not for dear souls or heavily believing people. Hopefully this is a turnaround in the Marvel universe that falters on all sides. After Avengers: End Game, with a few exceptions, no decent movie came and Disney also wanted to kill you by adding a lot of series to the MCU. But if Disney is good at one thing, it's killing successful franchises, just look at the Star Wars franchise. Hopefully this doesn't apply to the MCU and it's the anti-hero Deadpool who has to pull things out of the mud again. Either way, this may not be the best Deadpool movie, but it has everything on board that makes it worth a ride to the cinema. So if you haven't seen the movie yet and you feel like an evening of brainless stupid entertainment, Deadpool & Wolverine is the right choice.

I highly doubt it. I'm a fan of all the marvel 21st century fox movies and I've watched every single movies(good and bad ones) right from my childhood. This movie doesn't seem to be a celebration of that, its just piggybacking on it's familiarity and Nostalgia factor. Ryan Reynolds has completely seem to ignore what made first two movie a Deadpool movie and not "Ryan Reynolds" movie. This movie has completely undone how fun and personal the first two movies felt. Everything is overdone, exaggerated not in a very entertaining way with too many bloated cameos and reference which after first few starts to lose it's Nostalgia factor..After a while this movie became a chore to sit and finish in cinemas as there is too little plot thread to keep the screenplay going and zero character development for you to actually care about any character. Wolverine is my most beloved childhood hero and somehow this film made me dislike him. Only decent scene with wolverine were DP visiting his variants(the irony) to recruit him, as Wolverine is somehow "anchor being" or some made up thing which the film spends some time trying to exposition dump. Another problem with movie is it's mindless action followed by exposition dump followed by dumb jokes which gets old pretty quick and when you feel stagnated a not so deserving cameo. I can't believe they brought back wolverine from death for this silly plot and X23 cameo is wasted(she ends up giving lame pep talk to Wolverine who doesn't actually have a daughter or doesn't care, so what was the point?).. Cassandra Nova plot is super contrived and she is added to long list of one dimensional marvel villaim..The irony is ppl cherish Marvel and hate Fox movies/timeline, but Fox did excellent job with all of their latest xmen movies than this bloated cameofest of a mess which is neither true to its source material nor the cinematic universe. Multiverse is just an excuse now to introduce character with zero development and this concepts gotta go.

When everyday is a total disaster , when life hits you hard , whenever you are facing a problem. Sometimes we dont need an educational movie , we just need PURE LAUGH. Its missing in this world at the moment. I m a movie maniac, but i think it was just what i needed exactly to get lost for 2 hours in just laughter , troll and surealism. Simple as that. Its a must watch.. Its not that much of a deep story movie , it doesnt have intense dialogs ,it wont go to oscars to win a leading or support best performance. But it will talk about friendship , stupidity , immaturity at its best ! Thats enough laughter for me !!

This is not a real review, it should be understood more as a collection of impressions on the film.A really beautiful film that gives comedy everything it can and in my opinion it works very well in this way even if the plot does not exist except in the last half hour of the film but in any case the film entertains a lot thanks to the continuous comic sketches that the film is structured on. Ultimately when one goes to see this film one knows very well what he is going to face also because it is the third in its saga and brings honor to all the others even if it is the one with the least plot overall. In conclusion, the evaluation that I can make of the film is extremely positive because in line with the other films.

Best film in the cinemas in the last years. It was just so great. It had all the things the previous super hero movies lacked: a heart. It had human connection, personal drama, character growth. It was funny, it was interesting and it was very vulgar (not for people who don't like those kind of jokes).I absolutely loved the dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine. Their bro-mance and the many gay jokes.The soundtrack was magnificent. Just the right thing for the action scenes.Although I enjoyed the movie tremendously, in retrospect I could point out a few things I liked less: the whole "world destruction" that became such a clich in the other 1000 superhero movies, the over load of side characters that we knew nothing about, somethings were left unexplained and it felt like they were there just to move the movie forward, the "bad guy" was just a bit caricaturistic.If there will be another Deadpool movie I hope they'll get back with the direction of the first two movies which had more of a personal drama rather than "saving the world" kind of thing.But never less, as I said - still the best movie in recent years.

The only movie I've seen four times at the theater, Deadpool and Wolverine is a near perfect film ... and absolutely perfect for the kind of movie it was trying to be. I am being quite serious in this assessment, even giving myself a few weeks after the first time I saw it (during my stay in New York City) before posting this sort of praise publicly about a movie that was just supposed to be silly fun.Why is it so great? I think it just scratches a lot of different itches. The initial viewing had me coming away thinking there was a crap story at the core of the movie but everything else was so good to more than make up for that weakness. From the second time on, though, I caught and appreciated more of the plot, even to the point of getting emotional in the final action sequence (and it wasn't just because Madonna was playing in the background). Love, as is always the case in Deadpool movies, lies at the center of all the adolescent jokes and fourth-wall breaking.Even this latest time at the theater, the folks seated to my right were having a grand ol' time, laughing at all the funny parts and "oohing" at all the... ooohy parts, and it's been a couple of months since the movie premiered. I think it's just that Ryan Reynolds goes "hey wouldn't it be great if we did that" and Kevin Feige has been "yes, go for it" around 95% of the time. Who knew that artists can make great art when permitted, right?Hugh Jackman brings his top-shelf acting game (when does he not?) to the story, making tragedy and redemption a believable part of a very self-aware cinematic experience. It's about as good as I've ever seen at combining winks at the audience with complete emotional investment by them.I really appreciate what Reynolds has been able to do, both in bringing Deadpool into mainstream culture and with almost single-handedly resurrecting the MCU. I mean, he is Marvel Jesus, you know.

What a crazy experience it was.. the movie was amazing.Beautifully made thank you note for FOX studios for their share of marvel movies. The studio threw everything in this movie from star cast, R-rated gore action, and amazing CAMEOS.If you have seen the comic con footage you already know some of the returning heroes but there is 1 that just blew me away. The cameos were surprisingly well executed. The guys knew what they were doing. I think it serves as a final goodbye for some characters while merging others in MCU.RR is perfect deadpool and HJ is perfect wolverine and their combination in this movie is beyond awesome. The NSYNC intro is very deadpool.I hope we see more of deadpool and wolverine in future installment and CABLE too (he is my fav) !!

For a start I loved the first two Deadpool movies, the second was even better than the first. But the third? Deadpool vs Wolverine is entertaining, but what it lacks is any depth or useful plot. There is plenty of comedy, and this movie is funny, but therein lies the problem. Instead of effective jokes this movie depends too heavily on over the top gross out violence and over use of Deadpool's breaking of the the 4th wall. Just like the myriad of cameos in this film its fine, but only works once, because it all leaves nothing to go back to.Both previous Deadpool movies had more involving plots, characters and better jokes. This movie has those things, just not done as well, and perhaps being done too often; proving the rule that more does not always mean better.Another area where this movie fails is its secondary characters. In previous movies these have always been played straight, against which Deadpool can be juxtaposed. But the TVA (a time travel police) are faux comedic and fumbling, and along with other characters give the movie the feeling of being an extended farce rather than an good action movie with great comedy. And that is something the first two Deadpool movies got right.If you like Deadpool, go see this movie. You will enjoy it. But you may find afterwards no particular desire for a repeat viewing.

Deadpool and Wolverine has been long in the making over the years in Hollywood and after six long years of waiting since Deadpool 2, I can proudly say that I absolutely loved this film and what it represents to a lot of people. Especially comic book fans like me. After bringing almost everyone back to life using Cables time traveling device in the credits of Deadpool 2, Wade Wilson has stepped down from his vigilante/superhero alias known as Deadpool and becomes a used car salesman after a nasty breakup with Vanessa. When the TVA from Loki comes knocking on his doorstep one day after finding out about his abuse of time travel, Deadpool is brought to the TVA and offered a chance to finally join the MCU like he's always wanted. When the TVA informs him that his universe is dying due to the death of Logan/Wolverine from Logan (2017) and that a statistic TVA Agent known as Mr. Paradox wants to speed up the process of his dying universe in order to protect the Sacred Timeline, it's up to Deadpool to go on a mission throughout the multiverse to recruit a variant of Wolverine to help him save his universe from extinction. So for starters, Ryan Reynolds as Wade Wilson/Deadpool has never been better this time around, while still having some of the same charm from the previous films. Hugh Jackman returning as a new variant of Wolverine was the biggest highlight and standout of the entire film and I will always be grateful that he returned at least one more time to do everything that he has ever wanted to accomplish as the character Wolverine. Especially when it came to his comic accurate costumes from the different variants of Wolverine we see throughout the film. Emma Corrin as Cassandra Nova I thought personally was one of the best villains we have had in the MCU in a long while, even though we didn't get much of a backstory for her character, she still had a menacing presence and also managed to have some of the funniest lines in the whole film, which is hard most of the time to do as a villain. When it comes to the cameos in this movie, I will say without a doubt, this movie did not disappoint at all and did justice for certain characters that will be remembered for years to come. As far as any cons goes, other than a few shots of CGI that I figured was done on purpose for the sake of the film and a few choices of dialogue, there is not much at all to complain about with this film. Overall, Deadpool and Wolverine is the most fan serviced movie I've ever seen in my life, that gave us all everything we could of asked for, while also giving us everything we didn't know we needed as well and will go down as one of the greatest comic book movies of all time. Rating 9/10.

I had never seen a Deadpool movie before, and had until recently found Ryan Reynolds to be really annoying. I first started appreciating him with Free Guy, and since then have loved everything I've seen him in (the Hitman movies, even the kid-centric If). I went to this one based on the previews i had seen and the INTENSE marketing that was being done by both Reynolds and Hugh Jackman. My biggest fear was that (as so often happens) the best lines were given away in the previews, and I would suffer in silence through a really terrible movie. Boy, was I wrong. I don't think I've laughed that hard all the way through a movie in years. The fast talking Reynolds is one thing, but his aside are something completely different. He comes up with turns of phrase that catch you by surprise and make you fall out of your seat with laughter despite yourself. He is a provocateur but in the BEST possible way.I won't give ANYTHING away here. You really need to see it for yourself, and I hope you do. It is absurd and silly and filthy and subversive. And it is JUST what I needed.

The last time I was excited to see a Marvel movie was Spider-man: No Way Home. Deadpool & Wolverine definitely brought the MCU back a sense of relevancy and allure to the big Marvel movie considering the state of the MCU the last few years. I'm happy to say, the movie delivered almost everything.A pretty fast paced movie, where the journey, when you think about it, didn't really go too far. Movie starts off with the classic, how did we get to this moment. After some confusing exposition in the beginning trying to tie up everything in time travel, we get to the famous scene in the trailer where Ryan Reynolds tells the audience that pegging isn't new to him, but it is for Disney, and then there we go off to the races.Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds definitely let their bromancy chemistry out on the set, and Jackman delivers another Logan style Wolverine character. The tortured wanderer. It was very fitting for the roll, where the movie acknowledges just how powerful 'Logan' actually was.The humor is back, but there are a lot of spots where Deadpool takes a backseat to the others on screen, where he is more of the setup guy for others to steal the show. Channing Tatum and Wesley Snipes have to be acknowledged for how they delivered on their parts and having Dafne Keen reprise her role definitely bridges the movie extremely well with 'Logan'.Regards to my Title, its not Ryan Reynolds that is Marvel Jesus. He's the catalyst sure. The irreverence and 4th wall breaks definitely brings the fun back to the MCU, but its Hugh Jackman's performance. The movie may revolve around Deadpool's universe, but without the heart, character, and depth of Jackman's Wolverine, there is no movie here. Definitely worth a Theater trip. Hope you enjoy.

From the opening dance sequence to the cameo of the year (no not that cameo or that cameo but THAT cameo) to the million plus Easter eggs, this film is a millennial nerd's dream movie. I choose not to have statistics on my side when I say it broke the record for number of times the fourth wall was broken. Strategically gruesome, nostalgic, encouraging, hilarious, and contrary to the one's that want to get offended for the sake of being offended it's a phenomenal movie. The nods at the comic books made me so happy. I'm thankful to have seen this opening night to avoid any spoilers on the internet because there are sooooo many to be had!

DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE, the third in the Ryan Reynolds-starring series, pulls out all the stops by teaming up the wisecracking superhero with none other than Hugh Jackman's Wolverine, who we all thought was finished after the events of LOGAN. Well, I'm glad he came back for another stab at the role, because this is the funniest and most frenetic superhero movie I've seen since THE SUICIDE SQUAD. Reynolds is on fine form here and Jackman is even better, stealing all of his scenes as the increasingly weary antihero. The plot is nondescript, but the endless cameos are particularly welcome and the sheer amount of screen carnage counts for plenty. Jolly good fun!

Top three the worst movies I have ever watched.Very poor comedy, stories are for child. So boring listening and waiting for good scene, but never happened.To many inappropriate words.To much touching middle part.To much speaking in every scene. Maybe was one scene where wolverine make the point with less words, otherwise other scenes was very bad. All the time pointless stories, very bad jokes.Even at the beginning it was so bad, that moves, slow motiooooon commooooooooon.This was so bad, i cannot believe I was 2 hours if my life on this.Reputation of Hugh Jackman with this movie is disturbed.

The movie was very enjoyable and funny, right from the first second. The cameos, the chemistry between Jackman and Reynolds, the fourth wall breaks, anything you may expect from a Deadpool movie. Even my boyfriend enjoyed it, and he ain't a superhero movie fan. I have seen all the marvel movies and we watched deadpool 1 & 2 and the Wolverine origins story so before watching this movie, just so he knew a little better what to expect. And it seemed to be enough to enjoy the movie. There were a few jokes that went over his head but he didn't care about that. We had a wonderful evening and I will watch it again when it arrives on disney+.

Starts off stronger than any other Marvel movie in my opinion with one of the best opening scenes. Then the movie starts to play it safe in the sense of forcing the plot as opposed to letting it develop naturally. The pacing is also up and down between great action, shoving in plot, and then starts to fall short a tad when trying to become serious in tone. However, there's lot of surprises and typical Deadpool fun, but sometimes leads to a couple moments that I'm a huge fan of in terms of direction... 8/10. It's one of the best MCU entries since Endgame, but leaves a little more to be desired in terms of the third act in the sense that it feels like the movie was building up to more than what we got.

Expect the usual mix of 'realism' undercut by copious amounts of breaking the fourth wall which constantly reminds you that you are watching actors act in a film which has a commercial imperative. Suspend disbelief then have have the rope holding you up severed. Rinse and repeat, to good effect. This makes the Marvel universe (MCU) cross-promotion not just palatable but also enjoyable. Any cynicism by the audience is anticipated by Deadpool (played by Ryan Reynolds) and it is he who lands the first blow.Not having watched any trailers for this film beforehand, I went to the cinema without any advanced knowledge of what happens. I'd already forgotten the previous Deadpool films but I've reviewed them both here and liked the first one more than it's sequel. This might be my new favourite in this franchise.I had seen clips or read somewhere how Reynolds was mindful of not tarnishing the memory of Wolverine (played by Hugh Jackman) as seen in that superhero's last solo outing. I hadn't even remembered that Wolverine had died there but the flashback to this scene in this Deadpool film reminded me that I think I've seen that film...and given it a good review on this site. Fans of Wolverine concerned with this issue have a Pyrrhic victory on that front, in a manner of speaking.It looks like I've missed a few new developments in the MCU, especially with regard to the TVA (Time Variance Authority). They seem to be a temporal equivalent to parking inspectors or "grey ghosts", as they are known in Melbourne, Australia. Maybe. I won't give away the plot but it is up to Deadpool to save the universe. Mind, Deadpool will often tell you that he isn't the type of person to the save the world. And the world is a bit smaller than the universe.What's appealing about this sequel is that it seems that Deadpool often appears to address me, personally, a casual fan of some of the MCU. He's like me in that often he doesn't have a clue who some of these other superheroes are. He'll ask them to introduce themselves, which is helpful to both of us.The first big 'reveal' of a potential ally for D & W in The Void drew a blank from me, until he did his superhero thing and I could place him (I could dimly remember that character from a rather uninspired film from prior to the MCU, some many decades ago). In other words, I couldn't put a name to the character but the character rang a bell.Another time I was more on the ball. A black character appears in The Void and I could pick the character, I felt, without the need for an introduction. Reading the actor's name in the end credits was a surprise...it would seem that AI was used to represent him, along the lines of what was done for Harrison Ford in some scenes of the last Indiana Jones film. Basically, the look of this character triggered my recall of him from a film that I don't really remember, having seen it many decades ago.Back to Deadpool being helpful to casual viewers, there's an amusing scene where he pointedly says what I'm thinking when a superhero is speaking English in a thick French accent ("thick" along the lines of that Spanish character in the sitcom Blackadder).As for Wolverine, well, Jackman has a chest like a barrel in this film, which makes me wonder whether he has kept in shape since his last turn as Wolverine or he got into shape for this film. Not being immersed in all things Marvel, the significance of the pairing of Deadpool and Wolverine was no doubt wasted on me. Personally speaking, a pairing more likely to make me cream in my jeans would be Deadpool and Tom Baker era Doctor Who. Both characters are mouthy, irreverent and go about saving the world. They just do it in vastly different ways. Deadpool can't do it without spilling Olympic-size swimming pool amounts of blood and gore. Lots of people die. However, Doctor Who does have a particular set of skills well adapted to the direction the MCU has gone with this film and elsewhere. Having AI do some of the VFX for the representation of Tom Baker would be ideal too.Other match-ups would no doubt infuriate Marvel nerds due to how anti-climactic they are.This was a fun and enjoyable film. I could probably watch it again for pleasure, not just because I often missed lines of dialogue here, for whatever reason, whilst in the cinema. Blu-ray would be my choice on that front, just so that I could enable subtitles when the dialogue isn't clear.If you like jokey, fourth wall breaking stories with plenty of blood and your favourite superhero frequently French kissing an ugly dog, then this is the film for you. When it was attempting to be serious, it did pull that off with feeling.Notes to self:In the end credits, two people are mentioned...Len Wein as a "significant contributor" to the X-Men and Raymond Chan, who is described as "an anchor", in the sense intended by its use in the film.Towards the end of the film, I was thinking that it would end with a plot hole but it didn't.That dramatic finale was very nicely done, in how it misdirected our expectations.Mad Max is referenced in the film and some of the scenes made me wonder how it could have so similar transport to the recent Furiosa film, which they presumably would not have had access to when they were making this.The use of snippets of existing songs got ridiculous towards the end. It's as if they realised that they needed to meet a quota for a double album soundtrack for the film and had to get cracking in the last few minutes to do that. .Rated MA15+ in Australia. This is presumably the same film that is rated R in the US.The man on dog tongue action was way too much for me.

Deadpool's formal introduction to the MCU is just as fun as his previous two outings. Wolverine (and a slew of other characters from the Fox era of Marvel) only added to the bloody, profanity ridden chaos. The story was simple but adequate for the film. The action is probably the best from the series. Each fight is truly a joy to watch. The opening is one of the highlights from the trilogy. The film also manages to bring a great soundtrack. The only bad thing about the film that I can think of off the top of my head is the lack of some of the previous X-force members. Left me kinda dissapointed. All in all a great film - a wonderful send off to the Fox era. Probably the best in the trilogy. Highly recommened :)

Deadpool & Wolverine" attempted to blend the irreverent humor of Deadpool with the iconic, brooding demeanor of Wolverine, but the execution fell flat on multiple levels. The film suffered from a disjointed narrative that struggled to balance the tonal extremes of both characters, leading to a patchwork of inconsistent humor and forced drama. The reliance on over-the-top action sequences, typical of superhero films, overshadowed character development and meaningful plot progression. Additionally, the reliance on gratuitous fan service and self-referential jokes often felt lazy, distracting from deeper storytelling. The chemistry between the leads was overshadowed by a lack of cohesive vision from the direction, rendering what should have been an exciting collaboration into a convoluted, uninspired mess. Overall, instead of delivering the comedic-savvy and emotional engagement fans expected, it left viewers with a hollow cinematic experience that missed the mark entirely.

A primary example of how to perfectly execute a 2 hour runtime on a movie, no second wasted. Absolutely top tier action packed with smart and hitting humor, just hearing the songs used throughout the movie made me giggle at the very least.Story-wise, it may not be on par with Infinity War and Endgame (the 2 hour runtime definitely affected the movie's core), but it was perfect for what it is, and what it's supposed to be. Everybody involved with the movie effing delivered and nailed it. They were able to fit both Deadpool & Wolverine's individual story arcs in one, 2 hour movie, and in a way that still makes us feel for the characters. The cameos were just sweet bonuses!

This movie was hilarious. The action was well done and the comedy was strong. Seeing Deadpool and Wolverine together on screen was great and I wasn't disappointed with their onscreen dynamic. They did a nice job with cameos. The writing around Wolverine was very interesting. I will say the movie was the max amount of gore and raunchyness I can take in a movie while still enjoying the film overall. Some of the screen where they mix violence and humor like the opening fight sequence was graphically disturbing at points. I honestly don't think I could watch that movie with my son even if he was 17. So a mixed bag. I wish they would have toned that gore and sexual content down to less than half. It was alot.

My ratings are usually aligned with critics' ratings, so I typically trust them. But because the disparity between them and the "people's ratings" was so significant, I knew something was amiss. It's a comedy, which can be judged incorrectly since humor is highly subjective, and I enjoyed the previous Deadpools, so I had to investigate the reason for such a discrepancy myself. My hunch was accurate. It's a 9. If you were to be critical, an 8 is acceptable. But any lower rating is intentionally downvoting. My conjecture is that it's because there's a scene that displays a "coexist" sticker incorporating Islamic and Jewish symbols, which might offend individuals siding with Israelis or Palestinians. If you're evaluating solely based on the film's merits, it's a very good movie.

Movies can be made to surprise, touch, entertain and a whole lot more. They can frighten you, put a smile on your face or be the talk on any given place discussing the art some movies can stand out to be.Regardless of the type of movie, those that stand out all have one thing in common. The pleasure, love and attention that directors, actors and all who make a movie put in. And by God, did they do a great job at this Deadpool movie.Deadpool & Wolverine is just a blast. It is made by people who, without anything holding back, made a MCU masterpiece that hasn't been seen since Endgame. The sheer pleasure that was put into this movie is visualized in every scene and put in every line of text and tips the scale into a solid 9.Is it the best story ever told? Nope. Is it oscar material? Nope. Will this movie be remembered in 10 years? Nope. But did I have a great movienight with stunning scnes, epic fights, briljant jokes and cameo galore? A hard yes!!

"Deadpool and Wolverine" delivers on its promises of humor, comedy, and action. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have fantastic chemistry, and their interplay provides plenty of laughs and thrilling moments. The movie excels in its comedy, with witty dialogue and clever fourth-wall-breaking scenes that keep the audience entertained throughout.Cameos and references are spot-on, adding a layer of fun for fans of the broader Marvel universe. However, the film's story doesn't make a significant impact on the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) as a whole. The introduction of the term "nexus" is intriguing but lacks sufficient explanation, leaving its implications on Earth somewhat ambiguous.Overall, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is a hilarious and enjoyable summer popcorn movie, perfect for fans looking for a fun ride without heavy narrative weight.

Deadpool and Wolverine is pretty much what you expect, with a few clever twists and some let downs. It's a Deadpool movie, so there is a lot of vulgar jokes and one liners asides and inside innuendo about superhero movies, drugs, sex, and violence. It's also a team-up with Wolverine from the Fox Films X-Men film franchise, and so he brings a more nuanced darker subtler tone with dramatic A-list acting. But, it's also a Disney/Marvel film and contains the ever-confusing multiverse.The combination is a strange film that doesn't always work...but so what? It's fun as hell! Deadpool and Wolverine run around the multiverse battling villains and heroes, some new some old, from multiple superhero movies. They also deal with Professor Xavier's evil sister, and a bureaucrat from the multiverse with his own agenda. All to save Deadpool's timeline - which can only happen if a Wolverine who destroyed his timeline can snap out of his depression.While there are probably a few too may corny jokes the middle of this film that get kind of old - near the end the two heroes have to battle an army of Deadpools...which is a flat out a hoot and anyone who says otherwise is crazy. It's really hard not to appreciate how much fan service they do in this film - and how great Hugh Jackman is as Wolverine.When the film is over - you're glad Hugh Jackman has been brought into the Marvel universe and you absolutely want to see more films with him. Would love to see him team up with Spider-Man, for example. Who knows...just keep casting him as Wolverine "til he's 90!"

Deadpool & Wolverine is an absolute blast! This film perfectly captures the irreverent humor of Deadpool while seamlessly integrating the brooding intensity of Wolverine. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is off the charts, delivering a dynamic duo that's both hilarious and action-packed.The plot is a wild ride through time and space, filled with unexpected twists and turns. The film doesn't take itself too seriously, embracing its comic book roots with tongue-in-cheek references and meta-humor. The action sequences are thrilling, showcasing the characters' unique abilities in creative and visually stunning ways.While some might argue that the film leans heavily on fan service, it's hard to deny the pure enjoyment of seeing these iconic characters share the screen. Deadpool & Wolverine is a must-watch for fans of the Marvel universe and anyone looking for a good laugh and adrenaline rush.Highlights:Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman's incredible on-screen chemistry Non-stop action and hilarious humor Creative and visually stunning fight sequences.

No coherent story, no logic or explanation why things happen. Excessive use of f-word. Completely silly plot turns. Symphony of bloodbaths underlined with 90s pop music. I don't know where to stop. Very sad performance by Hugh Jackman. All in all a terrible movie. Nice acting by Emma Corrin as the bad character and surprised how well Channing Tatum pulled his completely ridiculous side character.I just cannot reconcile what I saw with an average rating of 8.1 and all these reviews between 8-10. Maybe if you are intimately familiar with the marvel universe you might be able to find deeper meaning. I can't. If it wasn't for the 20 minutes nap in the middle it would have been a complete was of time.

I mean, if you've seen the others, just go see it! It does bring some characters from the past, which I was shocked to see.... Ryan does a brilliant job at bringing Deadpool to life.And I can't help but LOVE how they manage to sneak little jokes or things I grew up on (like music taste)! And I mean who would not wanna see Ryan doing Nysnc dance moves!And oh my gosh.... Dogpool!!!!!! I freaking adore her. And her tongue, my goodness.... If you like the witty character, cheesy old music, awesome story line, and a few laughs.... Just go see the dang film!And the chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine, chefs kiss!

Being a tech nerd and a Marvel fan is like living in a playground of endless possibilities. You're constantly surrounded by the latest gadgets, innovations, and stories of epic heroes and villains. It's a thrilling mix of exploring the cutting-edge and diving deep into fantastical worlds where anything can happen.The new Deadpool and Wolverine movie adds an extra layer of excitement. It's not just about seeing two iconic characters team up; it's a nostalgic trip back to the days when you were a tween, and pop culture was at its peak. It reminds you of those legendary moments, like debating who was better: Backstreet Boys or *NSYNC. That rivalry was as intense as any superhero showdown, and just like in those days, choosing a side was half the fun. Now, watching Deadpool and Wolverine brings that same energy back, blending the old with the new in a way that only true fans can fully appreciate.

I loved it from start to finish!Just simply so much fun, with a surprising amount of heart. I expected to laugh, but did not expect a few moments to make me a little teary-eyed.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman play perfectly off each other. The fights, the dialogue, humor, surprises, music, dancing, the dog, etc, all made me happy.Loved the cameos! Shocked to see so many. Even more so the old favorites who became secondary characters. Really loved the respect paid to old favorites, both movies and characters.Until you're 90! I'm in.Honestly, I really hope we see Deadpool & Wolverine in future MCU projects. Bring Shawn Levy along too.

Really enjoyed it but had one major issue. Why would TVA even take him in with choice to go somewhere else? Just him live his life until you wipe it out. Duh. Lol.Was good seeing and hearing all the easter eggs and cameos. I'm not hating on other marvel movies or shows that have happened recently because I go for entertainment and I have a life. Not one dedicated to keyboard warrior mentality of bashing everything. That said though, this was a great mornings entertainment. Other than the plot hole I don't have anything really negative that comes to mind. Go see it and enjoy. I'm looking forward to what's to come next.

Simply fantastic. A true love letter to the Fox Universe. Which is ironic considering many fans were ready to put all that behind them. Shout out to Marvel Studios for truly respecting, and embracing what came before. Without going into spoilers, this film managed to balance the comedy of Deadpool, and also give us enough emotional beats with Wolverine to truly deliver an amazing film. The 2nd act slowed things down abit, as the void set piece seemed to drag the film a little bit. That's my only nitpick of this movie. If you're a diehard Marvel fan you'll love it. If you are a film fan in general you'll like it.

The first Deadpool created such a cult that Shawn Levy overused all those spices which makes the dish tasteless, even worse than Deadpool 2. Slangs, DC and Disney mocking, knives in the balls or butt - it's like a flavour spice, it gives you a comic relief at most in few scenes. Here the whole movie is about that. Good movies need good villains. Character building. Emotions and drama. This villain - whoever it is paradox or that girl, it's worthless, no character building, no emotion, no drama, just superhero stuff. Multivereses are truly death of storytelling, everything is possible in it. Bring back whomever you want, make dead people alive, it looses all the authenticity. People got so overhyped they got fomo and wrote good reviews. Truth is - this movie is Sh8T.

Get ready to laugh until your sides hurt with Deadpool & Wolverine (2024)! Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman team up for an epic bromance that's as action-packed as it is hysterical. Picture Deadpool's razor-sharp wit clashing with Wolverine's grumpy growls - it's a superhero buddy comedy for the ages! We watched it at RoadHouse Cinemas in Scottsdale, where the recliners are as comfy as Deadpool's red suit and the nachos are as cheesy as his jokes. This film has everything: explosive action, fourth-wall-breaking humor, and unexpected plot twists that'll keep you guessing. Whether you're a Marvel fanatic or just in need of a good laugh, Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) is a must-watch. Trust us, you won't want to miss this wild ride!We at 66 the FIX are huge movie fans, and when it comes to Ryan Reynolds, we watch all of his films. The Deadpool series is hysterically funny, loaded with action - it's the action comic anti-hero for grownups to enjoy. Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) is a fantastic addition to the lineup. Sure, it had its ups and downs and some familiar tricks, but that's what makes the Deadpool films so special, and we absolutely loved it.We give Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) 5 out of 5 stars and 10 out of 10 stars! For a more in-depth look at the movie, check out the full review on our website. You won't be disappointed!

Woe, honestly wow. This movie was phenomenal. It was hyped and hyped for a reason. I have not laughed that long for a movie in ages. The amount of cameos and giving other characters a second chance it was absolutely amazing. I have no words to describe it, I don't know what to say. There were no bad things about this movie only good and watching back on the credits made me realise how much I loved watching the x men movies during covid 19. And it's soo sad that disney has brought fox and it is the end of x men movies unless disney want make some, but it will never be as good as the fox x men movies. Overall best movie I have seen In a while. In fact I will even say best movie this year. And definitely my favourite deadpool movie.

I love this movie. Deadpool is super hilarious. But Wolverine is more of a man then Deadpool. This movie has some odd couple and I heard it was supposed to be called Deadpool and Friend, which is crazy. This movie was a little sad though. And I feel bad for Deadpool. But sadly I didn't watch the first and second Deadpool but I still got the movie. Who doesn't love the song at the beginning? If you don't you're weird. I can't wait for this to come out on streaming on Apple TV on October 1st. When I mean it is weird that an X-man teams up with a not even Avenger it is weird. In conclusion, this movie is great!I would recommend to a friend!

Rarely can a movie make you crap your pants laughing, and later bring you to tears. What a perfect combination this is. Deadpool comedy in this movie is perfection. In the previous movies I found him a bit too much, too over the top, too crude. What ever it was I always like him, but didn't love him.But he slays it in this one... and Wolverine... WOLVERINE!. Didn't know i missed you so much. Wow Hugh Jackman can act... Amongst all this insane story, action, comedy there is an amazing redemption story.I loved it so much. I found the writing to be so smart. Always calling out when there was too much exposition. Never afraid to talk trash to anybody. The fourth wall breaks were so my favorite. Talking trash on Disney, Fox, calling out Ryan's wife. Man that had me in tears.Go see it!!!!

Even with my hyper-limited knowledge of anything MCU-related since 2021, Deadpool & Wolverine felt so refreshingly joyous, unabashedly madcap, filled with heart, laughs and glorious colour. A genuine celebration of Marvel's legacy that is sure to tickle you down under, one that reminds us old-school Marvelites of the highest highs and the biggest misfires. With extremely bloody violence, dirty humour, incredible performances, complete savagery and absolute love of the superhero genre, Deadpool & Wolverine functions as a beautiful closing farewell to two of its MVPs yet simultaneously looks towards the future with the highest of hopes.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" (2024) is a cinematic mess that epitomizes everything wrong with modern blockbuster filmmaking. The plot is paper-thin, barely holding together the chaotic barrage of characters crammed into every scene. The overuse of humor, which is Deadpool's signature, backfires spectacularly here, rendering once sharp wit into a tiresome, repetitive slog. It's like they threw every joke at the wall, hoping something would stick-spoiler: nothing did.The storyline is predictable, devoid of any tension or genuine surprises. It's almost as if the writers decided to lean on fan service and overwhelming references instead of crafting a compelling narrative. Speaking of which, the constant barrage of references is not clever; it's lazy, and it suffocates any chance of originality.To make matters worse, the film indulges in excessive violence and vulgar language, seemingly to shock, but it ends up feeling gratuitous and hollow. This is not edgy or daring-it's simply overdone. The special effects, while technically impressive, are also overused to the point where they lose their impact, blending into the chaotic noise that is the rest of the film.In short, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is an exhausting, disappointing experience that relies too heavily on cheap thrills and shallow humor, leaving any semblance of substance behind. It's a weak, overstuffed, and ultimately forgettable entry in the superhero genre.

Whew, where to start!? First, this movie had everything you want in a Deadpool film: Action, Raunchy Humor, "normal people humor", a plot worthy of a hero, dozens of Easter eggs and so many cameos you can't catch all of it the first time you watch. Gen X & Older Millennials will be tickled seeing familiar faces and hearing so many references. The opening credits scene was epic to a level of perfection that can't be described, and you will never listen to that song the same way again.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman exceeded expectations with their acting and chemistry on screen. Casting and acting all around was perfect. I can say without a doubt any other storyline, or a different set of characters, wouldn't have been able pull of this level of perfection. Prepare to laugh from your belly, cry some ugly tears, and cheer loudly for 2 hours.

I'd say that the saddest part of this film is that it didn't happen 15 years ago, except that it did... And everything between now and then had to happen the way it did to create this gem. I didn't think DP 1 or 2 were particularly great. Reynolds tends to beat stupid jokes to death, and others are just so superficially in the toilet, they're just not funny (I'm thinking especially about shirt cocking it, and Juggernauts electric cheeks). DP 3 has the same humor missteps, but frankly not as many, and there's a lot of very well treated cameos that somehow fit the setting and the story. It's certainly a parody of an MCU that has become a parody of itself, but it was treated smartly, and I think only Reynolds could do it... But it's lightning in a bottle and I doubt they could catch it twice.Jackman and Reynolds truly were born for this movie. Their charisma is enough on their own, but together they're truly on fire. A clear example of how the right actors at the right time, with the right chemistry, and the right cameos can make a movie truly memorable.Will it hold up? To everyone watching it this year, I believe it will. To anyone watching it for the first time in 10 or 15 years? Time will tell but I have my doubts. Hell, I'm not that young, so for me it's a part of my post COVID happy time memories.Now, will it save the MCU? Not a chance. Disney had no part in making this film great, and seeing some of what's on the horizon for their upcoming MCU films gives me serious doubt. This film was all Reynolds and Jackman. Enjoy it for what it is.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a cinematic masterpiece that captures the essence of Marvel's beloved characters while delivering an exhilarating blend of action, humor, and heartfelt moments. This film is not just a treat for die-hard Marvel fans but also a remarkable standalone experience that will captivate anyone who appreciates top-notch storytelling and character development.One of the standout elements of this movie is the dynamic bond between Deadpool and Wolverine. From the very first scene, their chemistry is palpable. The film brilliantly juxtaposes Deadpool's irreverent humor and unpredictability with Wolverine's stoic and gritty demeanor. This odd couple pairing works wonders, providing endless entertainment and depth to the narrative. Their interactions are a delightful mix of banter, camaraderie, and poignant moments, showcasing a friendship forged in the crucible of shared battles and mutual respect. It's not just their banter that stands out, but the evolution of their relationship that adds a layer of emotional resonance to the film.The attention to detail in "Deadpool & Wolverine" is another aspect that deserves praise. Particularly during the void scenes, where the characters navigate through surreal, liminal spaces, the background details are nothing short of mesmerizing. Each scene is meticulously crafted, with subtle nods and Easter eggs that pay homage to the broader Marvel universe. These intricate details enrich the viewing experience, inviting fans to rewatch the film multiple times to catch every hidden reference and nuanced visual cue. Whether it's a fleeting glimpse of a familiar artifact or a cleverly placed poster, these small details contribute to the film's immersive atmosphere and underline the filmmakers' dedication to their craft.A highlight of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is the ingenious way it brings old Marvel characters into the fold. The movie seamlessly integrates these beloved figures into the storyline, creating a sense of nostalgia while propelling the plot forward. Each character is introduced with care, and their appearances are woven into the narrative in a way that feels organic and meaningful. This thoughtful inclusion not only pays respect to the rich history of the Marvel universe but also enriches the film's tapestry, making it a true celebration of Marvel's legacy.Perhaps the most striking aspect of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is its energy. The film possesses a vibrancy and momentum that are reminiscent of Marvel's monumental "Infinity War" and "Endgame." It manages to balance high-stakes action with moments of levity and introspection, creating a rollercoaster of emotions that keeps the audience on the edge of their seats. The pacing is masterful, ensuring that each scene packs a punch, whether it's a jaw-dropping action sequence, a heartfelt character moment, or a hilarious exchange of dialogue. This energy is infectious, drawing viewers into the story and making them feel like they are part of the Marvel universe.In conclusion, "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a triumph of filmmaking that stands tall among Marvel's best. The bond between Deadpool and Wolverine is the heart of the film, providing a perfect balance of humor and heart. The meticulous background details, especially in the void scenes, enhance the visual storytelling and invite viewers to immerse themselves fully in the world of the film. The inclusion of old Marvel characters adds depth and nostalgia, enriching the narrative and connecting it to the broader Marvel lore. And above all, the film's energy is electrifying, capturing the same magic that made "Infinity War" and "Endgame" unforgettable. "Deadpool & Wolverine" is a must-watch for any Marvel fan, offering an exhilarating, heartfelt, and thoroughly entertaining cinematic experience.

The film is very funny, intriguing, entertaining and emotional! I highly recommend, we watched it right after the premiere with my fiance, who doesn't like this type of film, but this one definitely fascinates her. I would watch it again and again, the opening cut is a real diamond. Anyone who wants to enjoy true humor should definitely give this film a chance. Nostalgia and the past time in which it transports you are exceptional as an emotion, it takes us back to a very long time (when we were young :)). Whoever hesitates to go and watch it will not be mistaken. And the dogpool is extremely sweetis extremely sweet.

So first of all, don't get me wrong. This movie is a lot of fun with great action sequences from start to finish and even though I hate relying on cameos and references, it's still surprising and nice to see some of those faces in the MCU.But, this movie with 5 writers still can't escape the trap of post-Endgame Marvel scripts. This movie is actually the epitome of what's wrong with the last two phases of the MCU. They messed up with Doctor Strange 2 once by making the movie just 2 hours and not giving ample time to anything, and they somehow did the same thing here.This movie is actually the Multiverse of Madness people were expecting. Fans will rejoice seeing what fanservice they're gonna throw at them in this movie. But all of them are the at cost of the plot.Just like Spider-Man: No Way Home, if you already didn't see the problem with the writing of this movie and think it's great or a masterpiece because they did some cameos, you're definitely gonna see the cracks in the plot with the second viewing when you're not just focused on the eye-candy action scenes and cameos.The biggest problem with this movie is exposition. This movie's dialogues have the subtlety of a hand grenade. It looks like the head writer of this movie is dyslexic and while reading the guide to writing a script, mistakenly read "Tell, don't show" instead. Because my God this whole movie is a big giant exposition. And no, being self-aware and meta about it doesn't excuse it when everybody in this movie is just expositing. This movie had a budget of $200 million, but they didn't have the budget to shoot more scenes for at the very least the Wolverine of this movie? Even he exposits his backstory as if his name isn't in the title and isn't one of the main characters. "I guess just saying some lines is enough for the audience to care about the characters", the writers thought to themselves. And I guess 70% of the budget went to the cameo actors.At least with the Multiverse of Madness, we had the backstory of Scarlet Witch from WandaVision and it was the same character we've seen since 2014. This Wolverine is a whole new character that I already forgot about what happened in his universe, because guess what, they don't show you anything, just him talking about it. They rely on your beforehand knowledge of his character for you to sympathize with him and care about him. But sorry, it just doesn't cut it for me.Even if we are to compare this movie to Deadpool 2, this movie still pales in comparison, and I didn't even like Deadpool 2 that much either. Now Deadpool 2 seems like a really good movie after watching this. Somehow this is the worst of all three Deadpool films. At the very least I can respect Deadpool 2 for actually having the semblance of a plot with a somewhat well-written villain and new characters like Cable, whom they actually Showed his backstory instead of him only dropping some exposition every 10 minutes! That movie didn't have to rely on 20 years of pop culture to trick the audience into thinking they were watching a competent film. They actually went and wrote a real plot for a movie that actually feels like a movie based on stories and characters from comic books, and gave them decent characterization unlike this movie.But this movie barely has any plot. Just like Multiverse of Madness and No Way Home, this movie finds a lame excuse to throw multiverse into the mix so that we can have cameo galore. And I really really hate the whole world-ending plot every single superhero movie and show has. It was already lame and trite 10 years ago, and it still is. I roll my eyes every time the goal of the villain of these movies and shows is to destroy the fabric of the universe. I bet they're gonna come up with a world-ending plot for the finale of their new Daredevil show too, can't wait to see that masterpiece!It is also funny that this whole movie revolves around the TVA and the Void, and the movie has cameos you wouldn't've even dreamt of, but they somehow don't even mention or involve Loki here.
