It's weird since with what happens in the finale of Loki, you'd think this would be the perfect movie to actually mention him or something, but nope.Like I said, if this movie was longer and they actually developed Wolverine's character a bit to make us care about him instead of relying on previous movies and distracting us with cameos, and maybe instead of having Wolverine fight Deadpool every 15 minutes (which were really good nonetheless), you actually spent some time with that Wolverine and did more with him, it would've made the movie a lot better and more competent. But unfortunately, nothing's changed and the latest Marvel movie still suffers from barely having a plot and competent script.Overall, while this movie is really fun to watch and has great action scenes and some surprising cameos, the plot is nearly nonexistent, the characters are one-dimensional, and the overall script and the dialogue are awful. You can basically call this film "Exposition: The Movie" and you wouldn't be wrong. If you're a hardcore superhero fan and MCU fanboy who still likes the movies after Endgame for some reason and only cares about cameos and pop culture references, you're gonna love this. But if you're tired of the same superhero movie with the same plot and are actually expecting a movie that feels like a movie that has a competent plot and decent dialogue and characterization, you're gonna be sorely disappointed.

Look right to the point if you're one of these easily offended Gen Z people, Go away, this movie isn't for you. Maybe go watch My Little Pony, or something else... It will upset your poor itty bitty fee fees and doesn't apologize for it. As many people can tell from the 1's and 2's ratings, a lot of that came from the aforementioned easilyt offended Gen Z crowd. Ignoring them, this movie was BAD ASS from the start.I can't remember the last time that I had such a wonderful experience watching a movie. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds are one heck of a dynamic duo.Honestly, I didn't expect any of this from a Disney movie, but they delivered a banger... Reynolds and Jackman both delivered fantastic quips to one another, the action was non-stop, and even the side characters, *wink* were a big surprise.This movie is definitely not for the easily offended, I'm looking at you Gen Z or young kids, also looking at you Gen Z... however, if you want to laugh til you cry, if you want to see lots and lots of blood and action, this is your movie.

I have waited years for this moment, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) and Deadpool (Ryan Reynolds) have finally teamed up and it was everything I wished for and more. I've watched this film nearly 4 times now and planning on another watch, I love everything about it. It was so cool to see everyone come back, this is a spoiler free review but let's just say this movie is everything I dreamed of.The movie starts when Deadpool's peaceful existence comes crashing down when the Time Variance Authority recruits him to help safeguard the multiverse. He soon unites with his would-be pal, Wolverine, to complete the mission and save his world from an existential threat.It was also so amazing to see the TVA involved in the story considering all the disputes with Majors, the way its all connected its so cool.I'd highly recommend you check this out, 11/10 if I could!!

I'm thrilled about this movie! Everything that could possibly be packed into one film from this genre and universe-it's all there! Sharp, biting jokes, references, satire, twists, and the return of old characters from the universe. It's pure madness-in the best possible way! I really enjoyed watching it. Thanks for showing the "old" actors from the universe with such humor and irony. It's like a celebration! Thank you!*** I'm thrilled about this movie! Everything that could possibly be packed into one film from this genre and universe-it's all there! Sharp, biting jokes, references, satire, twists, and the return of old characters from the universe. It's pure madness-in the best possible way! I really enjoyed watching it. The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine is one of the most intriguing and entertaining in the Marvel universe. Their contrasting personalities create a unique blend of humor and intensity that resonates with fans. Wolverine's disciplined and stoic nature often serves as a grounding force against Deadpool's wild and unpredictable antics. This not only leads to comedic situations but also highlights moments of genuine friendship and mutual respect.Their interactions are a testament to Marvel's ability to craft complex character relationships that transcend simple hero-villain dynamics. Whether they're teaming up to face a common enemy or clashing due to their vastly different approaches, Deadpool and Wolverine's relationship adds a rich layer of storytelling that continues to captivate audiences. Moreover, their shared history as products of the Weapon X program adds an extra layer of depth to their relationship. Both characters have endured immense suffering and loss, which occasionally brings out a more vulnerable side in each of them. This shared trauma sometimes creates moments of unexpected solidarity and understanding.The banter between Wolverine and Deadpool often provides comic relief amid the more serious and dark storylines, making their scenes together memorable. Fans appreciate the unpredictability of their interactions, never quite knowing whether they will end in a fight, a begrudging team-up, or a surprisingly heartfelt conversation. This dynamic continually evolves, ensuring that their stories remain fresh and engaging.

From start to finish, this movie is an absolute delight. The cameos are perfectly placed, adding an extra layer of enjoyment. The witty dialogue, side eyes, and all the delightful absurdities make this chaos incredibly fun to watch. The references are fantastic, with Easter eggs just waiting to be found. There are so many backstories to grasp to fully understand everything, and the sarcasm is at its peak. The best actors and actresses for their roles are all present, performing at their best.Thank you, Ryan, Hugh, and Shawn, for creating one of the best movies of 2024. I haven't enjoyed a film this much in a long time. The music, costumes, and dialogue are simply brilliant.

I tried to avoid the trailers and any spoilers for this movie, so I went in expecting something akin to the previous two. I am getting a bit tired of Ryan Reynolds comedies, so I wasn't expecting much more than a decent way to kill 2 hours.It was so much better than that. In fact, I think it's probably the best Deadpool movie yet and the most fun I've had with a movie in a long time.If you are not a fan of graphic violence and crude humour, this movie won't be for you.If you like that sort of thing, but haven't seen a lot of superhero movies, this movie might be a 6.5/10. Make that a 7 if you've seen the previous 2 films and enjoyed them.To enjoy it as much as I did, you need to not only love the humour and enjoy the violence, but you also need to at least be familiar with a lot of superhero movies, including those from the pre-Disney era. (Unfortunately, it's hard to recommend what to watch without spoiling things.) The cameos carry this film and, overall, are probably the best I've ever seen in a movie.If you've seen Deadpool 1 and 2, you know what to expect. Watch this if you liked them, skip this if you didn't.

This gave the ruined marvel a new chance.This single handedly brought back marvel from the brink.I havent watched the last shows and movies after The Marvels, all of those new media was just garbage. I knew a deadpool movie pretty much cant be screwed up that hard, so I had hopes.... and it delivered.The story was okay FOR A DEADPOOL movie. I didnt expect more.The jokes, the puns, the timing, the cameos, all were on point and I like how it made fun of both disney and 20th centrury fox multiple times.Marvel need this more mature movie line back, like Blade, Deadpool.And thank god the gore wasnt moderated.

If this is the last DP, they sincerely went out on a bang. No Theory; it was a Big Bang.As much as I try my best to avoid trailers for how spoil-rich they are, I did manage to catch a few for this movie. Holy cow...for once, they kept the 83 secrets/twists/cameos hidden. THANK YOU, Marketing team. Finally did your job right. (Though, some of the biggest jokes did lose their impact having being ruined from the previews.)I digress. Since Mr. Pool has finally joined the MCU - and in case you didn't know that, they'll repeatedly remind you in this movie (not a complaint - each one-liner was hilarious,) it would be hard to rank this movie amongst the other 30+ films. This was wildly different than any single one of them. That said, I'd probably rank it...8th.Not that it's a perfect movie. It's just that the majority of the MCU was merely good to meh and some terrible entries. This was a VERY entertaining film and deserves a top ten spot.While this was out of this universe, in more ways than several, this VERY much felt like a Deadpool movie. Helps I just revisited 1 & 2 within 24 hours. Six years since the last one and it's as if they just walked off Part 2's sets.As the title indicates, Wolverine (nice to see you back, Hugh!) & Deadpool team up, fight, unite other heroes, fight, make up, fight, swear a lot and kick some A when their worlds/universes are threatened or broken. Will Tilda "Ancient One" Swinton's twin (actually she's a twin of...joke, no spoilers here) stop them and destroy everything they love?The jokes were good, fresh and relevant, though I can't see them aging too well for future generations. Can't say this movie was made to stand the test of time, but for now, it was a great addition and conclusion (if this is the last) to the D-P-Three.That said, was I laughing as hard as the first two? Negative. But, I WAS laughing a lot so it definitely did its job. What I actually liked the most, and I can't believe I actually feel this way, were the cameos.Obviously, I ain't spoiling ANY of them for you, and you should unfriend anyone who does. They were all SO good to see again. And speaking of which, definitely stay through the credits. The first clip is really touching and very fun to watch. And the second/final clip post-credits was pretty comical.Definitely a recommend to any Deadpool fan or even of the MCU as this 100% intwined now. I do wish to see it again soon as I bet I missed a ton of the Easter Eggs, references and jokes.***Final Thoughts: Funny. I just rewatched 1996's Twister in anticipation of this year's long-overdue sequel, Twisters and I was thinking: "I really miss huge Event Movies (like the original Twister.) Doesn't seem like they're really made anymore." If a movie's gonna make its money, it'll be in the first two weekends and then shipped to streaming a few more weeks later. They're like quick firecrackers these days vs. The old days of Event Movies that last for months, with constant week-after-week box office profits and repeat-viewings.Well, Deadpool & Wolverine feels like an Event Movie and while I know it's gonna make insane money this opening weekend, I hope it has longevity. I know I wanna see this again very soon.

I mean the cameos alone (without spoiling anything) are just what a fan really never asked but the movie did deliver umpteen times!It's just amazing how well this movie brought together both Deadpool's antics without compromising anything Wolverine. It had plenty of humour as a whole without loosing depth with Wolverine.Kudos for an actually good script in a canon of superhero movie sagas for a long while with excellent characters and character development too. Clearly the makers knew what movie they were making, way to go Reynolds! Everything was up to the par.This movie was such a trear that I actially do not want to see a sequel for this. And the costume of Wolverine, did not believe but they really pulled it alao off!

Deadpool and Wolverine is sheer entertainment, and that is its main objective, but afterwards when you get a break to stop and think about it, you realize it really juggled a lot. In the midst of the onslaught of jokes and violence, are well-handled tributes and well-placed Easter eggs and references. It tells its story well enough while making room for lots of fan service. It's indeed a real crowd pleaser, which is what it most wants to be.For those who have issues with multiverse movies, don't worry, Deadpool and Wolverine is a Deadpool movie before it's a multiverse movie. I don't think people go see these movies for their amazing stories. People want to laugh and have fun. So if you liked the first two movies you'll have a blast with this third installment. The action is wild and exciting. I was hanging on every word of dialogue as I didn't want to miss a single joke or reference.The movie is so self-aware and just what Marvel needed at this time. I like how they humorously acknowledge instances where the MCU and the genre as a whole have fallen short. Deadpool speaks for the fans. It shows us that the writers are at least aware of what the people have been saying.Ryan Reynolds and Deadpool know how to create a good time, but I admit I was most excited about Hugh Jackman and Wolverine. It was so good to see him back as the character, but even more comic book accurate than we've seen him before.I loved that they managed to give us humor and heart with this movie. Marvel has given us a few examples of how a movie can be ridiculous and hilarious and yet somehow get serious and sentimental without it feeling jarring or out of place. It makes me think of the Guardians of the Galaxy trilogy. Both of these trilogies came out strong with a very successful first movie, followed it with a good sequel that was also fun, and then ended with their biggest and best.

How can i review this movie while keeping it spoiler free? Well lets say that Deadpool and Wolverine is pretty much what i expected and what i wanted.With Disney having bough Fox and likely integrating Deadpool into the MCU, there was concerns to say the least. But i was please to see that this movie does not hold back on the meta and jabs against both Fox, Disney and woke stuff in general.Movie is very violent, the curses are there, and altough the story is really secondary to the rest in my opinion, its still such a fun movie to follow and get surprised at the numerous cameos and references.Obviously seeing Hugh Jackman once again in the role of Wolverine was a joy and its in my opinion the best movie where he star as Wolvie.This movie is a must see for any comic book movie fans. After numerous disapointements at Marvel both in movies or mini-series on Disney+, this really feel good.

Marvel has always been audacious, whether we realize that or not. Even as traditions and cultural mores sometimes cramp and even asphyxiate, even as oligarchs and old unyielding machiavellian monarchs persist to control and extort, even as fear and insecurity and self-doubt paralyze people and sometimes entire societies into inaction and malaise and paranoia, good old-fashioned moxie rooted in the simple elementary desire to breathe free and feel the sun springs eternal. Moxie. Audacity. Marvel moxie. Merc with a mouth kinda moxie can jolt you loose and free you, at least for a little bit, until the human condition and existential constraints reel you back in again. But alas that human condition with all of its misery is just what Deadpool was born for- he comments and commentates to the crowd even as he himself experiences the human condition firsthand. What a trooper. "Deadpool and Wolverine" is audacious and audaciously funny and it could have even been more so if not for the need to wrap up or tie in so many strands and loose ends, which is a notorious MCU complication. Nevertheless, the movie is a show and the show must go on and the showman and his showmanship needs room, plenty of it, even if he needs to break the 4th wall to get it. "D&W" is a doozy, a jaunt, a feast for the senses with its heart in good places- check it out at a theater near you.

We've waited so long for this moment, and it was beyond fun, wholesome, full of surprises, emotional and epic! Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman and Shawn Levy pour out their hearts for this movie to be what is it.It's beyond the MCU timeline, it's beyond even FOX's "X-Men" movies. It's about all the kids who grew up with these movies and these characters. The kids, who are now adults (like me), but still love every bit of it.You know it's going to be fun with these two, but man... I laughed so hard, even my stomach was feeling it. And the jokes... be sure this is not Deadpool watered down in the MCU, it's Deadpool at its best. The inevitable bromance unveiled before our eyes. The story is fine, nothing special, but you feel it, and knowing the past knowledge about these characters and their respective universes makes everything hit the emotions.What about the cameos, you'd ask, I guess? Well, we already know about a bunch of them, but be sure, there's a bunch more and even the ones we already knew are more than what meets the eye.Emma Corrin as the villain Cassandra Nova is such a good addition to the movie and to the MCU as a whole. She is smart, strong, cold-blooded and also makes fun of our two leads.The action and the visuals are beyond amazing. There are some really, really creative scenes, where adamantium swords and claws create such a mayhem, that makes everything so bloody!The music choice is great and fun, at times could crack you so much. The opening scene is pure gold!Can't praise the movie enough, but "Deadpool & Wolverine" is definitely in my top 5 cinema experiences, and you can easily guess the other ones. The whole theater was laughing, cheering and sobbing like a one person. What more could you ask for? Also, the movie got such a rewatchability factor, the length is perfect and be sure it will make tons of money! You can't possibly catch all the details in the first viewing for sure, but you will want to, so you'll go again and again... and again.What about the credit scene, you might ask? I kind of don't want to say anything about it because I don't want to spoil even the possible direction your thought is taking. Just stay for it, also during the credits there is something really beautiful. It's nowhere near "fun filler", it's not "Infinity War" level too, but it's a great movie, and it's one of MCU's finest!

Very Boring except Wolverine scenes. Ryan Reynolds is a 1 Trick Pony and that 1 Trick happens to be Deadpool as he states in the movie. Hugh is a proper theatre trained Actor, Ryan on the other hand is just a wannabe funny guy living his day dream in a red suit. It's very American in it's sense of what entails as a Comedy these days which sucks because there's not a lot in it. I smirked twice no laughs or chuckles. Neither did the theatre.The trick worked in 2016, it sorta worked out in 2018 too but in 2024 it's just an embarrassment. Half the cinema hall was groaning and sleeping anytime there was no Action put on the screen. For a MARVEL Fanboys this is it. For Fans this is an average summer flick. Anybody else don't waste your hard earned money on this lousy picture.

That not everything is shallow and made pure for money. That good cinema could be for the fans. Supported by the fans (as most of you know fans helped launch for the Deadpool 1 a lot). What a great cinema experience. Thank you, Ryan Reynolds!!! Thank you, Hugh Jackman!!! Thank you, Madona!!! This has been truly enjoyable. There are mostly 1 or two movies a year a top that can make you feel like this. And this is one of them. I wouldn't give it less than a 10. Even if you aren't a comic or a Marvel fan you should watch this movie. If you are not a Disney fan you should also watch it (I know you aren't, no one is).

Merely words cannot express enough how great the movie was, it's a must see for all fans of the genre. Gave it Two thumbs up, it's easily a 10 out of 10! LFG! From start to finish there is non-stop action it's packed with hilarious comedic elements but also a lot of heart and friendship vibes. I never laughed so hard in my life! If you plan to watch it soon, please watch it in 3D, believe me you will be very happy you did. Director Shawn Levi, Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman and the rest of this awesome cast famously nailed this movie. Trust me you will not be disappointed, looking forward to watching this movie many more times soon.

It's obvious that Ryan is in the movie it will be funny with lots of action. Literary best direction and story. It's keep you engage to the last and in the last you will regret that why it's ending want to see more of it. Little bit upset that the old cast was not in the centre of the movie and the chemistry between Wade Willson and Vannesa was missing !! Literary it's a treat for the Marvel lovers across the globe. The story line and the bonus of funny punch's with the great fighting scenes are hilarious. It's like a treat for movie lovers. Eagerly waiting that how Wade Willson aka Deadpool will assemble with The Avengers and hope to see him in Avengers Doomsday.

Deadpool & Wolverine (3) (2024) -As we left the cinema from watching this film the first thing that my 74 year old Mother said was "I need to watch that again!" taking the words right out of my mouth and it wasn't even because she's a deaf old cow who probably missed most of the throwaway jokes, but because it was just so damned enjoyable. I really hope that it will be just as good when I do go back to watch it with the foreknowledge of it all.I very nearly didn't watch the Marvel films and TV series that had been released to build up to this one, having last been to the cinema to see 'Dr Strange In The Multiverse Of Madness' (2022) and not bothering to catch up in between, because I'd been so disappointed with that one.But I was glad that I did make the effort to catch up, because I certainly would have been a tiny bit lost without watching 'Loki' season 2 before this one. It wasn't absolutely essential in order to enjoy Mr Pool's adventures, because it just had such great content and so much of it, but a reminder of the work and the environment of the TVA (Time Variance Authority) was definitely a helpful jog of the memory.Because of the Deadpool's (Ryan Reynolds) hilarious fourth wall breaking it was clear that this story was taking the Mick out of the sudden influx of Multiverse storylines, whilst also utilising that same trope and doing it very well. Not only was it just a good story set in multiple universes, but it was also a great way of fixing many of the situations that had arisen as a result of so many Marvel incarnations and "Variants" made by different studios.Joined by Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) in an attempt to fix his own timeline, Deadpool caused havoc at the TVA and found himself banished to the void. A waste dump filled with cameos from many of my favourite Marvel films and they just kept getting better. There were twists galore as what I thought was going to be one thing turned in to something else entirely and sometimes there were just some really simple ways to save the day, especially when Peter (Rob Delaney) turned up towards the end.There were numerous action sequences, mostly fights, that could potentially have become boring if they hadn't been so darn good and so appropriate. They happened because the two volatile leads would quite clearly fight constantly and not just amongst themselves, so it wasn't just for the sake of creating massive battle scenes although that was certainly the case at some points.It culminated in a superbly epic way that only the goodness of Wolverine combined with Deadpool's nutty ways could pull off. Everything tied up in a neat bow, but still with huge potential to keep the franchise going and maybe in a new direction?As the film credits rolled there was a stream of nostalgia which I could only imagine was a way of saying thanks to what had gone before, but seemed to be clearly saying that those bits were over and new things were coming that would replace them now that Disney has taken over.It was brilliantly clever in the way that it mocked the multiverse idea, but delivered it far better than the others.I certainly haven't laughed like that for a good long while either. It also had a cracking soundtrack as was to be expected from this franchise.There were superb performances from all. I can't really mention outstanding moments without giving away too much about the surprise appearances, but it was great how they came from a more serious timeline and still managed to take the pee out of themselves as Deadpool had always done.And look out for the Easter Eggs dotted throughout. They will surely fill IMDB's trivia section with all of the fun placements and nods to so much more.I deliberately didn't watch any trailers to get the best out of it and I'm so glad I did that, because it was such a joy to behold everything brand new. I think that I would have been devastated if this one had let me down, but I can honestly say that it beat all expectations.The only reason that it didn't score higher was because it wasn't a totally original idea and there had to be other films and things beforehand to make this work as it did.899.69/1000.

I watched Deadpool and Wolverine today (8/20/24) and absolutely loved it. Amazing movie from start to finish. I can't recommend it enough. The fight sequences are amazing, the humour is hilarious. Deadpool's 4th wall beaks are hilarious. The story was engaging from start to finish. The character development and character arcs are brilliant. Personally I really hope to see Ryan and Hugh work together on a sequel. That would be amazing. I want to watch Deadpool and Wolverine again and again. So much fun. I can't wait to buy a dvd or blu-ray of this movie. Everything about this movie is amazing. I love it.

Wolverine and Deadpool in a movie together kicking arse and taking names is something everyone that like these characters would have desired to see someday on the big screen and just hoped that its done well and that proper justice is done to the characters that are loved by many people worldwide including me.Wade and Logan, Marvel Jesus and Anchor Being whatever name we want to call them, right from the start credits to the end credits and also the bonus scene post end credits, start to finish this movie doesn't disappoint at all. It's fast paced, humour throughout which we always would associate with Deadpool movies and with Old Man Logan aka Wolverine joining forces it just checks all the boxes.Its a fun action comedy movie that's catered especially for the people (including me) who like both Wolverine and Deadpool but even if you don't know about them and want to have a good time at the movies enjoy a fun flick that has a good even at times nostalgic soundtrack, good background score, awesome fight sequences, very good VFX then you will certainly enjoy watching this movie.Kudos to the entire team behind the wonderful project and Thank you for doing justice and delivering well and then some.Sometimes the people we save, may save us right back.... Absolutely Bang On

Pretty much no story line,. It is a movie to just get in references and cameos from the marvel universe and pop culture. While this is amusing at times, overall the movie just falls flat with little to no substance to keep viewer engaged with the story. I was a fan of the first two Deadpool movies as they had a compelling story line and characters were well flushed out, but that was not the case with the third one here. It felt more like a Hollywood money grab to sag, look what we slapped together to make some money. While I am sure it will make money, I don't believe it deserves the credit it is getting..

This film was so well done it truly felt as if you're watching a live action comic book. They spared no expense and i believe only Ryan Reynolds had enough pull to gather all this talent in one movie. It's such a fun watch and just when you think all the awesome cameos are done they hit you with another one. It's also extremely rare the third film in a trilogy ends up being the best of the three but this one accomplishes that feat. The fantastic cast puts it over the top Reynolds and Jackman are perfect and the chemistry is off the charts. I don't believe anyone else could play wolverine. This movie plus the RDJ announcement has really got the hype train going for marvel again. Can't wait for F4 DD and secret wars.

Well, Well, Well, Ironic that the "critic scores" are pretty low on this movie. I guess it wasn't "diverse" enough for them, guess they better wait for that next season of "The Acolyte" ROFLI usually base my entertainment choices off of movies/shows these DEI ass-clowns rate low that way I know it isn't gonna have any of the crap these "CRITICS" usually try to cram down our throats.Lots of action, blood and cool effects, typical Deadpool fare. There were a lot of cameos of old Marvel characters, and it had A LOT of heavy laughter moments. All around a decent movie. I wasn't expecting rocket science, it's DEADPOOL! Easily the best Marvel movie to come out in the last few years.

Keep it brief review:"Deadpool & Wolverine" is the 34th film in the MCU and the first Disney Deadpool film. Deadpool & Wolverine is the 3rd film in the Deadpool trilogy this time featuring the team up and highly anticipated return of Hugh Jackman as Wolverine.It's no secret that the MCU has been suffering from fatigue and creativity lately. The hype around this film was that it was going to be the MCU saviour and a step back in the right direction. The film even jokes about this constantly. With expectations at an all time high can Deadpool pull of this endeavour?The short answer is yes...yes it sure can. Deadpool & Wolverine is pure and simply a summer superhero blockbuster. It knows what it is and just thrives on being a fun film. From the opening scene Deadpool sets the tone and lets the audiences know what they are in store for. Deadpool is consistently funny, has some amazingly done action set pieces, and perhaps better yet throws surprise after surprise at the audience. I went into this film blind as I've just kind of been done with the MCU lately...and let me tell you this is the best way to see the film. Avoid spoilers at all cost.Overall this is a true summer film. One that is meant to be enjoyed in theatres. The plot is serviceable although not groundbreaking or setting the path for future Marvel movies. It knows what audiences are looking for and what they have been asking for and it gives it to them...hard. This is definitely a step in the right direction and I hope Disney/Marvel can continue this momentum going forward.Positives: + The chemistry Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have serve this film very well.+ consistently funny+ some very well done action set pieces+ love him or hate him Ryan Reynolds was born to play Deadpool and 3 films in continues to give a top notch performance.+ Tons of surprises throughout the filmNegatives:Rating: 4 out of 5.

Out of all of the Deadpool movies, this is the BEST one.Ryan did such a fantastic job and seeing Hugh in the full true Wolverine X-men suit was the most beautiful thing. As a 90s kid who grew up on the X-men and adored everything about the animated series it was the most beautiful thing to see brought to the big screen in terms of nostalgia and it made me beam with pride and joy. From the reactions of people in the audience with me, it was clear I wasn't the only one who felt that way.The biggest thing I'd like to share about this film is that it's nuanced and makes it such a great movie. I feel like I just experienced the most joyous nerd-fulfilling film in a long time and I don't think anyone else could've made it happen as on point as Ryan did. The cameo of Elektra and Blade also brought so much happiness to me and it was written all over my face as all I did was smile through the entire movie. I don't want to spoil anything but STAY after the credit (as all fans should already know, lol)It was such a great movie and this team-up made a great movie experience.Highly recommended.

If you don't spread out with a feather and don't pour water, then it's just GORGEOUS. With a good team and creative freedom, the result is on the face. It's a pleasure to watch what is happening, so even an adult rating, finally, this was not enough, otherwise some mediocre fairy tales were filmed.Logan from Henry is just a power in the flesh, he came to the people, so damn, drag him into the universe, he and Hugh will just tear everyone up. I hope everything will be fine with Marvel now, now the remaining garbage will come out, and it will be just fine. Dr. Doom will come and put things in order) So please, Marvel, pull yourself together, stop taking off all the junk and cringe.

Is the story a work of art, no, is the dialogue, yes. Is the acting, yes, is the directing, yes. And overall you can tell they had a vision for this movie, a vision that works quite well and is really funny. It's personally my favourite deadpool because I think it's the funniest deadpool, there are cameos but not as many as the trailer will lead you to believe. **Deadpool and Wolverine** is a must-watch for fans of both characters and superhero movies in general. It successfully merges the best elements of its titular heroes, creating a film that is as emotionally resonant as it is entertaining. With its perfect blend of humor, action, and heart, this movie is sure to leave audiences eagerly anticipating whether there will be another movie for this dynamic duo.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is undeniable, bringing a unique energy to the screen that perfectly captures the essence of their characters. The witty banter and relentless action sequences are balanced with deeper, more poignant moments, offering a well-rounded cinematic experience. The film's innovative storytelling, combined with top-notch special effects and a killer soundtrack, makes it a standout in the superhero genre.Overall, the movie not only meets but exceeds expectations, and I can simply say that Marvel Studios is saved by Deadpool and Wolverine.

Honestly I have no words how good this is.Besides the obviously generic "save the world" plot and generic evil villains this movie is a genuine masterpiece of cinema.The writing of both Deadpool and Wolverine is world class and the comedy is outrageously funny. The action delivered thanks to Marvel letting this movie have an R rating and it really brought out the best action sequences one could possibly imagine for a Deadpool and Wolverine team up movie.The editing and visual effects were really good and I'm glad Marvel gave the movie a 200 million dollar budget because it also helped with bringing in great cameos and delivering on the hype of this movie.Honestly I couldn't have hoped for a better 3rd movie in the Deadpool franchise and the addition of Wolverine made it even greater.Marvel is back baby.

Finally, after many years of waiting and speculating, we have an answer to the big question. How will Deadpool fit into the MCU? I imagine most of the readers already know, a lot has happened between now and the previous films Logan (2017) and Deadpool 2 (released 2018). To sum up: The film Logan ended the Hugh Jackman's Wolverine story, Endgame wrapped up the Infinity Saga, Disney bought out Fox, and the MCU continued into the next Phases (4&5). In middle is Deadpool. What to do, what to do. Well, the wait is over, and we have our answer to the Deadpool question. The answer is spectacular.Deadpool (played by no other than Ryan Reynolds) has retired the "superhero" life. While enjoying a birthday party, he is kidnapped by the organization TVA (Time Variance Authority, seen previously on the Loki series). During his escape from the TVA, he gains the help from a most reluctant ally, no other than the Wolverine (played amazingly by Hugh Jackman). Together, they must put a stop to the TVA's plans of destroying Deadpool's current timeline and go head-to-head with another menacing villain known as Cassandra Nova (played by Emma Corrin). They will brutally fight villains, as well as violently fight between themselves.While past Marvel movies, in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, are rated PG-13. Make no mistake, this film is a hard rated R film. I can speak on behalf of the fans by saying, thank you for making this film rated R. Between both Deadpool and Wolverine, they will swear constantly, and spill all the blood of their enemies. With a few powerful moments of Hugh Jackman's serious moments are Ryan Reynolds classic nonstop graphic comedy. For a two runtime, the jokes and violence doesn't necessarily get old. Over the top, maybe, but I can tell the audience never got bored with this film. The main villain, Cassandra Nova, might be another forgettable MCU villain; however Emma Corrin performance shines with the rest of the cast. Especially with the inclusion of so many cameos, and each one of them was a welcome surprise. Whether the cameo was a familiar face or even one's the audience has forgotten about.Unlike the previous Deadpool films, the story itself for this movie felt chaotic at times. Understandably, Deadpool was always a chaotic force of nature and thrives in it. However, keeping up with all the humor and characters can feel like the story is taking on too much. In my opinion, dealing with the subject of the multiverse always presents this problem. However, having Ryan and Hugh's character performances anchor the film and helps steer the film in the right and epic conclusion. If any other character in the MCU lead this film, the chaos wouldn't have worked as well. For a Deadpool movie, this works perfectly within the chaos.Overall, fans of the Deadpool and Wolverine franchise will love this film. Anyone looking for a superhero comedy/action adventure will also enjoy this film. As I said before, the two-hour runtime was just right, even with all the constant graphic humor and violence.

I know it's always unfair for movies that set the bar so high in terms of expectations, there's always a high risk of those same expectations not being met and I guess that's all right... I have to admit I was hyped for it, I enjoyed it but I thought it could've been greater...Let me start with what I really enjoyed about the movie, as always it doesn't take itself too serious as it shouldn't, Deadpool was always a comedic approach to the super hero genre filled with meta commentary and jokes targeting real life situations, the peak of 4th wall breaking, I feel this continues to be the strength of the film and they manage to keep the jokes funny and most importantly fresh!The fact that both these actors, Ryan and Hugh, seemingly have been born to play these roles makes it also a really pleasant experience, they do it perfectly and their chemistry, most likely also due to their real life friendship, shines on the big screen.I also really enjoyed the cameos and the references, regardless of some people calling it fan service, I don't see why that's a bad thing, I feel that if you are going to be ridiculous about the Multiverse there's no better movie than a Deadpool movie to do that.It had some really funny scenes, good action sequences and fights and the soundtrack was really something else.And one thing I was surprised was, regardless if you find the plot interesting or not, they actually nailed the way they set the story, how they managed to bring Wolverine back, adding the TVA into the mix to explain some of the plot decisions, I felt that for a movie that doesn't take itself serious it was a really solid explanation of context.With all of this being said, I did have a few issues with it and the reason why I won't rate it higher;All in all it's an entertaining and good movie, its greatness is simply achieved by the two main actors that bring the characters to life.

I've been really disappointed with Marvel movies ever since Endgame, but damn, this really gave the MCU a huge W. I really appreciate that this was obviously made by fans for fans. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman really made sure to give us all the things we've been begging for for years, if not decades. They took the mess they were given by the current state of the MCU and made it work in a way that makes sense and is just the right amount of silly. It's genuinely such a breath of fresh air to see this duo sort of unshackled from Disney's (and Fox's) censorship, with the exception of not being able to do cocaine, lmao. Yes, Deadpool has been rated R in the past. Plenty of violence, language, etc. But this felt different. This was them frolicking through a field of rated R goodness, being gratuitous but in the best way. It's honestly pretty great, and it worked perfectly for this film. It stayed true to the core of what Deadpool is, and is a step up from the sequel. Loved the cameos, the writing, the palpable homoerotic tension between the titular pair. You could argue that there was a bit of an overuse of music throughout, but it was mostly done well enough for it to not bother me. I definitely recommend this for Marvel fans and those without delicate sensibilities.

The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine is one of the most intriguing and entertaining in the Marvel universe. Their contrasting personalities create a unique blend of humor and intensity that resonates with fans. Wolverine's disciplined and stoic nature often serves as a grounding force against Deadpool's wild and unpredictable antics. This not only leads to comedic situations but also highlights moments of genuine friendship and mutual respect.Their interactions are a testament to Marvel's ability to craft complex character relationships that transcend simple hero-villain dynamics. Whether they're teaming up to face a common enemy or clashing due to their vastly different approaches, Deadpool and Wolverine's relationship adds a rich layer of storytelling that continues to captivate audiences.Moreover, their shared history as products of the Weapon X program adds an extra layer of depth to their relationship. Both characters have endured immense suffering and loss, which occasionally brings out a more vulnerable side in each of them. This shared trauma sometimes creates moments of unexpected solidarity and understanding.The banter between Wolverine and Deadpool often provides comic relief amid the more serious and dark storylines, making their scenes together memorable. Fans appreciate the unpredictability of their interactions, never quite knowing whether they will end in a fight, a begrudging team-up, or a surprisingly heartfelt conversation. This dynamic continually evolves, ensuring that their stories remain fresh and engaging.Moreover, their shared history as products of the Weapon X program adds an extra layer of depth to their relationship. Both characters have endured immense suffering and loss, which occasionally brings out a more vulnerable side in each of them. This shared trauma sometimes creates moments of unexpected solidarity and understanding.The banter between Wolverine and Deadpool often provides comic relief amid the more serious and dark storylines, making their scenes together memorable. Fans appreciate the unpredictability of their interactions, never quite knowing whether they will end in a fight, a begrudging team-up, or a surprisingly heartfelt conversation. This dynamic continually evolves, ensuring that their stories remain fresh and engaging.

While this film pokes a lot of fun at the MCU, Fox, and the hero genre in general, it is abundantly clear that the writers (including Ryan) have such a love and respect for this universe of superheroes. There are so many references, easter eggs, nods, and cameos that will surely require multiple viewings. I would be doing a disservice to spoil anything, much of the films enjoyment on first watch will surely be jumping out of your seat at what is arguably the greatest cast of cameo appearances to ever be put on film. The fanfare here is worth the price of admission alone. The humor is spot on and pulls no punches, the action is brutal! This is a Deadpool movie, so seeing characters from PG-13 hero films performing brutal and at times gory action is incredibly satisfying. There is a lot to love here. The film almost never misses, apart from a couple of lines that cater towards gen z lingo that didn't land perfectly. The film also feels a little small at times, not quite as large scale and epic as an Infinity War or Endgame, but is of the same caliber and feels right at home. Ultimately, there is nothing to critique here. The movie doesn't waste your time nor does the pacing feel rushed. This is a must watch for any fan of the genre, and is pure insanity and enjoyment from start to finish. They absolutely stick the landing on this one too, I refuse to let myself cry in a movie theater but I definitely felt myself tearing up at the end. The Deadpool franchise is a blessing to the MCU and I sincerely hope this isn't the end for Deadpool and Wolverine.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" is a refreshing breath of irreverence and grit in the Marvel universe, a film that might just be one of the best things Disney and Marvel have produced in years. From the get-go, the movie captures the chaotic energy that fans of both characters crave. Deadpool's trademark humor is as sharp as ever, cutting through the action with a relentless barrage of fourth-wall-breaking quips and meta-commentary that feels both fresh and familiar. Meanwhile, Wolverine brings the grizzled intensity that perfectly balances Deadpool's manic antics.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is undeniable, driving the movie with a dynamic that feels like a violent buddy comedy-if the buddies had a tendency to eviscerate their enemies in creatively gory ways. The plot, while not groundbreaking, serves as a solid backbone for the characters to do what they do best: unleash carnage, bicker, and begrudgingly save the day.Visually, the film is stunning, with action sequences that are as brutal as they are stylish. The direction embraces the R-rated potential, ensuring that neither character is diluted for a younger audience. This is a film made for fans, and it knows exactly what they want.Where "Deadpool & Wolverine" really shines is in its willingness to take risks. It pushes boundaries-not just with its humor and violence, but with its narrative choices that cleverly subvert typical superhero tropes. However, it's not without its flaws. The pacing occasionally stumbles, and a few jokes feel more forced than fluid. But these are minor quibbles in an otherwise exhilarating experience.In the end, "Deadpool & Wolverine" delivers a bloody, hilarious, and surprisingly heartfelt romp that proves that sometimes, all you need is a foul-mouthed antihero and a cigar-chomping mutant to breathe new life into the superhero genre. It's not perfect, but it's damn close-a triumphant return to form for Marvel's edgier side.

Wow I haven't felt this way after I left a movie theater in a LONG time . Hours after I watched it I am still talking about it telling everyone to go see it. It was hilarious, new, fun, action packed ,exciting and did I say hilarious? Ryan is at the top of his game with the fast talking foul mouthed wit he brings to the marvel universe. I honestly want to go back again to the theaters to watch it again because I know I missed stuff laughing so hard . The overall plot of the movie was actually mediocre and I didn't love the storyline or the "void" that they went into it was kind of over the top and dumb in my opinion but the comedy overpowered it and somehow it all worked . The cameos alone were worth the ticket price . I would go as far to say it's definitely 1 or 2 best marvel movies and probably top 10 comedy movies of all time . Solid 8.5/10.

Probably the worst one ever created. Jokes are not as good as they were before and the story not really making it.One of the most disappointing aspects of "Deadpool 3" is its reliance on tired tropes and recycled jokes. The film often feels like it's trying too hard to recapture the magic of the first two installments. While self-referential humor has always been a cornerstone of Deadpool's appeal, here it falls flat, feeling forced and repetitive. The once-refreshing quips feel like they've been run through a blender of clichs, and the novelty of Deadpool breaking the fourth wall has become stale. Instead of clever commentary, we're treated to a barrage of eye-roll-inducing one-liners that seem to be there just for the sake of being there.

On top of everything, the dialogue and character acting of this movie. Which are great and the Hindi dub is awesome specially Sankat Mahatre has done amazing Hindi dubbing for Deadpool's voice...But to look at the negative side, some things are good to say the story is a bit shaky after the second half. The last scene could have been better. Anyway the movie can be enjoyed and presents us with a childhood nostalgia.But the movie The cameos were amazing, I didn't expect so much, really amazing..And thanks to Marble for giving such a beautiful r rated movie for the first time.....Witnessed a nostalgia moment.

Left the theatre thoroughly entertained and forgetting any worry or apprehension I had before sitting down to view on the silver screen.The first of those being...Will it be as poor as deadpool 2?No this film was great and I even prefer it over the first one which I didn't see comingWill I regret seeing it at a premium opposed to a streaming service?: No it's a resurgent return to form, had I waited the extra months the spoilers would've done their job in pruning any excitement over potential characters and events, also it takes the money away from the people who helped make itWhere will the multiverse elements be on a scale from antman to endgame?Sitting in the Loki segment approaching endgameWill I recommend to friends and family?Yes, I encourage it so I can talk about itWill I rate it and review on IMDb Naturally! Especially with some heavily tanked reviews out thereEveryone of course has their own tastes and preferences over any artform, I went to view hoping I wouldn't leave disappointed and excited for the return of wolverine to a film rated for adults. I wouldn't change anything I saw the costumes, the characters involved, the sometimes over done comical elements. Watch it and enjoy it I did and from the sounds all over the imax screening I attended I was in a screen space full of people who thought the same haven't heard people interacting with a film like this for years.I don't want to give any spoilers away hope this has been somewhat helpful.

This is Deadpool from the marvel comics.Have you not read them, you probably won't recognize the themes.Deadpool is about the most skilled and miserable, technically immortal mercenary with a mouth, searching for his place in the world of mutants and superheroes.Deadpool is a psychopath and quite unlikeable most of the time, but as Colossus says: "Four or five moments - that's all it takes to become a hero." This is the essence of Deadpool in the comics, where 98% of the time he seems to just be fooling around, but in the end his good side shines through and he actually uses his skills for good.This huge contrast between fooling around, owning up to his responsibility and being a hero can create some surprisingly wholesome moments in the comics.Deadpool and Wolverine is the best take on the Deadpool comics and Hugh is playing Wolverine the exact way we see him in the Deadpool comics. He is always the guy to shut down Deadpool's BS with a good load of dismembering.It is possible Ryan have read Deadpool or his vision is just so spot on that because of his likeness to the character.Either way this movie probably isn't for you if you've never read anything similar to Deadpool or if you don't like over the top action movies with spectacle, dirty humor and a lot of gore.If you are looking for a movie with deep intellectual storylines with a lot of emotion, intricate mystery and social commentary, then save your money and time.

This movie was an eagerly anticipated showdown that promised an exhilarating clash between two of Marvel's most beloved anti-heroes. Unfortunately, it fails to live up to the hype, leaving fans with more frustration than satisfaction.First and foremost, the plot is a convoluted mess. Rather than delivering a coherent narrative, the film is a jumble of disconnected scenes and over-the-top antics that lack any real substance. The story feels like an afterthought, merely an excuse to bring these two characters together without any meaningful development or stakes.Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, while charismatic as always, seem to struggle with the material they are given. Their performances come off as forced, as if they themselves are not convinced by the direction of the film. The banter between Deadpool and Wolverine, which should have been a highlight, often falls flat and feels repetitive.The action sequences, typically a saving grace in such films, are surprisingly underwhelming. Despite the potential for epic battles, the choreography is lackluster and the special effects feel subpar compared to other recent Marvel entries. Instead of jaw-dropping fights, we get a series of poorly executed set pieces that fail to impress.Moreover, the film tries too hard to blend Deadpool's irreverent humor with Wolverine's brooding nature, resulting in an awkward tonal imbalance. The humor feels forced and out of place, while the darker, more serious moments lack the emotional depth needed to resonate with the audience.In conclusion, this movie is a missed opportunity. It squanders the potential of its iconic characters with a disjointed plot, mediocre action, and a tone that fails to strike the right balance. Fans of both Deadpool and Wolverine will likely walk away disappointed, wishing for a more worthy confrontation between these two legendary figures.

The good: This movie has one of the best intro (credit) sequences I have ever seen. It is funny, irreverent, meta, entertaining and subversive all at the same time. It is flawless - sadly the movie never reaches those heights again. But this movie more or less delivers on what you expect - Deadpool + Wolverine + gore + comedy + 4th wall breaking. A bonus, is that somehow, Hugh Jackson has still got it. And he carries most of the emotional weight of the film. The movie is well paced, with action scattered through out. And finally, the cameos - whilst some do miss the mark - most are good, some are brilliant. Subversive, honorary and/or just simple hilarious fan-service. Overall they add to the movie rather than subtract from it.The bad: The big bad is probably the worst part of this movie. She's so infuriatingly 2-dimensional, with a "destroy world because people mean" kindergarten drive. There's also too many plot conveniences to get the main characters to their next destination that it's grating. I'm wildly confused as to why the writers couldn't just come up with a logical reason to move characters from scene to scene.Summary: Overall the movie earns it's spot amongst the MCU echelon. Probably coming at a time when marvel needs it most. It's definitely a top 1/3 superhero flick and is worth the watch. The marvel messiah it is not, however.

This is the best movie of 2024 that I've watched. Without political correctness, without complexes, without an artificial agenda, it's just a very funny movie. After Avengers: Endgame, this is the best MCU movie. My friends and I smoked weed and went to the cinema; we laughed for two hours.Everything is at the highest level here: the acting, the soundtracks, the plot, and the humor. Even the antagonist is funny.I hope Hollywood wakes up and starts making truly high-quality films.Acting by RYAN REYNOLDS a 10/10 Why is Thor spitting? It was epic.But I'm not sure if this will revive the MCU.

"Deadpool vs. Wolverine" delivers exactly what fans have been craving-a chaotic, hilarious, and action-packed showdown between two of Marvel's most iconic characters. The film balances sharp wit with intense fight scenes, showcasing the unique dynamics and chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman. The plot is as unpredictable as the Merc with a Mouth himself, filled with surprising cameos and meta-commentary that keeps you on your toes. If you're looking for a wild ride through the Marvel universe with plenty of laughs and jaw-dropping moments, this is it. Don't miss out on this experience in theater.

As a lifelong comic book fan, especially Wolverine this was the movie I've waited my entire life for. Not only was homage paid to characters and their comic history but the making of a duo that was always meant to be. This was a raucous, comedic, action pack movie of heart, substance and full of surprises bringing honor to several past Marvel characters and giving them fitting hero tributes.The action is incredibly well timed, and the comedy is gold and the storyline does not disappoint. This movie not only fulfilled childhood dreams for this nearing 50 year old gal but what comic book movies should be.

After seeing this movie, I almost want to wait for the M's year to call my next dog  Mary Poupette   I asked myself the same thing when I first saw the dog Frank in Men in Black back in the day!More seriously, this third movie is amazing!Ryan Reynolds fits perfectly this character. The way the actor and the character match together even seems almost too perfect I have to say.This superhero movie, even more than the 2 previous ones, is capable to transcend the principles ans rules of Cinema.The way the character speaks subtly to the spectator with references is a type of thing we only rarely see on screen. Everything has been thought of and it feels natural. So, if Disney uses Hugh until his 90's, do not be shocked In resume, (even if the scenario is really light) the realisation, dialogues, jokes and the originality of the staging make this movie one of the best superhero movie I have ever seen.

I'm trying really hard, and obviously failing greatly, on not getting or being too excited about this movie!But it is impossible!There is no greater feat in filmmaking these days than to give the fans exactly what they are wanting, all the while entertaining the general masses down to every single living soul in every single theater.And that is exactly what happens here!And in two wonderful hours!No two and a half or three or ugh, more!Two delicious hours.So many amazing things going on in this movie?Did anyone else catch the burned out automobile and the trunk from Planes, Trains and Automobiles??Greatest. Easter. Egg. Ever!!!There's a dog so ugly, it's cute.Amazing musical montages.Hilarity on top of hilarity.Incredible cameos.One of the Best Films of 2024.
