I like this movie. I like it a lot. Probably need to watch it again to discover stuff I didn't noticed before. The movie gave me a lot of good laughs with enough semi dramatic scenes to prevent an overkill of jokes. The type of jokes is what you can expect from Dead Pool, but for the MCU and also Disney it is a novelty. The chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman was as expected great. Lot of inside jokes (they prank eachother loads of time in rl), but also lots and lots and lots of franchise jokes. And that is what I think is an reoccuring MCU issue: you are expected to have seen about every previous MCU movie, other Marvel movie and tv show and read all the comic. Sure I exaggerate a bit now, but lot of cameo's date even before MCU, but also were referring to comics. Some of the storyline can be confusing for people who missed the Loki series (like my wife). But ok, it was fun to laugh at some jokes most of the younger people in the audience wouldnt get (I am getting old), and even though my wife hates complicated stuff like multiverses or references to other movies she had a great time (and she hates MCU movies). So dont bother to dive too deep into the storyline, it will spoil all your fun. I have read some more negative reviews and they all took the movie too serious. Dont do that. Just sit back, relax and most important have a lot of fun.

Absolutely Loved it!! Nonstop laughs, full of action and intense fight scenes!! Plus we get a bunch of cool cameos, and some of them had people cheering in the theatres! Best portrayal of Wolverine by Hugh Jackman, very violent and more like his comic counterpart, and of coarse Deadpool was hilarious, Ryan Reynolds is perfect playing that character! So many surprises, if you're a fan of comics you'll really appreciate this film, I was shocked at all the nods to the comics. There's scenes in this movie comic fans have waited a lifetime to see and like I said if your a fan of marvel your in for a treat!!

A great movie with a great choice of music and characters, a lot of twists and Easter Eggs, however the story telling was a bit poor for a 10/10 movie, and felt like it was a clich movie, mixing the wolverine character and deadpool in one movie is a difficult thing to do, it was well done, but the hype gave us high expectations, worth the money and time however it couldn't reach the level of Avengers End Game, and it's not enough to save the MCU, therefore it still feels far from the avengers, the storyline of deadpool needs to grow itself to the level of avengers, needs more time and more character development.

With the third installment of Deadpool, Marvel is back on top again by introducing the X-Men into the MCU as The Marvels had anticipated and has maintained all the mature tone and dark humor of the previous films. Deadpool had already predicted in the PG-13 version of the second film that Disney would buy Fox and that generated certain concerns once it came true. In the end, Disney introduced Deadpool into the MCU in a worthy way adding to the X-Men franchise. With his characteristic humor and charisma, Deadpool keeps the essence of his previous films intact. He continues with his references to popular culture, breaking the fourth wall and also jokes towards gen Z. The film offers its clever gags combined with a good mix of action and comedy. The soundtrack has very good songs, including an epic version of Madonna's Like A Prayer. The X-Men were already being considered for the MCU, and the best way to start it was with Wolverine. To be honest, Wolverine has become almost the face of the X-Men saga since the first film. Hugh Jackman was brought back as an alternate version of the original Wolverine, but he retains his tough personality. The film also brings back some characters that have been seen in the X-Men saga. In addition, not only does the MCU manage to link this saga as part of the multiverse, there is also a possibility that the X-Men animated series from the 90s could also be part of this multiverse. That's because Wolverine wears the classic costume from the animated series and Gambit also appears in the same outfit he had in the series. All of that is just part of the best of this movie because the rest officially confirms what was suspected to happen after the last Spider-Man movies and the Doctor Strange sequel. The movie also features the appearance and mention of some characters from the Marvel movies that were made before the MCU started. This movie officially confirms that all the Marvel movies that were made over time are part of a multiverse. They knew how to take advantage of the theme of alternate realities very well to connect the movies and series as it happened with DC Comics in The Flash movie. That even helped a lot so that some Marvel movies that passed without pain or glory got a second chance. Deadpool & Wolverine is indisputably a great movie that revives the fascination with the multiverse and also the appreciation for Marvel's filmography even if it is out of a feeling of nostalgia. My final rating for this movie is 10/10.

Biggest disappointment of the year!Deadpool and Wolverine movie is what we all wanted and were so excited about and what we got is a mess. The story is very thin, the jokes are not even funny (one person laughed out loud only once or twice) it was almost like they ran out of jokes for this movie.The best thing about the movie was Hugh Jackman as Wolverine, he did a ver good job but the scenes was constantly spoiled by a trying-to-be-funny Ryan Reynolds. I am a big fan of Ryan's acting but to me the humour was forced and that hardly anybody laughed in the cinema speaks for itself.Ryan Reynolds can refer to this movie as his worst and not Green Lantern!

The current reigning champ at the box office comes right at a time where some MCU fans have given up on the Marvel saga which follows Ryan Reynolds mouth in a mask partnering w/an anchor character (expect to hear about more of that phenomena since Robert Downey Jr. Is our Doc Doom), Hugh Jackman's clawed lone wolf to right the wrongs before their timeline gets flushed down the astral toilet. Their surprising nemesis is not Professor X's sister Cassandra Nova, Emma Corrin (she played Princess Di on Netflix's The Crown), but the unctuous Paradox, Succession's Matthew Macfayden, who hopes our heroes will follow the diseased timeline & go away. Fun all the way w/a layer of cheapness (the sets look found & lived in, maybe lying around since the Loki finale?) w/the emphasis on the humor ginned up between these 2 contrarians who are the best of friends in real life. Hopefully the brass at the Mouse House will learn from this film's lessons & go forward on the good foot not complicating the simple but who am I kidding?

Deadpool : Known for his irreverent humor, fourth-wall-breaking antics, and chaotic unpredictability. Deadpool's constant wisecracks and meta-commentary provide endless entertainment.Wolverine (Logan): The gruff, no-nonsense mutant with a brooding demeanor and a strong sense of justice. His serious and often stoic personality contrasts sharply with Deadpool's zaniness.Humor and Action Blend: The combination of Deadpool's humor with Wolverine's intense action sequences would create a unique blend of comedy and high-octane action. Deadpool's comedic approach to fighting and Wolverine's brutal efficiency would complement each other, leading to innovative and entertaining fight scenes.

My most anticipated movie in quite some time has been released. Does it live up to the nearly infinite amount of hype? Well just keep reading to find out. DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE is a movie with SO many surprises and spoilers in it, it would be very tough to go into this blind. Don't worry, I won't spoil a single damn thing for all you fine people reading this. As a die-hard Marvel fan, this review will probably seem biased, but that's just a part of who I am. Even though I haven't read a single Marvel comic book, I have ingested everything they have released since 2008's IRON MAN, even some from before that. This is a buddy movie between two actual buddies, Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool and Hugh Jackman as Wolverine. Both were born to play these roles. This is Hugh's 10th time as Wolverine, and he hasn't lost a single ab- I mean step. Ryan is literally the "Merc with the Mouth", he's just getting paid to be himself at this point. I'm not going to say anything about the plot, other than the fact that it's the weakest link of this movie. Saying that, I loved literally everything else. It has extremely profane language, has extremely satisfying violent action scenes, and is fantastically funny. There are an absolute litany of cameos that I can't even mention here, all so good. Emma Corrin plays a great villain, whose name I can't even say. This is what Marvel fans have been asking for for a very long time now. It's fan-service up the ass, pardon my Deadpool-ness. There are a lot of "in jokes" about companies like Disney and Fox, and for comic book nerds. To understand all the jokes, I recommend watching DEADPOOL 2, LOGAN, and season one of LOKI. I gotta stop myself here before Kevin Feige starts hunting me down. Will DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE save the MCU? Only time will tell. Is DEADPOOL & WOLVERINE a must-see for any fan who has waned a bit because of the 5-year quality dip from Marvel? Let's f***ing go! Stay till the credits stop rolling.

Another one of my most anticipated films of the year and it delivered. Got what I was expecting and I am satisfied. Deadpool & Wolverine directed by Shawn Levy starring Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman ofcourse, is a really entertaining and fun deadpool and wolverine film with lot's of camoes and multiverse stuff. The multiverse , the variants , the cameos etc.. were honestly becoming lame which kind of led to Marvel's downfall but in this one , the multiversal stuff made it even more enjoyable, there is no plot but it's just pure chaos and fun. It continues that Deadpool 2 vibe but with even better humour, most of the jokes were great , all of these meta references and Wolverine being Wolverine. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are simply irreplaceable as Deadpool and Wolverine respectively. Their chemistry was the main highlight of the film. Marvel is kind of back with this one and Deadpool is really the Marvel Jesus. Great soundtrack , great opening , the meta jokes , the cameos , Deadpool & Wolverine's chemistry , the fight sequences and Hugh Jackman returning as the Wolverine made this film a really fun and enjoyable ride from start to finish.

Appalling is an understatement. Deadpool was already a fail at 2 and if this was Marvel's last gasp for air, well they deserve a closed-casket funeral. Utterly disgusting display of incompetence. It's over!This movie ruins a lot of talent. Nothing on actors really they tried to squeeze lemon juice out of a rock but unfortunately, they aint Jesus Christ.It seems to me there is a lot of fake hype to boost sales which is working and it is shocking that they have won awards, well I must say the cinematography is good. The title of the movie should have been " Deadpool: The death of Marvel " I do not mean to be mean.

You must admit that, in terms of entertainment, the sequel managed to surpass itself, offering a more fun experience full of exciting moments.However, when it comes to epicness and greatness, the third installment remains firmly in first place. This film is a true masterpiece, a true cinematic joy that has managed to capture the essence of what it means to be epic in every scene.The numerous cameos are a delight for fans, each carefully thought out and masterfully executed, giving the story an additional dimension that enriches the plot and makes it even more memorable. The appearance of these characters is not only exciting, but also adds a level of depth that few films manage to achieve.Furthermore, the film's central message is especially powerful and resonant. Through the story, we are shown a hero who, despite his carefree attitude and tendency to take things with humor, truly wants to be recognized and valued as a true superhero.

Action-packed, heartfelt, and a thrill ride all in one movie! Movie starts out in perfect comedic fashion with Deadpool trying to find Wolverine while he smack talks about how he is overrated. This movie even managed to turn me into more of a Deadpool fan. The special effect fighting scenes are the best I've seen in years of movie releases.They managed to include the right amount of gore while keeping the fighting comical but badass. The villain story did not have much unique appeal but the way they retold the backstories of Deadpool and Wolverine to emphasize their past trauma is what brought the two rivaling faction heroes together.The pace of the movie was perfect, no scene felt out of place, and the environment settings were wicked. Some scenes took place in a desert type mad max environment or as relative to the common civilian areas of Deadpool's apartment, city downtown, and traversing through the woods trying to find the enemy base.If you are either a Wolverine fan or Deadpool fan you will enjoy this movie! They captured the personalities of both characters without being too over the top. Deadpool's comical but heartfelt personality is the strongest a Marvel heroes wholesome personality has been since the original Peter Parker Spider-Man in my honest opinion. Marvel even included a scene honoring Iron Man brilliantly showing how Deadpool knows of the Avenger's top tier existence while envying the fact that he isn't included but also while relishing in the moment how Deadpool is not objectively contracted to be told what to do. Saying something along the lines of "an Avenger or time travel mission boy?"... you can't tell Deadpool what to do! Do you know who I am?! I'm Deadpool baby, I'll break your nose and roundhouse kick you in the nuts before you tell me what to do and handle the mission myself even without the overdosed testosterone furry man behind my ass.The film makes you feel like you are in the movie experience with the unfiltered one liner humor of Deadpool making fun of every possible person he comes into contact with. If you don't laugh more than 3 times during this movie I'm going to boldly say you must not have a great sense of humor because the insults in this film are top notch. Movie music soundtrack also does not disappoint... I'm not going to spoil it but let's just say there is a troll song that Deadpool fights too like something Starlord would put on and a classic rock song in a fight scene that the likes of Ironman would use. Both music fight scenes were relevant music and captured the fighting essence of movies like Avengers, Star Wars, and Transformers special effects. Fighting was not too zoomed in and not too flashy.My only 2 critique's with the movie was number one I was not a big fan of Juggernaut. I think he looked too human like and the fact that once they made it to the villain base there was NOT a lot of story or fighting in the main villain's area.Character role casting and dialogue were outstanding but the villain story interaction was on more of the short lived side to the point where the main corporate anti-time travel crony guy was more story focused. This didn't make a whole lot of sense since the villain was supposed to highlight the aftermath results of Professor X dying. Story spent a little too much time on the inner battles of the multiverse time travel.Movie was excellent overall however, a great film, excellent characters not just including Wolverine & Deadpool, and the best part is the that the fact that it was action badass but totally wholesome all at the same time. I would buy this movie in a heartbeat once it becomes available on dvd or digital store marketplace. I give the film an overall score of 83.5. This has been the best film since Deadpool 1 beating out both Deadpool 2 & Logan in my honest opinion.In a ranking table I would probably rank it like: Avengers 1- 93 Ironman 1- 91 Deadpool 1- 85.5 Deadpool & Wolverine- 83.5 The Wolverine- 82 Logan- 81 Deadpool 2- 80.

I enjoyed X-Men comics as a child, but let's face it all the hero's were complete dorks...with a slight exception of Wolverine and Gambit. To this day I don't understand why Gambit has never made an appearance, he was by far the coolest X-Men. So, I was excited to see him even though how limited his screen time was.Deadpool franchise really brought the Marvel universe for the adults who enjoyed Christian friendly Marvel comics as children, to the big screen, unlike Spider Man.The third installment to the Deadpool franchise, did not disappoint. It's not my favorite, but the originality of this film really made it a fun to watch without a single dull moment.I think this film is very child friendly despite the over the top comedic violence and vulgar language. This film is a morality play, about forgiveness, dealing with differences, and finding common good among characters who seem irredeemable.Enjoy!

Watched it today and absolutely loved it. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh jackman together .. brilliant . Some great laughs and one liners . Gore and fight scenes great . Wesley snipes (blade ) and channing Tatum (gambit ) brilliant .. snipes has hardly aged . Not once did I get bored of any scene. Would highly recommend anyone to go and see it and not enjoy it . Am considering a second visit . Deadpool and wolverine are such fabulous characters and I've loved the older films but together pure genius . The dog is an added bonus .. and some English actors thrown in as well. Go and see .. you won't be disappointed.

I was so looking forward to watching this. I cant believe how anyone can say it was good! Absolutely no plot. One fight scene after another, so it got extremely boring and beyond silly. Some of the dialogue was hard to follow and rubbish anyway. Hardly any was funny enough to make me giggle never mind laugh like in the first two films. Deadpool always remained likeable even though you knew you shouldn't like him. In this film however, he was too far removed from reality to make you even care a jot about him, never mind like him. Having a toothless, tongue out, mega old chinese crested dog myself i did appreciate the dog. Even the great little dog though wouldn't tempt me to ever watch this film again. What as waste of money. With all this talent it's a shame they didn't get good writers on board too.

STAR RATING: ***** Brilliant **** Very Good *** Okay ** Poor * AwfulWade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) has put his alter-ego Deadpool behind him, and has now settled into a quiet life working at a home convenience superstore, along with the rest of his 'X Force' crew. However, one night, at a raucous house party, he finds himself rounded up by soldiers working on behalf of the zany Mr. Paradox (Matthew MacFadyan), who wants to create a time shift that will wipe out Wade's universe. His only hope is to locate his old adversary, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) whose universe suffered the same fate, and form an unstoppable fighting team.In the world of the Marvel Comics Universe, and DC Comics, which have an unstoppable grip on the box office which shows no sign of abatement, it's easy to get burnt out with the lack of distinction between them all, a mass churning out of the same thing, as long as it all pleases the fanboys. And so, Deadpool is an all the more refreshing character, an anti-hero who doesn't play by the rules, and with all the character flaws not present in traditional action heroes. And Wolverine, of the X-Men, serves as a perfect foil, and they now have a long awaited collaboration that should please those who've been waiting for it.What could have been a self indulgent, self congratulating borefest is instead quite evenly balanced, and successfully pulls off what it wants to do very well. Reynolds occupies the first half, with Deadpool's story told in reverse, and delivers the goods, with Deadpool as his wise-cracking, pop culture referencing best. Wolverine doesn't enter the proceedings until about two thirds of the way in, but when he does, they form a snappy dynamic, with Jackman injecting his grunting, volatile take on Wolverine. Support wise, MacFadyan hams it up as the mysterious villain, while there are surprise cameos from Jennifer Garner (Elektra), Wesley Snipes (Blade) and Chris Evans (Captain America), in their respective superhero roles, as well as appearances from Channing Tatum, Henry Cavill and Wunmi Mosaku.In what appears to be a farewell to the characters, director Shawn Levy has crafted a loud, fun, riotous romp that pays a more than respectful homage to its two central characters, and leaves fans, either casual or obsessive. ****

I think this is a great marvel movie and the best movie of the year..this movie should get 10/10 rating. The power character is so smooth. The quality is very cool. The cameos is not expected and is very exciting things. Deadpool humour is same and its very hilarious. My favourite character and actors which is Hugh Jackman as Wolverine is so cool and I'm glad he's coming back to the movie. It's not recommended for kids under 18 years old .The characters makes me feel nostalgia and I'm very happy for the coming back characters. The ending was perfect and I hope Deadpool and Wolverine will comeback again in Avangers secret war or another movie..Thanks for the great experience. Sorry for the bad grammar. <3 Wolverine.

I 100% agree with Hugh Jackman when he said he never quite got to scratch the depths of Wolverine in his previous movies. Deadpool & Wolverine ticks off every missed opportunity in terms of storylines, quips, costumes and things fans from the comics always hoped they'd get to see. They packed in everything and more into a film that, by modern superhero film standards, wasn't excessively long either. I'll forever be grateful for these three men (& Feige) for finally delivering a well-rounded Wolverine to the audience. D&W is a film where, the more knowledge a viewer has about the actors, studios, characters and comics involved, the more they'll enjoy it. Deadpool & Wolverine's jokes and references operate on so many levels, it's a film viewers can appreciate more with every viewing. People who say this film wasn't as funny as they'd hoped it would be, or question why Channing Tatum was cast as Gambit, have completely let the last 20 years of superhero movies and general pop culture news whiz by them. Savvy nerds and geeks will feast upon these easter eggs. That's not say D&W can't be throughly enjoyed without knowing all the meta jokes. It's similar to how adults appreciated jokes in Shrek that the younger audience didn't get. On a personal note, it was thrilling to see Jackman back as my favourite character from the Marvel comics and movies. He and Reynolds are a magic combination and each gives something extra to their performance when onscreen together. You can replace Bond, Superman, Spiderman and Batman, but for me, there can be only one Wolverine. Let's hope Disney really do make him do this til he's 90!

The length of the film was quite challenging for me. I had to take four breaks just to get through it, and unfortunately, I only truly enjoyed the last quarter. Despite the strong performances by Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, the overall story did not resonate with me as much as other films like Logan and DP2.The inclusion of Laura x23 felt rushed and lacked depth, while Channing Tatum's cameo seemed out of place and unconvincing. It's clear that this movie was made for fans, but the lack of development in both the story and characters left me feeling underwhelmed. I don't mean to be overly critical, but this film just didn't meet my expectations.

Deadpool movies are the one and only movies that makes me smile. This one was also awesome too. Thanks to all crew that makes this great movie!The way of using all actors were also marvelous :) . The subtle and smart jokes are sprinkled throughout the movie as usual. I also congratulate the writers for this wonderful production.Some may say it wasn't perfect, you're exaggerating. But it's almost impossible to produce work of this quality in such a short time. Only real professionals in their field can do it.If you want to have fun and don't mind swearing, I recommend you go.By the way, this is not a family movie. Don't go with your kids :)

I was hesitant about watching this - maybe because Deadpool 2 ended in a not-so-happy way - but I am thrilled to say that this was the best Marvel film I've watched in years. Reynolds and Jackman understand their characters well, and the back and forth banter, the push and pull of their yin and yang personas, make them the perfect "odd couple" duo. They're both dealing with similar loses (won't go into details because that would be a spoiler) but the circumstances allow them to understand that they're both trying to rewrite history. The aspect of the TVA is quite literally how they plan to do that, with Logan more-or-less agreeing because of a half truth. The fight sequences, the cameos, the locations, the dialogue, literally everything was perfect. And my favorite quality, the sarcastic, inappropriate wit of Deadpool complimented Logan's dry, mature perspective, making their quest epic.

It's one of my top superhero movies honestly. I thought Hugh and Ryan had great chemistry on screen and all the cameos were cool and well thought out, unlike multiverse of madness. It was the perfect multiverse movie without getting ridiculous and it was hilariously brilliant. The fight choreography was sick also.The comedy within the movie was the perfect amount of humor with jokes that actually landed. The action and fight choreography was very fun to watch. I thought they finally did Wolverine comic accurate and I'm convinced nobody can out do Hugh Jackman as Wolverine. Ryan Reynolds just exudes Deadpool so that was amazing as well. The dancing throughout the movie was one of my favorite parts.

I was really optimistic, despite Marvel's lack of consistent movie making lately, that they would continue the good work done by Fox to make another good Deadpool film. And they definitely delivered. The comedy was very entertaining, and the action was impressive and classic of Deadpool. He still was the merc with a mouth we love! There was a lot of 4th wall breaking which I loved, and there were many amazing cameos. The plot was not the greatest I've ever seen, but it was more than enough to move the movie forward and explain the multi-verse changes and leaving the plot of Logan alone and bringing back Hugh Jackman as the one, only Wolverine. The ending was very satisfying as well. I would highly recommend watching this movie in the theater!!

I've never felt the urge to write a movie review before, but here I am, iPad in hand, ready to tap out words of praise. Why? Because if you're a Marvel fan, you'll watch the movie anyway. But if you're like me - a bit meh about their universe - you might skip it. And that would be a mistake.I want you to be as astounded as I was by a film I had zero expectations for. The only other movie to both baffle and exceed my expectations like this was Life is Beautiful. Yeah, I know, it's an odd comparison, but it's true. So deal with it.Deadpool and Wolverine managed to make me laugh and cry simultaneously. How? Go watch it and see for yourself.Simply magical.
