I watched this film feeling like I was in the 2000s. I'm a 30-year-old adult who grew up watching the golden age of heroes, with incredible fun films like Spider-Man (2002 and 2004), Fantastic Four (2005), The Punisher (2004 ), between others... Deadpool & Wolverine is practically a celebration of this incredible, experimental, fun and unforgettable time. I feel grateful for being born in the 90s and having the opportunity to watch those films in the 2000s. This third film in the Deadpool saga is simply the BEST of the trilogy, and perhaps it won't have the same effect on the younger generation.It's so worth it! Fun from start to finish with lots of Easter eggs, unbelievable cameos and a damn good ending!

Very nice and I am a fan of X-Men I have seen all the movies that were in it I hope to see it in the future in new movies I liked the movie the photography and directing and acting also Marvel has great heroes I was a fan of DC before but after this I am a fan of Marvel and I hope DC heroes join Marvel like Superman Batman and Flash the market will be completely for Marvel and Green Lantern also who played the role of Deadpool and Catwoman I think she is from DC I really want them in Marvel I hope you take a step to achieve that Will there be upcoming parts of Deadpool or is this the last one The fun is really Marvel no discussion.

I truly adored the second edtion (which was absolutely brilliant) and therefore I had high hopes for this 3rd sequel...The bad: There is definitely a lack of good dialogue and the story is all over the place. I couldnt make sense of it. There is also a lack of good character's chemistry. It's just off. It doesnt flow like the second edition did with ease. And without a good flow and solid characters that I can relate to, without all that even some of the better jokes dont land. They fall flat.What's left? A ton of nonstop bloody action, a lot more than the previous editions. And I get BORED by endless bloody fights just for the sake of trying to impress with CGI effects.It's not a terrible movie for sure, but the editing is overkill with it's constant fast cuts (even in talking scenes). Not letting the characters TALK and INTERACT with each other at a more natural pace, like the second edition did that is a big let down for me.This 3rd sequel didnt surpass the brilliant second edition I am disappointed to say. It was quite underwhelming to watch this latest 3rd sequel.I wont recommend it to my friends and family like I did do with the brilliant second edition. Not terrible, but quite underwhelming...

Movie is filled with comedy, all the things which people r discussing about marvel, deadpool says this blatantly in this film, amazing script full of good comedy which u rarely see nowadays, every actors, every surprising cameo, man everything was top notch, not a single dull moment Their r references in this movie about mad max too this was hilarious Do not miss this in theater coz these kinds of movies r made for theater, action is too notch, gore and bloody which i really like, many scenes where entire theater will erupt and will start cheering out loud After a long time marvel with a good movie.

This movie is really great..A really fun ride. The cameos are top notch. Really glad to see all those characters again. Hopefully will see them again in future.. Maybe Story wise this isn't the best MCU movie but if you want to get a Deadpool-Wolverine duo ride this is for you.. If only it was released before Loki Season 2 & little bit of introductory 101 about the void would have made this story great.. Nonetheless I enjoyed the whole time...About the intro, It's the best in any MCU movie. The fighting scenes are greatly choreographed..Different versions of Deadpool & wolverine were fun to watch too ( This is not a spoiler lol) ; Maybe it is :) Got you there in Deadpool Style!!So let's stay Deadpooooooool & Wolverinnnnnnnne!

What is wrong with the world when this movie has such a good reviews!The bad humor, the unnecesary violence, unnecesary swearing. I couldn't even smile during the whole movie.I red the good coments but I can't believe it. What kind of sense of humor is that?Sorry to see Hugh Jackman at this kind of movie. We watched because of him, but such a big dissapoinment.You just ended with a very bad feeling of what kind of movies are now popular and successfull. The people who made them, see them and act on them.I hope the future is not full of this movies that don't give anything else than nauseas.

"Deadpool & Wolverine (2024)" delivers everything fans could hope for and more. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool and Hugh Jackman's Wolverine is electric, blending humor, action, and heart in perfect balance. The film is packed with razor-sharp dialogue, breaking the fourth wall in classic Deadpool fashion, while also giving Wolverine his gritty, no-nonsense edge. The action sequences are exhilarating, combining Deadpool's chaotic energy with Wolverine's brutal combat style. Fans of both characters will love the playful banter and the emotional moments, making this crossover a dream come true. It's the perfect mix of comedy, action, and nostalgia that leaves audiences eagerly wanting more.

Let me preface by saying that this is my first *movie* review on here. I have been meaning to get into it for a time but gaming reviews have been all I have had time for up to this point. However, after seeing this film, I really felt I needed to share my thoughts.First and foremost, this movie is excellent; but it will not be what you expect. I personally am a hardcore DC fan (despite their disappointing movies) and I still found myself eagerly awaiting "Deadpool and Wolverine". I followed the development of this film thoroughly and paid close attention to cast & crew credits with interest. I grew up liking Marvel before it was cool so I had high hopes for this film.As for this film, you certainly get the best of both worlds with both old and new Marvel. You'll certainly laugh until you cry if you get the references, but the little details are what truly bring this movie up to an 8 for me. The story itself is kind of boring and poorly written. But the acting and dialogue are so good that you don't really care.I would put it in my top 5 MCU films for sure but I still felt that they left something to be desired. I do recommend this film and I will probably see at least once more myself at some point.

The best Marvel movie since End Game! We are planning to actually see it a second time in the theater. We laughed from start to finish. Deadpool and Wolverine are AWESOME together. Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds commaderie comes thru the screen through out the entire movie. If you get up during the movie and leave the theater for even a minute you will miss something. You don't even feel how long the running time is because the entire movie is entertaining. We love all the Deadpool movies but this is the best one. The supporting characters are all awesome. I eouldnt change one second of this movie.

My life is complete. I want to kiss on the mouth everyone who was involved in the making of this movie. Let me tell you why you need to do yourself a favor and see this masterpiece. 1- The multiverse centered plot was executed perfectly, which most other Marvel movies have failed to do. Many other films butcher this redundant dramatic story of a character needing to save a timeline, but Deadpool 3 transforms it into a hilarious, meaningful character arc for both Wade and Logan. Instead of taking themselves seriously, the writers embrace the ridiculousness of Marvel, creating a perfect self deprecating comedy. 2 - The jokes and cameos had the entire audience laughing without one, cheap corny quip that Marvel is famous for. Obviously this is Deadpool, so the dialogue wasn't child or their overprotective mother friendly, but this raunchy comedy is just what this cinematic universe needed to kick the restraints Disney put on their shoulders. 3 - The performances of Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman really complete the 10/10 rating. Both actors convey the complex moral conflicts that make these characters unique so well, you can't imagine anyone ever usurping these roles. I don't think I could run out of compliments for Deadpool and Wolverine and this movie secures the title of best trilogy that the Marvel universe has.

Ryan Reynolds takes himself too serious in this movie. It is not a movie about a cartoon character anymore but a movie about Ryan Reynolds and his wife. Does he think, he created Deadpool? The only interesting and creative part of this movie was the depiction of the lost zone, especially the fortress of Cassandra. The only good actors were Matthew Macfadyen and in one scene Hugh Jackman, his angry monolog in the car. It was hard to watch this movie without lots of eyerolling or completely closing my eyes due to too much cringe. There are a few funny scenes, but not enough to apologize for the rest of the stupid script.

This movie has everything a movie should have i dont get why people are giving it 8 or 9 stars and saying only good stuff about the movie like you cleary enjoyed every second of the movie so give it your props and give a 10 star review.This is the best work Marvel has done in the last 4 years or so for sure and you most certainly are not going to get bored.I give this movie 10 stars and i think you are gonna have a good time watching it too, if you liked deadpool 1 and 2 well then get ready because this one is without a doubt the best work yetyou can cleary see they put alot of time and effort into the production and deadpools lines have definitely not gotten worse.So get ready with your popcorn because you are in for a ride.Enjoy!!

I absolutely loved this movie ! Hugh Jackman thank you for your service. And if you've already seen the movie you know exactly what I'm talking about. This movie was for us , the fans. The plot , the cast , the music TOP TIER Marvel. It's one of the best movies I've seen since No way home & Avengers Endgame. And I won't spoil anything but the cameossss OMG! Ryan reynolds really must've called in a lot of favors because the cast is insane. If you grew up with early Marvel you will love all the Easter eggs and cameos throughout. My only complaint is that I wish we knew why Thor was crying lol I feel like that's a question I need answered. Go see it if you can ! You will not be disappointed.

Firstly I'm going to start with this movie is not for everyone, if you are going to watch this movie I am going out on a leg to assume you are not easily offended and at least fit into on of the below categories!If you enjoy a good action flick with some top tier laughs this is for you. If you are an avid follower of the Marvel Universe (comics and movies) then buckle up because you are in for a real treat.I fall in to the latter category and without any exaggeration I am absolutely chuffed with how good this movie was. Without ruining any part of the movie with spoilers all I can say is the references, the little jabs, the breaking of the fourth AND fifth walls on top of comedic excellence as well as fitting it snugly into Marvels over-complicated MCU was just an absolute delight.I will be watching this again!!

This is a brash movie full of brutal, grotesque sequences, but below the surface there is joke after joke and reference after reference. It's just brilliant.Maybe I'm biased because I'm a 90s kid and I got all the references, so I found it particularly great, but i think I'm astute enough to not be bowled over by a nod to something nostalgic.This is a superb film.My wife and I laughed out loud so many times. The humour oscillates between ridiculous and huge self awarenes. And thankfully they've gotten rid of the more slapstick stuff.This has immediately become one of my favourite movies of the last decade.Watch it, relax and enjoy.

I absolutely LOVED this movie! It was everything I hoped for and more. Deadpool and Wolverine together on screen is pure magic. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman is off the charts! Their banter, action, and comedic timing kept me laughing the whole way through. The humor is spot-on, with endless witty jokes, meta-references, and just the right amount of absurdity that we love from Deadpool. Wolverine's tough, no-nonsense attitude combined with Deadpool's chaotic energy creates the perfect balance. The action scenes are top-notch, full of intense fights and epic moments, but it's the humor and heart that truly shine. Whether you're a fan of the characters or just love a good action-comedy, this movie delivers in every possible way. Hands down one of the best Marvel movies ever made - I can't wait to watch it again!

I had pretty much given up on the MCU since Endgame but being a fan of Hugh Jackman and his past cinematic runs as Wolverine I decided to give this one a shot. The violence, profanity and scatological humor is as you'd expect, off the scale, and there is something of a convoluted plot going on, but really the main drive of the film felt like two characters who hate one another and spend a good portion of the film trying to kill one another. But the problem is, knowing that both protagonists are essentially immortal (one with endless regenerative abilities, the other with an unbreakable adamantium skeleton and a fast-healing factor) then their fights become essentially meaningless. They can't kill one another, so it's just basically watching two guys fight with one another and waiting for it to resolve so we can get on with the story. Maybe it was a little interesting with the initial fight but after awhile, it gets old. Likewise the many numerous cameos that I won't spoil here were amusing at first, but you can only do so many "oh it's him" or "oh its her" reactions and then it gets tedious, especially when you're teased with a cameo and then the character either dies shortly after or just isn't seen again. It's nostalgia key-dangling at it's worst. As mentioned, I am a fan of Hugh Jackman and his return to the Wolverine was fantastic, like he stepped right back into the same role he was so legendary at before, but unfortunately there's just not enough of him and, to be completely honest, I would have preferred to see him in his own film instead of in a tiresome, gory buddy comedy.

Yep, this will save Marvel enough. I can't imagine the amount of effort to put together a coherent script that contains a hot stew of satirical comedy, The-Boys-level violence, fourth-wall superimposing, and out-of-everywhere cameos and to convince Disney to fund it. Despite playing under Marvel's worldview of TVA and multiverse, Deadpool & Wolverine actually tells a simple story of two losers saving the world and redeeming one another --- a could-not-get-any-simpler formula but made with such respect and compassion of the lore which we have not seen from Marvel productions in a long time. It is a rewarding experience to all the fans who accompanied the cinematic superhero history thus far, whether the universe under Fox, Marvel, or more. However, this movie is extremely fan-based, as well as many other superhero films that are successful in part because they allude to prior works, which is concerning because the story itself is often placed secondary. Anyhow, this film deserves to be enjoyed in a crowded theater or with a bunch of friends --- just like the old Marvel.

I don't know why the current screenwriters are always doing some stupid plots, but when I see the characters who grew up with me appear on the big screen again, I really can't describe the touch and sadness, as if the past time once came from behind again, only I was in the middle and the memory was around. Sore. You can experience the lost time in a movie, through our favorite characters, even those inconspicuous villains. They used to live in front of us, and then in our memory. Now they appear in front of us again. This is the surprise and touch brought by various guest appearances. They make me feel the real passage of time, the past and the present.

I cannot think of another movie which was so incredibly hyped up and actually came close to living up to its billing! Comedy is for me the most difficult thing to produce in a movie theatre..... one great hilarious scene can make an average movie into a good one! I'm a huge comedy fan in every genre..... I've flown around the world to watch stand ups! This was just brilliant! I'm sure their will be the fair share of wannabe "edgy" critics who will always try put themselves on a pedestal by going against the crowd but I'm sorry if you didn't laugh out loud during this movie then this type of action comedy just isn't for you! Don't watch it and certainly don't tell people it wasn't good! I don't watch or review romantic period dramas because I don't like them! However DP&W I loved!! There's really not much more I can say! I just loved it! The fight scenes were choreographed spectacularly, the off the cuff 4th wall break comments you could easily miss were so funny, Ryan and Hugh were always going to be a great pairing and yes they really did deliver! I won't put any spoilers in here other than to say do yourselves a favour.... Go see this movie and then give an accurate IMDB (which is the only site worth anything in my opinion) review so others can enjoy it too! Well done guys! This will take some beating!!

(MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD) I was very hyped for this movie. I was very excited to see the chemistry between a collaboration expected for years, I was excited to see the cult-funny action moments and the humor all the Deadpool movies, I was excited to see the Villain of the movie (Kassandra Nova) who looked quite interesting, in general everything about this movie looked promising to me at least. And I am happy to say that I was not let down or disappointed one bit at any part of the movie. Don't get me wrong now the movie is not flawless. It's 2 problems for me are the minor plot holes and kind of the way they managed the movie's time. These would be big problems if the movie was taking itself too seriously. DeadPool 3 is a cult superhero movie full of action that aims to only be fun and enjoyable and it isn't afraid to show it. However it still is an objectively quite good movie. I liked the cinematography, the soundtrack, the acting...Everything in this movie just amazing. Is this the so called ''Marvel's savior'' movie that will make us forget 85% of what happened after phase 3? I don't really know. Maybe. What I liked is that I sat down enjoyed 2 hours of MARVEL/DEADPOOL action, didn't get bored ONCE watched a very good movie and in general had a spectacular experience. That is something both MARVEL and DC aren't so generous nowadays so...have fun and enjoy 2 hours and 7 minutes of pure cult, funny, R rated action.

I'm thrilled to have seen a Marvel movie this year, especially featuring Deadpool and Wolverine. These two make an incredible duo. The fight scenes were fantastic, and the comedic storyline had me laughing throughout. The film was packed with Easter eggs and cameos. It had two villains: Cassandra Nova and Paradox from the TVA. Cassandra's powers were intimidating and she had a truly scary presence, although I wish the MCU would do more with her character rather than potentially letting us down. Some scenes felt dragged out, and the pacing was occasionally slow and awkward. Despite this, the movie was overall fun and exciting. It was the great summer blockbuster we had all been waiting for.

If we may have hoped in vain, no, this film will not "save" Disney's Marvel Universe. It can't even save neither the "Deadpool" series, whose first sequel was the only one at all fresh and interesting, nor the "X-Men" series, whose "Logan" from 2017 could have been a decent ending. The way it is, the movie wouldn't even deserve any comment, but it's good to draw a line once again and state how far this franchise has come. As far as I'm concerned, any interest faded long ago with the disappointing "Endgame" back in 2019.What can I say, except that you can like the movie only if you really liked the TV series "Loki" (unfortunately, I don't know such viewers), and if your humor remained at the level of preschool age, but far from the fact that the film is recommended for the mentioned age. I'm not even sure who this production is actually intended for, because with this amount of gratuitous violence, severed heads, hectoliters of spilled blood, constant swearing, profanity and cheap lines, it's hard to determine the target group that this wish-wash should like.All that aside, the biggest problem is the lack of any meaningful story, even reasonable motivation and characterization of actors, and that the reminders of some other heroes from Marvel history are reduced to literally appearing and disappearing in the next frame, wouldn't it cause a little nostalgia for long ago past better times, which represents, if not an insult to ours specific once-favorite characters, then certainly an insult to the good taste of the aggrieved audience. Also, there is an obvious intention to plan the future of the Marvel franchise by recycling the same characters from parallel universes, of which this film is just an announcement.I will add at the very end, the only two bright little spots are the main protagonists Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman, who despite everything showed that they can somehow act in this kind of movie without any inspiration, script and real dialogues. Judge for yourself if you think that's enough to watch it.

A breath of fresh air. No agendas shoved down my throat. The last ten years have been girl bosses and men are bad. I finally enjoyed a show that contained men and women working together. Wonderful fun writing. Better acting. Disney take note of this movie. You don't have to make all men incompetent and stupid. A well balanced well written fun experience is all anyone wants. I don't want to see the hate that Disney + spews. I cancelled my subscription to Disney+ for this reason. Give us good stories. The eighties were great because the films were exiting. Not filled with man hate rage. You want movie goers back. Put films out like wolfy and dapple.

We all knew that Marvel had a lot at stake with this premiere to get the MCU and its stumbles back on track, but there was a trio that had an ace up their sleeve to make our hearts beat again.Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman and Shawn Levy give us a really fun, adult movie, designed to satisfy all the needs of fans. Beyond the fact that one can talk about fandom, the interesting thing that Marvel's new project proposes is to honor its past and look together to the future with a duo that breaks it on screen with charisma, blood and emotions.No one can argue with Reynolds' charisma, but it's good to know that Jackman is joining us to give us the tone necessary for an on-screen adventure full of gags, incredible sequences and the adult quality that we all wanted and that we now also know we needed.This is where the intelligence of a director like Levy comes in, who knows how to handle humor, action and blood and sets out to give us all those Marvel-style madness in a correct, precise and fearless way. So much politically incorrect humor, references, jokes and transgressive moments that are squared even over its two predecessors. Decisions that serve to make a correct mix between laughing at the entire world of superheroes, but also giving it the moment to vindicate its own story.So we can ask ourselves, was it worth the risk? Of course, it was worth the risk. It's pure entertainment that leaves no one out of the party, it's a gigantic event that Marvel wins with, not by providing the best MCU movie, but by giving us the movie that we all needed right now, which is to believe again that everything can be possible at Marvel.To think that this is a movie that only uses fandom resources to sustain itself is really wrong. It is a well-made movie that has absolute intelligence embedded in knowing how to handle emotions in equal parts and in respecting itself as a movie that has people behind it who know about cinema and entertainment.It is a well-directed, well-acted film, with a brutal soundtrack, with well-executed sequences and with a villain who is very well occupied, it is not a simple event film to satisfy needs, it is a film that fulfills its role as being in good hands that make it noticeable and without reproaches.For me, it is a result that does not disappoint, it remains firm with the initial proposal of the saga, and knows how to take advantage of certain decisions that Marvel planned lately and that end up being the perfect addition to become one of the most fun and functional crossovers of superhero franchises.A film to watch and enjoy and leave the theater satisfied, simply because Marvel was what it needed to give us, and we were totally grateful to receive it.

What's not to say that has not already been said.I really thought Logan was perfect and thought perhaps this might be a last ditch from Marvel and in many ways hedged their bets on Deadpool to redeem life into a universe that's been awash with bad tv series and let's face it some really terrible movies.The reason I say everything, the soundtrack was quality the story was a bit too much at the beginning but boy did it get better and better.I avoided all spoilers and I mean all. It's been YEARS since I enjoyed a cinema trip like this. There's a part in Logan that charles says this is what a family looks like and to take it in and enjoy it. Many people did.You can't touch this. It's one of a kind. Hugh Jackman and RR are just amazing, the family they created is one of a kind, take it in and enjoy it.

As I waited about 3 years since the first confirmation of Deadpool 3, not a day went by when I thought of it being the best thing to come. And now in 2024, it is here and I'm so glad it's everything I wanted it to be. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are the duo I never knew could be so perfect on (and off) screen. Both of them just embrace the role of our favorite characters and delivers something beautiful and magical. With crazy cameos, amazing story and just a ride full of 4th wall breaks, laughter and action sequences, Deadpool and Wolverine is the experience of the decade so far. This is what comic book movie is like and it feels like a gift for all Marvel fans for the dedicated 30+ years of fan following and just completes the circle in the most wholesome way possible!P. S. I was so disappointed with the critics low reviews that I decided to give it a 10 as I legit couldn't anything to pick as a con. It's just a perfect CBM movie even if it's your first marvel movie ever!PROS:CONS:

It's been years since I've laughed so much at a movie. For a while, I completely forgot it was 2024 and felt like I was back in the golden days of 2010. This film is a breath of fresh air, with humor that hits hard and a satirical edge that's both razor-sharp and brilliantly funny.The writing is packed with quotable lines and digs at Disney, Fox, and the entire entertainment industry-each more hilarious than the last. The humor isn't just surface-level; it's clever and self-aware, creating an experience that makes you laugh, think, and appreciate the nuances of satire. It's the kind of comedy that we've been sorely missing, and it's been far too long since we've had a movie that pulls it off this well.In a world where comedy often feels watered down, this film dares to push the boundaries, delivering an experience that's refreshing and undeniably entertaining. We need more movies like this-bold, unapologetically funny, and capable of transporting you to a time when comedies knew how to make a real impact. Without a doubt, it's one of the best films in years.

I've head many different takes on the third 'Deadpool' entry - some enjoyed it, others didn't. A few thought it was merely okay. I guess what you're going to get out of this film is dependent on what you stand on the franchise and superhero films in general.If you're utterly tired of superhero films then this one doesn't offer much that's different - a supervillain wants to destroy the world and our antihero, Deadpool, must (finally!) team up with Wolverine (complete with yellow comic book costume) and save the day.And that's it. There's absolutely nothing majorly new about this film, so you could say it's merely average, unless - like me - it ticks all the boxes you're looking for in a film. Ryan Reyolds and Hugh Jackman are great actors who are perfectly cast for their retrospective roles and they play off each other perfectly. I've always wanted to see Hugh Jackman's Wolverine get the 'proper' outfit on screen and go crazy. I get that here. Personally, I loved the Marvel Cinematic Universe up until 'Phase 4' started, so a film like 'Deadpool & Wolverine' which openly mocks how the franchise has fallen is also very welcome. Finally, the cameos. I'm old enough to recall the superheroes films of the late 90s and early 2000s, so let's just say it was great to see a few 'old friends' on screen again.So I enjoyed it. If I had to offer any criticism, I'd say the opening twenty minutes did feel a little slow compared to the 'main meat' of the film. Plus a few scenes later on could probably have been trimmed. Overall, I'd take out between 10-15 minutes of the runtime to tighten it up. The main gripes I've seen online are that it's not very focused and if you dwell too much on the plot then it all falls apart. Okay, this may be true. So, in order for that not to be a problem - just don't think too much about the story and enjoy the excellent chemistry between the two leads and laugh at all the in-jokes based around the genre.I did. And I loved it.

Anyone calling this the "best movie of 2024" should be banned from this website.In order to even remotely have a chance at understanding this movie you should have watch the Loki series at Disney plus. Otherwise, it is impossible to get a grasp of several concepts displayed here.This is a movie for Marvel nerds, a public that is easy to please. Regular moviegoers are going to have a hard time making any sense of this film.This was a disappointment and a missed opportunity. Marvel keeps abusing the "multiverse" genre and they are failing miserably to produce anything one could possible enjoy. I am not expecting a masterpiece. These are supposed to be films you can casually enjoy but now the stories are lame and too convoluted.This film should have been screened at a Comic Con. The vast majority of moviegoers are just wasting their time and money.

Yeah i knew this would be good. There was zero doubt in my mind that the third deadpool was gonna deliver but it 100% exceeded my expectations. Where do i even begin???Easter eggs, inside jokes, and oddly specific references are the gold that makes these deadpool movies so fun. It's not the sex jokes or the one liners or the slapstick humor in particular, but it's deadpool says something that only certain people will get depending on how much they know. This is what creates the disonance between a fictional movie that only refers to things that happen in the movies world and a fictional movie that acknowledges real world things. Deadpool takes both as well as references from other completely unrelated fictional movies to frame his jokes. That's why these movies work so well.Deadpools character is molded through Ryan Reynolds. Hes learned over the years what to do and what NOT to do with deadpool through trial and error. He knows what the fans wanna see and this movie spoon fed it to us.Pulling in wolverine was a necessity to this films success. Hugh Jackman...the man you are. The fanservice we were given was through the roof for simps, geeks, and every type of fan in between. The two of them together was what i needed.Other films needa take notes, this is how you make an audience happy. Of course not every movie has to have the same goal deadpool & wolverine had, but i know for a fact that Ryan, Hugh, and Dogpool are all swimming in pools of the 1.32 billion dollars its made.

Script may not be very good... But has some sense of humor, tough some lame jabs. Ryan and Jack an are some of the finest comic characters replicas.Wolverine could actually be brought back to the big screen... The character is ageless and could live on effortlessly...And for this movie, a lot of nostalgic characters brought in a whole new level of excitement. But where this movie missed it(for me), was when they introduced an alternate universe... I think that idea should be scrapped. And yet again, there was no way bringing back long dead characters without allowing that thought.Mehn... The visuals though!

No spoilers here. If you are a fan of Deadpool, see this movie. If you are a fan of Wolverine, see this movie. If you are a fan of movies that poke fun of movies, go see this. This was by far the best way Ryan Reynolds could make up for and help us forget Green Lantern. They went and earned that R rating with a gusto and determination that made for an entertaining, thrill filled ride that left little if any room for improvement. I am glad Disney didn't stifle the raunch and blatant use of the spillage of blood to stick to a formula that proves family friendly. The little kid in me didn't mind one bit. Thanks to the entire cast for such a wonderful summer movie. Make sure to stay through the credits!

Only one thing about this movie made me feel completely betrayed and annoyed. That's the fact it ended. But I've tried to heal, and grieve the best movie this decade, but alas, that is the price of this cinematic excellence.Wow, Disney, you actually allowed a unique, interesting and r-rated movie with genuine suspense, humour and allure release under your production. Wow, just wow. Maybe this is a red herring and tomorrow I'll see an announcement for a new she hulk movie starring the newly named x-women of colour, written by TJ Miller and Greta Thunberg.Hopefully, this is a turning point and you'll begin to eviscerate your connection to dei discrimination against not only people, but common sense & decency. Who knows, maybe you'll produce something else I can watch for longer than 5 minutes without getting the symptoms of a heart attack but worse: Rage, Irritation, palpitions, sweaty palmes (it's worse because a heart attack usually ends in death, except I have to live with the memory of those so called films and tv shows, I'm looking at you Doctor Who, She-hulk and all the hulk spin-offs coming up, as well as the acolyte)

I really don't care what "official" reviewers say, they only care about boring god awful movies anyway. This movie is finally a movie that had FUN with it again. Remember fun? Remember when entertainment was actually light hearted and entertaining? Remember when movies weren't over 3 hours long with over 2 hours and 45 minutes of boring talks and fluff? Yeah! I missed that, and this movie truly delivers on its promise. Its just 2 hours of pure zany fun, a great sense of humor and just an overall feast of characters we know and love. I also really enjoyed (for me) newcomer Emma Corrin in this movie and I'm kinda hoping she can do the character of Cassandra in some movies again, because as a character it was nice and solid. An unexpected treat really. I feel this is the best Deadpool movie to date, and its just mad fun seeing him together with Wolverine. Also really hoping they will team up again, Hopefully also with Dafne Keen as Laura X-23 because she was again on fire in this one. Just good stuff, really!

In Deadpool and Wolverine, I praised the story, performances of Raynolds and Jackman, direction, soundtrack, visual and sound effects, emotional weight in Logan's story, entertainment value, action scenes, comedic scenes and humor, breaking the fourth wall parts, and number of characters in the movie. All these were very good and I enjoyed them very much.But what I didn't like in Deadpool and Wolverine is the screenplay, extremely complex and messy plot, and pacing because the plot seriously makes the person who is watching lost and in some scenes, does not know what exactly happened and why it happened.But these flaws do not mean that I didn't enjoy Deadpool and Wolverine. I enjoyed it, and I am looking forward to see what the MCU will carry for Deadpool, Wolverine, and the X-Men in the future. When it comes to the score, I gladly give Deadpool and Wolverine 9 out of 10.

Deadpool & Wolverine has some entertaining moments with humour that lands well (except for all the worn-out homoerotic jokes), but falls flat and becomes a victim of its own hype. The narrative leans heavily on the idea that audiences should be in awe of Wolverine's return and his team-up with Deadpool, expecting fans to cheer at every turn.Unfortunately, the film often feels bogged down by its over-reliance on nostalgia, cameos, and especially meta references. Rather than enhancing the storytelling, these elements come across as superficial and often serve as a cheap trick, adding little real depth. The overemphasis on fan service distracts from the core plot-which is already quite shallow-making the movie feel much longer than it needs to be.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" delivers fan service at its finest. Finally, we see Wolverine in the iconic yellow and black outfit we've all been waiting for! Hugh Jackman reprises his role as Wolverine, and we hope he continues to do so until he's 90. The film is packed with cameos, bringing back heroes that were memed to death, each making fun of their own legacy. Chris Evans' role had me dying of laughter, and I had to explain to my daughter that he was part of the Marvel Universe before Captain America. From start to finish, this movie keeps you entertained with its humor and action. Every cameo felt like a well-placed nod to the fans, making the experience even more enjoyable. The chemistry between Deadpool and Wolverine is electric, showcasing their unique dynamics and adding depth to their characters. The plot, filled with unexpected twists and hilarious moments, keeps you engaged throughout.But why was Thor crying?

More bigger studio films should follow this films example. If you want a big, summer popcorn film this is how you do it.I'm happy that Disney let the team behind the is make the movie that they wanted to make and not dilute the character.Like the 2 previous films this is violent, crude, silly, partially serious but always so much fun.This character will define Ryan Reynolds career as Wolverine has defined Hugh Jackmans. They have amazing chemistry together and that is the thing that makes everything work.Wolverine is the serious one and Deadpool is the smart ass. A Classic buddy comedy duo that shouldn't work well together but work beyond expectations.Will Marvel Jesus save the flaying MCU after "Endgame"? Time will tell but this is certainly a massive, positive step on the right direction.

This movie has me laughing hysterically so often throughout the whole movie. There is so much I love about it. I love the Marvel callbacks. How many comic book references and storylines it makes. If you know your actual comic books, you'll know which ones I'm talking about. All the Characters were just Awesome. I Really loved seeing all the Deadpool Variants. Ryan Reynolds yet again plays Wade Wilson aka Deadpool perfectly. It looked like everyone who was in this movie, had so much fun playing their roles and enjoying themselves. This definitely takes top spot in my favorite Marvel (All Of Them) movies.

From the moment the opening credits rolled, I knew the movie featuring Deadpool and Wolverine would be something special. This film exceeded my expectations, delivering an electrifying blend of humor, action, and emotional depth that left me utterly enthralled. As a fan of both characters, I can confidently say that this movie is a triumphant success, deserving of a perfect 10/10.The film brilliantly captures the essence of Deadpool and Wolverine, staying true to their distinct personalities while weaving a compelling narrative that brings them together in a way that feels organic and thrilling. Ryan Reynolds reprises his role as Deadpool with the same irreverent charm and wit that has endeared him to audiences worldwide. His quick one-liners, fourth-wall-breaking antics, and unapologetically outrageous behavior are all on full display, providing a steady stream of laughs throughout the film.Hugh Jackman, returning as Wolverine, brings his trademark intensity and rugged charisma to the role, reminding us why he has been the definitive Logan for nearly two decades. The dynamic between Deadpool and Wolverine is electric, with their contrasting personalities creating a delightful and often hilarious juxtaposition. Their interactions are some of the film's highlights, ranging from comical banter to heartfelt moments that showcase the depth of their characters.One of the standout aspects of the movie is its action sequences. The choreography is top-notch, delivering visceral and thrilling combat scenes that highlight both Deadpool's acrobatic agility and Wolverine's brutal strength. The film does not shy away from the graphic violence that fans of the comic books have come to expect, but it balances this with a sense of fun and exhilaration that keeps the tone from becoming too dark. Each fight scene is meticulously crafted, ensuring that every punch, kick, and slash feels impactful and satisfying.The storyline is engaging and well-paced, skillfully blending elements of both characters' lore into a cohesive plot that keeps the audience invested from start to finish. The film explores themes of redemption, friendship, and the struggle to define oneself in a world that constantly tries to box you in. These themes are woven seamlessly into the narrative, adding emotional weight to the film without detracting from its primary focus on entertainment.Supporting characters also shine in their roles, adding depth and richness to the story. The inclusion of familiar faces from the X-Men universe is a treat for longtime fans, and the new characters introduced are compelling and well-developed. The film's villain is particularly noteworthy, presenting a formidable challenge to our heroes and driving the plot forward with a palpable sense of menace.The visual effects are spectacular, seamlessly blending practical effects with CGI to create a visually stunning experience. Whether it's Deadpool's rapid healing factor in action or Wolverine's claws in combat, the effects are convincing and enhance the overall immersion of the film. The cinematography and direction are equally impressive, with dynamic camera work and creative shot compositions that keep the audience engaged and invested in the action.The soundtrack deserves special mention as well, perfectly complementing the film's tone and enhancing the emotional impact of key scenes. From high-energy tracks during action sequences to more somber pieces during reflective moments, the music is expertly curated to match the film's shifting moods.In conclusion, the Deadpool and Wolverine movie is an absolute triumph, a perfect blend of humor, action, and heart that pays homage to its source material while offering something fresh and exciting. As a fan, I couldn't have asked for a better portrayal of these beloved characters. The film's flawless execution and captivating storytelling make it a must-watch, and I wholeheartedly give it a well-deserved 10/10. This movie is a celebration of what makes Deadpool and Wolverine iconic, and it will undoubtedly be remembered as one of the best superhero films of all time.

I wrote a critic about this film.. without harsh words, but I criticized this movie. But IMDB declined my text!!!!!Hmmm...it seems that you shouldn't criticize a film rated 8 points, but actually worth 0 points.This says everything about the film... The film is bad, weak, not humorous, but inferior. (I'm not asking for more anal-themed humor!) It's sad that it turned out to be such a weak film.This movie is weak, boring and inferior.Enough of the many superhero movies. Screenwriters should go to a library and start looking for good stories, because viewers want exciting stories, not forgettable garbage like this one.

One of the top 5 movies I've ever seen. I actually have nothing bad to say. It's the most I've ever seen people laugh in a theater, cameos that put Spider-Man: No Way Home to shame, an emotional story better than Deadpool 1 or 2, and fight choreography that rivals John Wick. If you know your Marvel and enough about movies in general, it's impossible to give this anything less than a 9. And it somehow found a way to be even more gory, bloody, and violent.This isn't something I cared about, but the reason why Deadpool & Wolverine only has a 79% Rotten Tomatoes critic score is because Cassandra Nova didn't have the worthy cause as villains such as Thanos or Kilmonger. But don't get me wrong, Emma Corrin was fantastic and Cassandra Nova put more fear into Deadpool than Wolverine's claws went into him.So if you haven't seen Deadpool & Wolverine, make sure your Marvel knowledge is up to date, AND GET YOUR BUTT UP AND PLACE IT IN A MOVIE THEATER.

Thank you Ryan and Hugh... I laughed and I cried and most of all I was wet and hard....as deadpool would say....what a bromance...if I was not gay before I definitely am now...the best movie ever....the best team up ever....there is nothing that will ever top this...this movie was so worth the wait...I think I can die happy now...because I got to see my two favorite characters together on screen finally...nothing will ever compare to this...I'm only sad that there is not more to watch right now...I would have watched a 24 hour love fest of my two favorite daddies....this was fecking epic....long live dogpool.

I must admit I was a bit nervous going to see this one at the cinema without watching a trusted review first. Yes; that's the current reality of modern Hollywood movies. After many a bait-and-switch and betrayal, I've almost given up and resorted to re-watching old movies.This scepticism worked to my advantage this time. The sensation of utter relief and excitement during the opening scene was incredible. And the movie kept delivering with great pacing, contrasting between deliciously manic highs and and a few necessary breathers in between. I still expected the obligatory scene of misplaced, heavy handed morality concerning whatever this years hottest cultural potato might be, and I might even have been fine with it due to the quality of the rest of the movie. But it never came! A delight from beginning to end. Perfectly balanced, as all things must be, but never has been since End Game.Good job, everyone!

"Deadpool and Wolverine" is a masterclass in blending action, humor, and emotion. From the opening scene, it's clear that this film is not holding back on the bloody and gory elements that fans of both characters expect. The fight choreography is intense and brutally satisfying, showcasing Wolverine's raw, animalistic combat style and Deadpool's chaotic, unpredictable approach. The action sequences are relentless and well-executed, leaving the audience on the edge of their seats.But what sets this movie apart from other superhero flicks is its seamless integration of humor. Deadpool's trademark quips and fourth-wall-breaking moments are as sharp and hilarious as ever. Ryan Reynolds embodies the character with such perfection that it's hard to imagine anyone else in the role. His comedic timing is impeccable, and he delivers each line with a mix of sarcasm and charm that keeps the audience laughing throughout. Hugh Jackman's Wolverine serves as the perfect counterbalance, with his gruff demeanor and deadpan reactions providing the ideal foil to Deadpool's antics.The film also doesn't shy away from exploring the emotional depths of its characters. While it never delves too deep into melancholy, there are poignant moments that add a surprising layer of depth. Wolverine's struggle with his past and his relationship with Deadpool bring a sense of vulnerability to the character that's rarely seen. These emotional beats are handled with care, ensuring they resonate without dragging down the film's pace or tone.One of the highlights of "Deadpool and Wolverine" is the plethora of Easter eggs and cameos. Fans of the X-Men franchise will delight in spotting the numerous nods to past films, comics, and even other Marvel properties. These references are woven into the narrative in a way that feels organic and respectful to the source material. The cameos, while abundant, are used effectively and add to the film's overall charm rather than feeling like gratuitous fan service.The chemistry between Reynolds and Jackman is undeniable, and their dynamic drives much of the film's appeal. Their banter and camaraderie are infectious, and it's evident that both actors are having a blast in their roles. This infectious energy translates to the screen, making their interactions a joy to watch.Visually, the film is stunning. The special effects are top-notch, bringing the fantastical elements of the X-Men universe to life in vivid detail. The cinematography captures the gritty, visceral nature of the action while also highlighting the more tender, character-driven moments. The score and soundtrack complement the film's tone perfectly, enhancing both the high-octane action scenes and the more introspective moments."Deadpool and Wolverine" also excels in its narrative structure. The plot is well-paced, with a good balance of action, humor, and character development. The story is engaging and keeps the audience invested from start to finish. The screenplay is tightly written, with clever dialogue and a storyline that honors the legacy of the characters while also pushing them in new and interesting directions.This movie is an incredible love letter to the X-Men franchise. It pays homage to the rich history of the characters and their stories while also paving the way for future installments. It's a film that respects its audience, delivering on their expectations while also surprising them with unexpected twists and turns.In conclusion, "Deadpool and Wolverine" is a must-watch for fans of the characters and the X-Men universe. It's a film that delivers on all fronts: action, humor, emotion, and spectacle. The blend of brutal action and sharp comedy makes for an exhilarating viewing experience. It's a film that you'll want to watch again and again, catching new details and Easter eggs with each viewing. "Deadpool and Wolverine" is not just a great superhero movie; it's a great movie, period. I can't wait to watch it again.

You know,we had to seen such a great superhero movie since spiderman no way home and I got to tell you that deadpool and wolverine was better than it. First of all when you are watching a deadpool movie,you want to get comedy,violence,a lot of blood and the best performances. For me this movie had it all with the strongest one being the performances. We know that Ryan Reynolds is deadpool in his real life so I wasn't surprised by him,I was surprised by Hugh Jackman who again gave his best performance for this character. I couldn't imagine that he could give a better performance than Logan. I can't say anything for this movie ,is just amazing.

Deadpool & Wolverine is a cinematic masterpiece that expertly blends the irreverent humor of Deadpool with the brooding intensity of Wolverine. This unexpected pairing results in a film that is both thrilling and hilarious, leaving audiences wanting more.The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool and Hugh Jackman as Wolverine is electric. Their contrasting personalities and styles create a dynamic that is both entertaining and heartwarming. Deadpool's witty banter and self-deprecating humor perfectly complement Wolverine's stoic demeanor and gruff exterior.The film's action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. The choreography is flawless, and the visual effects are stunning. From the high-octane fight scenes to the explosive set pieces, Deadpool & Wolverine delivers on every level. However, what truly sets this film apart is its exceptional writing. The script is filled with clever dialogue, hilarious one-liners, and poignant moments that will leave you laughing, crying, and cheering. The writers have a masterful ability to balance humor with heart, creating a film that is both entertaining and thought-provoking.One of the most impressive aspects of Deadpool & Wolverine is its ability to seamlessly blend genres. It is a superhero film, a buddy comedy, and a heartfelt drama all rolled into one. The film never feels forced or contrived, and each element contributes to the overall narrative.In conclusion, Deadpool & Wolverine is a must-see film for fans of both the characters and the genre. It is a hilarious, action-packed, and emotionally resonant masterpiece that will leave you wanting more. The performances are outstanding, the writing is exceptional, and the chemistry between the two leads is undeniable. This is a film that will be remembered for years to come.

This was the most fun I've have at the movies in a long while, Saw it in IMAX 3D on Sunday at 12:20pm probably the 1st Showtime and it was probably 75% full, and, I'm guessing every Showtime after that was Sold Out, I remember certain movies that at the time I thought would have the Legs to get past the Billion Dollar Mark for different reasons Titanic was a great movie that even though it was over 3hrs long the word of mouth was incredible, it stayed in theatres for months, Avatar was a good movie over 2hrs 30 minutes great word of mouth for it's story and breathtaking visuals and after 2 weeks of breaking box office records there was no slowing it down and now I Deadpool & Wolverine has all those elements, It's an Absolute Cameos dream that will attract everyone but more importantly, It has a mean and lean 2hrs 7 minute runtime making it's earning potential quite possibly the 1st $5 Billion Dollar Movie? Anyways that's to be determined in the next few weeks-months but the Movie was Fantastic. And yes it was a Cameos dream and it helped tremendously my viewing experience that I didn't this beforehand, I had an absolute Blast as did everyone in attendance, The Movie has a during credits Show Reel from past behind the scenes X-Men movies and a Hilarious end credits scene, everything about this movie was spot on, It's a "10" for me hands down.

Sit back, watch and enjoy. This is about as perfect as a movie gets. Had a LOT of good laughs. The acting is awesome, the cameos are brilliant, the special effects are amazing, the humor is hilarious, the references to other pop culture are priceless, it is simply a pleasure from beginning to end. A spectacular achievement in the Deadpool franchise. Please make lots more of these 2 fantastic actors together! I want to see it again immediately, because I'm sure I've missed stuff the first time around. It doesn't fail to deliver. Sometimes I wonder just how they can continue to resurrect the characters again and again, but the multiverse doesn't disappoint.

Deadpool and Wolverine are a great duo... I went to watch this movie with low expectations being Disney. Though the story was the greatest. This film had me entertained for two hours. It's hard to say that when actually going to a movie theater these days.The action sequences were great, the cameos were surprisingly good.and the most of the jokes landed.It was not a perfect movie but when a film makes me forget reality for a couple of hours it's perfect for me.Deadpool and Wolverine is a must see film.I will go back and watch it for the Easter eggs.Let's hope Hollywood takes notes on what the audience wants when making films.

I'm sure Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds had a blast making it. However, as far as a plot/story go, it is t-e-r-r-i-b-l-e.

Deadpool is a comedy movie that is extremely fun and exciting with fight scenes. Anyone who hasn't seen it yet, I recommend you go watch it There is something exciting throughout the story. The songs in the movie are also very fun. Characters that have never been seen are seen in this story The story is very fun. Amazing to see so many cameos & be able to cheer up."Deadpool & Wolverine" delivers an exhilarating cinematic experience, packed with unexpected cameos and thrilling moments that are sure to make fans cheer. The film's strength lies in its playful nods to the wider superhero universe, creating a sense of shared excitement that's palpable. The blend of humor and action keeps the audience engaged, showcasing the unique chemistry between Deadpool & Wolverine.Critics may have their reservations, but for fans, this movie is a delightful escape that celebrates the spirit of these beloved characters (give us a break!).Sometimes, the joy of seeing familiar faces and enjoying the playful banter is more than enough to make a film memorable. If you're a fan of the franchise, this film is likely to exceed your expectations and provide a refreshing break from the more serious tones of recent superhero movies.

Very funny movie and made so much better when you're with a whole group of people all laughing out loud at so many great jokes, many of which are fourth wall breaking but that just adds to the humour in a lot of ways, plenty of cameos from all sorts of characters, that being said there are some weaker, slower moments that stop it from getting a perfect score but still very very good. Glad Disney didn't ruin Deadpool and otherwise allowed it to retain its R rating, probably longer then it needed too be, not unlike this review as I'm just looking for a last extended sentence to get all the required characters.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" made me think it could reach another level. The writers are generic and still manage to do something much worse than mediocre. A totally nonsense script with no depth, no purpose and to make matters worse it looks like a typical Marvel movie released in the last few years. The R rating of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is the most "PG-13" I've ever seen, the violence is made to shock 3-year-olds and the obscenity and swearing make the movie look like a Seth Rogen comedy, but the worst and most unfunny one he's ever made. The direction is actually interesting and the framing even offers beauty (sometimes), but these are perhaps the only really positive points of this movie. In the final balance, "Deadpool & Wolverine" represents the decadence of the superhero movie era and especially the decadence of Marvel Studios, it's a shame, I could write a very long text about how bad "Deadpool & Wolverine" is, but to save words, I prefer to end this review here.

This movie is for fans , we love it  every little scene is a massive feelings, every breathe was taken by waht I see on the screen .This movie is a portal for a whole new worlds , just keep going marvel , please don't make bad movies again , complete the road for more and more of the multiverse , bring back everyone again , ypu can see how that make fans love it , and that make you make money too , so bring them back , and that new wolverine we saw in the movie .. is fantastic awesome, use him as Wolverine in a new dimension , for once in your life , hear us Marvel , hear US , we know what we need to see , and that make money for you . So please do that , and once again , thanks for the movie of the year .

What can I say, it was exactly what I wanted to see! This a buddy comedy to it's core well seasoned with porta-potty humor and cartoonish ultra violence that just works. Reynolds and Jackman have an undeniable chemistry and I couldn't stop laughing from beginning to end! If you're a comic book/ movies nerd then you're in for a treat, because there's thousands of easter eggs and cameos that really stick the landing on account of the meta approach the film takes. I'm not giving away any spoilers but to me it all worked really well. Problems with the movie? The story isn't great, but honestly who cares, it does the job and it's tightly written, the cgi in the third act was not great and took me away for a bit, especially regarding the mask of a certain character. But these are minor gripes, go watch it and support Marvel Jesus.

This third entry in the meta heavy Deadpool series follows Wade Wilson as he lives a somewhat normal life with his family and friends. But when Marvel come knocking and offer him an opportunity to join the MCU, his initial excitement fades when he realises they want just him, and not his universe. After violently rejecting their proposal and being banished to a void-like dimension where forgotten cinematic Marvel heroes go to die, he has to rally together some classic heroes to break free and save his friends from extinction.Before going into these films, you need to understand they they are not going to take themselves seriously whatsoever, be full of lewd jokes, break the fourth wall and be utterly rammed with references to not only Marvel, but real life situations. Oscar bait, this is most definitely not. But what this is, it funny, charming, heartwarming and full of awesome action scenes and some amazing cameos. Despite a somewhat underwhelming and annoying antagonist, everything else is on point. I have said it before, but Deadpool is the character Ryan Reynolds was born to play, and Hugh Jackman's gruff and grumpy Wolverine is the perfect juxtopostion to Reynold's cheery and smart mouthed merc. If you are a fan of Deadpool, Marvel or the X-Men and just want to laugh and have fun for 2 hours then I can't recommend this enough.

You can still just leave a random score on a movie that, much like this movie, convinces otherwise sane people to throw good money away and spend over two hours in a theater rather than, oh I dunno, nailing your tongue to a tree? Which I might add would be a better use of time than seeing this overinflated vanity project for the bromance of Hugh and Ryan.It's a struggling storyline that just can't seem to make up its mind on a consistent narrative, takes too long to arrive at anything resembling a point, and no amount of 'oh hey that's so-and-so!', of cameos could save this dumpster fire of a film.Anyone hoping to have a film wrap up a trilogy in this flick is in for a very obnoxious excuse of an attempt, and if you simply must go see this anyway, check your expectations at the cinema door and just use your brain as a door stop and then you might find this remotely interesting and find entertainment value.

"Deadpool and Wolverine" is X-stastic and bombastic! This film is great fun with fan service aplenty, though a tad overcrowded with cameos crammed into its 2-hour runtime.Seeing Wolverine in his classic comic book costume after so long is a dream come true-he looks absolutely badass!The fight scenes are creatively brutal and visually gorgeous, showcasing the characters in all their glory.Loved the way it tries to tie up as much as superhero movie genre flavour has to offer starting from 2000. Leans heavily on nostalgic elements. Combinig different aspects and bits of references from both comics and superhero movies that came before.This movie feels different and it does not fit into the tiredness that superhero films have added in the last 2-3 years, it offers a well-deserved refreshThe movie leaves the door wide open for so much more and I can't wait to watch these films until I'm 90! :)) pun intendedMy personal opinion, a fun summer movie to watch at the cinema with familly and friends.

For someone that's been through the whole marvel universe starting at a very young age when Blade came out this is an absolute delight. Perfect amount of cameos and throwbacks to previous movies but original enough on its own that it's a fun watch for those who haven't fully invested themselves in the MCU.Every time I see a new marvel movie it makes me want to learn more about the characters backstories and read every graphic novel they've ever appeared in, but hey - who's got time for that.A chilling villain and two excellent leads who you don't even mind take up the majority of the screen time. Definitely one that I'll watch again!

I have Logan Blu ray, love it. I've seen Deadpool 1&2 numerous times.I didn't have any expectations for this movie going to the cinema. I didn't see any trailers, just wanted some fun. I didn't.The plot, is silly but what do you expect? It's a super heroes movie, there's fights, a villain and the good guys always win. Always the same.But this movie put spend so much time talking about Fox and Disney and real world references I didn't care for. I get breaking the 4th wall can be fun, but not on every scene please.Xavier's evil sister with androgenetic alopecia is ridiculous.Channing Tatum as gambit makes no sense, it's like you have a skinny athletic long face character and you cast a buff dude with the widest face on earth... Why? Cos he's known? OffVery few jokes made me smile, most of it was cringe at best. Skip it.

Great Movie. High expectations as I LOVE Deadpool 1 & 2. Full of hilarious jokes , one liners , violence and great cameos. Both Hugh Jackman & Ryan Renyolds were BORN to play these two characters and to finally see them together properly is brilliant. As per the opening fight scene is incredible & arguably the best out of the Deadpool movies.With the route they went down it leaves endless possibilities for both characters to proceed into another film together or branch off even further into the MCU which everyone would love to see.There was a few loose plot holes but no film can be perfect and did not ruin my experience watching the film. Highly recommend and I will be watching 10+ more times over the next few years.

This film was made for the fans. If you're a fan of Wolverine, Deadpool, and the MCU as a whole, this film was made for you. There are countless cameos and Easter eggs throughout the film that will honestly leave you speechless. Also, Hugh Jackman's performance as Logan/Wolverine is as amazing as ever in this film. The chemistry between Hugh Jackman/Wolverine and Ryan Reynolds/Deadpool is on another level. The film has the comedy down, and the action is simply amazing. The MCU in recent times has had a bad rep regarding its cheesy comedy and it's rough special effects, but this film brings the MCU back to top form.

Hugh Jackman is the perfect Wolverine. What a fun movie. I like the dialogue. It's not taking itself too seriously. There are tons of fun cameos I didn't expect! You know it's going to be fun with these two, but man... I laughed so hard, that even my stomach was feeling it. And the jokes... be sure this is not Deadpool watered down in the MCU, it's Deadpool at its best. The inevitable bromance is unveiled before our eyes. The story is fine, nothing special, but you feel it, and knowing the past knowledge about these characters and their respective universes makes everything hit the emotions. It's a fan service, but who cares - it's an entertaining fun summer blockbuster that gives you what you've paid for.

So this isn't quite like other Deadpool films. And yet it is. It's violent, gratuitously potty-mouthed, pcked full of in-jokes and it's bloody funny.And yet it felt different somehow. Like there was a*slightly* more serious undercurrent.The plot was daft but worked well enough to support a spectacular ensemble cast with cameos all over the place, subtly (and not so subtle) nods to and digs at various movie tropes and events and lots and lots of snappy one-liners.Plus the cutest ugly dog you'll ever see.If you're easily offended then you may not like it. Ditto if you're after highbrow entertainment. But if you're looking for clever but ultimately mindless laughs (yeah I know it's an oxymoron but you get what I mean I'm sure) then you'll love it.

Watching a movie from the MCU has seemed very strange in recent years- you feel like you have to know alot beforehand, watch the Disney+ shows. I kind of gave up after seeing Multiverse of Madness. This one was everything you'd want and then some.I wasn't totally a fan of Deadpool 2, but this one is right on par with the first in terms of how awesome it is. The humor had everyone geeking out in the theater, the action and the violence was amazing, the cameos were hilarious and rewarding (without being excessive.)You don't really need to know anything before watching this aside the first movie, a little of the 2nd. The story is very simple and I think that's the way it should have been. Wolverine is back and honestly better than ever. Saw it twice and I'll probably go again. Only ranked it a 9 cause I wanted it to last longer.

It was very complicated and not as beautiful as the first series. It started off well in the beginning, but got boring in the middle, and strange scenes at the end, and a different scenario. I was expecting a very different movie but it was below my expectations. Different characters added color to the film, but all of them had very short roles. Wade Wilson and Logan Will Definitely Star in the Next Marvel Movie There were also missing characters, the movie could have been better. It contained a lot of swearing and had very few action scenes. Watching movies in cinemas has become very bad, people are very disturbing and repulsive It's watchable but I didn't like it so much, stay happy.

If you've ever wondered what would happen if you took the wild humor of Deadpool and mixed it with the grizzled charm of Wolverine, then *Deadpool & Wolverine* is the answer to your comic book fever dream. Here's my take on this rollercoaster of a movie:This film is a glorious, action-packed riot that embraces its absurdity with open arms. Hugh Jackman as Wolverine proves yet again that he's the best at what he does, even if what he does isn't very nice. The banter between Jackman and Ryan Reynolds is nothing short of comedic gold, with Reynolds' Deadpool delivering quips faster than Wolverine can pop his claws. The chemistry between these two is electric, and their dynamic is the heartbeat of the film.The plot? Well, it's as chaotic as you'd expect from a Deadpool movie, but that's part of the charm. The film doesn't take itself too seriously, and neither should you. It's a blend of action, humor, and heart that keeps you engaged from start to finish. The dialogue is peppered with enough f-bombs to make a sailor blush, but it's all in good fun. The cameos are plentiful and surprising, making every scene a potential "oh snap" moment.Emma Corrin as Cassandra Nova is a standout villain, bringing a cold-blooded yet sardonic edge to the film. She's a perfect foil for our two heroes, and her presence elevates the stakes. The action sequences are a banquet of madness, especially the "corridor" fight scene (which is actually in a street) - it's a visual and visceral treat.The soundtrack is another highlight, perfectly complementing the film's frenetic energy. The opening scene alone is pure gold, setting the tone for the chaos that follows. And let's not forget the post-credits scene - it's a must-see, packed with hints for future adventures.In summary, *Deadpool & Wolverine* is a bloody, hilarious romp that's sure to please fans of both characters. It's not Shakespeare, but it's a damn good time. So grab your popcorn, suspend your disbelief, and enjoy the ride. And remember, if Wolverine can keep going until he's 90, then there's plenty more fun to be had with these two.

Solid action movie I think marvel should continue introducing rated R movies and they have really good direction as of now. The plot was a little hard to follow if you didn't watch any of the Deadpool or x-men movies previously but it's worth catching up to understand this film. The dry humor between Wade and wolverine was right up my alley and simply hilarious. The army of Deadpools was not expected whatsoever but I liked how the movie lore overlapped with the TVA and Loki's universe. There were some character incorporated in the story that I'd never heard of or seen before so it was nice to have my insight of these characters expanded.

A bit biased I'm sure but this movie smashed it. Never a dull moment and with some real chemistry between the main characters. The star of the show? Dogpool, or is it Gambit or is it Wade Wilson? I have no idea. Fact is I never felt this good leaving a theatre.Sure it has its rough edges, it's to damn short for my liking. But this is the first movie I want to see again in theatres. I loved every bit. The opening scene is majestic. After that they slow down a bit just to end up in a majestic shots, one after the other. I won't do spoilers but if you take on thing from this love song then go watch this movie!
